column4: It's an interesting museum, with a bit of everything - from dinosaurs, to Indian statues, Egyptian tombs, natural history section (with some lovely birds) and interior design history to some gorgeous paintings by Canadian artist Rex Woods. There seem to be various interactive events for kids. I walked by some groups that were shown some huge live cockroaches and got...

The ROM is a must see when you're in Toronto. I've come here multiple times over the years and really enjoy visiting every time. They bring in different exhibits to see and there's always something new to learn about and check out. The building itself is reason enough for a visit. It's very easily accessible on transit too!

A must visit place while in Toronto. It was huge and requires at least couple of hours to view their normal items on display. Apart from their huge European coin collections?, Canadian navite historical collection, East Asian expositions, and the Dinosaurs collection, the most what I like was the display of European architectural evolution through ages. It's worth 20$. They...

I haven't been to the museum in years, but there wasn't enough hours in the day to refresh my memory and see it all. From Ancient Greece to Canada's own history, ROM has an excellent collection of exhibits to interest anyone, young to old.What I especially loved this visit was their addition of people at various booths throughout the...

We went here during our trip to Toronto, because I'd read about the recent architectural addition of The Crystal, and was intrigued to see it.We found this to be an excellent museum, and particularly enjoyed the contrast of the dinosaur skeletons against the ultra modern architectural structure. The blue whale exhibition was interesting.This museum is worth a visit.

Beautiful building and easy to get to. Went here on a day out with the family. Lots of things to see and do. I love the dinosaurs best. Multi levels and you can see some exhibits? from different angles.

We visited on the last Saturday of March Break. Lines were out the door and it was CRAZY. We had pre purchased our tickets. Thank goodness.The exhibits are very good. We started on the highest level and worked out way down. We missed a gallery due to time. But we had a sensational time exploring what we did.Our...

I have been to better attractions but thats just my opinion.My wife and adult daughter thought it was awesome.I was disappointed that there was an extra charge for the new whale exhibit and also for a photo exhibit.The cost is high enough without charging extra to see more exhibits.

All day..Amazing artifacts and exhibits. Very busy since we were there on the March break. Would totally visit again. Took us 3 hours and we could have spent more time but we were on peiple overload when we left

Went to the ROM as a family outing today, and loved it. Our kids are 11 and 8, and they were able to get much more out of it. We noticed many families with young children under 5, and the kids were bored and getting into trouble a lot. We did not attend the Blue Whale exhibit, as it was...

We picked up a family membership this year for the ROM and have been absolutely thrilled with it so far. Over the march break we thought that it would be a little crowded (which it was) but surprisingly not so much that one could not enjoy themselves. We specifically stopped in to see the Whale exhibit and were so NOT...

We took the kids for March break. 14 and 9. Lots to see and you could spend hours. After awhile the kids lose the thrill of seeing ancient exhibits. It would be good in small doses for kids. The venue holds and can handle large crowds

The ROM is a very interesting and unique place -- a combination of natural history, anthropology and history museums, all under a single roof. There are departments featuring paleontology, ecology, zoology and mineralogy. Also, there are extensive sections of First Nations, Asian, Egyptian, Greek, Byzantine and Roman statues, costumes, textiles, furniture, pottery, coins, temples and other cultural artifacts. There are...
We went for the Friday Night Live Beer night and it was amazing. The museum seems even more magical in the evening with music and food. Almost all the the exhibitions were open for viewing.

It was an enjoyable day with excellent exhibits. Our family really enjoyed seeing all the history. A very impressive collection of items from all over the world. The dinosaurs, Egypt, Greece and Roman exhibits were our favourites. The Blue whale exhibit was not really worth the extra fee but I guess it is an important education tool and the extra...

I expected to go and spend maybe 2 hours here looking around. 4.5 hours later I left but missed a few things. Poor planning and I wish I had given myself more time. Great place, everyone should check it out. Well worth the money to visit.

Spent the day at the ROM (if you by tickets online and use PERKS you can get a 10% discount). Great to see history and recent discoveries like the Franklin expedition. Different areas had little scavenger cards for the kids and a prize at the end (pin) so it kept their interest. Face painting and an interactive colouring wall were...

We needed a warm place to go for the day. The ROM is a great mix of learning and exploration.My kids are 7 and 9. Here are the highlights for them:-new feature at the T-rex exhibit that allows you to take a photo with a "live" T-rex. Then you email the photo to yourself to keep.-the bat...

During March Break is probably one of their busiest times but we still enjoyed it! Found a coupon online before going at attractionsontario.ca that saved us $3 per person which more than paid for our coat check ($2.50 per item). So much to see! I can already say we will be back!

Gotta love the ROM. Just investigate what the main attractions are and you'll have a good time. Also, make sure to go with a little background knowledge of the displays at least if you're bringing children. It's too much to take in one day, so go with a plan. Unless yiu just want to see everything.

I don't have kids but happened to be here as the guest of a member just as the Big Blue special exhibit was kicking off for spring break. Kids were EVERYWHERE delighting in all the hands-on and interactive, educational activities and displays aimed at them. There was something for every age. I managed to weave through all the small people...

The ROM itself is a treasure, and often they have special exhibits. We went for the Award Winning Photography display and weren't disappointed. Afterwards we wandered around the Dinasoars, Middle East, and Furniture and Weapons sections. As seniors it was a lot of walking and sitting areas weren't always there when you wanted them, but we managed. It is easy...

We have visited this museum several times and have enjoyed each visit. The highlight for us is their impressive Mineral Gallery with both natural samples and ones cut into gemstones. The gallery has minerals from around the world, not just from Ontario. The museum tends to be crowded and waiting for tickets can take awhile but since we belong to...
The whale exhibition is amazing and the museum is worth visiting just for this. Beautifully presented and so informative

I always find new and interesting things that I seemed to miss the previous times I've visited.The staff are knowledgeable and seem interested in their jobs. They interact well with youth and seem to make the learning fun.I am a little disappointed in the fact that special exhibits are an extra fee. I understand they need to supplement...

A fantastic museum that all museum lovers must go to. The building itself is great to look at. They have various different exhibits that take you on a historic tour across the different ages. Both young and old can enjoy these exhibits. It is very big so you will have to plan a day for the visit.

I spent over three hours here and still felt like I hadn't gotten to seen everything. The nature exhibits were my favorite. They have some great fossils on exhibit. The art was very good, and from all over the world. I learned lots of interesting new facts!

The modern steel and glass, avantguard entrance and display space that has been added to the original neoclasical building is awful. while I admire it from tbe outside, the interior addtion has plywood walls, poor lighting, filthy windows and dust balls the size of muskrats. Truely a dissapointment.

Spent 3.5 hrs and could have stayed for six, so much to see, loved it! So many different display areas, it is not possible to be bored, something for everyone. They have a coat check and also take luggage for you at a small fee.

The Mineral Gallery is spectacular with both natural samples and ones cut into gemstones. The collection includes material from Ontario as well as other famous mineral localities in the world. You do not want to miss this gem !

After living in Newfoundland, I was ecstatic to see the blue whale skeleton at the ROM. The exhibit is well designed, lots of hands on activities for all ages, and lots of interesting information about whales.The rest of the museum is huge so we only saw a small part. Enjoyed the staircase of wonders. The exhibition on Ghanian flags...

We had hoped to see the Wildlife Photography exhibition here but having been charged a ridiculously high price to go into the museum they then wanted more money to view the exhibition so we didn't bother. Not worth the money!

My husband and I love visiting thre ROM at least once a year. Always fantastic exhibits and we never get sick of it. Staff are always helpful and informative. Would highly reccommend for families! We are taking our grandchildren now :)

I went on my birthday, which also happens to be on March break, so there were so many kids running around all over. Try going when kids are in school for a better experience.It was quite hard to navigate around, and a lot of what we saw were old plates. The best part was the dinosaurs! I wish they...

If you have a full day to get amazed and want to learn something new you can visit this place.Even I visited it last year all the memories are still fresh....I remember we were so tired that we couldn't visited all the sections but whatever we saw was just astonishing..Go and have experience...

Not reccommended to go with young children as you wont have a chance to pay attention to kids and exhibits at the same time.2nd floor dinosaurs and interactive dressup area is the only areas that kids were interested in and wanted to keep going back. The rest of the tour the kids were restless and just not interested.Reccommended...
The exhibits and special exhibits and programs are great I remember taking my daughter when she was young to the children's programs now she is taking her son my grandson

Please try to see the nature photography in the week that remains before it is closed. You won't regret it, au contraire. The photos are absolutely stunning! They don't benefit from being exhibited in the wretched Crystal, but no matter: they are magnificent, worthy of the ROM at its best.
The ROM is a great Toronto destination. The permanent displays are always fascinating but check for new exhibits. Located with easy access from the subway.

Wow I was really impressed with this museum!!! It is in a beautiful building with so much to see! I loved the Dinosaur exhibit. It was very impressive!! My 9 year old just loved it!!! He kept saying how fascinating it was!

A visit to the ROM is a must for anyone visiting this great city. The museum is wel laid out in various sections and well documented and easy to follow. The First Nations section is most impressive paying tribute to the nations first people.

City pass attraction. The museum is easy to get to and massive. They offer a free 45 minute guide to what they deem as cool art and history. The guide was knowledgeable and clearly passionate, a volunteer who dons his time to share, a good way to see what's what before you go yourself. A massive museum with lots to...

Swingin' Place - come with a friend, then never see them again until your through soaking up this joint a day later. I love coming here and emersing my head in whatever spectacular journey the curators have set up for us.
The exhibits are well curated, and there are enticing special exhibits. The special exhibits are interesting for the kids and they truly learn a lot!
Went here to see the Japanese & Chinese historical art collections. Really excellent exhibits. It has many collections so more than one day should be planned to see multiple exhibits there.
Just amazing in terms of the types of artifacts and sculptures throughout this museum. Lots to see - tons of history.

The exhibits are well maintained and well lit. Our visit was during the summer so it was fairly busy, but it didn't feel crowded.There's a wide variety of things to look at, you could spend quite a few hours looking at everything.It's located in a beautiful large building so you can enjoy the architecture inside and outside as...

A place not to be missed . Very large will take a few days to really enjoy .The special exhibits are worth it really really nice and well done . Extra charge for those but well worth it . So many thing to see and do . A wonderful place for the whole family .
we purchased a city pass and this museum was one of the attractions that we good choose. We really enjoyed it. It is a big museum and has large displays of items.
I think it is really the best museum in the City of Toronto. Perfect for children as well with loots of activities for them and friendly staff.This is MUST SEE place!

It's been a long time since I visited the ROM as a child. So much has changed but the feelings it bring hasn't. The ROM is a must see if your visiting Toronto or even if you live here and haven't been in a while.

First off if you plan on visiting this museum I recommend you come as early as possible, closing hours do vary from winter and summer months. That being said, this museum is HUGE!! There's 5 levels and a lot to cover if you want to check out everything. Just the outside geometric shape of the building draws attention to what...

The "real dinosaurs" are amazing. The Egypt exhibition is also very interesting. The only thing that is not perfect is the "Asia" areas besides China's section. A good place to spend time with family or friends. I spent around 3 hours walking through every sections.
Is the biggest museum I ever seen. A lot of things to see, best for family. You can spen a whole day in this museum, sometimes they have limited special shows.

Killing off a few hours one afternoon on a business trip, was not enough time at this museum. If we'd known just how big the place was and how much was in it, we would've definitely taken more time!From dinosaur discoveries to ancient civilizations, and artwork to geology this was just a wonderful place to visit.If you haven't...

My kids, 8 and 12 really enjoyed the differerent exhibits, particularly the children's area and the dinosaur and biodiversity exhibits. The second floor is the place to be. The other areas although quieter, were more for adult tastes. (Ancient Rome, Greece, China, Africa, Egypt on the 3rd floor and Canada and First Nations on the first floor) although the kids...
Excellent exhibits - a great way to spend some time with family over on a long weekend! The building itself is really a piece of art. They have many collections and cover many topics

This is a great museum, but my favorite part is to see it at night during Friday Night Live events and roam around while catching up with friends, getting different options of cool food and maybe a drink or two, learn while you're dancing to different beats! Special exhibits are only open during the day though, so if there is...

This is a fun museum to visit, though I found the layout confusing. There were specific things I wanted to see and it took some searching to find them.That being said, there is something for everyone here. So many topics are covered you're sure to find something of interest. The temporary exhibit that was there when I visited was...

It was bigger than I had expected! There are a lot of exhibitions in this museum! In every room has different taste and theme so I really enjoyed it!???????????????????????????????????????????????????
Was visiting in TO and went to the ROM to see the Nature Photography Exhibit - great exhibit - make sure you take the time to read the narratives on the pictures - they are very informative

Go on a day when there are not huge crowds and your children can run free for hours. Bathrooms are top notch, our favourite exhibits are the minerals and mammals. Kids are terrified of the bat caves. Parking available for a few bucks along the side roads near U of T soccer arena. Have fun!
I love the ROM, go for a nice relaxing travel through time. The awesome dino exhibits are where its at. One of my other favorites is the area with different Rock types. Enjoy a fun day.

Was looking forward to a great time but got not only tired from the sheer size of the place but ultimately got bored - and I love Museums!Excellent for doing Research but neither interactive nor entertaining.

Living in Toronto I come here about once every couple of months. Always have great exhibits with fun stuffs around the world to look at.Got apps you can download to guide you through the exhibits. If you are not here for the featured exhibits, there are still tons of pieces from around the world in the past thousands of...

Parking was close and admission was easy. There is a coat check near admission. They have many exhibits from minerals to medieval things. There is a lunch room on the lower level with bathrooms. The trip was from 11AM-3PM. Expected to be there for a full day anyway. I would go again.

It takes a while to go through the 4 floors of exhibits, there is place for everybody, there are dinosaurs, animals, coins, Roman, Egyptian, American, Asian. I don't think I have enough room to explain how good this is. I will recommend to plan a visit, it is not cheap but what you will see there is comparable with the...

I always try to go to at least one museum when traveling. ROM had a lot of great exhibits including the Glass and the Japanese third gender exhibits. We spent a good amount of time in those two areas. The downside was that there was a separate charge for the glass exhibit.

The angulated metal and glass extensions to the original ROM exterior are unique and interesting. However, the new addition is awful to view new original exhibits. The exhibitIons tend to be found after entering a small, nondescript elevator. The exhibition areas have low ceilings and are relatively dark. I don't mean mood lighting! This new addition could have been so...

Definitely a must if you are in town! I love going they always have new things - listed on their online web page. It's good for kids, adults, families, and couples!Every floor offers something cool - Dinosaurs, Europe, Egypt, Asia, Animals.Super affordable especially for something that can be a fun activity for several ours. Definitely dedicate at least...

We visited when the Pompeii exhibit was on. It had some great pieces but nothing like visiting Pompeii first hand. I found the rest of the Museum kinda boring to be honest. Lots of paintings but not much in selection of original pieces. I want to see a real mosaic or clothing from way back when and I found all...
This is a full day trip. This place is huge and you can really spend all there day. I went to see the Chihuly exhibit which was amazing.A get way to get out of the snow.

Enjoyed th Chahulli exhibit last summer and the nature photography one this winter. We downloaded a coupon that got us $3 off each ticket but the 9 day city pass is a good deal if seeing more than one museum per visit.
One of the best museums I've visited. It has some pieces of everything and is indicated to both families on inf=dividuals.

Going there often with a 2yr old .we have a membership so it's a fun spot to go every week. Weekends are packed so we usually go on week days at 10am. They have a special area for toddlers to play. Lots of great exhibitions for adults too . We love it!

world class museum, one of the best in Canada. Our children and family lover it for the wonderful dinosaur fossil exhibits and enjoy the full range of exhibit from Indigenous peoples to natural history and wonderful special exhibits

This is a beautiful museum. We spent most of our time in the Canadian and First Nations sections. The artifacts and details are beautiful. We visited on Family Day weekend and although the museum was quite busy there was still lots to see without feeling too crowded.

One of the best museums I've been to (and I'm a history teacher). Great exhibits and a huge variety. Really enjoyed the world cultures on the third floor. I liked the dinosaurs because they told you what was real and what was replicated. Overall comparable to the Smithsonian Museum but smaller and way less crowded!!!
Interesting place to visit, my friend and I weaved our way through, and although it felt like we could have gotten lost, we never did and it added to the experience of the museum.

We hit the ROM for some culture - It was a good day .. it was quite the maze to get through and the maps were a little convoluted and hard to understand. We took the subway which was easy to get to and from the museum from our hotel. There were numerous artists in the museum which made it...
This place is amazing!It's a must see for kids and adults it has the best of both worlds so much to see

This is a top notch museum! Where ever I travel to I always visit their most notable museum. As such I've been to the Natural History Museum in London, England and the Museum of natural history in NYC. The ROM is located right in Downtown Toronto alongside pretty impressive shops, like Tiffany's Louis Vuitton etc. Really cool and modern building,...

Visited here on "family day" they had a lot of things going on for children. There's lots to see and do, it came as part of the Toronto city ticket. Glad we visited, lots of interesting exhibits, plenty of room never felt crowded. We didn't have the time but it would have been easy to spend all day here.

I love the ROM. Solo - lots to see, nooks and crannies, and you can take the time to do your OWN thing. As a couple, or w friends - yes, always good to have other perspectives, and a few laughs along the way. I do recommend the free tours. With children - definitely, the dinosaurs, the bat cave are...

This is the perfect place for a winter day activity. You can spend hours here touring all the different wings that hold a crazy amount of artifacts. We originally were drawn to this museum because we were told that it has some of the most complete dinosaur skeletons and it did not disappoint. I would definitely pick and choose what...

Had the pleasure of visiting the Rom recently loved It!! I went with my two young sons aged 8 and 5 kids loved the dinosaur exhibit and Egypt the mummy...the museumIs well planned out there were lots of people there but it is a huge building with exhibits spread out that it never felt too busy. I also likes...

Excellent interesting museum with very interactive children's area (including dressing up section and Inuit teepee), interesting and informative section about Inuit culture and heritage and lots of the other exhibits and displays you'd expect in a major museum. Something for everyone - highly recommended for families with children or teenagers of any age!

I spent 3 hours in the museum and still did not see everything. The museum had several floors and most were fully stocked with artifacts from all over the globe. Each section was vast in information and visuals to entice any reader. Higher levels of the museum had some empty parts but had random other pieces from much older times....

Loved it....We saw the Wildlife photography exhibit and it was stunning....Breathtaking! The regular exhibits are always pleasing and eye catching. Loved all of the hands on exhibits for the child of any and all ages.
I really want to go there again. Passed there like 4 hours and still not satisfied. So much different stuff is crazy. For sure the best museum Ive ever been.

The museum is very busy and had a great layout and really encompasses their history recognising the colonial start and the original people of the land in two seperate areas i loved the native peoples exhibit
Loved my visit - the ROM has so many different features and exhibits - something for everyone! Perfect for young and old alike.

I took my niece to this place ROM last summer since she was a guest from Denver,Colorado.She definitely enjoyed exploring the place especially where the Dinosaur exhibits are.It is a fantastic museum and staffs are friendly according to her.

Always enjoy heading to the ROM, usually to see a special exhibit as well as touring parts of their permanent collection. This time we saw the Wildlife Photography exhibit which was really very good - over 100 really amazing photos well displayed. Always like to see the mineral and gem collection which it really spectacular IMHO. Also went through the...

The rom is beautiful. There's something for everyone of all ages to enjoy. I suggest watching for different special exhibits as they change. Though I wish they had a price for just the exhibits instead of the whole museum plus an extra charge. I highly suggest visiting

Lots of exhibits and recently received an exterior cosmetic renovation that transformed it into an abstract landmark! Again, easy accessibility on the University subway line just get off at Queens Park.

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) is the BEST museum in all of Canada. And probably one of the best in the entire world. There are a great many things to do. They have a European gallery; a Judaic gallery; a Far Eastern Gallery; one devoted to Greece; one devoted to African culture; a South Asian gallery; a Dinosaur exhibit; a...
Lovely place for kids but exhibitions don't change too often therefore subscription may not be worth it.
We came on a three day trip to see this incredible exhibit by my favourite Group of seven artist-Lawren Harris.

I took my 5 year old grandson here for a visit and we had such a great time. He was able to dig for dinosaur bones, draw pictures, wear costumes and of course learn about cool things. He still talks about it.
This Museum has everything you could want. Art. Medieval Knights. Native American Pottery. Dinosaurs. there's something there for the whole family, I can guarantee that.

As a local or a tourist the ROM is one to keep on the radar ... the exhibits constantly change and three are evening events with cocktails and music very reasonably priced. I love my nights at the ROM!
My 3 year old loved it, there's some interactive stations where he can touch and play and learn, it's great for the whole family!

The ROM is a huge and wonderful place to spend a day (you won't see it all in one day). There are wonderful exhibits to engage everyone from young to old. (I haven't gotten past the dinosaur and animal exhibitions the last couple of times I have been there-My kids love it!) Everything to see, learn about and explore so...
Interesting exhibits but, unfortunately, was not sufficiently interactive to engage the children. The kid zone was interesting but too many other displays were way too static.
Check for specials on their site before going there or get the city pass and it will be cheaperOverall it is amusing

When you walk it to the ROM first thing that comes to mind is HUGE. Well thought exhibits well taken care of, friendly staff. We have nothing like this in Puerto Rico loved every Square inch of it. Make sure not to rush it takes about 3 hours to really appreciate everything

We spent too much time trying to find it. We got there with less than a hour to close, we did doesn't matter. It's well decorated, and there history from the whole world, is easier to walking inside, but the washrooms are not well signalized.
A quick 2 hour visit to kid-friendly floor would be preferable. Lots of static displays but very few hands on activites. Might be more on weekends, we went midweek.

We live in Toronto and have an annual pass to the ROM. We visit at minimum 3 times a year and often take our kids friends. There are many fantastic special exhibits and events and the regular collection is terrific.

For a full day I stayed inside the ROM! Huge space and really you have to walk around and check everything! I catch Japanese guide, exceptional lady (Marie) and I can say only best about her! Sorry did not have time for the tours around ROM but next time! Sure buy the annual pass is convenient and really nice to...
You can spend at least half a day exploring the galleries. Check the website for current exhibits. I highly recommend the guided tour.
The mummies.. tombs.. dinosaurs..fossils..etc are in its magnificent presentation.The place is spacious and allows you to reflect the past with awe.

Must see in your itinerary , there are around 4 different levels , showcasing different kinds of things at each level , you can spend you half day here , very huge Dinosaurs skeleton you can see at entrance only , each level you will find some things new, full of historic artifacts/paintings/birds/animal etc etc etc etc ......

I really didn't know anything about the museum or what to expect but it I'm so glad we went because it was so worth it. There were so many exhibits and interesting things to see. Very informative as well. I recommend going in as soon as they open because less people. For the student price it was worth the money....

Must see. Beautiful and interesting architecture. Remarkable breadth and depth of collections. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. A jewel of Canada and expertly managed! Only had a short time to visit at end of a busy workday but it was the perfect way to spend an hour: relaxing and refreshing. However best to plan to spend a few hours to...

2 hours by bus from Niagara falls is Toronto. We managed a day in our schedule for the short ride just for a visit to the Royal Ontario Museum and an amazing showing of the works by the western glass artesian, Dale Chihuly.Opened in 1912 it is the largest museum in Canada and the second largest in North America....
first time there, it was amazing love the wildlife exhibit, the pictures were amazing, the pizza was terrible
So much history and culture it's a great place to bring the kids on a rainy day or a sunny day even!
Spent hours here, so much to see. Very diverse and compared to other museums (London national history museum) feels very airy, modern and light.Would love to go back there with my children
First time here and we loved it . Very informative and reasonably priced . Special exhibition was worth a visit , will definitely go back

I have been to many museums in many different countries of the world and this one just didn't leave me feeling excited. Although it had good reviews for me it felt like it lacked focus. It seemed to be just groups of old items without any real story, I'm sorry but this is one of the least favourite museums I...

Very nice museum, dinosaurs are especially special, lots of them and well displayed. Lots of people when we were there because of the Holiday season and the museum seems disorganized, long line ups with little information. We enjoyed our visit though and we will go back to see the exhibits that we didn't have time to see when it will...

Lots to do here for my 3 (boy) and 5 (girl) to do for an entire day. We had a great time taking them around the dinosaurs and mammals area and world cultures. Then when we needed some down time there were several areas they could play with minimal supervision

Royal Ontario Museum embraces a diversity of cultures, eras and collections. From Jurrasic collection, to First people section, to Earth's treasures, and contemporary art.. you will definitely spend a very informative and enjoyable day at the museum! I recommend you attend a guided tour "Museum highlights" that takes less than one hour where the guide points out the main attractions...

This is a must. I was up there visiting a friend and while she was in class, I spent several hours here alone and ended up back again another day. Its Huge, organized and very informative. Its very child friendly!

Was recently at the ROM for the Chihuly exhibit and it has been years since I have been. Still the same wonderful place. The Chihuly exhibit was fantastic and the entry was well organized. Great permanent exhibits throughout the museum.

Being the beginning of February it was a brisk walk to the museum, but it was certainly worth it. A coat check and pleasant staff greeted us upon our arrival. The exhibits are nicely laid out with detailed, informative placards for everything. The native peoples exhibit does a nice job of discussing the history and sensitive issues. There were more...

I live in Toronto and never get tired of going to the ROM. Just went and saw the Chihuly exhibit which was incredible. Has moved on but there is always something special there.Kids especially love the bat cave and mummy exhibits.Don't miss it if you are visiting and if you live here, get an annual pass for a...

A great place to visit, especially with young grandchildren. There is so much for kids to see and with many touch and feel exhibits. Dinosaurs and the bat cave were highlights for our 2. If you are a local, would suggest buying an annual family pass that would let you return to see some of what you missed. Very helpful...

This is a nice museum great architecture well thought out exhibits I think it only a question of the scale of what you would see us/europe in terms of granduer size,if you can get over this however to concerntrate on the quality and not the quantity you will find it well worth a visit, the first nations exhibits for...

We ordered tickets on line ahead of time. A good move. The lineup was huge and we were there early. Definitely a good move. Pre order tickets and get there early. The lineup was not too bad to see the Chihuly exhibit but much larger when we left. We also saw the wildlife photographic exhibit. Again not bad when we...

The natural photographer of the year exhibition is great! It is on until Mid March. The Rome tour we took was well presented and provided new insights. Other special exhibits were equally interesting.

When arriving at the ROM on your first visit it can be overwhelming. Even from the exterior it is an impressive building. It's worth checking out the exterior only to see the traditional Ontario stone neo-classic facade, contrasted with the contemporary cubic addition built more recently by the famous Japanese architect.If you don't fancy spending the whole day at...
We have been there a few time for different events and all of them have been greatExcellent for family tooYou must goMichael

I visited the ROM with my family for the 5th time, and it was like we've never been. They add new exhibits (e.g. Chinese dynasties, dinosaur) every year so there's always something new. Going again next year :)

We arrived at 2 pm and spent 3 hours in the museum and didn't even have time to visit all the exhibits. I suggest arriving earlier. This is a place with plenty of variety to suit all tastes. I really enjoyed the Biodiversity gallery where you can find birds, reptiles and mammals among others. It was stupendous. Very nice place...

I am a member of the Royal Ontario Museum so this review is biased in favour of this great museum. In the last 12 months I have done the museum tour (runs 2 plus times a day) on at least 3 occasions with our of town friends, and their unbiased views were all positive. After the tour (or before it—one...

The ROM is great!! 4 floors with different topics. Right now it's Asia, Animals and Dinosaurs, greek/Egypt/roman history and a special exposition. Now this is a nature photo competition and soon about whales.Bring at least 4-5 hours. I came at 12 and left 4:30 and haven't seen all. It's really interesting and for all ages.Cost is 25$ for...

This place was wheelchair accessible and staff were extremely helpful with this challenge. It is really large with 33 galleries to visit. My brother was thrilled even though we did not get to see it all. We also took in the wildlife photo exhibit.
the architecture of this building is just amazing !!!u can sit and admire it for hoursthe museum by itself is a great experience !!

We visited the ROM recently to take in the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibit, and we loved it. We visited most other exhibits while we were there as well.The exhibits are very well presented with ample space between items. The downfall that I noted is that some of the text displayed beside items is actually very difficult to...

I've visited the ROM many times in my life, great place to go as a kid with family as well as on a date as a couple. I like that they have different exhibits during the year as well. I feel The ROM is a great place to go while in the Toronto area as the museum is so big,...

I had been to the ROM a number of times already and only wanted to visit the Chuhily exhibit, so I did not appreciate having to pay $29 which included the regular ROM admission! The exhibit of blown glass was stunning, very colourful and creative but not worth the fee!

The ROM is definitely an amazing museum. I travel a lot and have been to museums all over the world. The ROM is on par with any of the other great museums in Europe, Asia etc. Impressive dinosaur exhibit which is a permanent feature of the museum. The special exhibits are always well- thought out and interesting. Fabulous place for...
Very much enjoyed the Royal Ontario Museum! Its a little confusing to work your way through but very interesting! Lots of information and lots if cool things to see!

This is the premiere museum in Toronto and boasts one of the worlds largest collection of dead animals. Honestly they are everywhere, from dinosaurs to budgies you can see whatever dead animal meets your fancy. All jokes aside, this is a beautiful place with where children and adults a like can learn about the world as it is and the...

Words alone cannot express the wonder and majesty of the images on display at the ROM's National Geographic photo exhibition. Even for a non-photographer, it is entertaining and for photographers it is truly enlightening. Along with the other-worldly beauty of the images, the information provided – location, lens, shutter-speed, aperture, auxiliary lighting etc. – is incredibly interesting and expertly presented....
We only visited the Chihuly exhibit. It was great. The museum overall seemed great with a lot of offerings.

This is an fantastic attraction that you could find in Toronto's citipass. I would encourage you to buy it and visit it. If I remember correctly it is close to Toronto U so you can also have a nice walk nearby.Is Family friendly and have a great Dinosaurs section.
We spent the morning at the museum and enjoyed it even though we're really not museum people. The native american section was our favorite!
Definitely a great place to go whether you are with family, friends, or on a date. There is something for everyone! Loved the interactive exhibits (look for the T-Rex)
Nice for families with young kids but lacking depth.Very few textiles. Southeast Asia did not include Indonesian art. Very little pre-Columbian and Egyptian.

My sister and I were looking for low key activities on a Saturday, and enjoyed exploring the Royal Ontario Museum. Especially the dinosaur exhibit- way more there than I thought there would be. If you've never been, it's worth checking out.

The ROM is pretty good, altho not the "new" Michael Lee-Chin crystal extension to the museum. That's an unimmpressive structure ill-designed for its purpose if ever there was one, and it's burdened taxpayers to the tune of many millions of dollars.That being said, the special programming is almost always excellent. We recently saw the Chihuly exhibit there and enjoyed...

When coming to Toronto you HAVE to come to the ROM. This museum is right in the middle of Yorkville, surrounded by high end shops and restaurants but contrary to what you might think, the entrance fee is very reasonable. Its a huge museum with many galleries and exhibits, including a Dinosaur gallery that i LOVED! i have never seen...
We also got to see the Chihuly glass exhibition . It needs a full day to cover. Beautiful place for art lovers and must visit while in Toronto

My friend and I had a small window in of time and wanted to see this exhibit. We went on the last day it was available. We both enjoyed it but felt the it was too small an exhibit for the money. Perhaps if we'd been able to spend the day in the museum we would have felt satisfied. Not...

Great museum with wonderful changing exhibits, plus a great collection of many items from dinosaurs to Chinese artifacts and furniture. Just a great place to visit, but check to see what special exhibits are up and if they peek your interest. Restaurant was closed the day we were there so used the cafeteria, food was just ok.

There's this old lady who works there, she'll go from group to group randomly to explain and tell us few of her personal favorite. What written is not as detailed as what she explains. If you see her, you can follow her around like a short mini tour, you'll learn something

I was staying just across the street and visited on my last day in Toronto. I had avoided as local told me it was ok but not really worth it. Well it was nice but he was right not on a par with museums you see in say Washington, London or Paris. Good to fill time but after being to...
Im probably comparing it to the Met that why I was 100% amazed. Still worth going to though for the great architectural view outside.

If you have kids that are interested in Dinosaurs they have lots. They four different floor of different exhibits. You can spend at least 3 - 4 hours going around this place.They have a place to get yourself something to eat while you are there.

We went with our two kids, 11 and 12, and had a great time. No matter if you're a fan of ancient cultures like chinese or japanese, or you like dinausors or natural sciences, you'll find an exhibit that'll make your visit worthwile!

Went with 4 adults and 2 children absolutely amazing the kids are five and nine and they were interested right from the time we walked to the front door so we were finished at the very end all of the exhibits were well-kept everything was in Immaculate order I think my only complaint would be perhaps if they have lockers...
If you have ever wanted to see an actual totem pole, come here and be prepared to visit your chiropractor later. They are BIG!If you get there before end of Jan 2017, see the Chihuly exhibition.

The ROM is a great place with a variety of permanent and temporary exhibits. Dinosaurs, Canadian history, and ancient cultures. This visit had special exhibits on nature photography, textiles and native inhabitants.

Apart from the art exhibits, the gift shop is really worthwhile visiting. We picked up many interesting items to keep as Christmas presents for our grandchildren. There's always something a little bit different to purchase.

I have been going to the ROM since 1970 and still love the collection and special exhibits. We just stopped in as we always enjoy wandering the collections when we are in Toronto and Chihuly's glass was an amazing surprise - so happy our adventures took us there. Love the Chinese and Egyptian collections too and this time took in...
Not an expensive museum. The design of the architecture is interesting. However, the expositions are just not attractive enough.
The Museum is very big and has a lot to see. From artwork to animals to prehistoric. You do lots of waling so wear comfortable shoes.
I am a history junkie so my boyfriend took me here as a treat. It was a great night, awesome things to see at a reasonable price. Also conveniently located for those of you who ride the subway

We particularly enjoyed the galleries with gems and minerals, one of the best of its type I have seen. We also enjoyed the ancient galleries and the exhibits on the First Canadians, especially the film Nanook of the North, which plays in a continuous loop. Free internet and opportunities for lunch.

We visited during the Chihuly special exhibit (which is unfortunately now closed). We were blown away by the exhibit and had purchased tickets day of online. It was the day of a Christmas parade so the museum wasn't very crowded because it was hard to access, but we walked over from our nearby hotel. We also enjoyed the dinosaurs exhibit,...
Great tourist attraction. Centrally located in downtown Toronto. You can spend several hours looking at some great items from the past and present.

A large space with lots of Canadian exhibits as well as well known and beautifully curated exhibits. The line up for tickets can be daunting but it moves very fast. And a great and very large gift shop.
Interesting museum to visit. Not world class but very good to interest kids for their education.Good for an afternoon visit.
There was so much to see! I also met a goodwill representative who detailed very well the statues beside us.

So glad we didn't wait in line for hours for the Chihuly exhibit. Even with pre purchased tickets, the wait was over 2 hours. Since we have never been to ROM and had seen the Chihuly exhibit before, we wandered through the museum to see everything else. Wonderful assortment of neat things. (rocks, furnishings, animals, ect.)

The ROm has always been a great place to go whether for family trips or visiting relatives. It is astounding when you get told more than 90% of the things they have are not even on display. You can spend hours there and never lose interest as there are so many different things and areas of interest to everyone.The only...

I recall creaky floors and dusty stuffed bears and tigers in the early 60's as a kid. I think some of those creaky floors are still there - but the dust has been shaken off and this is NOT our grandfather's dusty creaky ROM. It has matured and grown significantly - the new additions add not only much needed space...

Took my grandson out of school for the day and went to the ROM. He still talks about that trip. He thought that it was going to be a boring museum trip but found out his smartphone interacts with the displays and makes things come to life.

There is always something new to see. The museum is a great way to educate children while having fun at the same time.I have invested in a membership because of how often I go.Highly recommended.Not enough people these days take advantage of these kinds of places.

When you think museum and kids, you might think....boring!Not so at the ROM. Weve had a family membership for years (now kids are 7,9,11) and have taken full avantage.There is something for everyone!! There are of course the amazing dinosauraur and animal galleries, but even the smaller ones have amazing curation. Bring the kids into the gems gallery...

I enjoyed the glass exhibit they had going on at the time. I found a few of the displays interesting. But for me, I wasn't really into it. However, I know many people were enjoying the place and it is quite educational if you are into history.
Never the same twice, but I still like the static displays. Large groups move quickly. Kids seem well amused, too. Cafeteria food was very decent. Subway there, walked around after - lots to do!

We went on a rainy day, so it was good to get inside and stay warm.They had a fantastic digital photography exhibition on display which took an hour to walk through and view. This we really enjoyed.They also had a massive dinasour exhibition, so for kids (and adults) this was really interesting.The ROM is a very large...

The ROM has many exhibits, so look for special ones on their website, as well as great exhibits for young and old. Dinasaurs are a particular favourite with kids and the ROM makes a real effort to be entertaining and informative for all ages.
I live close by and have an annual membership, so I come here all the time. There is always something cool to see, and I loved all the special exhibits - Chihuly, Wildlife Photography, etc.
The whole family will enjoy! Whether you are a history buff or simply a tourist out to look at things to do in Toronto, this will be a good place to go

Our family went to see Chihuly Exhibition at the ROM. Glass work is incredible, displays are amazing. The size of the works, abundance of colours and lighting impossible to describe by words. Truly magical experience. Must see for everyone!
Lots of things to do and see for everyone in the family. Went the last day of Christmas break and the line ups to get in were crazy. But once you're in - it doesn't feel crowded.
This is always a fun place to go, especially when the weather is less than perfect out. Great learning tool for the kids. We got a Toronto City pass at costco and found it to be great value.
In Toronto often and decided to buy annual membership. Great solo activity. Enjoy wandering solo. Only negative is the cafes are very expensive.
went to the Rom and just loved it. The rom is a great place to go to learn about everything and anything, but it's a little expensive as most places are.
We went to see the Chahuli Exhibition at the ROM. Incredible glass works, very expertly displayed. The size of the works, the amazing colours, the lighting were all amazing. Go see it!
Really enjoyable , you could spend hours here so give time to visit. I recommend buying a city pass if your planning on doing all the tourist hot spots. Works out 50 percent cheaper to do all 5.
I LOVE the ROM!! As a lover of history, it has everything for you. We went on a tour which was fun. See something new every time I go.

We went this past Thursday and since school was still out the families were out in force! The line up to buy the tickets was huge right at 10am when the museum opens and we were concerned that we would be packed like sardines. I have to admit that we were pleasantly surprised that the museum was still enjoyable despite...
i went to ROM and the volunteer told me that the Chinese section is the most valuable section, but i think it is just so so.
One very big museum. 40 years since last visit, amazing how big it is. Great special exhibits. Very busy, but not crowded. Very pleased. Need a couple of visits to see it all. Must see.

If it's your first time here, you would find this exciting. I've been here a lot of times, so I don't find it facinating anymore...I recommend parents with young kids to go here. Kids really love the dinosaur exhibition.

Two special exhibits in one day at the ROM - awesome! The Chihuly exhibit is a definite for anyone interested in glass art and the wildlife photo exhibit had some amazing photos! I would definitely recommend it.

We knew the ROM would be busy, but went anyway, and noted that some of the baby strollers were the size of small cars! The Chihuly and Photography special exhibits were excellent. I would return and plan to spend a half day to appreciate all the museum offers at a less busy time.
Go to the ROM and by a total rom ticket so you can see all the exhibits available. Well worth it! I was amazed at how vast the museum was. There was so much to see and take it. 10/10 recommend!
I am a fan of museums, but this one is not the best, hard to understend where to go and what to see. Excibitions ar good, but one by one

I spent 3 hours in the museum, but I bet you can just stay for a whole day here. There are so much to learn and see, the museum includes Chinese, Japanese, African, European and other regional cultures, also natural exhibitions. I also enjoy the temporary Chihuly exhibitions! So tired but interesting!
I reluctantly agreed to go with my daughters, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. It was relaxing and engaging. I bought a membership because I plan to go back.

Very interesting museum, be aware that it is way too big to see all of it in one day so you might want to decide which exhibitions you want to see at the start of your visit. The one hour free highlights tour was good to orientate, it took you through the whole museum and showed some of the top...

Lots of different things to see. Well organized. Research ahead to see what is showing. When I was there they had winners of photography competition which was great and a huge display of glass blown flowers and various plants....it is amazing what artist can do.
I visited it with my daughter. It was an exciting place.My daughter learned a lot.I found it informative.Thanks

Royal Ontario Museum is a wonderful place for every age. Everyone should visit and will never be disappointed. Excellent wild photography exhibit is now on and must be seen. Little kids will have lots of fun visiting the bat cave, Dinosours and many many more areas.

The Chihuly exhibit is awesome. Dale Chihuly is truly a gifted artist. The only negative I have to say about the exhibit is that it's too short. I wish more of his work could have been on display as only a sampling of his work was shown. Words can't begin to describe the joy and amazement every piece offers.I...
Great if u need to get out of the cold or beat the heat. Cool kids area where u can touch great Dino exhibits. We went for the special chihuly exhibit it was amazing.
This museum is the best for all ages particularly school age children. A wonderful display of animals,dinosaurs, mummies and special exhibit of Chihuly glass until January 8,2017.

This is a fantastic exhibit of wonderful blown glass by the artist Dale Chihuly. From his Persian ceiling, to his underwater garden, to his reeds emerging from Canadian Birch logs, the shapes and forms of glass is amazing. The range of colours and imaginative arrangements of his glass objects have to be seen to be believed. A most exciting show....

I've been to the ROM many times over the years and am always impressed by the quality of the special exhibits they bring in. The most recently Chihuly exhibit was expertly displayed and not too crowded.If your time is limited, I'd recommend the gem gallery on the second floor and the nature gallery. Chihuly exhibit is shown to perfection. The installation was bright and spacious. The history of his work and the inspiration behind the collections were explained easily. Walking through the exhibit had a nice progression. I was surprised but the impact of the large groupings. It's ending this week.Upstairs I viewed the gem of a wildlife photography. The photos from...

This can be a very pricey place to visit for family of 4 so check if your kids are interested before you decide to go. It can get very crowded on the weekends and holidays. Again, one of the attractions to use your city pass for. The current Chihuly exhibition is amazing.

There is something for everyone to enjoy, from the cultural to the fun exhitbits on the stairways. Lots of space so you are not contantly in the way of others. Wonderful wildlife photography exhibit. The food in the cafe/restaurant is good and not too expensive as in some places where they have the monopoly on food choice.A good overall...
Some great collections, especially dinosaurs and Chinese but had to navigate with children between parts.

Must return soon to this beautiful museum. The ROM is educational for the entire family. World Class exhibits and a lovely clean building which is central to so many other amenities in Toronto. Make a day of it, or come for the weekend and make this one of the must see destinations for families in Toronto.

What a most amazing exhibit! The pieces are beautifully displayed and the colours and shapes of his magnificent glass sculptures are amongst the most visually appealing that I've ever seen! A must see exhibit!

This is a great place for family. All the interests of each member can easily be met by the many departments in this museum. ( bat caves, dinosaurs gallery for kids) (nature and rocks; jewelry through history; Far East display is one of the best in North America; etc)The exhibits are thorough, beautifully displayed as a good museum should....
So many things to look at , their is a interest for anyone. I have been here 3 times and still learn new things each time.

If you have a few hours in Toronto, def drop by the ROM. Their permanent collection is excellent and they often have wonderful special exhibits that are more art related. I last visited the ROM in December 2016 and got to see a glass art exhibit and a wildlife photography exhibit - both were well curated.

As a disclaimer I'm not a huge museum person but I do like the good ones so I make an effort to go to them when travelling. Since ROM is so highly revered I thought I'd best check what all the fuss is about.I have to say I was somewhat disappointed by the whole place. To begin with a...

I visited this museum to see the Chihuly exhibit and the Wildlife Photo exhibit. Both exhibits were extraordinary and I highly recommend seeing them! The museum itself was well-organized with easy access to multiple levels via elevator. The museum also offered a cafe and various restroom locations throughout the museum. Overall, the museum was very busy and the staff seemed...

The ROM never fails to provide it's cultural mosaic of beautiful artifacts. This was a wonderful relaxing day to share with my loved one. Indeed the ROM is a jewel in the crown of Toronto's must experience venues.

We were there on Jan 2, 2017 and got to see the Chihuly glass exhibit which both my wife and children (8 & 5) loved! We arrived at 10:30am and went directly to the Chihuly exhibit and walked right in. After the glass exhibit we spent a lot of time looking at the collection of dinosaur fossils and also spent...

We visited the ROM and really enjoyed our time there. We took a fascinating free tour which lasted an hour and then we explored the areas in detail, which we wanted to see. We saw the Chiuly Exhibition which was magnificent.

Such a good collection! We enjoyed the natural history section, and the medieval & renaissance selections. We were lucky to be there for the Chihuly exhibit as well. Be sure to wear comfy shoes as we were there for several hours.

Located in the trendy Yorkville district, this museum is curious architecture of a meld of historic old building with a modern multifaceted structure.We were lucky to see the Dale Chihuly special exhibit. This one exhibit was worth the entrance fee on its own. The balance of the museum is fine, sort of ordinary fare, some of the displays are...

Visited as a family with my two daughters. They absolutely loved it here. We have the natural history museum in the U.K But I preferred the royal Ontario museum it was brighter and the artifices were presented much nicer. My children loved the interactive floor. A really good day, would recommend.
Like the Asia show in the first floor. A lot of ancient Europe goods are there as well. Highly recommended to family visit.
The ROM, is a magnific place to visit and is necessary have a confortable shoes to spend more than 3 hours, seeing all the zones.

I loved Chihully and the World Photographer of the Year. Nicely prepared and displayed. We took advantage of the opportunity to visit again some of the permanent collection. Great museum in the heart of the city, I look forward to more upcoming exhibitions.

The ROM is something as kids we are forced to go with schools and as teenagers something different to do as adults it is mind absorbing and relaxing. Not really suitable for the average child under 10 as it might literally bore them to tears.

Used to be a member here so I know the ROM. I also have travelled to many top museums throughout Europe. Recently went to see the Wildlife Photography exhibit. The show was impressive but the signage and directions were almost non-existent. Staff were of little help, the map of exhibits was next to useless. We were given vague and contradictory...

We went for the Chihuly Glass Exhibit, but ended up spending hours looking at this interesting assortment of displays. The collection contains everything from Art Deco furniture pieces to antique swords and Egyptian mummies. Chihuly was beautifully displayed--if you can make it before the January end date, you should check it out. The permanent collection is fascinating in its diversity,...
Currently they have an amazing Chuhuly exhibit.But even with out that I also visit every trip. It's just such a lovely place. Great permanent exhibits. The dinosaurs are always a hit.

The ROM is great for everyone: geeks/nerds, gangsters, weirdos, art aficionados, archaeologists, cool kids... you get he point! There's something there that will pique anybody's interest. Been there a few times in the last year as the exhibits change. Pretty cool spot for sure... allow yourself a few hours to explore.

Wonderful exhibit, certainly a must do if you are in the Toronto area while it is still there! You can take in the exhibit by itself or take in the whole museum. If just doing Chihuly you can finish it in under 1 hour unless you want to sit back and enjoy the splendour of his artistry. If you have...
A little boring, needs more local Canadian culture never the less, interesting. Abit expensive though.

On our most recent visit, the primary focus was the special Chihuly exhibit. It ends in January; if you have time to go before it closes, I highly recommend it. There are a few spots we always visit; the dinosaurs, Egypt. But especially if you are with kids, it is too much to see in one day without getting "museum...

Buy your tickets online to avoid the lines. The Chiluly and Wildlife Photography exhibits were worth it!!! The use of space between the old building and addition is great! Well done. Kids love it. That can be good of bad.

Decent museum in Toronto. Was able to see temporary Glass Exhibit by Dale Chihuly. Certainly worth seeing the temp glass display. As to rest of museum, artifacts and echibits are well documented, in both English and French. There are 4 gloors covering all different areas of interest- Roman, Greek, Asian, etc. Be nice if there more room to display, but...

We went to see the Chihuly exhibit and it is amazing. A very special treat to see the work of an extraordinary artist, it's really magical. But the price of admission to the ROM + the exhibit is too high.

What a magical, educational and fun place to visit! Having children with you makes it so much better. There are so many interactive and assisted exhibits, far removed from the "don't touch anything" museums of yesteryear. The space, the flow and the facilities are all geared for huge throughput and it all works seamlessly. We saw a fabulous dinosaur exhibition,...

a very nice museum food is expensive and it is difficult finding some displays because of the buildings lay out. on the plus side displays were plentiful and interesting i even thou there were many people there it did not seem crowded

Visited the ROM for the special Dale Chihuly exhibit. Definitely a must-see! This artist and his studio produce incredible works of art from glass! The sizes of the various installations are incredible and stunning. Note that this exhibit ends January 8, 2017.Also visited several other areas within the ROM - always an enjoyable experience!To save time, book your...

Bring snacks with you! The food isnt great but everything else was! My favourite was the egyptian floor. There was also a floor with only animals. Pull out drawers with insect specimens. There's a few play areas for kids to try on kimonos and play puzzles too. I wasn't crazy about the chihuly floor. Wasn't worth the extra money for...
The museum is amazing! We went for a special installation of Dale Chihuly but went about to see other exhibits. Parking may be a bugger if you are not taking public transit.

I love museums and have been to the ROM a few times. They have stunning collections of art as well as fossils. I would love to see them add more intereactive features like the science center also navigating can be a bit challenging but I am never in a rush so I dont mind.
I can proudly say this is one of the finest museums anywhere with an amazing variety of collections. Definitely a must see when visiting Toronto.
It was a while that we visited a museum, the collection was huge. The museum is especially good fun for children.

I went many time with the kids and we still enjoy it. It is the biggest museum I ever saw and always they introduce new things. It is no boring like other museums. Their is things for kids of all ages to see and explore. But be aware you need three days to finish it ?but for kids one day...
Great layout and exhibitions. Comfortable wonderful to navigate are and helpful staff. Wonderful area for kids to discover and play.

The permanent collections are worth visiting but we came specifically for the Chihuly glass exhibit and it did not disappoint. It is an amazing display, well worth the price. We also took in the Wild Life Photographs on a different day. Some interesting photographs.

We were really lucky to go when the Chihuly glass sculpture exhibit was on. An absolutely stunning exhibit, it added a whole other experience to the ROM. It was utterly unforgettable.The museum itself is a wonderful place: every time we go, a different exhibit seems to capture the attention. One fascinating section looks at furnishings through the ages, from...
One of the goto places at Toronto with family. Some amazing artifacts to view. Overall a nice experience.
The ROM regular exhibitions were good in general, but Chihuly's was outstanding, we loved it!Colourful, creative, well arranged and nicely staged.

We visited the royal museum ontario on nov 29, 2016, an unforgettable experience, you can spend the whole day in the place, the pavilion of pre history is the most impressive and the oriental culture also very good. Ideal for full family.

We were in town with a group. I went for a special exhibit- Chihuli, and it was great. Two others went for a wildlife photography exhibit, and they really enjoyed it too. But three others went for the general admission, and it was fantastic. The museum is well set up, and quit expansive. It is well worth the visit, as...

Give yourself lots of time. We saw both amazing exhibitions, the chihouly glass art works and wildlife photographer of the year from the natural history museum in London which were breathtaking. Did not have enough time to do justice to the museum.
The provision of seating near each display made the visit more rewarding. Time permitted at least a cursory visit to most displays and a ponderous visit to the jurassic and egyptian displays.
A fantastic place to visit with family!You must spend a lot of time in it in order to see all the things! It's worth !
All visitors to Toronto and Locals should visit this world well known and well appointed museum. It has a great kids area

I went last month because I wanted to see the Chihuly exhibit. It was wonderful - so beautiful!Then I made my traditional visit to the gems exhibit. The gems and jewellery are really lovely and there is a lot of interesting information. I had no idea that tanzanite is a rather ugly brown colour when it is mined. It...
Lots of variety. Excellent special exhibits. Very easy to get around. Plenty of food and rest areas. Worth the time to add to your itinerary.

Having seen a few single pieces of glass sculpture artist, Dale Chihuly, this special exhibit in Toronto got my attention. It was entirely worth the surcharge to the regular R.O.M. admission. A second special exhibit was running concurrently, so that was added to the admission ticket, too.The exhibit is nothing short of overwhelming on so many levels. Taking the...

Enter from Bloor Street.Very extensive collections, so if you are limited for time pick your areas of interest ahead of time.The dinosaur exhibit is particularly spectacular and great for children.The recent Chahoile glass exhibit was magnificent..A great place to visit especially in the cold weather.

I was visually thrilled by the artistic creations and fluid movement of these pieces of art. I found myself staring at each piece in amazement and thinking that something so ordinary created something so visually appealing. The exhibit was a nice surprise and I would recommend it to anyone.
Standard museum, not worth the entry price. Would be suitable for family with small kids otherwise there are much more exciting things to see while in Toronto.

I live a 2 1/2 hour trip from downtown Toronto, but I make the time to take the trip whenever a new exhibition is available at the ROM.My first ROM experience was seeing the Terracotta army exhibition as a guest of family who are ROM members. I don't know why but Trip Advisor puts these places on my log in page forcing a review that I don't want to do and sometimes it is a place I have no intention to visit, but Every time I log in there it is demanding a review. So Trip Advisor wants to waste my time and yours. Pay attention...

This exhibition is absolutely will blow your mind away.Colorful glass sculptures, vases and candelabras.Chichuly is famous around the world and we are very lucky to have his exhibit? here in Toronto.I never ever even can imagine what glass can looks like.Amazing...wonderful..gorgeous...

This was time and money well spent. Excellent value for $17, and a bit extra to see the Chuhilly exhibit. Spent about 4 hours there, and only saw a fraction of exhibits. Took a one hour tour to start, which gave us some background - then we explored areas of interest. Something for everyone, including dinousaurs, Canadian history, gems and...

This place is even better when you are older. I visit TO now but grew up here. I remember going to the ROM as a kid and being amazed but it is even more amazing now. The new dinosaur exhibit is awesome.
This art form was spectacular. I would like to see his work in a ,"natural" setting as shown in the video at the exhibit.

I like the exhibition about the Canadian history and culture. It is a pretty big museum, so plan to spend at least 3 hours here. The bike racks outside the museum are very artistic. There is an ancient church on the other side of the street.
Interesting museum and a lot to see. May need about 3 hours plus. Buy tickets via city pass so you get to see not only the ROM but also Ripleys aquarium and cn tower etc
I was very lucky to happen upon the Chihuly exhibit in November 2016. What a find. Lovely museum in a great walk around area.

I never go there with anyone so I can stay longer!Love the museum and love the feeling being there. Brings me closer to my home and teaches me that we are not from yesterday. Our lives are hard but worth it every step of the way.

I love the ROM, and I know that it is a world-class museum. My only thought is that they could do more in terms of changing their exhibits. Of course they have the special visiting exhibits, usually one or two at a time for an extra charge on your admission, and this is fine, but I mean in terms of...
The ROM covers history from all across the globe from different era's and is massive!Lots to do, worth a visit

There is not a better attraction (on multiple levels) in Toronto. This is not your stuffy museum full of ancient Greek, Egyptian, and Asian antiquities. That stuff is all there but as a family attraction its all about dinosaurs, mammals, birds, bats, hands on biodiversity, play area for kids, interactive displays and more. Their permanent collection is always good for a visit but their visiting exhibits are always great. The building is worth a visit in itself if you're an architecture buff.
Interesting and informative, the tour guide gave us relevant information then we Hello darling time to explore for ourselves

Wow! This was my first time to the ROM. There was just too much to see and do in one day. We walked so much, I would have liked more seating to take a load off. Didn't actually get to finish. ROM is comprised of several sections; I definitely suggest to visit all levels, but with an emphasis on Level 1&2. I'm told that it has the biggest Chinese section outside of China. Byzantium, Middle East and Egypt sections are weak comparing to the museums that I've been in Istanbul and Vienna. I really enjoyed biodiversity and dinosaurs. Overall, it's been...

The Chihuly exhibit at the ROM. The only word that says it all is WOW! These were the most fabulous works of art I have ever seen. The only way is to see them so as to believe. The ROM is located on the corner of the scenic University of Toronto campus and fashionable shopping on Bloor street and Yorkville, the ROM provides several galleries of really interesting historical exhibits, with the opportunity for also visiting scenic activities nearby. My only peeve is the obnoxious new addition on the Bloor street side of ultra modern, cold glass and...

A wonderful piece of architecture and Toronto landmark.This museum has been and continues to be a part of my life from childhood until now. I've been many times but, continue to always find something new to learn about.This is a great place to take children because of the enormous collection of dinosaur bones. This museum is wonderful because is large and you can spend time there. Split a good time to visit the museum and go to the store. In February on Tuesday after 6:00 PM is free the visit, you can check this is working yet.You can use the CityPass too.

We started with the ROM "Highlights Tour" that went by very fast about 45 minutes of globetrotting around to different cultural settings. The best museum in Toronto fairly recently revamped with a new "crystal" facade and higher admission pricetag.Bottom and top floors cover social history (Asia on the bottom floor and Europe and middle east on the top) fantastic dino exhibits on the middle floor very nicely laid out with lots of fossil mammals too. Went on a cold day waiting for the Santa Parade. The many exhibits are varied and well done. The gems were stunning, spend quite a bit of time admiring all the beauty. The Liebeskind addition truly adds to the existing older buildings of theis natural history museum. The present show on glass by Chiluly is fantastic and its a Busy place full of visitors, children etc.
Breathtaking , beautiful exhibit, can't be missed on your trip to Toronto , have seenit few times now and it will not be the last time , there is always something new to see at the ROM

Vibrant color and shapes AKA the world of Dale Chihuly now on display at the ROM until Jan 8 2017. The ROM itself is certainly worth the trip but the special exhibition of Chihuly's work is what we took the 2 hour drive to Toronto for and we weren't disappointed. I was impressed with the museum. It has many floors and sections. I was unable to see all the sections on every floor but was impressed with what I saw. This museum is a great one to see. I love this museum. The Egyptian section was an educational section for me and my wife. Also the different kinds of animal...
Kiddy saw the Chihuly exhibit at the ROM and highly recommend it. Absolutely stunning huge glass works!

Not only the building is interesting! The inside of this museum has something for everyone. So bring the family and come often. We visited specifically to take in the Chihuly (glass artist) exhibit and it is spectacular.Also had a forgettable and poor quality lunch in their café, something I will avoid in future - a sad basement space and sad food -so many better restaurants and cafes nearby.We toured some of the rest of the museum and found it looking...

The ROM is pretty much always a good place to spend the day, with lots to see in the regular exhibits. This museum shows far too much of other cultures and far too little of the culture of Canada both now and in the past. Many of the artefacts give you the feel of seen it/done it before. For tourists it misses the opportunity to showcase Canada and for us to understand its roots and experiences.

When I need to escape I go the the ROM and find myself transported to different places and times. I can escape to the times of the Romans or Greeks and never leave without learning something new. Haven't been to the ROM in years. We were there just to see the fabulous Dale Chihuly glass exhibit - very well worth the price of admission- but I plan to visit some of the permanent collections next time I'm in TO.

huge and impressive, highly recommended to be visited if you are interested in world culture and natural history, absolutely amazing permanent exhibitions as well as temporary which are switching in a while
The prime reason we visited was for the Chilhuly exhibition, which was brilliant. The rest of the museum was okay.

This is, without doubt, the best museum i've been to. You must allow a whole day to explore everything on offer. Wonderful Family Attraction - good for all ages.I recommend this to any and all to visit multiple times as it is necessary to see more than once to take it all in.Great diversity of cultures are displayed and its history.

Today, I was very much treated to an excellent exhibit of blown glass works, all done by Dale Chihuly, an American man who is well-known for his artistic talent in the above-mentioned area. This exhibit takes place, currently, at the Royal Ontario Museum, the R.O.M., in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. A word of advice: for anybody who is so inclined, this...

We were so lucky to be able to take in the Chihuly exhibition on a layover in Toronto. The online ticket ordering was easy, and it took a lot of pressure off us to know we wouldn't be stuck in some endless lineup. At every turn, staff were friendly and helpful at every turn. For visit who is the first time come to Toronto, you should be consider here to look. They have different language brochure to help you understand. Share pictures with you.
Took some time to visit the ROM last week to see the Chihuly exibit , if you dont know who he is or have not seen his work , DO IT. amazing stuff , well planned out .Wow just wow.
An amazing museum with so much to see. My great Uncle has his art in the museum and they had a private showing for us.

The ROM has outstanding collections that range from totem poles to dinosaurs to mummies and everything in between. A superb place to check out!It's always improving and new stuff gets added for every visit. If you love art, history, science, anthropology and what not- this is your place.
Great museum with 4 levels to occupy yourself all day and feed your intellect!Perfect place for families.

I enjoyed the combination among various things: dinosaurs, Greek art, lifestyle, geology, etc. Very well balanced and absolutely enjoyable. Ideal for families with children, but also for a walk in search of relaxation and possibly intellectual emotion.

We went to see the Dale Chihuly exhibit and were not disappointed. His glass work is outstanding and the exhibit was unbelievable. The boats filled with glass objects, the underwater scene with small sea creatures (Slugs, rays, fish etc,) sculpted onto glass reeds, the orange bowls, the ceiling of glass, and so much more. This is a definite must see.

Visited the Museum to see the Chihuly Exhibition on the recommendation of a Toronto resident. It was excellent - the effects created by glass and Chihuly's skill are stunning.
