The wait was long until I figured out how to get tickets on my phone, from then on it was wonderful. The Chihuly exhibit didn't fail to impress, the colors and positioning of the pieces left many in awe. The museum itself had many interesting sites from rocks to bats with a few dinosaurs thrown in.
There is something interesting here for everyone! A must go-and-see! I would suggest to go with the package deal for multiple exhibits, it is the best bang for your buck!

Always something interesting to see and do at the ROM. I have been here several times since I was a child and always enjoyed it.
Amazing exhibits in a beautiful older Toronto building. All the classics with something new coming for a stay all the time! Great place for families, schools or solo!

Went to the ROM today and saw the wonderful Chihuly glass exhibition.What talent and imagination.Plus we also got to see, again, the terrific dinosaur and other prehistoric artifacts.Get down there and see the Chihuly exhibit before it ends in December.

An amazing museum. So much to see in there. Make sure you give a few hours over to it. Families with children will love all the dinosaur exhibitions. There is an excellent selection of exhibits from around the world. Only disappointment was the lack of a guide book. But definitely another of Toronto's must see attractions.

outstanding The works of glass displayed were amaxing, and well worth the price of admission. The entrance moved smoothly with no appreciable time lapse. With the entrance fee, you could also have visited other areas of the museum. perfectly suited for all ages, including young families.

Amazing museum! Worth every visit. My nieces loved the Dinosaur part where they were able to pretend they were excavating Dinosaur bones on sand boxes. The museum is huge and might take longs hours to view everything - focus on what you like best and leave the rest for another visit. The architecture of the building is also stunning -...

Every floor has it own charm. Personally we had the best time on the floor where they have Dinosaurs exhibit. Our kids had amazing time playing and searching for dinosaurs parts . A stunning display of cultural and natural artifacts. Very easy to navigate and the cloaking charge is about $2.50
It was an amazing place to see. There was different collections in each floor. Good choice for all ages to enjoy.
The halls, the atrium and the galleries are worth your trip and money! definitely spend some time here. The only thing is that some halls may charge you extra to visit. check on your ticket entrance.

I visited ROM in November. I wanted to seeAn exhibition before it finished. Having been lucky enough to live in London,UK, I have seen some great museums. This is definitely worth a visit. You can never get tired of going to the ROM. There are constantly changing exhibits, a super dinosaur section, great gift shop...the old and the new in design and architecture. RIGHT downtown.

I come from Ottawa, where we have seven national museums, so we're a bit spoiled for choice when it comes to big exhibitions. Great museum with a very interesting range of displays but it's a rotten shame there's an entry fee. A charge should be limited to special displays/exhibitions, either those brought out from stores or those on loan from other museums.

Visited yesterday with my adult daughters. I have seen several Chihuly exhibitions and this is wonderful for first timers. My daughters loved it, I was in Montreal for their exhibit a couple of years ago, so found this a bit disappointing. We really enjoyed the rest of the museum which was a first for all of us.
It has dinosaurs, animals, birds, remnants, etc. I really loved this place and highly recommend to others.

Good verity of artifacts of many cultures. There is a large amount of large dinosaur bones. The bird collection was my favorite as they are displayed very well. This is a very large museum and there are many places to sit and rest

Very nice museum, definitely worth a visit if you are in Toronto. My favourites were the dinosaurs skeletons and the biodiversity section (the same as the children there!).
Again if you're visiting Toronto the Royal Ontario Museum is a great afternoon or morning visit. Interesting displays and well done.
Enjoyed all the exhibits its a fun way to spend an afternoon indoors with the family. Enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit.

We went to the ROM for a work event. It was a group art scavenger hunt which was fun. We ate at the cafeteria which wasn't bad. An enjoyable day. I would do it again. It is a definitely good way to see the exhibits with colleagues.
There's a permanent exhibition with natural history and is very interesting. We spent a lot of time there, but after we had lunch on Gabby's, just in front of the museum.

We were at this museum on Halloween and it was a fun day of activities for kids and adults. There was a costume parade which was enjoyable.The Chihuly exhibit was not to be missed! Amazing pieces on display.Other exhibits were from Africa that were also interesting.

This museum is first class: the building is really striking for both its modern extension and its older parts and it has several really interesting exhibits. The collection of dinosaur skeletons in particular is simply fantastic. This makes for a great day out.

We only had an hour and a half,so chose where we wanted to go. Managed to see all of our choices. So much more to see, if you have the time , you could see so much. Would need a few hours at least. The shop on the way out was good too. Worth the visit.

When planning our trip my 15 year old daughter asked if we could visit here as it was great place to visit in combination with some of her studies. everytime our family is in Toronto we go to the ROM...this time we went for this exhibit....it was enthralling to see the "installations"..the museum is great....wonderful dinosaur exhibit...Oriental exhibit is splendid...just a great visit everytime....highly recommended as everyone who has a pulse will enjoy walking through the Museum. and for those who cannot walk, there is accessibility throughout the...

All the CHIHULY works are stunning and it's definitely a "must see" exhibit for anyone who enjoys beauty and creativity. We visited the Chihuly exhibit and loved it!!!!! Very well done!!! We own a door & glass business in the USA and we're tickled to be able to see this exhibit while in Toronto!
The largest stones and gems I ever saw in the world with a very nice presentation - a place to visit

It's a very important place for the kids to visit often , education outside the classroom, a must have experience for the younge generation, it covers everything from geology archeology,dinosaurs from under the earth, the current from the ocean,and the items from space. We are AGO members and this weekend was a free entry to the ROM for us. Went to the ROM to see the Chihulet Glass Exhibit. This was the most amazing exhibition I have ever seen. Been to many museums around the world and this was a fabulous show. Only here till Jan. 8. If you are in Toronto its a must see.
Every time I'm in Toronto I visit the museum. It's so fascinating and I learn something new every time. Great place for families, kids or a first date too!!
Becoming less and less enamored of museums, though there are occasional good ones - this wasn't one of them. Maybe too tired or whatever, but not interactive - dry and still life.
My girlfriend and I came to see the Chihuly glass exhibit exhibition. This is a must see. An amazing show. I like love his work. It is breathtakingly beautiful.

Visited specifically to see the Chihuly exhibit which was very good (go to his Seattle museum for a better time). Explored the rest of the museum and found the set-up for the dinosaurs odd. It was very easy to miss rooms. Go to Druxy's Cafe for a good lunch!
An absolute must. Put your hand on the ball and have your hair raise in all directions and definitely visit the tropical gardens. So much to see and do a day isn't enough.
They know how to be kid-friendly. They have different things on different floors. Have play areas in some parts. Usually have a fun exhibition happening.

This is a very nice museum with a lot to see. The dinosaur exhibit is excellent. The Bat cave is fun. There are lots of interact things for kids to do and learn. We were able to also see the special Chihuly exhibit. It was a wonderful day spent at the museum.

The Rom is a delightful museum in downtown Toronto. Age appropriate for all. They have excellent lecture programs and offer many fun things for children as well. The exhibits are well organized and presented. A must see when you visit Toronto.

Dinosaurs were the most interesting part for my family, also China, Japan and Korea were great!But from my own point of view, after visiting "Toronto zoo" and "Ripley's aquarium" there's nothing much to enjoy with animal models, taxidermy and pictures

Oh my, what a place to visit. We were extremely impressed by the outside of this building, but oh my, this place is huge and a gem of a place with so much to see. It took us two visits to see the whole thing as there is so much to look at and see. It is a not to...
Spectacular exhibit. Dale Chihuly's glass exhibit was so beautiful!The Royal Ontario Museum is easy to get to by transit and a great place for people visiting the city to see.

The ROM has this unique ability to choose historical topics to be featured that most others don't at the opportune times. My favourite til date was the Maya exhibit. Visited here on a Sunday afternoon and it is good for families and couples. It is a fun outing, being able to walk around and check out the different exhibits. My wife and I visited for an afternoon on a recent trip to Toronto. I am not a fan of the ROM (not my type of museum) ... the Chihuly exhibit is well worth the visit. It's on until January 8, 2017.
This is the type of place to spend 3-4 days and still not see it all. Say the Dale Cheholy (SP) glass exhibit. Amazing! Must see when in Toronto.

Even though I travel to Toronto quite a bit, I have not visited the ROM in a few years. This is a good place to spend a few hours. It was very interesting to walk around and look at all the displays and read the materials.

Lovingly known by the local Torontoians as the ROM. It is situated within walking distance of down town Toronto. Highly recommended if the weather is wet and if you want to spend some quality time enjoying the museum. Although it can get busy at times, inside it is spacious and there is lots to see and do. Amazing exhibit. Towering glass art set against perfect lighting. Great artifacts in the museum also.
The only thing I found interesting is the mummy's. There's a lot of vases and dishes in there. The dinosaurs are ok but overall I was so bored.

The ROM doesn't disappoint, from the architecture of the place itself to the wonderful exhibits which have something for all ages. My daughter loved the animals and dinosaurs and I could have walked around the ancient Greek and Roman exhibits for hours. The ROM offers a variety of displays that cover many different topics. There is stuff for kids to enjoy and there is lots of stuff for older people to enjoy, too. You are sure to learn something! Come here for the day to ensure that you see everything!
The ROM is a very fine museeum. Especially the special exhibitions is a must. Staff is well trained and educated. The museum shop is very good!

This is a must see place.Take your time and let the art talk to you. Special exhibition at it best.The museum shop is extra ordinary good. The employees are well educated and competent. A pleasure to visit the ROM.

This is another 'must visit' place in Toronto. It's massive and value for money if you spend the entire day exploring all the rooms. The highlight is the exhibition to the First People, which easily takes two hours to explore fully.There's a lot for children to gain from this trip.

Great way to spend an hour. We went came across this museum by accident while walking on Bloor Street. It's very modern and admission is free. Very informative and full of interesting artifacts. This museum is a must see! We used our Toronto City pass and actually went back and paid a full admission to see the rest of the museum! It is so large and has so much to offer as far as history and information. Very kid friendly, and as an adult, I learned so much! I would come back and...

Well worth catching this exhibit while it's in town. Stunning work by masterful artisans headed by Dale Chihuly. Won't say any more as I wouldn't want to spoil the delight. really normal good everyday food at these touristy place we went to littlindia even though some people dont have a great opinion of this place we ate a beautiful meal there and the staffare fantastic and its reasonable also boston pizza cheap cheerful brilliant atmosphere especially when a blue jays games in town
The ROM is always worth an afternoon, but the Chiluly exhibit is an added bonus. My wife and I walked back and forth through it twice
I went this museum many times, with my friends, with my classmates and with family. Very time I had different experiences!

This museum is just outstanding. They have an amazing collection of relics, archeological findings, medieval time tools, weapons, vehicles etc. I'll leave the rest to you folks, have a look, great place to be at on a fine day.

Museum has a bit of everything and family friendly. I'm sure the kids love the dinosaurs and wild animal displays. I would've liked a bit more European art. Reasonably priced and beautiful building. Worth a visit
I really like their dinosaur display. Looking at them knowing that some of the bones were from actual dinosaurs millions of years ago is mind-blowing.
The glass display they have on just now is fantastic but it cost extra to get in. After visiting it, we were a little underwhelmed by the rest of the museum but the dinosaur display is good.
The museum itself has many different exhibits which is good if you like a lot of variety. The staff member we encountered was rude though. They give you a free map too!

This was a really wonderful experience. 4 of us, all different ages. Lots of fantastic choices, activities and experiences. Loved the Wildlife section the most. We will be going back soon to see what we missed.

The startling crystal design is great, however it results in an uneven floor/gallery plan and the contrast of dinosaurs being displayed in an ultra modern space (with bare white walls) just doesn't work. The collection certainly has some highlights, but compared to the great Museums of New York and Washington, the ROM just doesn't compare in terms of the overall...

All three of us (two 40 somethings and a 15 year old) loved the ROM. The building itself is stunning and the exhibits cover everything from dinosaurs to the Egyptians and mammals. Do not miss the Chihuly exhibit!! It would be easy to spend days in this wonderful museum - it is very convenient to the subway.

I did a mistake of giving myself 'only' 3 hours for this museum. Phenomenal exhibit on chihuly. It had been ages since we had been to the ROM and he only thing that disappointed was the food which I guess isn't why you go to the Rom. Super fun rainy day activity

From beginning in floor 2 I realized dinosaurs bones were not real, all exposures are done with fake bones for handling sake . So, no real bones. Roma Greece Egypt exhibition are not big. No emperors statues shown or even mentioned. In my opinion too expensive.

I saw the dinosaur exhibit and it was fabulous. Life like skeleton bones of various dinosaurs were available, all named with some history. It takes more than one day to see everything at the museum. It took me about 40 minutes to find a parking that close to the museum. Actually there is a not pricy municipal parking on the opposite side of the same street. Even the museum building has futuristic exterior. The museum is rich and well organized.

A review already posted kinda sums this place up "pretty from the outside" While attractive and with a fun subway station (all Museum themed!) the actual museum was very disappointing. Love going to the science center! They have many staple exhibits but always rotate new, exciting ones in as well. It had already been a long day, and we were exhausted, so it was hard to find things to really catch my attention, and reel me in. There was a lot to see, and its probably more of a place for some history buffs. But it's a staple for Ontario, so we had to go.

It's pretty great place with lots to see and do. Some pretty awesome special exhibits. Put on some good shoes cause you'll be doing lots of walking, and give yourself lots of time so you can see it all.
There are enough exhibits to satisfy every interest. This is a world class museum that has fostered traveling displays such as King Tutankhamun artifacts. It has something for all ages!

Not sure about this museum. On the positive side - I found a lot of interesting things in the permanent collections and the special exhibition on the third gender. On the negative side - Long queues to buy tickets, and some rather crowded displays, cramped spaces etc.
Had no issues with this place. It was good. Sufficient exhibits for the whole family. Enough washroom, clean, updated and organized.

I popped in here at see the latest exhibit. I only had an hour and enjoyed the exhibit but wished the admission cost was cheaper if you're only going to see the new stuff. $30 is a lot to shell out for an hour. If you've never been dedicate at least three hours for a visit and stay to enjoy...

If you are a traveler then this museum will not hold you attention as much. very nice place to visit, they have a wise and varied selection of things to look atvery intersting
The exhibition was really lovely. Amazing art to enjoy.Nice building and other exhibits worth seeing.
This was one of the best museum experiences I've had. I loved it. The Dino exhibits were some of my favorites.

"If I had more time, I would have written a shorter letter" wrote Blaise Pascal. Love the Lee-Chin crystal at the entry and the large open spaces in the interior. Exhibits of every kind, from everywhere and every time. So much to see and do! The Chihuly exhibit was wonderful... we went thorough it at the start of the day and again at the end. After 6 hours we felt like we had only scratched...
Every exhibit I visit in the R.O.M. is beautiful.The familiar and the new; dinosaurs, textiles and glass.The recent and very old is very well presented in this very accessible museum.

ROM is truly is a world class museum. It has wonderful permanent exhibits and a great line up of visiting exhibits. Museum is fun for the entire family- big kids and little kids alike. It is stroller friendly. Chihuly's exhibit that is on now is truly magnificent.
Exceptionally creative! loved it!!!!I am not a huge fan of museums and galleries but my best friend insisted on seeing this with her. I must say, i don't regret it at all.
Excellent exhibit of Chihuly pieces. Well laid out and easy to navigate. Well worth a visit, spectacular.

I have visited a lot of museums, but i honestly have to say i got overwhelmed by how many things are squeezed into vitrines.....way to much to examine. Little less would perfectly do the job.Sometimes there are great exhibits in the "crystal", on the upper floor. The Chihuly exhibit was absolutely stunning.I prefer the AGO over ROM ,...

We go often as a family...membership is the way to go...its so much more cost effective and also you will go more often and for shorter visits. Because you are not paying the one time fee, you dont feel obliged to see the whole museum on your visit (which is impossible as there is so much to see). And then...

The ROM is a great activity for parents with children, couples or just on your own.There are some amazing exhibits to visit over and over again - and also new things to seeWandering around the halls and rooms feels like an exercise in peacefulness on weekdays- lots of fun and excitement with the grand kids on weekends.As...

First, It is not an art museum, although they had a special Chihuly show. The museum is mostly anthrological. WE really enjoyed the gem exhibit. It is $27 per person, even if you arrive an hour before they close!

We loved the Royal Ontario Museum, it is a lovely small museum with four floors. We spent 1.5 hours there and explored all the exhibits. The Egyptian exhibition was very good. The museum is included in the Toronto Pass. The building looks amazing from the outside.

Our mistake was to go on a showery Sunday afternoon without tickets! A long queue to buy tickets and an expensive cloakroom ( $2.50 per item) were not a great start. There's a lot to see so give yourself plenty of time to get around.
If you're visiting the Asian or Egyptian areas expect a LOT of pottery. There were some other great parts (like the mummy and huge Asian installations) but lots of pottery.

Great attraction to visit if you are a history lover. It has lots Canadian, Asia, European, Egyptian cultures to visit and look at, I would recommend this attraction to anybody history or none history lovers.
Enjoyed the Chihuly touring exhibit. A nice taste of his Seattle exhibit.Lots to see. We also saw the dinosaur exhibit which was greatGood for a full day.
This is worth a visit in fact it's great. Make sure you have plenty of time to visit the different exhibits. Take your time and enjoy. I would highly recommend that you visit.

We went specifically to see the Chihuly exhibit. It was fabulous! I have seen installations of his work elsewhere but not such a large exhibit. The museum itself is very nice, clean, well organized and easy and enjoyable.
The museum is a gem, in the middle of an excellent area to decompress and enjoy Toronto. The Chihuly displays were fantasy like and the power of colors and lights entertwined was amazing.

It's in a very nice university area. Even walk around the Museum could be something delighting.The Nature and Animal have more content than human being culture. And all the content is arranged in a nice lay out. The kids center is a great place to visit with a lot interactive activities.
The ROM is home to a great variety of exhibits for those with varied interests in museums. It's part natural history, Canadian history, world history, and art, all rolled into one.

This is a museum with a huge collection of artefacts. We spent an entire day in there and did not get round all of the galleries. If you want to take it all in and not just zip around then you will need to allow a couple of days.The exhibits are many and varied in what they cover, but...
It was a great museum. Lots of things to do from Chinese to Dinosaurs passing through Egypt culture. One day is not enough if you want to see everything deeply.
The amount of minerals on display and the beauty of it was something to die for. So much beauty in one place. Just too impressed by its collection

I have to admit that I had difficulty finding my way around. Signage could be improved. I did do a tour of the Roman collection and the docent was very good and knowledgable.I had a wander around various sections. I was disappointed with the first people's section.

I love museums, and this was not different. Really liked it here, it comprises a lot of natural history, nature and also other exhibitions. The problem is that I liked the temporary exhibits more than the permanent ones. A little expensive for what was offered, but overall a great experience, but not in the top museums for me.
The outside architecture it's more exciting. Little expensive and you need to pay more to visit special arts.
Lots to see here- decently well organized, wish it had a more linear or circular pattern but otherwise it was great.

I went to go see the Chihuly and tattoo exhibits. if you have ever been to Vegas and found yourself in awe with the ceiling at Belaggio well then you are in for a real treat. The details, colours, shapes, and amazing sculptures are absolutely remarkable. Pictures do not capture the true art in those pieces. The next exhibit i...

After joining a small queue showing our prepaid pass booklet we accessed the museum spread on several floors inside a building which kept it's original historic walls adding a new contemporary structure on top.What I found annoying was that there were not enough directions on the upper floors so the structure can confuse you: you can see the location...

The ROM is one of these places I always visit when in Toronto. So much to see, with their permanent displays augmented by fascinating and inspiring special exhibitions. It is a place where one can be stimulated and educated and also feel relaxed at the same time. One of Toronto’s five-star attractions, and with good reason.

This museum was a great experience. It covers many historical cultures, from ancient egypt to modern Europe and Northern America. There is also a section on natural science (rocks and minerals). The museum has 4 levels. Be prepared. You can bring your camera and take pictures. For the price (and the content), this museum is a must,

Such variety and so much to do and see that you could easily spend the whole day here! The kids were kept busy learning between many engaging activities available throughout the museum including dress up, archaeology, computer apps, sketching. The staff were very knowledgeable and keen to help. The let down and the only reason for the four star was...
We took our grand children to see the dinosaur exhibit.The adults were amazed just like the children.Another first rate visit to one of the finest museums in the world.

From the moment you catch a glimpse of the contradictory architecture at the museum entrance, you know this is going to be a good day out - or should I say in. The new addition of the crystal structure divides opinion, but I loved it. Inside there is a good mix of natural and cultural exhibits. When we went there...
The Chivuli exhibit is extremely good. You are allowed to take pictures and at slow pace it takes 1 1/2 hours.The ticket is expensive, compare to similar and probably better museums.
We spent a few hours in the ROM on our most recent trip to Toronto. It was an incredible place. With so many different exhibits, there was something for everyone.

The complete tour of the museum could take an entire day. Very informative and interesting. I would recommend to start with your point of interest first and work your way back, because time may not allow you to fully explore everything.
Just packed with things to absorb. Awesome experience for those with a brain. Well laid out and a joy. Will be back again and again. Soooo much to learn.

I took my children with me who were amazed by all the history (especially everything about the dinosaurs!) A lot of touch and feel stations for the kids which is extremely interesting of course :)They still talk about wanting to go back!
Loved the Chinese exhibit and the dinosaurs. We didn't have a lot of time when we visited the museum but tried to fit in as much as possible. Would certainly recommend.

My husband and I spent 4.5 hours here on a Friday and we only made it through the second and third floors! If we had done the first floor, fourth floor, and the Chihuly exhibit, we easily would have spent the entire day here. If you only want to spend a few hours here, I would recommend coming around 1pm...
What an amazing architecture. Beautiful looking building.I spent quite some time just taking photos OUTSIDE of the building.
Really enjoyed this museum I found it to have an excellent balance between entertainment and education.Check out the aboriginal exhibit - was very well put together and interesting.
This is a richly-endowed museum with contents worth many re-visits. Poor photography exhibit in our visit but so much more and better to see.

Visited the museum today as it was the last day of our city passes. It was very good, lots to see. I found the layout a bit confusing, I wasn't sure which sections I had missed etc. Give yourself a few hours to go around
The ROM is a fantastic museum. I've been twice and it still has a lot of value on the second run through. It's a must-see in Toronto.

Enjoyed the opportunity whilst in Toronto to visit this museum as part of my Citypass ticket. Seeing the queues to get tickets, I was glad to have had the advantage of the ticket which enabled me to bypass the queues.The Chinese/Korean/Japanese exhibits on Level 1 were, I felt, particularly well set out to give a sense of light and...
His work is stunning and breathtaking. However it was a quite small exhibit. It was a little pricey unless you want to explore the rest of the museum
Great place to explore history, old culture, fossils and dinosaurs. Displays and exhibits change regularly, but permanent displays are always interesting.

Haven't been to ROM in ages. Did a day trip from Windsor. I have to admit, the new architecture, to me, is rather hideous. That's from the outside. On the inside, it's worse. It looks like unfinished drywall everywhere.That aside, our visit was quite nice. The dinosaur exhibits are stunning. Loved then all.The Third Gender exhibit was eye...

My husband and I visit museums on a regular basis and for a museum with such hype it was not impressive. For one if you are going to replicate dinosaur fossils, then just skip it. For that price I can go to multiple awesome museums. If I was a local I would get a season pass to do some art,...
Enjoyed a fun scavenger hunt at the ROM. Beautiful exhibits. So much to see. Had to come back to see the Chihuly exhibit in June which was awesome!

This building is gorgeous and very interesting, from the outside.For us that was all. We had entry included with our City Passes, but wished we didn't. For around an hour or so, we wondered around here and to be honest didn't enjoy it (each to their own I guess). Maybe we've been spoilt by visiting Smithsonians and other such...

Lackluster permanent collection in a carbuncle with over priced admission! I was amazed why anyone would build a museum where none of the walls are straight and of poor build. Luckily they have some good visiting exhibits, but charge way too much!

seen live size skeletons of diverse types of gigantic creatures which appeared during Triassic period. very good for childrenHad a diner at the museum and was very efficiently served fro a large crowd of people gathered from all corners of the world.
Well worth the visit for the Chihuly glass exhibition . Quite amazing. Would recommend this exhibit. The ROM itself is always worth a visit for the regular collection

I love this museum because it has extensive dinosaur and animal collections. The particular reason for reviewing it though is the Dale Chihuly exhibition which is simply outstanding, mind-blowing and well worth the extra fee to experience. We spent a long time just mesmerized by the spectacle and had a really enjoyable visit.

This is a first class museum and one we have visited on various occasions.This time we went to see a special exhibition of Chihuly glass, which was incredibly beautiful and showed off this artist's work to perfection.The museum has much to see and it is difficult to describe the range of its collection.

So many great exhibits. I enjoyed the Native American one the most. Great history there, even if it has been watered down and candified to underplay the savage role old england and the new worlders played in destroying it.Chihuly exhibit was great, wherever this guy sets up exhibits. I will go, it's always special

Perfect combination of art, science and history! This museum has very detailled and comprehensive collections of world cultural heritage and natural history. Especially loved the volunteers in the biodiversity section explaining details!

Wow! What an amazingly beautiful Museum. I can't even put into words for you the reader to fathom how large this place is. It is gargantuan! We could not even see it all. We received a free tour from Anica, who really knew her stuff! I particularly enjoyed the bee hive exhibit, which had a whole colony of live bees,...

The museum has some really interesting exhibits. But the best thing is the special Friday nights, from Sept 30 to Nov 25. There's food, drink, live music, and free access to the new exhibits. We went last Friday and saw the spectacular Chihuly exhibit, the Japanese woodcuts, and the Asafo flags. Most people are downstairs drinking, eating, and listening to...

The ROM is a must-see in Toronto. There are endless exhibits to see and it seems to never end; this is by no way a complaint! I thought I might only be inside for a few hours, but those few hours turned into almost seven-eight (and I still didn't see everything! A complete tour can be done in a day,...

This is one of the gems if Toronto. There are numerous galleries devoted to various collections. The gem collection is incredible. Armour is impressive. If you have kids then the bat cave is not to be missed. Chinese collection is reputed to be world famous. The current Chihuly show is not to be missed.

The museum contains notable collections of dinosaurs, minerals and meteorites, Near Eastern and African art, Art of East Asia, European history, and Canadian history. It houses the world's largest collection of fossils from the Burgess Shale with more than 150,000 specimens. The museum also contains an extensive collection of design and fine arts, including clothing, interior, and product design, especially...
If you have a couple of hours to spend, I recommend this museum. The Dale Chihuly exhibit was outstanding!
Went for a business dinner and was only allowed to the gallery which have all kind of dinosours on display. If you like dinosours, here's the best museum to go!

We went to this museum to see the Chihuly display, but this museum is worth seeing for all its displays. It is also very easy to get there as it has its own subway stop, it was 15 minutes from our hotel.

Just not enough time to see everything. We thought three hours would be enough... wrong. Take all day, every exhibit takes a long time ago through because it's so informative. We're going back again before leaving Toronto, don't want to miss any of it

We had the pleasure of taking our relatives from England to the Museum in Toronto .Being history buffs they were overwhelmed with the many exhibits . This is a place where you could spend days and not see all there is . I would suggest to spend the extra and visit the blown glass exhibit just breathtaking to say...

THERE is a lots of good memories.& good thing to keep in mind of olden time knowlad ge , very new thing and unblleve thing to keep in mind. it is very good thing to all age of people . ov er all there is very amazin thing., and good attraction&
Enchanting collection of glass sculptures displayed on black reflective surfaces.Also stunning Pavillion with fan-shaped 'flowers'.
Plan to spend a whole day if not more as this place is never ending with beautiful displays and exhibts. We found the gift shop very expensive and way above our budget.
Don't miss this beautiful exhibit of blown glass. Some is similar to his installation Bellagio in Vegas. Brilliant colors, design masterpieces.
Nice museum...nothing really extraordinary about...a typical visit ..if you like visiting museums wherever you go nice enough.

We are not much on museums but this one was exceptionally well done. it had info and artifacts from all over the world and was well laid out based on regions and continent. A short walk from the streetcar stop.

This is definitely a place where you can roam. We liked that there was plenty to see, but also that there was space between the exhibits to walk as well as spots to sit and look. That allowed us to take our time.
Excellent displays for all ages and interests but be sure to check website for special exhibitions, order tickets (often timed entry) and plan visit around them.

You would need at least four hours to do the museum justice but really appreciated our tour guide who showed us the main highlights. There was a beautiful glass art display which was mind boggling in terms of the intricacies involved in the creation of the elaborate pieces, as well as a tattoo exhibit. An enjoyable day rounded off with...
We went especially to see the Chihuly exhibit--which was amazing. Their dinosaur gallery is informative and fun. That's all we had time for but we'll definitely visit again!

This museum had a little of everything to view - they had tons of art work from all around the globe - archeology amd science objects - special exhibit on tattoes, beautiful tapestries, Canadian/Chinese/Indian artifacts. We spend 4 hours there and didn't cover everything.This is a must see when visiting Toronto
This visit took most of our rainy day as there is plenty to see here. There were children's events therefore lots of families on a Saturday an enjoyable day
The architecture was absolutely amazing. The pairing of a glass extension to a landmark building. Brilliant!
This museum was particularly interesting and gave an insight into Canadian history and in particular the First Nation. We spent a very enjoyable few hours here.

We had a day to kill in the area and went to the ROM. A day is not enough. This museum has such a broad range of displays from natural history, world history, Canadian history and so much more. I suggest you give yourself lots of time to allow for reading all the information and to experience all the displays....
Such a beautiful museum! The visiting exhibition is surreally stunning and my favorite area of the museum, the gorgeous collection of minerals always makes my day!

Beautifully laid out museum - the mineral and gem room could have taken me all day. Lots for children to see and do here as well. Great Dinosaur walk and exhibits. Cafe was just ok, but served its purpose.

I love museums any time I get a chance to visit one I try to capitalize. If your in the Toronto area and you just want to burn some time, but stimulate your mind at the same time this is the perfect place.

This is a somewhat eclectic museum, with things both modern and ancient. We started at the top and worked our way down, all the way to the basement cafeteria.Will go back, if we ever visit Toronto again.
Fun for the whole family. The dinosaur exhibit is a must. Great place for a birthday party. Keep in mind you can't bring in any outside food.

Totally enjoyed the Chihuly" exhibit!The blown glass and play with light and color was outstanding!! It was well worth the visit! This was way more than I had imagined...Also checked out the Dinosaur exhibit while we were there, and it was fantastic! It was a nice enjoyable way to spend the afternoon!If you are in Toronto, the...
An exhibition not to miss!!Beautiful colours, amazing shapes and blending of vivid colours.A master piece of art work in glass.

This museum is amazing! There is so much to see and the exhibits are really well laid out. The temporary travelling exhibits are always worth checking out too and usually that is when I go visit. Really a must-see in Toronto if you like museums!

This place is like all the Smithsonian museums mashed into one. And that's not a bad thing! Mainly a museum of natural history, it's got a good collection of fossils, art from antiquity, etc. Wonderful gems and natural metals. My wife and I spent a rainy day here and LOVED it.

A few of us decided to visit this attraction and we spent around 2 hours here and it was enough because there is just so much to see. You need a couple of days to see everything!Very interesting and exhibits are well set up.Hard to find your way around at the start.Visit if you are into this...
Royal Ontario Museum is a must see in your Toronto visit! Do reserve a halfDay for this visit! It's quite expensive but it's worthy!
A lot to learn for everybodyThe dinosaur part was interesting.the part about First Nations was amazing.

Love the exhibition, beautiful colors of glass art sculptures, amazing displace, one of the exhibition you got to see it, the color makes you feel so happy and definitely makes my grandson excited when he sees all the colors(he is only 5months old), money will worth spend for the exhibition.

Flew in for a day in Toronto & Royal Ontario Museum was high on the list to visit. We walked up from the CN tower along University to reach the museum to be told by staff the museum is closed for a private function. Nothing on the website stated this & would never see a museum of this scale in...

This Museum is Huge! Spread over 4 floors there is more than enough to cater for everyone. Exhibits range from stunning rocks from the moon and our own planet to the evolution and impact of humans on biodiversity.Lots of animals to see and a fun section for the kids. Fun facts and interaction stations available. There are exhibits spanning...

We were so lucky to be visiting when this exhibition was on.. Dale Chihuli is a pioneer in the studio glass me cement. His works are a riot of colour in installations that fill the room. Truly exceptional. A must see if you come across his work.The rest of the museum is excellent as well
I went here with my family it was so fun we. enjoyed the dinosaurs ,animals and ended with the stone .

Interesting building if nothing else! There was an exhibition by Chihuly on which is why I visited, cost extra to see that, but totally worth it! His work is amazing and ROM gave it sufficient space to be enjoyed.Eat int he restaurant there too, pretty good!

Bigger isn't always better. The museum is large, however we found an entire section with random pieces of furniture and doors (yes, doors) on display. We couldn't think of a purpose for the display other than to fill what would have otherwise been empty space.Top 5 Things to Know:1. Buying a CityPass ticket in advanced is smart! We...

There are so many floors, ages, and empires to travel through. My wife and I started from the top with Egyptian, Greek and Roman and worked our way down. The dinosaurs were fun and we learned so much! I was slightly disappointed with the Canadian and Chinese areas as they lacked historical information though they did share lots of styles...

The ROM is big, spent a good 4 hours there. Thoroughly enjoyed the dinosaurs and animals and ended with the stones being mined. From exhibits of china, africa, earths treasures, textiles, rome, european flair, military exhibits and the list goes on. Glad we did not do the extra exhibits as there is enough to see. Great for teens learning history...
The layout of the museum is very open, so if you're not careful you can miss exhibits, the Chihuly art glass exhibit was very beautiful and worth the extra few dollars

Did some viewing alone, but took advantage of the docents' tours. Each docent has a different take on things and they are most informative. The museum is located in a beautiful university area, and I enjoyed walking around the neighborhood. Just wish I had had more time since I stayed until close and didn't get to see everything.

To be honest, I walked away from a recent visit to the ROM feeling as though I was attending an exhibition of gyproc...I'm not impressed with the collection any more... and am totally disappointed with the modern entrance...I'm just glad they didn't destroy the former facade of the older building and its historic interior rather than just detract...

The ROM was calling my name from my Hotel window, and like a young school boy, I couldn't wait to start wandering the endless halls, and floors of history, Art, geography and more. I have found it's always best in a huge facility to get a floor plan, pick out the highlights, visit them in order, and then go back,...
This has Something for everyone. Loved the dinos! Gems were amazing too. Great museum for the whole family.

Maybe my expectations of Museums have changed after visiting the Smithsonian, but this Museum was a bit of a let down. Large rooms full of furniture. Lots of bones. Went here on the City Pass. The main exhibition "Chihuly" wasn't included, so we didn't want to pay extra. No obvious layout of what to see first, and where to go....
a lot of different stuff to see..... great to take kids .... food is cool tooo... you will be here a lot of hours (if you want to see everything)
The ROM does not have history exhibits, but also has exhibits for the nature around Canada. I was greatly impressed with the museum.

I love museums and this place is a great place to get your museum thrills from! Very informative, open, clean, and organized! It reminds me a lot of the natural history museum in Washington D.C. Definitely worth a visit if you love to learn!

A must visit, the only crazy thing I have to say about the ROM is that it's so silly that each big exhibit costs extra to get into over top of the general admission. Huge money grab, a specially for torontonians..
Didn't have enoug time to see all the exhibits. If you go alone, plan 3 to 4 hours. With kids, 1 or 2 since they'll get bored or exhausted.

This Chihuly exhibit was beautiful. His work is so different and worth seeing. We were disappointed that the exhibition was quite small. We had seen his exhibit in Dallas, which was much larger, but outdoors. Indoors at the ROM the glass sculptures reflected the light in very special ways. Definately worth a visit.
Interesting, educational and historic. Would recommend to anyone visiting Toronto to take the time to visit the ROM. You will not be disappointed.

Went in here using our Toronto pass and to skip the line too. Modern building that is stuffed full of artefacts and exhibits from around the world. We asked at the information desk for tips on the best bits as it would take a week to see everything in here. Good information given and we had a good 3 hours...

The Museum has an extensive collection and is quite varied. There is something on display for the entire family to enjoy, While at the Museum I saw a number of different age patrons enjoying themselves. The museum is well laid out and makes navigating the collection easy and straight forward.The museum is easy to get to with subway stopping...

The collection is extensive and varied so you need to focus on areas of interest. If you are resident or in Toronto for a week or more then it is good to visit in bits of 2-3 hours at a time to avoid saturation. Exhibits are well explained.

I had a good time. There are four floors in this building, and the very top floor is for the tattoo art show. Which you have to pay extra if you want to go and see. I didn't go, maybe next time since it does seem interesting. But don't worry, the other three floors has a lot of showcase as...

This is one of the most varied museums I have ever been to and definitely one of the best. We took one highlight tours which is part of the admission and was really fun. Most museums contain your Roman/Egyptian artefacts but this also has dinosaur bones, fossils and crystals including a meteor and you can also see a 1 million...

We spent a very enjoyable and interesting afternoon in this museum and were surprised by the quality of the collection. From Roman sculptures to beautiful Buddhas and amazing Chinese wall hangings, to a fascinating section on animals, dinosaurs and the natural world etc, this museum has something for everyone. The only downside was the mobs of children on 'summer camps',...
Lots of information here. Particularly interesting was the history of the indigenous people to the land.

It's a history museum + natural museum in one. Great Egyptian collection and lots of dinosaurs, the Japanese galleries are very good also. You need 3-4 hours to walk this small gem. If you are into architecture, this museum has a addition by a famous architect, very good photo opportunities. Pros: Cool gift shop, little crowds, part of city pass,...

column3: São Carlos do Pinhal, São Paulo, Brazil
column4: The museum has a great collection from China, Japan and Korean. They also have a wonderful collection from Rome. People will be fascinated with the mummies. Children will be fascinated with the amount of interesting activities for them.
Great museum & store. Chihuly exhibit was exceptional. Very easy to borrow a wheelchair & very accessible.

This is one place with something for everyone. There is an activity centre for little ones. There are plenty of exhibits for all sorts of interests from animals to fine gems.We went to see the Dale Chahuley exhibit and it was breath taking. This is art at its finest. We were a little disappointed to have to pay extra...
This is a must see. The Unique design of the building and exhibits make this a great visit. There are great lunch Dinner options over the road within a 10 minute walk
Went in not knowing what to expect to see the Chihuly exhibit. Greatly surprised but the museum as a whole. Diverse exhibits, - art, history, and science!

It is the typical generic museum I like to visit when I travel to a new city, however, it doesn't have as much as I would like to. In addition, it is quite expensive, not to say very.Profit on Fridays afternoon-evening when it costs half the price.
I Took my children to the museum. They enjoyed some of the history and artifacts like the mummies and dinosaurs. They really liked the interactive play areas. Educational and fun!

Truly a world class museum that all Canadians should be proud of.Great permanent exhibitions, really interesting seasonal exhibitions & even a good gift shop that has souvenirs that aren't cheesy.A must see for all tourists & Canadians alike.My only complaint is that the cafe is not state of the art but a Deli chain...... So boring.For...

OMG! This museum surprised the heck out of me, in a good way. I ended up staying over 5 hours, I had a breakfast pastry, yummy, and a good lunch there. The people are nice that work there, the exhibits are varied and very high quality. I kept seeing one good thing after another, almost as good as the MET!...
Many historical information. My kids enjoyed it and learned many things. Lovely souvenir shop with unique stones.

Depending on what is on display, the ROM is hit and miss. That said, great for families as the child friendly works have some awesome interactive stuff (that I wish adults had too!). I would reserve 3hrs to see it in full. The lunch there is nothing spectacular so feel free to bring a snack and walk to one of...
We visited the ROM to see the Chihuly exhibit and it did not disappoint! The exhibit was fabulous! We also visited other exhibits and learned quite a lot. You could really spend a whole day here.

The Royal Ontario Museum is part of the City Pass package. It holds a great selection of antiquities from Ancient Greece and Rome as well as many from 16th, 17th, 18th, and 19th century Europe. They also hold a large collection of Dinosaur bones.The City pass is a must for Toronto visitors! It includes the zoo, aquarium, Casa Loma,...
I go to museums occasionally but I would definitely visit this one again. The history and exhibits they have here are tremendous and you could spend a couple of days touring it.

Recommended for those interested in antiquities and an afternoon activity indoors. I found it a bit costly, as I do with many museums in major cities. I wish there was a donation option for those who cannot afford the full price.

You are walking around Toronto. The ROM is in your guide, and you are not sure. Then? I live here in Toronto. You have a lot to do in this city if you are 3 or 5 days. Then 3 to 4 hours at the ROM should be a part of your journey. First, the renovation of the building is...

The Royal Ontario Museum offers a step back in time to pre-historic times and a great glimpse into the world around us. A fun way to spend a day and there is something for everyone at this destination.

As Toronto residents, my wife and I never had the inclination to eat here, but with visitors we decided to give it a try. Since we made reservations, we were whisked past the hour and a half lineup and went quickly up the elevator to the restaurant where we were greeted and shown to our table. The service was of...
Granted we didn't allocate more than about and hour & a half to visit, but the displays were so-so. Nothing spectacular or highly memorable. Disappointing.
wonderfully surprised with the amount of areas to see and things to learn! Wish we had more time to see everything.

We got here late in the afternoon but were able to see most of the museum. We did not do the extra exhibits-Tattoos and Chihuly. We aren't interested in tattoos and have seen Chihuly twice where we live. We did see the Egyptian exhibit and spent a lot of time there. It is highly interesting. You can see how living...
A very educational place to spend some time. Beautiful exhibits depicting history, art, Culture. Great for kids. Lots of hands on exhibits. Favorite place was the First Nations museum.

ROM is amazing ! For someone who love museums this is the perfect place to go. People say that 3 hours there is enough but after being there for 6 hours I am not sure did we see everything ! Displays are just amazing , and one of the floors is perfect for kids.
Interesting .. especially the section dedicated to the stones , precious and not... Take's up to two hours to visit it well .

Our family loves the ROM. Great dinosaurs and always amazing visiting exhibits. I definitely recommend the Chihuly exhibit this year (2016), the colours and creativity of these sculptures are really unlike anything we'd seen before.

With one of the largest Egyptian exhibits in the world and an equally impressive dinosaur exhibit, the ROM is a great museum. The problem is there is so much to see it becomes overwhelming! Great interactive exhibits for kids. Special exhibits cost extra and are not included in the Toronto City Pass package.

Many years ago, when I lived in Toronto, I visited the " Old Royal Ontario Museum". What a delight that was. On a recent trip to Toronto I decided to visit the museum again. What a waste of time!!!! First, the new architecture that housed the exhibits, was dreadful. All impossible angles and dead ends which called for a lot...

Friend came from overseas and we went to see the ROMWe had a lovely day out and thoroughly enjoyed the exhibitsI love to go wander around and see what's new and see any of the exhibits that are visitingEducational and relaxing

The museum is a mandatory stop if visiting Toronto, always interesting exhibits and the permanent collection is fascinating. The location can't be beat, you can fit some shopping and sightseeing after.

The museum is nice especially the part on native Indian people, yet from an European point of view is pretty strange. Everything has been reconstructed and from dinosaurs skeletons is hard to distinguish original from reconstructed part. I think it's pretty a pity but I understood that that is the way Americans do museum, they rebuild.

This was a good place to visit for the toddler, kids, adults and seniors in our group. For the toddler and kids there is a play area and hands-on discovery zone, bat cave and dinosaur dig. There is a large exhibit on dinosaurs with interactive screens that allow you to learn more about each specimen- the kids really liked that....
Great museum, lots of things to see, many levels of great artifacts, was not bored at all. Took you through the history, ancient Egypt part was great (actual mummies on display).

My husband and I stopped in at the ROM, basically because it was a rainy day. We enjoyed the animal and dinosaur exhibits along with the coats of armor. I thought the museum was "just ok", but earlier in the week I had been in the Henry Ford Museum which was AMAZING so that was a high bar to compare...

The Royal Ontario Museum is a great museum but has become disturbingly crowded and expensive. The things I like about it are the European, Chinese and Canadian collections. After letting our membership lapse, we decided recently to renew it and are glad that we did! I visited two of the ROM's featured exhibitions for an hour or so while in the Bloor & Queen's Park Crescent area on other business earlier this week. The Chihuly, "From sand. From fire. Comes beauty." is much more than the use of...

The first thing you see at that show is a rowboat ful of glass bubbles and it only gets more amazing as you continue on through the show. The second show I saw was the other feature-The Art and History of TATTOOS. Not for the faint of heart. The original tools for tattoo were nothing short of primitive and nasty....

They have some of most interesting dioramas of any museum we go to. If you visit Toronto 3 times a year it is worth getting a membership (discount for out of towners). The latest works are glass art by Chihuly and it is breathtaking. But every exhibit we have seen is like that. For example the Titanic artifacts, or the...

Bring walking shoes, camera or maybe a sketch pad and open mind and some time. There is lots to learn at the museum!Not necessarily the best place for little kids as outside of the animal and interactive exhibits as there are not too many interactive parts outside of the kid zone and they would likely get bored fast. However...

I have been to the ROM three times and I have never been able to see the whole place in one visit, it is just too big and there is too much to see. The constantly changing exhibits are great to keep things fresh.I have been to museums all over the world and although my favourite was the natural...

First of all, I noticed the lines tend to get somewhat crowded but since I had a City Pass I didn't have to wait at all!!They have great exhibits I enjoyed most of them, the ones I liked the most were the Chinese, Chihuly and the Minerals, the others were OK.At the time of my visit they had...
Kids and parents will love dinosaur displays which are very impressive. Kids below 8 years will specifically enjoy Kidspak.

We are 2 seniors from Washington DC and spent over 5 hours walking through these extensive exhibits. High quality cultural collections from all parts of the world are well presented, labeled and explained. With only one day to visit, we had to choose only a few items in each area to read thoroughly and continue to move forward. We spent...

We were attracted to the museum to see the Chihuly glass art exhibit, which was spectacular, we also really enjoyed the Chinese exhibit. Loved the museum but felt it needed a few more guides or even security guards.Spent a lot of time trying to find someone to help me. Even the brochure handed out with your ticket didn't mention When the guided tours started. One exhibit was listed on my brochure but it didn't start until the following month.

There are a variety of exhibits that are very suitable for young children. We went to ROM in August for the Chihuly exhibit. We really enjoy it and make sure to bring a good camera to capture the beauty of all the glass sculptures.
Visited the ROM with my son. Tickets fairly expensive. It is ok as a museum. Maybe it is unfair comment as I am comparing it with museums in London which have amazing collections and are free.

I came here mostly for the Chihuly exhibit which was terrific! The rest of the museum is quite good too including the small but interesting Bat Cave and the dinosaur exhibits. I was disappointed to have missed the tattoo exhibit by a few days and further disappointed to find the Egypt exhibit to be closed on the day I came....
Every visit is an amazing experience for the entire family. Especially young kids. My children love the dinosaurs to this day and have seen them countless times.

I have been to a number of museums over the many years and this is just slightly above average. For the price it is a good price and has a nice hands on area. It seemed that most of the dinosaur exhibit were not originals. For this size of a city I expected more then I have seen in many...

I visited the Royal Ontario Museum on Fri. Step. 2 to see the Tattoos exhibit and to experience their summer nights at the C5 lounge. There was a jazz trio performing that night which performed very well. The lounge atmosphere was hip with modern decor. It would have been nice if they had a better selection of drinks instead of...

Very unique and beautiful. I only spent about 10m - 15 minutes perusing the installations. Spent another 30-40 minutes roaming through the iconic exhibits in this magnificent building. You could easily spend several hours. Found it a bit pricey at $29.00 - but I guess that is what the big city costs.

Beautiful building design filled with more than a day's worth of enjoying! There was a very interesting special exhibit on Tattoos and the regular collection on dinosaurs and Rome were both amazing to see. Something for anyone on a couple of rainy days!
Love the ROM. Again used CityPass as everything in Toronto as everything is $$$$. Would like to see more at the Rom as I'm sure they have a lot of items stored away.

We went to the ROM mainly to see the Chihuly glass collection. It was spectacular and should be on everyone's list as a must see. There were no guided tours but there was a video of the Chihuly history which was fascinating. The rest of the museum was standard museum exhibitions.

Went to the ROM to take in the Tattoos exhibit. Bought discount tickets for the special show through Costco. The ROM has a spacious and well-rounded selection of displays featuring natural history, decorative arts, geology and archaeology appealing to kids and adults alike. The special exhibits are generally compelling and can take easily take one to two hours to go through. There's a lot to choose from, so it's worth prioritizing your visit to ensure you see your top...

We took our three year old and 15 month old for a visit and enjoyed ourselves very much! We pretty much covered the entire second floor, which is where all the kids stuff is and there was a lot to see and do. Go early with little ones so it's not too busy and they have more freedom to roam....
My kids loved all the dinosaurs. We spent many hours walking around. Parking is pricey but it is anywhere in Toronto

We love the dinosaur exhibits and the bat cave, as well as the hands-on exhibition for kids. We thought Chihuly was a bit disappointing, the exhibition is very small and I'm not sure it is worth the price.

The ROM is located in downtown Toronto, easily accessible by public transit. Currently the Dale Chihuly exhibit From Sand. From Fire. Comes Beauty., is showing. A must see! The scope of Chihuly's oeuvre is breathtaking. Also of interest are the Romanesque and Gothic sculpted Madonna's. The bat cave and dinosaurs are a favorite for many. You will not be disappointed.
This is such a wonderful museum. All cpls and families visiting Toronto shouldn't miss out on a day at ROM. Such a great and well kept museum unlike any other

We had a fantastic day at the museum. Boys are older now so the Tatoo exhibit was especially interesting to them. We were not planning on going to see the Chihuly exhibit, but changed our minds when we were there. Got a discount as we had also paid for the Tatoo exhibit. This museum is world-class and has exhibits which the entire family will enjoy, including children of all ages. I recommend it highly.

We went to the ROM for the first time in years (my bad) to CHIHULY, an amazing show of huge, mouth-blown glass. This world famous artist and his team leave you breathless. The Royal Ontario Museum has always been a staple whenever we visit Toronto. Honestly, I had not been there since both of my girls were quite Young but it was great for them to experience even know that they were all grown up. Great museum with plenty of neat artifacts to see! I am much into history stuff, and this is the place to go! Nice reasonably priced gift shop too.

My main reason for going was to see the Chihuly exhibition as I had seen some of his work in the more natural setting of Kew Gardens some years ago.The exhibition was superb, some of the larger exhibits were stunning! After seeing friends posting about this exhibit and seeing TV coverage I was still a bit apprehensive about whether or not this was worth the cost of entry. Rest assured, this exhibit is absolutely gorgeous and only on until the end of the year. Really enjoyed it - as did my 10 year old daughter. She did not have the...

If you don't know who this artist is, go see this show anyway. The master of blown glass will take your breath away. I could have bought a small 12 inch glass bowl for $600, 20 years ago. His bowls that size are available at ROM now for over $10,000 a piece. His installations are big and small and all...
Different era of art work. We took 4 hour moving from one era to another amazing work. It will need tow visit to see everything and enjoy.

As an art lover, I had to visit ROM. Arrived early because I hadn't bought my ticket online, the queue awaiting was long but surprisingly I didn't have to wait at all, 10min and I was in. This is a wonderful museum. We arrived not too long after the museum opened, and we stayed until just before closing. We could have spent longer there. The special exhibits were fantastic. We would want to visit again.

Great museum but most exhibitions were curated in mazes. There's no clear map and very hard to find specific area that we were looking for. However the employees were extremely friendly, even the security guard who walked us to the Tattoo Exhibition because we couldn't find the elevator.The exhibitions were great. We enjoy the special Exhibition of Chihuly. The...

deserves a look. but i prefer these exhibits in their natural settings versus in a museum, but not all can fly to venice or vegas. i thought they looked tired or dusty, also the look dont touch - kinda got that too. wish there was some interactive anything. not for young kids.
The exhibit was excellent and the museum is huge. Great way to spend the day and a must see while in town

The city pass did not grant access to the top floor.Excellent displays and subject material.Too much to take in, need to budget 3 to 4 hours for walking around and exploring.I was disappointed in the gift shop. I was looking for a cool ROM shirt but did not see any.

This was one of the highlights of my visit to Toronto. Plan for this to be at least a half day activity. Splendid Asian exhibits and a very complete display of minerals, gems and jewelry. Also natural history and paleontology exhibits. Nice food options at the cafe too. I definitely recommend visiting this museum, admittance can be obtained with a...

Good Price! Been a few times and there is always a new exhibit so you dont feel like you're seeing the same thing all the time. For just under $20 a person you can spend HOURS here. Always learn something. If you can, GO!

Stopped here on my first stop with City Pass (I highly recommend!). They had just opened so it wasn't too busy. Loved all of the exhibits! I personally think that this is more of an "adult" friendly museum. Or at least the top levels are. Not much for interactive or fun things for kids. However I personally enjoyed every minute...

Good mix between a traditional museum ( ancient history, natural sciences ) and a trendy museum. Presently there are two exhibition Chihuly and tattoo that are very good. You can spend hours in the Chihuly exhibition - the colors,shapes and layout is fabulous.The traditional exhibition are the same as in any other museum in the world

Since I was a kid this place has been a favourite. The dinosaur exhibit is a must visit but there is so much to see and explore. Went to see the special Chilhuly Glass exhibit - which was outstanding! Stayed to enjoy other parts of the museum. The section on Canada as a US citizen was really appreciated. The Egyptian was much better than the Fields's.

Enjoyed the Asian history and dinosaurs! Very nice modern, hi tech, hands on museum. Plenty of Canadian history as well. Free wi-fi. Bathrooms are hi tech, Toto toilets, dyson washer / dryer for your hands.

I returned to the Royal Ontario Museum after an absence of 50 years. I was in high school the last time I visited. It was incredibly interesting with sections devoted to Asian. Canadian and European history, animals, dinosaurs and minerals. There were a couple of special exhibits but didn't visit these due to an additional cost. This place is vast...
went as part of Toronto citypass was a neat place i think if our kids were older they would of had more fun lots to see and read
The mammoth amount of glass, the mammoth amount of work, the astounding and pleasing result is most enjoyable. The history of the man is intriguing.A most enjoyable visit.
There is so much to see and the exhibits are very well presented. We will go back because we didn't have time to see everything.
Great museum..it's super big, with tons of amazing items. The Chihuly exhibit is fantastic, but cost extra. The tattoo is also extra, but disappointing.

We went as part of our City Pass. The design of the building from the outside is very cool. The inside is nice and has four levels. The fourth level you have to pay extra to see so we skipped it. The other displays were nice. Nothing too exciting. Was a nice way to spend a hot afternoon in the...
We have a family membership and worth every money. It has a new exhibit every three to six months, which makes it worthwhile to hAve a membership. Excellent amenities within the museum.
Perfect timing to see the Chihuly exhibit. Museum is must visit if you are in Toronto. A good glimpse into to the soul and character of the region.

You should take your time to visit ROM.Great place. A good tip if you are traveling to Toronto for your first time, is to buy the city pass, which includes the ROM, CN tower, Ripleys aquarium and Casa Loma.

This museum has an amazing and interesting permanent collection. Presentations unfortunately mostly behind glass so photography is difficult. I enjoyed the Canadian collections best as a foreign visitor. The juxtaposition of the old and new buildings/wings is very clever. The temporary exhibitions were great (Chihuly & Tattoos) too.

We love the museum. The first time I went with my kids I saw some people just sitting in chairs reading and I couldn't understand why you would come to such a great place to only sit in a chair and read. After a couple of visits I quickly realized that just being there was awesome and I found myself...

The museum is great and very large. You need at least 4 hours or more, depending on how interested you are in each exhibit.On Friday nights, the museum holds an event with a different theme each night, with live entertainment. Check their website for more details/themes.My friend and I went to the Chihuly exhibit and it was beautiful!...
Visited the ROM mainly for the the Chihuly Exhibit - certainly a must see. Walked thru other exhibits - all very interesting.

I would love to say how much it pleases me to visit the ROM but it is just not my favourite place. I find it overpriced, too crowded and overrated. This opinion is shared by my spouse and 10 year old son. We paid extra on top of our Toronto City Pass to see the Tattoo exhibit. Frankly I could...
Highly recommended if you've kids and also if you like museums. Lots to do. Easily accessible in downtown. Will visit again.

My wife and I absolutely loved our trip to the ROM. I loved it all so much, I don't even know where to begin. It had some great example of ancient Greek pottery as well as a fairly good sized Egyptian exhibit. The section on European periods was well done as well. There was a large section of the first...

Went in principally to see the Chihuly Exhibition. Not as large as Seattle but very impressive none the less. Great way to spend an hour or two and perhaps on a wet day would have looked at more of the museum which looked very interesting

The ROM is one of my favourite places to hang out in the city. Friday night live at the ROM is a fantastic event featuring live music, food trucks and still access to the museum exhibition rooms. It's a fun night to go with friends or date night spot. It's a cool and schick vibe and much better than a...
Attended the ROM mainly for the Chihuly exhibit which was amazing. Definitely recommend visit here and definitely during this exhibit.

Went during their "Friday Night Lights" event....which is basically occurs in the evening on the first Friday of certain months. The crowd is adult only, with people mainly 20-40 years old. There is music, food, and obviously the majority of exhibits are open. Definitely an interesting way to see the museum, while also getting to mingle with others.

Our group visited the ROM on a busy and bustling weekday afternoon. We were impressed by the museum and the diverse exhibits and displays. We were especially impressed by the wing housing the indigenous peoples (the true native Canadians/Americans) exhibit, and loved their wildlife displays and the dinosaur exhibit. The museum even has a very nice cafeteria that we all...

How could anybody give a bad review to the Royal Ontario Museum----with all the incredible work it must take to gather all those artifacts.
