We visited the Museum twice on our one day in Toronto. The special exhibit of Lawren Harris' paintings "The Idea of North" was outstanding. "The Group of Seven" paintings were displayed in many rooms. It is a stop on the Hop-on, Hop Off Bus tour so we were able to get on the bus after the museum closed and take...
When we went, it was at night where they open it up and allow drinks in the museum. It was fantastic getting to see the displays and have a cocktail while you do it!
At almost 40, every time I come here I learn something new. So many different things to explore and learn from. Also some unique and amazing exhibits added frequently.

Museums are the number one attraction for our daughter, so on a rainy Sunday afternoon we visited the Royal Ontario Museum in downtown Toronto. The outside of the museum is very cool. Inside, the exhibits are well maintained and easy to maneuver through. It was crowded - which was expected - but not too crazy. My family enjoys ancient Greek...

My family and I did our yearly visit to the Royal Ontario Museuem. Saw great artwork just like last year. So many interesting exhibits and since we are Downtown we were able to wk around for a few hours and then do Downtown Toronto. Worth the visit

My kids enjoyed the interactive displays and LOVED being able to hold actual medieval weapons and armor!Good to check what's being highlighted on the museum's website before visiting as the large exhibits cycle out periodically.Very cool museum!As with everything in Toronto, expect to pay a lot for parking if you drive there.

Lots to see for adults and kids, from dinosaurs to Egyptian artifacts and animal and bird displays, native displays and Dinosaur displays, gem and jewellery displays, as well as special touring displays. Cafeteria on site. Gift shop on site.

The breadth of exhibits at the ROM is just staggering! We spent 5 hours walking around viewing the different exhibits and still never got a chance to make it to the second floor! We loved the first and third floor, and my daughter thought the tattoo exhibit was very diverse and really showed how tattooing has been part of history...

It was a pretty hot day on our visit to Toronto, so we decided to try something that was indoors and air conditioned - so we came here to spend the afternoon. There are a lot of exhibits to see, so don't try to kill yourself by trying to see everything. They had a special exhibit on Chihuly (extra cost)...

I always encourage anyone visiting the city to visit the ROM. Some think, I suspect, that it is some musty/dusty old place full of dinosaurs living and dead. Well, it IS partially full of dinosaurs but it is also one of the most fun places in the city to visit. Your kids will LOVE the dinosaurs, the adults will love...
A must see when in Toronto! We were lucky to see the Chihuly exhibit - some photos below. Our 13 and 10 year old enjoyed it immensely!

The history is amazing!!!Seeing all of the exhibits....gems...Chinese...Dinasaur...bat cave...Egyptian...Romantic and most of all Chihuly's were just incredible.I would have loved to see more of a First Nation presence in the museum.This is a must see place when you come to Toronto!! Bring the kids and spend the day!! You won't regret it at all!!
Spent a few hours walking through this interesting museum. Loved the Chihuly blown glass exhibit that will be here until January. Well worth the trip!
A first class museum. We went because of Chihuly Exhibition. Outstanding. Visited the rest of the museum. The China section is special.

We went to the ROM to see the Chihuly exhibit. The sculptures of glass were the experience of color and light the artist hoped to evoke. The space was well laid out and not crowded allowing for us the time and space to enjoy the pieces. We also took the time to view the exhibit on the "third gender" during...
From Asia to Europe, from ancient to nowadays, the museum will tell you the story. Besides the history, you also can find dinosaurs. It is interesting.

This is a very nice museum. From the exterior design to the interior openness and the various exhibits. It was a great morning viewing the Chinese, Japanese and Korean exhibits. I highly recommend a visit.
Enjoyable afternoon spent here, wasn't to busy so that was a bones. There's a lot here to see and take in so give yourself a few hours to get around.

I wasn't originally interested in the ROM, but it's part of CityPass and a friend recommended it. It's a natural history museum with some art and antiquities thrown in. There are dinosaurs I hadn't seen at other museums, mummies, and statuary. (The ability to Tweet with curators is an added bonus, though I didn't try it!)Note: Special exhibits cost...
Beautiful stunning place with great decor and landscaping. We had a great time and everything was available that was needed. Great price for a great place .

We started our visit with lunch outside the ROM but found out that we could have enjoyed the deli inside. We parked in a lot mark for the museum and walked across the street to the main door. It has been years since I have been for a visit. Today we went for the glass exhibit. We were "blown away"...

Make sure you buy the City pass. Fantastic value for money when you want to visit Toronto.The museum is next to the St George subway station so very accessible.The museum is located within old and new building. Credit to the architects, the building itself is marvellous. The new extension is beautiful.Exhibitions are located on three floors with...
The ROM is pretty big so allow yourself lots of time to see the exhibits. If you only have 2-4 hours, it is a little pricey, especially if you want to view the special exhibits.

Quite enjoy the exhibits at the museum, we try to make it out each year. The entrance fee is pricey, and parking sucks big time. I wish they left 5he old facade on the front of the building. This Crystal thing has to be the worlds ugliest design attached to what was, at one time a stunning structure. Definitely a...
One day wasn't enough. The variety and depth of the history on review would be a joy to anyone interested in History, or even education.
What a great place for the whole family (if the kids are not too litte!); the collection is stunning, the place is very well organized and clean.

We wished we came earlier to visit. There are so much to see. We took the free tour, that was definitely worth it. It gave a better sense of how to get around in the museum plus the stories were quite interesting. Thank you
Take the free tour. The gems were great. The Roman art was super. There's lots to see so schedule enough time

Very enjoyable. Quite a diverse grouping of enjoyable items to look at. I came here specifically for the wendiceratops, but enjoyed the museum quite a bit. Kid groups also there seemed to REALLY enjoy the gems/minerals area. There is an affordable cafe to eat at right in the basement of the building. Chihuly special exhibit was beautiful, and worth the...

While the Royal Ontario Museum is a huge building with many, many exhibits, we went specifically to see the Chihuly glass exhibit. If you are in Toronto this is a cannot miss. The glass sculptures are amazing. Each one is unique and beautiful. Mostly you stand in awe of this amazing artist. Having seen his work at the Bellagio Hotel...

If you love museum this place is a must see.Huge museum, I couldn't see everything (in detail) even spending 4 hours there. I took 2 guided tours that gave me the most important highlights about the museum.

The temporary Chihuly exhibit is great and worth the extra price of admission. He and his studio are really masters of the art of glass. Beyond the special exhibits the museum tries to cover the sweep of animal / evolutionary history and ancient to modern world history. There are elements of a lot of different items but not a lot...
Absolutely don't miss the gem and minerals section. Everything else is wonderful, too, but wow, the gems and minerals are incredible! Best collection I've ever seen.
As members and frequent visitors we find the special exhibits at the ROM especially educational and rewarding -- a 'must' destination for all of our out-of-town visitors.

We spent about two hours at this exhibit of the art of Dale Chihuly. His glass creations are incredible. We have seen his work a few times in other places like the Balagio Hotel in Las Vegas and another art gallery in Toronto. Each time we are amazed by the creativity and beauty of the work of Chihuly and his...

Chihuly exhibit is a special attraction of coloured glass. its is absolutely beautiful --well worth the addition admission fee. there are several large sculptures made from blown glass very colourful. there is one room with an amazing display on the ceiling. there are large bean bags on the floor so you can lie down flat and really enjoy the exhibit....

If you love museums, you will love this one. So many interesting galleries, exhibits both permanent and special. For the kids, they will love the dinosaurs and minerals, there is a special exhibit on China/Asia currently as of this writing and the not to be missed Canadian galleries. We learned quite a few things we didn't know previous. Take the...

I took my young son to the museum today hoping that it would offer a young boy some insight into his books etc. The Royal has a fantastic number of large displays as well as displays of birds, mammals and marine life. We had a great time there and lost 3 hours plus looking around which is amazing with a...

Visiting this place was like a dream. It is so well-organized, each floor has a distinct theme and time period/geographical location. You can really get up close and personal with the artifacts, each one is labeled clearly with amazing facts pertaining to it. If you love history and/or science, this spot will definitely captivate you. I had to literally pull...
Hade a lot of fun wish we hade more time to look closer. There is a kid area witch is nice. I think the kids learned something.
You need a lot of time to visit this museum, it is very big and very interesting, had a great time and would go again

The glass world exhibit runs through January 2017, and it is worth it to just visit this one special exhibit. Of course, there are other items to see and the gems, tattoo, and China/Japan exhibits will hold your attention.
Their collection of dinosaurs is magnificent. From T-Rex to Brontosaur you can see them all. My son (9 years old) had a blast!

This is a very large museum with very impressive collections. It has a little something for everyone in my opinion. Plan to spend 2-3 hours there at least! We loved the dinosaur collection the most - the display of them was awesome!

This is very similar to the Smithsonian Natural History Museum. The exhibits are spaced out nicely. There was no wait in-line for us as we had CityPass. My daughter and niece enjoyed. The exhibits are very interesting.

The museum covers a very wide scope of cultures and worth the visit. We mostly enjoyed the birds section and gained lots of knowledge.The enclosure for the bats was equally great.Overall great day out with the family and an opportunity to see things and places we'd normally only read about.

This was a really interesting visit, plenty to see and is a great venue to keep in mind for those days where you either need a day away from the heat or rainy day visit. Plenty of interactive areas for kids, and would keep them occupied for full day.
We could not stop finding interesting areas to explore. The two special. Exhibits were awesome. Chulily and Tattoos. The regular exhibits were really great too!

My 88 year old mother and I decided to go to the ROM to see the Chihuly exhibit. We both have an interest in glass art as my father used to do business with glass blowing factories in Italy. The exhibit was just spectacular. It didn't take us long to go through max - 1/2 hour. We had to pay...

Went with my wife and two girls ages nine and twelve and had the best time in there so much to see and be takein.very educational exibits. I myself just loved this place..good for all ..a must when in toronto.

This museum is a must for visitors to Toronto. The building is beautiful and the exhibits are excellent. The staff are helpful and the different exhibition halls are easy to find. Our favourite galleries are biodiversity, and the gems and minerals,but we recently saw the Chihuly exhibit that is just spectacular! It is a great place for children as many...

My son and I went here for a day trip and had a good time. He was perhaps a little too young to get a lot out of many of the sections, but enjoyed the areas aimed at children.Nice collection of museum type things (bones, historical artifacts, etc.).
We really enjoyed this museum. There was an exhibit there to make every age of visitor happy from special exhibits to dinosaurs! Amazing building.
It was good to study overall the every cultures. Some places had to have more explanations but overall had nice explanations and good contents to show about the culture. It was good.

The museum actually has a lot of things to show but perhaps needs update the way things are shown. You can tell, once upon a time, this was a very good museum..... I do like how they show the Western history progression alone with period furniture and music on the 3rd floor. It has a lot to offer. But if...

Spent a fascinating day going round the many and varied exhibits. Great value for money and a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Ideal for when the weather is too hot or too cold as it often is in Toronto!
We were in Toronto for the weekend and went to ROM specifically for the Chihuly exhibit. I have seen Chihuly work installed in both indoor and outside settings. This installation was truly special.

Went specifically to see this exhibit. Awesome! Good film to explain how the artist developed his style. Take pics if you want, but some good ones are on line. Buy tickets in advance - avoid the lines and save some cash. Spent some time with the dinosaurs as well. Get your picture with the T Rex.

We thoroughly enjoy the ROM and made a special trip to Toronto from Windsor to see the Dale Chihuly Glass show. It was worth the trip. We did add the Tattoo show and that was..well, moderately interesting. This is a lovely visitor destination but you need time and good feet. Few places for older folks to sit and rest on...

Went to visit Chihuly temporary exhibition that was simply beautiful, glass art at its best. Also visit their impressive huge permanent exhibition. There is something for everyone to learn and discover.
You need a full day to give this place justice. So much to see and read, exhibits are amazing. Note some are on loan, so rare view on these items.

I have seen pieces of Chihuly's work at the Corning museum in Corning, New York and the Turning Stone Casino in Verona, New York has a beautiful piece called the Tree of Life. When I heard that the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) was having an exhibit of his work I made a point of attending the show. I was not...

One or two days are not enough to explore ROM which is a fantastic place not only for kids but also for adults to like life-long learning. I go with my daughter every Saturday between her two classes in RCM and we eat our lunch and then focus on one part to learn mindfully. I go to the lectures by...
ROM had lots to see with plenty of hands on activities for the kids!Lunch in the cafe was good too! Just plan for long lines.I would have 4 hours to get through.It is also part of the city pass.

What a lovely museum. We compared it to our Museum of Nature in Ottawa. Similar in exhibits but done differently. The kids had a blast. The architecture is stunning. Check it out as part of your CityPass.
I love the ROM and the exhibits are always worth the additional costs. There is a great shop and an equally good cafeteria. It needs to vern every visitors list

Don't take this wrong...it was a nice museum...but if it wasn't for the Citypass or extra time I wouldn't have gone. It was mostly boring for my 9 and 12 yrs.old and their parents. If you aren't into art and artifacts...skip this museum. The only awesome floor of this museum is the dinosaur one!!

I really loved visiting ROM! I actually went there twice in my 6 day visit to Toronto, first to visit the temporary exhibits, Chihuly and Tattoos and the next day to visit their Chinese section and the children's hands on activity center! Was quite impressed with the glasswork on display. My favourite exhibit involved lying on bean bags to better appreciate a ceiling adorned with stunning glass pieces. A visit to the tattoo exhibit was an education and a pleasant lesson in the art of the tattoo.
If your kids are really into dinosaurs, you absolutely MUST visit the ROM!In addition to its featured exhibitions, the Royal Ontario Museum has a very large collection of Dinosaur fossils year-round.
i went to there 1 month ago. it was huge place. it took 5 hours go see everything. im impressed. i want to go there again soon.

The glass sculptures by Dale Chihuly are outstanding - absolutely worth the entry price to see! Very enjoyable, my 17 year old son loves it more than I. My wife and I had fun. Worth the time and cost. Local and international venues. Parking was easy and had lots of other thing to see close by if your spending the whole day

We went to the museum on a rainy day. It was busy as many others decided the same thing but it was great! The kids loved the interactive displays and the dinosaurs. We loved the artifacts and the geology. It may have been busy but we all left loving the experience!

I brought my 8 year old daughter here, and she had the time of her life. There is so much to see, and they have so many amazing exhibits. I wish I could go more often. They always have something amazing happening here. If you are visiting Toronto, I highly recommend this

The Royal Ontario Museum is a fantastic attraction. I purchased and got in on a City Pass, which I highly recommend. They should not close early. . It's Saturday. ! I don't wts the reason? They don't have enough employees? Only 7 hr a day.. does the status sleep at 5:30?

Located in downtown core, close to hotels and Yorkville area, on subway line. You need few hours to explore it. I have been going for years and every time I discover something new. Exhibitions are usually good, Pompeii was lame tho.

We visited the ROM for the Chiluly exhibit and we're amazed at how well the entire museum was. In addition to Chiluly exhibit, we visited the gems area and the dinosaur area. I will visit again, definitely.
Nice museum if you want to see a lot of different things like dinosaurs, gems, egyptian mummies and naturalized animals. Special exhibition can be fun too. Good place for bringing kids.

This was my favorite museum I have been to in my life. Very well laid out, kind people working there, so many dinosaurs! We spent a few hours walking around and could have easily doubled that. A definite must visit if you like museums!
We went to the Royal Ontario Museum for the Chihuly exhibit, which was beautifully curated. It was a spectacular exhibit.
This is a great choice on a rainy or cold day to just enjoy. I like that that have incorporated things for children.

Always provides the best in education. Interactive exhibits for tots. And very historical. Plus the best place for learning about our own national history over the years too. Only thing I had a problem with were the ridiculous prices for things and foods. But I guess that's a given in the heart of downtown Toronto.

Our firm attended a catered dinner reception in the dinosaur and mammal galleries at the ROM. The venue and food were both excellent! Very impressive!

I brought my daughters aged 10 and 11 for an afternoon. It was an even better experience than the Ontario Science Centre. The Chihuly exhibit was a definite plus. The best part about our visit was the special attraction showcasing Dale Cheluly glasswork. This was truly spectacular and worth the price of admission. The rest of the museum was no different from most other similar museums with the standard fare.

Once you get past the god-awful crystal facade over the front entrance this is a classy world-class museum. We visited to see the Chihuly glass exhibition and were blown away. The museum is absolutely smashing. The Chihuly exhibit was wonderful. The layout of the museum and navigation is really easy and makes for a good half day tour

Very good museum in itself. I went especially to see the Chehuly exhibit. He is s master glass craftsman and the works on exhibit are gorgeous . They also have a little film that shows how he works. Very nice.

This museum is so big and vast you will have to dedicate a day to spend there.The museum is very well kept with an exciting array of sections and something for everyone. We particularly enjoyed the dinosaurs and the native sections. Well worth a visit.

Very well curated and presented. It is a huge building and holds its own against major museums worldwide. If you are a museum head and wanted to immerse yourself fully, you couldn't cover everything in a day.As a place to stroll to escape heat or cold it delivers a good experience. Went with my family of 6, ages ranging from 13-62. I was very impressed with the variety of exhibits, particularly enjoying the special exhibit of Dale Chihuly's work. However, there were plenty of activities to keep younger children engaged as well. I would recommend going earlier in the day as it was getting quite a long line by 12pm.

Wanted to check out the Chihuly glass exhibit and was not disappointed. It was amazing, the colours bold and striking. Wish it was a bit bigger but totally stunning, from start to finish. Esp. recommend the Chihuly show, fascinating! Also great ancient civ displays and very thoughtful curators comments.

We like to go to the ROM when we have a chance and often check out their special exhibits. Currently the ROM has an exhibit of glass installations by Dale Chihuly. Excellent museum with a magnificent set of displays and plenty for everyone to enjoy. Set out really well and in a fantastic building.

I think every museum is better than the last one. There was so much information about the history I could barely take all of it in. It is so cool learning about the different cultures and the men's and women's role in it. The people who did not want to fight moved to Canada and man is Toronto huge.

As far as museums go, the ROM is pretty nice. We appreciated the free tours they offer every hour or so because it gives you a good overview of the museum layout and main exhibitions.

Second year in a row coming and reserved 2 days this year for the ROM. The exterior may be somewhat controversial but the interior is beautiful and works very well. They feature different artists throughout the year so you should check out what is scheduled during your visit. However, the museum's collection overall is wonderful.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a fixture in Toronto. Toronto is full of great things to do but one of the really authentic and original places is the Royal Ontario Museum. We went on a Saturday morning, calm downtown, easy parking and the museum was definitely worth a visit on many levels. It has well throughout exhibits that work for both young children as well as adults…. strongly recommended.
Ontario's premiere museum is huge and well-curated. Easily spent 3 hours wandering around. The Chihuly exhibition was astounding.

This is a world-class museum and worth spending an entire day. I was extremely impressed, as was my teenage daughter. The glass exhibition is so large including a video in which the grand master tells and explains. The ROM is a great museum. Lots of interactive games to keep little ones interested. The dinosaur section is excellent. I was not impressed with the Cafe though. You're better bring your own lunch or eat outside.
A visiting Chhuly exhibit made it a great visit. The regular exhibit of Firts Nations people was very well done

Friday night specials are amazing; however, there is so much to see and do for the whole family you could easily spend the entire day exploring the exhibits. Tip: buy drink/drink tickets online ahead of time for $15

Very large area with lots of floors to visit. We had planned 2-3 hours but ran out of time. The kids loved the dinosaur section, but other sections were mostly intended for adults. Perhaps they could outline which sections should be emphasized for families... Nevertheless, well worth the visit!

Went to see the Chihuly exhibit with friends at the ROM and enjoyed the glass blowing sculptures and installation. Anderson through the permanent sections with ancient civilizations, dinosaurs and art. A nice way to spend a Sunday afternoon.
Included with the Citypass. Worth several hours to explore the many displays in this museum.The museum is well laid out. Some interactive displays for the children and good information signage.
Excellent dinosuars and asian art exhibitions. The building it selfe is a great work of architecture.

We visited the ROM primarily as it was part of the Toronto City Pass scheme and spent a good half day there as 2 adults. A must see when visiting Toronto. Very good museum. Really enjoyed all the Dinosaur bones exhibits and the mineral exhibit.

We stopped to take in the Chihuly exhibit (which was stunning!) and stayed to enjoy the other works this museum offers. This was a great excursion for our little Dino fanatic! The best part is on the 1st floor, the Canadian culture. Secondo floor worth for kids, plenty of anomala and the bats cove. 3d floor mainly egyptian culture. Worth a visita when in town. 16canadian $ per adult. Time inside 2hours ca.

If you're a museum aficionado, the ROM is one you won't want to miss. been here many times with my family, enjoy it very muchone of the best museums i have been toexcellent exhibit
I and my girls spent a whole day in the ROM. We enjoyed very much. There are lots wonderful things. It is a great place to come to frequently. You can't finish it in just one day.

The ROM has excellent permanent collections but the temporary Chihuly Glass exhibit is excellent. The Chihuly Exhibit was over the top beautiful. I was moved by the colors and structures. Photos are permitted. Don't leave Toronto without seeing this exhibit.

The building's stunning architecture and the way it stands out from the others around it calls to mind the Louvre's glass pyramid add-on, and ruffles many feathers in the same way. Since this is what good art should do, I give it two thumbs up!

Great way to spend a hot day in the city. We loved the bats and dinosaur exhibit and the kids discovery zone. Mike, a very helpful staff was awesome giving us tips and making sure we got the most out of our time. The Costco citypass gave us a huge discount. Would highly recommend

I was at first reluctant to see Chihuly's work inside, as I've viewed his large scale pieces in natural environments. However, the ROM has created an environment that is electrifying. I went to the ROM for my first date with my girlfriend and we absolutely enjoyed it. Went to the Chihuly Glass exhibit and it was amazing. Being around those large pieces of blown glass is a great experience. I just wish there were more! hard to imagine how these pieces get shipped and reassembled.

As a Torontonian I have a annual membership to the museum. Otherwise it can be expensive to visit and is way too big to see it all in a day.

We spent about 3 hours with the kids walking the exhibitsEnjoyed the dinosaurs , the birds, animals, the history areas and especially the Roman exhibit

Toronto is a culturally diverse city and Royal Ontario Museum reflects the same. It has exhibits from around the world, and some out of too....yes, I am talking about space and meteorites. I love this museum! It has such a great variety of things to see, from different fields of interest, too. ROM has wonderful displays that would interest old and young audiences.They often have special exhibits.Recently we visited the Chihuly exhibition which was very interesting and colourful.All other areas from dinosaurs to the Far East Japanese and Chinese artifacts are very interesting.

I lover museums and art galleries and ROM lived up to my expectations with many and varied exhibits.Wonderful place to wonder around . Only disappointment was that we missed the Glass exhibit. It wasn't until after we left that we realized that we had missed it.Good for adults and kids alike.

There's so much to see. My kids loved the ROM. The dinosaur section being their favorite, there's also a nice play area. A very nice museum, we'll be coming back l!

This stop was part of our City Pass. We have been to a number of museums all over the U.S. so we were looking forward to this. I can't really put my finger on it but all of us left earlier than we had anticipated because we found it to be boring.

Wanted to go check the Tattoo Exhibit the moment I saw it advertised on the subway. I took my 12yr old daughter and we had a great time checking out all the exhibit. My daughter loves the bat cave.

The museum is a mixture of natural history and culture sections with the emphasis on the latter.It is not a pure history or art or science museum. Great trip and very enjoyable for family with a 5 and 8 year old. We liked the bat cave the best. The whole second floor was great. Could easily spend best part of a day.

The Chihuly exhibit was simply stunning. One of the finest exhibits of any type I have ever seen. The lighting was magnificent. Wonderful collection and very varied, lots for children to be entertained. Would highly recommend for all the family.

we showed up a bit late and had to rush through the museum. it closes early and is not open in the evening. we were not allowed in one of the sections at all but kids got to see mummies and dinosaur bones so they were satisfied

I visited with my two teenagers who are a bit crazy about dinosaurs and they were thrilled by the exhibitions. Fantastic collections of skeletons and fossils. I understand that the Museum was recently refurbished and this could explain the brilliant displays of the collections. The cafe could be nicer so perhaps best to eat outside.

While visiting Toronto, my daughter and I decided to go see the exhibition of tattoos and their history at the museum. It was a very well done exhibition. We saw how they were made from their early days, their application in different cultures and countries, and their different meanings. A wonderful experience. If you are into dinosaurs this is the place to be.A good half a day activity.Good value for money with Toronto city pass.My children throughly enjoyed this.
really nice museum and learning experience for kids. kids having a good time and they really enjoyed it.

The Chihuly exhibit at the ROM is a "must-see" stop if you're in Toronto in 2016. I've been to several of his exhibits before (for example, Boston Fine Arts), but this was the best. i love glass and the thought he does outside installations around the world just blows my mind! on my bucket list to see and outside installation. till then, this exhibit is beautiful ...
Wonderful museum. They have a little bit of everything. Kids will love the dinosaur exhibit. My husband I thoroughly enjoyed it.

The Royal Ontario Museum has a great showing of north American history and nature. It also has a large furniture selection including paintings, serving utensils and more. We tried to see their (temporary) Chihuly exhibit. Sadly it closed early, which makes me think that other special exhibits will be that way too.

There is always something to see at the ROM. I have been there so many times and I still haven't seen everything. I could walk around there for hours. I tend to end up at The ROM about once a year, and it's always an impressive experience. The building itself is beautiful and there's something for everyone's interests. And you don't have to exit through the gift...
Where do I start. There is so much to see and learn frio old artifacts to mummies. It is so modern and well built. It should be they've spent millions for the renovations.
Some exhibits were great, others were very boring. VERY busy when we went after lunch, i have a feeling it's busy all the time though in the summer.

I have visited the ROM several times, but this was my first with family. All ages had a good time. Highlights include the dinosaur wing and the Egyptian wing (go early!). One of the best museum I have visited there is a lot to see for everybody but the map is awful I found it very difficult to follow or find where you were and the museum
Had a wonderful time with a 3 and 5 year old. Just the right size. Dinosaurs, bats, art. Kids area was a particular hit with books, toys, costumes.

My friend and I spent some time in this museum on our trip. We went specifically for the collection that Steve Martin curated. It was beautifully done! History and culture and just plain fun! I went with friends, but I saw families with young kids having a good time, too. There were too many standouts to name everything there is to see. This was the last of the attractions for our family to do on our Toronto City Pass, having gone to Ripley's, the CN Tower and the Science Center last week. It was a reallly huge place. With 3 levels. I mostly liked the first level about canada's past. And the Eygept level. Cos after a bit walking most of them become boring and there were so many similar things but it had so many great things to see and it totaly worth it. I wish they had some things from...

Some sections of this Museum are really interesting, others are just average, and a few pretty confusing. I really liked the Chinese frescoes, but I missed more context and information about the pieces.

TIP: if you want to buy the City Pass at ROM, get in the member line...you don't have to stand in the long general admission line. We were really impressed with ROM - the native Canadian exhibit was amazing. We also enjoyed the traditional Mexican clothing exhibit and the tattoo exhibit. This was our first visit to Toronto so we wanted to visit the ROM. The Chihuly Exhibit was wonderful! Make sure you pay the extra entrance fee to see it. Truly outstanding. The rest of the Museum was very nice. Use your City Pass and go.
We had a great time visiting the museum. It has 3 floors. We were told to start at the third floor and go down. It's amazing!

Wide variety of exhibits which is good and bad - plenty of choices but is this a natural history museum or one about human civilization? The layout is a bit confusing, and this museum must be seen in pieces – don’t try to do it all at once because you will miss something. Pick your interests. All of the staff...

We went for the Chihuly exhibit & it was well worth the trip. When we finished we wondered "what now?" The free 50 minute General Tour answered the question. This is an excellent way to become familiar with the layout of the museum and to gain some insights into the contents by way of the guide's talk. There are also...

Currently exhibits include Chihuly and one on tattoos. I loved the Boats part of the Chihuly exhibit. Didn't have time to explore the rest of this vast museum. Tip: purchase tickets ahead of time because, at least on the rainy Sunday morning I visited, the wait to buy tickets was quite long.
Enjoyed our day at the ROM, it's a time piece in the heart of Toronto. It has an amazing array of displays from around the world. A very educational experience for all ages.

We came here today for the Chihuly exhibit, which was SPECTACULAR. Also checked into the Tattoos exhibit, which we found OK, not great. This museum, even without special exhibitions, has a little of something for everyone. It is well-run, and pretty.

First time to have this exhibit in Toronto. Don't miss it. Enjoy it all especially the mummy section.Great on a hot day. You can still learn a lot just by going to the different exhibits.

Possibly one of my favorite places as it has a ton of interactive and new exhibits year round. The exhibits are very wide in range and also offers special exhibits. The special exhibits at times are not always worth the money, however some are very well made and is worth it. For students, Wednesdays are free. The ROM also holds...
I have been to the ROM several times and always enjoy looking at all of the exhibits. I never seem to see the sames things twice. Good quality museum.

The museum is not about Canadian items (there are a few of course). It is a smaller but good collection of everything: fossils, dinosaurs, ancients art pieces etc. from around the world. At times felt like a miniature version of American Museum of Natural History.

We are not big museums fans, but I must say this place is amazing, we loved the dinosaurs and nature floor, the kids enjoyed it very much.Also loved Canada and China part on the first floors and Egypt on the 3rd.

We brought our 4 children ages 2,5,13,15 and there was so much to see-for all ages. The special exhibits have been cool to see as well (we went two summers in a row). There is something for everyone and the cost is low compared to many other attractions with less. Check out the website-if you like cultural history you'll enjoy-

The ROM may be a huge treasure-house of artifacts from all over the world, but a normal visit is not the great experience it should be. Haven't been to the ROM for years. Wanted to see Chihuly exhibit - beautiful glass, well displayed. But 15-30 minutes should be enough to see it. A visit to the ROM is always a good way to spend and afternoon.Lots of great exhibits - Canada's First Nations, Early Canada, Medieval Europe, Greek & Roman sculpture & pottery, and of course Dinosaurs & the Bat Cave!School holidays and weekends are traditionally busier than mid-week visits.

Interesting artifacts and replicas from all time periods, cultures.Parking was a bit of challenge until we were able to finally turnaround and get into the garage.The Field Museum is close to where I live, so it is a bit hard compare fairly. Definitely more for adults/older teens than small children.
Only had a chance to enjoy a fraction of the exhibits, but it was well worth the visit. Lots to see and do. Great gift shop.

I have membership, and they have a fantastic variety of exhibits for adults and kids, and lots of interactive exhibits and play areas for the smallest patrons. Very nice place to go with family and friends while you are staying in Toronto or live in Toronto. .

Famous glass sculptor - worth a visit on for a limited time.Lots of tourists enjoying their visit to this place

I have been to the ROM around 10 times already, and it just has so much to see (besides the special exhibitions). Las time was a couple of days ago and they had the Tattoo and Chihuly? This is an amazing museum but make sure that you give yourself time to go round - best if you set aside a day for a visit - worthwhile for adults and children

We had a wonderful visit the only thing I regretted was not getting there earlier. We did enjoy lunch at the museum and it appears they allow patrons to bring lunch as well. ROM was definitely a highlight during our visit to Toronto.
A whole day is too short time to see everything in this museum. I hope I had at least one week just to go there. It was one of the most impressive places I visited in Toronto. A great tour, forsure.
This was a great museum with a varied collection. The only reason it gets 4 bullets instead of 5 is that the map was a bit confusing. Definitely worth a visit.

It's a nice place to go with kids if you live in north America. Native Nations room, antics, chinese, some european stuffs, mineralogy, dinosaurs, local animals.... Modern museum in the heart of the poshest centre in Canada, the trend-setting Yorkville. When we went there, saw the Chihuly exhibit of glass art. Modern but exotic. Artistic and contemporary. That pretty much sums up the ROM. Very nice place to see.

Another 'girls' trip to Toronto. We purchased the internet deal.. great price and no lineup wait! Photo contest winning shots were in the R.O. M. which we did not anticipate.. great nature shots by all ages. Enjoyed the dinosaur display and loved the history of the totem pole and Egyptian display.

Starting from the outside architecture where a modern facade merges into the original old venue this is a great experience. You need several hours to take in all the exhibits. This is mostly a Natural Science museum, great to introduce kids to this area of knowledge. There are numerous interactive areas for the kids. The Dinosaurs exhibit is outstanding.

I've been to the ROM several times at this point and I intend on going back in the near future. The admission fee is affordable and it gives you hours of learning and viewing some really neat things. We purchased the city pass for Toronto which I totally recommend as you get to by-pass all the ticket purchasing lines which were all long.The museum was included with this pass and if you haven't been to a substantial museum, it is quite the experience. great exhibits lots to see a bit pricey though would go back again someday my son and I loved it took lots of pictures

I have been to the ROM three times now. After you take in the beauty of the exterior of the ROM (which looks like a crystal star that fell to earth) you enter into a building housing an incredible diversity of art. Generally, the ROM is "ok." Two exhibits should not be missed however. First is the exhibit of fossils. Very nice collection. Second is the First Nation Canada exhibit. Great history lesson of Canada.

Visited the ROM to see the Chihuly Glass Exhibit. As a collector of crystal, this was a very enjoyable experience. I had been to the exhibit in Montreal 2 years ago, but I do believe the "boat" at this exhibit surpasses the beauty of those.

it has tons of collections from the world, very unique and good place to visit. I like specifically the Chinese antiques, some of them I haven't seen before, and I am glad it is preserved well and open to public.
Dad and I saw the Chihuly Exhibit of incredible Glass sculptures. Wow, what imaginative and colourful pieces of art ! Their variety in size, scope and the power of the images created, was superb.

Great place for the whole family. There is something for everyone. May dinosaur bones and other Egyptian artifacts, and cultures from around the world. We saw the Chihuly Glass art exhibit. We’ve had recurring memberships many times and even after countless visits I return happily. The architecture alone is worth the visit and is truly world class. Currently, the ROM is exhibiting the Chihuly glass exhibit. Just a joyful experience. Takes around 45 minutes to view. Less crowded on weekedays.

Went to see the glass exposition it was out of this world. It was amazing to see the work of this artist.

We are members and we do our best to get value from our membership. It was a great educational experience for my ten-year old daughter and an enjoyable day out for me too. Always new exhibits, fun for everyone...wear comfy shoes...a lot to see & learn. Friday afternoons good deals. Great gift store.

I always visit the ROM when in Toronto. There is always something to see. Just viewed the Chihuly and tattoo exhibition. This was interesting to see w HB at he does with glass. Also the history and culture of tattoos. Do not miss the other galleries as you will find something interesting.

The permanent exhibits notwithstanding, making a trip to the ROM while the Chihuly Glass exhibit is on display could not possibly disappoint. The glass pieces are unbelievably breathtaking. Well worth the few extra $$ and time added to your ROM visit. In the permanent part of the museum, kids will love the dinosaur display which is quite expansive. There's also...
The ROM is a fantastic place specially the Egyptian Collection, and the Asia area.... However, the minerals exposition is amazing.
The ROM is Toronto offers a variety of antiquities and unique exhibits, i.e. The Darwin Exhibit, Egyptology, The Dead Sea Scrolls, etc. Excellent art classes for children.

The ROM is one gem in the city that must be seen by all visitors and residents to and of Toronto. Revisit the rooms you used to see as a kid in school and then visit the new exhibitions to learn more and enlighten your mind.

The highlight of this museum is the collection of dinosaur skeletons (most of which are actual bones recovered from sites; some are just replicas of bones).You won't lack for stuff to see. You can follow civilization from the Bronze Age through the present by viewing the broad collections at the ROM. Something for everybody in the family....good cafeteria and great souvenir shops...always some special exhibit going on
Worth seeing. Building architecture is beautiful. Nice mixture of items to see. Had several kids areas for the young ones.

Excellent museum! It is multi-leveled and huge! There are many interactive areas for small Children and older Children. My boyfriend and I went for the special presentation of Pompeii and we loved it. We brought 2 adults and 8 (!) kids to the ROM. A fantastic time for everyone. Ages 4-10, the kids each found something that quickly became their favourite experience of the day. And when you buy your tickets from COSTCO online, you save $5 per adult and $4 per child.
Go now and see the fabulous Chihuly exhibit until January 2017. The museum was so interesting and had a great design for moving people so you can see everything without too many crowds.
Somebody said chihuly was supoused to be very nice, but actually, it wasn't. It was only ok. And for the entrance fee, I think it should be way better. It felt like a ripoff.

You could spend a lot of time in this museum, but there are a wide variety of exhibits so all may not appeal to everyone. There were some closed areas and upcharge areas, but still a lot to see if you have time to burn.

My wife and I visited the ROM in July and were genuinely amazed at the incredible displays from all over the world. The ROM has many great and unique exhibits. It's one of the better museums we have visited. However, the layout is literally maddening. Words cannot describe how fabulous the Dale Chihuly exhibit was for us .. Each room at the smashing Royal Ontaro Museum was displayed with unique life size colorful blown glass creations. Everything was interestingly presented. It was great to go down a hallway and find classrooms filled with "taking it all in" children.
The museum is quite large so be sure to take the whole morning or afternoon to see everything. The aboriginal and the Egypt exhibits were particularly interesting.

While on a visit with my youngest daughter to visit with her brother in Toronto we dropped in at the ROM. We have been members for many years and every so often will go there to visit and revisit certain artefacts.The special exhibit on Chihuly is exceptional.

What I liked:- Absolutely loved the Chihuly exhibit! The glass sculptures are huge and go beyond what I imagined. The colours are bright and eye catching. I visited this museum and was thoroughly satisfied with their exhibits. Being from the greater Washington DC metro area I has the Smithsonian basically in my backyard. This exhibit is marvellous. Although it is not too big, the pieces are well worth seeing. The mastery, creativity, and the colours are amazing!! Don't miss this exhibit, take some pics, best screen savers ever! Canadian exhibits provide a lens on early Canadian heritage and life.
The ROM had a wide selection of art and antiquities from Europe and Asia. It had several interesting special exhibits during our visit, including a Chilhuly and one on tattooing
If you have been to the world's great museums, this one way seem a bit small. But it does have charm! Lots of see and there's always a special exhibit worth checking out.

The museum is huge with large collections from jurrasic to medieval age. The museum is divided into sections based on civilizations. Very educative for young children and entertaining for adults.The cafetaria is very presentable to refresh visitors.

Beautiful Baroque building. And what a phenomenal extra limited time exhibit we got to see on our first visit! The largest and best exhibited display of his glass I have ever seen.....and I have seen a lot!
An excellent museum which avoids the stuffier feel of some of its contemporaries with a modern feel. Dinosaur exhibition is really 1st class.

My girls and I have been to museums all around the world and the ROM is fabulous. The GEM section has every crystal ever discovered and kids spend hours in here. Good time to spend. One need atleast half a day to see all collection.very neat, huge, with lift facilities.Every thing is well covered. The stone section, China and other sections are too good.Entrance having Dinosaur is main attraction.

This special exhibit of the works of glass artist Dale Chihuly is well-worth the price of admission. Focusing on large works of incredible blown glass, we were awed by the beauty and genius of the artist and his studio.

What makes ROM special for me is how it kept part of its memorable past, like the totem poles and the brick original structure, and introduced daring new design, like the crystal, and refreshes with startling exhibits.The new Chihuly exhibit was a joy to walk through. Stunning and vibrant and so well presented. My daughter loves the dinosaur skeletons,...
It is a huge place with many various and different exhibitions. But the most interesting is local artist, which are usually are unknown

The special Chihuly exhibit was wonderful! Truly magical and even better in person than I thought it would be. The tattoos exhibit wasn't worth the money - then again, I'm not that into tattoos. The rest of the museum was vast and took three hours longer than we thought to go through (including going to the cafe). The cafe disappointed...

One of our family's favourite places, so much to see. Check the daily schedule as there are often live shows/demonstrations on the weekends and holidays. If you live in or near Toronto, a family pass is a great value.

The first people exhibition is definitely fun to go. It is interesting to read all the history of Canada.The area for minerals and rocks is absolutely amazing. Very nice museum, too sad we arrived a little be late, and they closed at 5pm. So, go early to see everything, it's a big place and take some time at the cafeteria, the food is good (Greek salad yummy)

We parked offsite and walked a short distance, which worked out well. We had about 2 hours to kill, but you really need more time than that. The animal exhibits were the best part and the kids(11-18yrs) even did the hands on stuff for kicks. Ancient civilizations were interesting, but that's all 2 hours would cover. I would go back...

As an encyclopedic museum, you can go nuts trying to see it all. This day, we focused on the current installation of Dale Chihuly glass. Though we have seen several other major installations of his (Chicago, Seattle and others), we were blows away by this one. This should have been mind blowing; six million items.Instead it was confusing, poorly signed and not at all user friendly. We visited earlier this month on a rainy day in Toronto. We took in all the different exhibits. Chihuly was by far my favorite the museum itself has so many different elements you could really spend a day here just going through the different part but if you are in Toronto while the Chihuly exhibition is on I highly recommending...

This is one of the larger museums that the city has to offer. It has an excellent rock and gem collection, as well as historical pottery and glass from around the world. Visited this in July and we weren't disappointed. We thought the dinosaurs and Chinese collections were best.Piece of advise: get a City Pass which gets you in here and several other places and allows you to queue jump!

Great landmark to visit in Toronto. Check out the dinosaur exhibit, Rome, Egypt, and bat cave. See some Canadiana and an exhaustive display on coral, fish, vegetation, animals, fossils and insects. Allow 2-3 hours for your visit.

Terrific natural history and ethnography museum! The dinosaur and ancient mammals halls were very well done with exceptional specimens and dramatic displays of same. The information panels and touchscreens were also very good. ROM's minerals and gemstones gallery was spectacular and a surprise hit with our family -- much better than we expected. We decided to go to the museum at the end of our trip and so wish we had had more time to spend here. There was so much to see and do and we left feeling like we only saw a part of it. The dinosaurs were awesome! Would go here again if we could.

We arrived at opening and left 30 minutes before closing! And we loved every moment. So many dinosaurs, cultural history from many countries, the decor & structure mixed with old world charm and modern design is amazing.Can't wait to go back.

There is no doubt that this is a great place to visit in Toronto, whether you live here in Toronto or are just visiting Toronto. My favourite section of the museum is the dinosaur area. Very nice museum, well curated, just excellent in all facets. If we lived in the area we'd go at least once a month... and still wouldn't have seen it all.
It's alright. Not exciting at all. But, if you're into that kind of stuff. It will be for you. The dinosaurs were the most interesting things there.
I visit the Royal Ontario Museum in Toronto with my family last July and they "like" the place, but they were not "crazy" about the visit. So, if you have spare time, go, otherwise you can skiip it.
Very nice. Lots of things to do.Exhibits were very good. Kids loved the Chullys exhibit. Lots of things for kids to do a whole level dedicated to them.

I love it! GREAT SHOWS. Came to see Chihuly and Tattoos exhibitions but so many unexpected arts, exquisitely curated shows also surprised me. Beautiful Youth-3rd Gender show, it's about Japanese Wakashu, AKA 3rd gender in Eto period, I truly gained knowledge.

I've been going here since I was a kid and it's still enjoyable. It's changed enough to keep it interesting buy stayed the same enough to still be the place I remember 25 years ago. Tons of things to explore, only checked out the one extra exhibit. Tattoos was small and underwhelming, but on Friday evening the price is cheap enough to pay the extra fee. This was hired for a private party and it didn't disappoint. A fantastic space especially with a dinosaur hanging over you. The space had bars, a band, pop up photo booth and loads of food stations. it was really good. What topped it off was a free tour of Chihuly exhibition.

Excellent choice for all visitors to Toronto. Native, Asian, Roman, Ancient Greek art for adults. Dinosaurs, natural history, mummies, arms and armor for the kids. Canadian art, artists and history interwoven in well-displayed, chronological galleries. An encyclopedic museum that hits all the right notes. A must visit while in Toronto! You should plan at least 3 hours for your visit. The Asia and Africa exhibits were awesone!

First of all, get the CityPass to save on all attractions. This was a really nice museum with a TON of exhibits. Spent about an hour and a half with the family here. You will have to take the subway from downtown which was only less than a 15 ride on the subway. Worth the admission!

I was very much looking forward to visiting this museum, but found it disappointing - the displays were comprehensive, but confusing, there was no clear way to track the exhibits by time period or route around the museum.I have no doubt that there is plenty to see, but having allowed a long time to visit, we left early lamenting...
Nice place, but my 16 year old wasn't as enthusiastic as my science whiz 12 yr old and my husband.There's a lot of history and science there. I loved the mummies and ancient Egyptian artifacts!
It'd be a great place to bring children, lots of interactive exhibits. Really big place, block out a whole day for it.Not great for teenagers.

The Chihuly glass works are outstanding, the colors and shapes breathtaking. The admission price is well worth it for that exhibit alone but you will find several other world class exhibits on display at the ROM.
We bought the toronto pass and had these tickets so we did it to use them. Kinda boring, just another museum to walk around and waste time

sad that from other countries things have taken and thy are now in this museum. and it is not that good museum, I did not enyoi, again also too many children.. screaming and running around, this is a museum, not a circus.. strange..

Went to the ROM a few days ago...been about 10 years...may be more since my last visit. I enjoyed the exhibition(s) but thought that $21.00 for a special exhibition, and that's Friday after 4:30pm special price, is a bit steep. I don't like the new main entrance on the north side...by Bloor Street. I prefer the one on the east...

You could spend a few days wandering around this place! Wonderful exhibits with so much to see and read about. Wear good walking shoes and bring reading glasses. Some of the printed plaques are very small print. The kids will love the dinosaur floor...so many different kinds! One of the best museums I have been in!

one of the reasons we decided to weekend in Toronto was so that we could go to the Chihuly exhibit that opened beginning of July. I believe it closes end of January 2017. You don't want to miss this - the man and his team do amazing things with glass - just unreal shapes,scapes with bright colors and designs. we...

The ROM was a huge museum with so many different exhibits! The Egyptians and Dinosaurs were the most fascinating for our family. There were some good food choices too. If your in the Toronto area, why not give the ROM a visit?
This was my favorite of all the things we did in Toronto. The museum has an impressive collection. If you go, be sure to take the docent tour -- it was wonderful!!

We went here because it was on the City Pass. Without the kids I probably could have spent all day here. There is plenty to see. I loved the geology section! There were a couple of special exhibits for an additional charge ($8) that looked interesting, but I did not visit. It's right next to a subway stop, but the...
Perfect size for a museum. Not too big and not too small. Perfect for kids of all ages. I recommend the guided tours for adults. A real gem.
We particularly enjoyed the exhibit by Chihuly and the exhibit about tattoos . Nice to be able to break for lunch and have reentry with our tickets.

They have an amazing collection. Every item will hold your interest. Educational signs help enhance your experience. The building itself is an architectural masterpiece. Their gem, rock, and stone collection is the most amazing collection I've seen. The colors, variety, sizes, origins. Even rock pieces from Mars. I was lucky enough to visit when Chihuly had an exhibit. I could...
Fantastic, huge museum! Packed full of cool stuff, we spent hours exploring and still didn't see it all! Great temporary exhibitions too.

A terrific exhibit of glassworks by Dale Chihuly and his studio. Also intriguing special exhibit on tattoos and the history. I was surprised that the Canadian exhibits were just First Nations and the furniture & tableware. I thought it would be more comprehensive.

We were amazed at how large the collections are. Definitely bring walking shoes and plan on several hours to go through it completely. The biggest hit with our group was the extensive collection of dinosaur bones - very well done.

This famous glass artist's exhibition delights, charms and excites at every turn. Take your camera as photos are allowed. The assembly of the show is captivating and the opportunity to see his work en masse is special. So often when I travelled, I got to see one installation only. Take the children as there is much to discover in his...

Spent a day at the ROM and could have returned the next day. So much to see and experience. My 13 year old loved it. Great tie-ins to Grade 8 Social Studies curriculum (Ancient Egypt and Greece).Highly recommend this museum on your "To Visit" list while in Toronto, especially for families with teens. Make sure to have at least...

I'm not sure why we were expecting paintings, but that's the only thing this museum didn't have! furniture, armour, textiles, ceramics, dinosaurs, a bat cave (!), and many other things that you can imagine!

Family of four, 10 & 8. Kids interactive section was very enjoyable. We of course ran out of time and didn't get through the entire museum which was a disappointment, give us a reason to return. Bee exhibit was interesting and can't say enough about the volunteers who answered all our questions with such enthusiasm and an obvious love for...
wow that is fun ..what more can you ask for dj great food drinks and walk around the rom nothing is more fun ..if your going to do the rom do it with style

The ROM is one of the world's great museums -- its collections are great and few museums have such breadth and depth, though there are issues of available space. We went in December because I had bought the CityPass in order to get the kids out during winter break and we had a great time. The Pompei exhibit was on at the time and it was definitely worth the extra charge to see it.The kids didn't seem as impressed, but kids rarely find history very interesting.We went...
There was nothing very fancy about this museum. It was a regular museum attraction. The kids didn't really enjoy it, because it wasn't very hands on.

We visited the exhibit at the ROM two weeks ago, and I must say, it is a spectacular exhibit. The effects of the contrasting colours and interesting glass shapes leaves one breathless. Perhaps the only aspect of this exhibit which I find downgrades it, is the fact that I do believe it is not all that unique. Meaning I believe...

Love the different areas of this museum!Being from Europe I have seen lots of museums but we don't have a first people's museum! This was by far the most interesting section to me!And the gift shop was very good too!

The ROM is a wonderful museum, with everything from fine art to natural history. The special exhibits there are equal to those at any of the best museums in the U. S. or Europe. This past week we went to the Chihuly glass exhibit, which was spectacular. Several years ago we saw the Dinosaurs of the Southern Hemisphere exhibit, which...
Fun and huge, consider several hours to visit it. Special exhibitions were totally worth the priceWe ate there also and they have lots of options, the restaurant is big enough to find a table
Good variety and well laid out, this museum keeps you interested …. With plenty of sofas for the those areas that don’t interest everyone in the group
It's so big that me and my bf only got around to a few parts! Very well maintained and curated! Will have to make another trip there again :)

We went when there was a Chihuly and tattoo exhibit. Both were excellent .. and quite unique. There was a dinosaur exhibit that is excellent for both children and adults. Numerous exhibits from all over the world ... worthy of an entire day (if ones feet hold out)
The museum covers a lot and you can spend days there if looking at all the exhibits. It is especially good for kids. Go and see the Chihuly exibit, that was the highlight of our visit.

The facility is very large with multiple levels. Be prepared for a DAY of discovery, meaning it will take most of a day to visit the entire facility. I did find that parts were, alrhough very well put together, needed a little more explanation, a little information for each exhibit. I was not overly impressed with the Canada exhibit, I...

We went here as part of the City Pass. We went mainly to see the dinosaurs (my son is obsessed). We didn't see even close to half of the stuff that was there as there is so much to see. Definitely will be going again (without kids so I can read lol). Lots of fun activities for kids.
What a great museum everything from Asian art to dinosaurs. They have the tattoo exhibit and the glass exhibit right now.what a way to spend a day
The museum is very nice, with exhibits ranging from Asian Architecture to Animal Life. A personal favorite was the rocks/gems exhibit.
Our family really enjoyed the museum. Tons to see! Several unique items we had not seen before in other museums

The ROM has a tremendous collection of Chinese, Egyptian, Nubian, Greek and Roman archaeological artifacts. That is really the highlight of the collection. The natural history collection is fine. There are a lot of dinosaur skeletons. There are a lot of interesting videos adding more depth to the exhibits. There is a good gift shop. The museum is definitely one...
Quite some collection. The entrance fees is $17 for adult. Would be better is it has collections about the history of Toronto and also about Canada.

I never get enough of the dinosaurs at the ROM, but there is so much else to see and do I end up staying for hours.I have tons of pictures from my many visits.It is always one of my stops when I'm in TO.

Yet another interesting Museum in Toronto! After our very positive visit to the AGO we wanted to check out the ROM!For Brits it will seem like a cross between the British Museum and the Natural History Museum which is a bit like fish and chocolate cake on the same plate, but it works. We came here to see the Chiuly exhibit, which was a nice compendium of bits from all his exhibits and we really enjoyed it. There is a great deal to see and there are lots of kids everywhere! The museum is very clean and easy to navigate. The gift shop is great, too, although expensive, but there are some good deals to be had. We had lunch in the cafeteria which has a wide variety of selections (a bit costly for a cafeteria, but...

We have been members of the ROM for years and we go often. We went with our sister and brother in law as they had never been. The Chihully Glass blowing exhibit was really really cool to see and was a highlight for us. Our guests enjoyed the entire museum, well as much as we can see in one day....

First of all, I have to say that parking for this place is a royal headache. We finally found the parking lot, which is across the street, and BEHIND the buildings facing the museum. It really is a wonderful museum but somewhat confusing in terms of trying to get to the area you want. We never did find the bust of Cleopatra & could not find anyone to help us. Our efforts in finding the restaurant area were also confusing as directions are not clearly marked.

We did city pass so the Rom was included. We were there for about 2.5-3 hours and did 1.3 floors. We could have done a full day and still not seen everything.Nicely curated exhibits and hands on options for kids in some areas. We were disappointed that the city pass did not include all exhibits ... Tattoo and chihully...
I actually dont have enough time to go inside, but to see only the facade, pay the trip. It is an amazing architecture worl

This is a great place for rainy days and hot days. Went to this museum on the hottest day of the week and it's very well air conditioned. There are a 4 levels filled with loads of different things. The new Tattoo Exhibition is extra though but not sure on the price.
It'll boggle your mind and put you in a great mood! The Tattoos exhibit is also worth a trip around.

One of the best museum we have visited in Toronto. The wide collection and displays are so easy to follow and we enjoyed every moment there. Do approach the very friendly information counter staff to plan your visit for maximum time efficiency before you wonder off into the exhibits.Be prepared for the very cold air conditioning inside.

The ROM has a very nice Asian, Roman, and Egyptian collections. The Chinese tombs are always fantastic to visit. There is a large Dinosaur exhibit in the second floor and other fun stuff for the little ones. You can download an app in your phone and look through the mummies in the Egyptian exhibit. You can see what's under the...
I go here occasionally and I absolutely love it each time. There is so much to see and even when it's crowded there's plenty of room to move around.

You've got yourself a nicely done modern designed museum of everything under one roof. We're very impressed and crowds were not overwhelming like in other Toronto's attractions, plenty of interactions and interesting artifacts to engage the kids

We visited Toronto for 3 days from New York City. Not to be snotty, but it is hard to please New Yorkers with Museums. However, we absolutely loved this place. Thanks to our toronto CityPass, we didn't have to wait on the cray long line. We were able to go straight to the entrance. What I love about this place...
Amazing architecture, wonderful exhibits, multicultural, slightly confusing layout for first-time visitors. Wonderful mix of a natural history museum and an art museum. Best of both worlds.
This museum is one of the best I have been to. I like the way it is organized and easy to navigate around.
The museum is well worth a visit and eclectic. There is a wide assortment of various natural history exhibits. The bat cave is great for children. We spent a good 3 hours in the museum quite happily.

From the old entrance to the new The Crystal entrance it`s just amazing , so much to see from from ancient to modern , loved the Natural History galleries and also The CIBC Discovery Gallery a kids' learning zone. so much fun

Very extensive collections. I was a little disappointed that admission did not include access to two exhibits that were on display. I felt that was misleading to not be able to see everything with our admission ticket.

What a great museum! So much to see and the arrival of the Chihuly exhibit is amazing. We had to wait a bit too long to buy our tickets and then back in line to get in. That was unimpressive. Also, there seemed to be nobody to direct you or answer questions once you get in. There are terrific people...
Better then I remember from my last visit. Too many kids this time of year. Lacks a unifying theme - just a bunch of items thrown together

The Chihuly exhibit is truly special. This museum is a great natural history museum and looks to be great for kids, too. But Chihuly was a pleasant surprise. His installations are atmospheric and really impressive. His glass work is mind blowing. The tattoo exhibit was also interesting although a lot of reading and light on images of actual tattoos. Buy...

First time visit with my spouse. We can't wait to take the kids here! The dinosaur exhibit was phenomenal. Chihuly was mind blowing!Unfortunately I had high hopes for the tattoo exhibit but it just wasn't worth the extra $.

We saw the Chuhly and Tattoo special exhibits. Both were incredibly interesting. Arrive early to beat the lines and crowds. And be sure to use your mobile device to buy tix from ROM directly so they can be scanned to bypass the lines.
I haven't been to the ROM in years and decided to go to see the Chihuly glass exhibit. It was fantastic and then spent hours seeing other beautiful exhibits at the museum.

We've been to a lot of museums in various cities round the world and I'd rate this 'medium' in terms of how entertaining the children found it. There is an interactive area where they can dig for fossils, dress up, look at stuff under a microscope and this was pretty good. The Bat Cave was a great idea but a...

I found the ROM to be quite difficult to navigate as the layout of the museum is confusing.The displays were a bit uninspired, but the collection absolutely has got some highlights.Make sure you sit down and study the map and try get the jist of the layout so you dont miss out on anything you really want to...

This museum is massive. I didn't even begin to see it all. But, the gem and mineral rooms are fantastic and where I spent most of my time. I suggest a visit as there is something to fit the interests of anyone.

This museum has a lot. A great place for a rainy day; you can spend a lot of time here. The current exhibition is a Chihuly exhibition. Not so interesting if you are from Seattle; but otherwise it would be well worth it. You get a choice of one of two special exhibits for an extra ~$10. Right not the...
Overall, great museum, lots of exhibits and best of all is the gem section, one even looked like bacon! A lack of interactive exhibitions though. Will visit again. :)

Loved my visit to the Royal Ontario Museum it was very informative a great learning experience. My favourites were the Egypt gallery and the Age of Dinosaurs gallery, I think both are definitely a must see.

When I go to Toronto, the ROM is always on my list. They feature exciting exhibits that change regularly, making each visit unique. Even the dinosaur exhibits get updated with new finds. If Ilived closer, I'd be a member, and you'd never get me out of there. Family friendly, and not just for the elementary school set. Don't miss it.

There is just so much to see at the ROM, especially with special exhibits always coming in. If your into history and looking for a day filled with entertainment for everyone I highly recommend giving the ROM a visit. I personally absolutely adore there natural history section.

Who knew totem poles were so tall? Not me. Very interesting collections housed in two very unusual buildings. Easy access via walking, bike, dble deck bus, etc. Included in City Pass along with 4 other destinations. Took us approx. 3 hours to walk thru.

Exhibits on 2nd floor of Egypt & those of China at ground floor are worth visiting. Old colorful pots are quite amazing. Chariot, tomb in Chinese section is also worth visiting.Section on Natural history is quite interesting. Kids will enjoy a lot. Bat cave & information about bats is well covered. Overall worth visiting.

Enjoyed an afternoon here with my mother. She is not a fan of museums and finds them quite boring but she enjoyed the ROM since there is such a wide variety of exhibits.I loved the Roman exhibit and we both enjoyed the animal exhibits and adored the minerals and gemstones exhibit.The cafe/restaurant serves good food for a reasonable...

I toured the ROM with my husband and 10 year old daughter. It was part of our city pass (which I highly recommend getting). It's a nice museum. We enjoyed the mummies the best. There were 2 drawbacks for us...the map and the parking. The map is not easy to follow and the layout of the museum does not make...

We just saw the Chihuly exhibit. Very well presented with pieces from many of his different artistic periods. You can lie on a cushion on the floor and look up at a ceiling filled with his " Persian" pieces infused with light. Truly lovely.We also spent over an hour at the First Nation exhibit. Make sure you have many hours available to visit the ROM. There are so many floors with facenating exhibits. THere are areas to sit and rest. Great access for wheel chairs.

It's a fascinating museum with many informative displays but so very confusing to find your way anywhere. We lucked out to be there (late June 2016) when the Dale Chihuly exhibit was in town and it is amazing with all new pieces that I haven't seen before, but the textile exhibit was closed so that was a disappointment. I have visiting museums my entire life, especially the ROM. I was always a fan of the exhibits and building and was excited to visit now post-crystal renovations since I am living in the province again. As a scientist, I have always appreciated the Royal Ontario Museum's relatively undiluted approach to presenting known information and hypotheses. The ROM has also impressed me with its fearlessness in presenting issues related to evolution and sexuality. Put all of this together with a lovely setting and location and reasonable admission price and there is no reason not to visit...

We went here with a bus trip it was interesting for older people my granddaughter was 4 and didn't understand lots buy they do have a gray area for little people to enjoy n have fun. You can spend the entire day here. They also have a lunch bar so you can sit eat and relax a bit . This...

This is a fascinating exhibition focussing on the role adopted, in the Edo period (1600-1868), by Japanese males between the age of puberty and the coming of age ceremony. Attached to adult men with whom homosexual bonds developed,this did not preclude romantic or commercial relationships with women. These youths are the wakashu and are identified in prints by a shaven...
So many things I like about this museum: the architecture of the buildings, their mineral collection, the information on animals, their Asia section... I'm always happy to return for another visit.

Is cheaper to buy the City Pass instead the single ticket of the Museum. You can go to 5 attractions with $83, each attraction is around $30.Lot of things to see like Mummies, Statues, paintings, historical outfits, I recommend.

I went because my father wanted to but I was interested in the European artifacts exhibit. They do have a great Canadian History display but other than that, the museum is geared towards children and families. I will also say they have an excellent cafeteria.

Tries to cover too much. Is it a Natural History Museum, a children's experience or an Art Museum? I do visit ROM regularly. One of the best in North America, the best in Canada. Well updated, visitor friendly. Nice selection. Highly recommended.
This is a good day out and a good bang for your buck the always have people around and the exhibit art always changing so you can go back and back and never see the same stuff

Breath taking colours and shapes - of glass - yes, glass !!! - So amazingly beautiful !!! World renowned glass artist! You couldn't imagine the colour ! The ceiling installation - --- is fun and ... wow !!!! Saw it today ! June 27, 2016.

We didn't know what to expect when we visited but was surprised by how large the museum was. It was not the Smithsonian but it did have a fairly extensive set of exhibits. We went thinking it would take about 2 hours to go through but it took us closer to 4 hours (and it felt rushed as it was)....

Beautiful museum! Saw the Chihuly exhibit on opening day and it was amazing if you enjoy glass art and Chihuly's work in particular.The Dino exhibits are unbelievable. Best we've seen yet.
