A new museum which houses 4 floors of exhibitions from different countries. We saw the Chinese artifacts. horrible café though, big, barren & noisy

What a awsome place for every age. It's a big museum with several levels. If your in Toronto its sure a great place to visit. It will take you several hours. The ROM is very different than the Louvre, because the ROM is meanted to teach you something about life. The art-expositions are ofcourse also very nice. So old paintings,...

The exhibits were arranged in sections and across levels. As I visit countries I would like to learn abt them, how they came about and came to be the country and people today. Thought it would be nice to have a continuation from the "First people" and how immigration patterns and interaction shape the Canada of the present day. In...
Was really interesting visiting it, if you like musuems. Its like pretty much every big musuems but its stays fun visiting them.

This museum is huge! Wear your most comfortable sneakers. The museum has everything; fossils, dinosaurs, Chinese display, art, etc. It also has the best rocks and minerals display I have ever seen. You will not be disappointed. Thankfully, there is a restaurant on location.

ROM it's a must see place in Toronto! You'll need from 4-5 hours and this museum can be compared with the Louvre but in a small version. They have a diversity in the collections and also amazing exhibitions.
I loved the museum. It's really worth to see it. Exhibits are amazing. Excellent location, very well connected from different areas of the city.
So much to see, but not overwhelming. Many interesting areas. Lucky to have an organised guide who took us on a "highlight" tour.

We visited this museum using City Pass. I would not have paid regular price to see this museum. To be fair, we didn't have tons of time and didn't visit the entire museum. My boys liked the dinosaur exhibit by far the most. I'm not a huge fan of dinosaurs, but it was interesting. My favorite part was the birds/mammals...

I quite liked the Asian and ancient Greek and Roman art in this museum. I only briefly skimmed the natural history stuff. The cafeteria is best avoided, particularly in Toronto, which excels at food. This is a huge general museum with natural history collections, as well as art collections. There is enough there to spend more than a day.However, fans of architecture, do not go there for the Libeskind addition, the Michael Lee-Chin Crystal. It is cheaply done (and it shows) and, with the exception of the dinosaurs gallery, the spaces created are...
Very nice museum!! Loved all the dinosaur stuff and when we were there a choir was singing which was awesome

The ROM is rich with a wide variety of different exhibits. As visitors from Europe though, seeing all the exhibits relevant to Canadian history were the most interesting. One rider : should you choose to visit the ROM during school term time, try and do it after 2pm as this has to be the noisiest museum we've ever visited thanks...
This is a must visit spot. Children love it for the excellent dinosaur rooms and the Egyptian mummies and adults will love the incredible wealth of displays. Worth every $ and minute you spend there.

This is a really nice museum, not overwhelming, with many areas of interest. Perfect for families! Lots of activities for kids, but certainly informative for everyone. Only had about 2 1/2 hours so I had to choose my areas of interest, but could have easily spent an entire afternoon there.

Not as interesting as we thought it would be.Kids became bored very quickly. A lot of the exhibits were not available due to maintenance.When we arrived we let the staff know we had never been before hoping we would get a little direction on where to start. This place is huge, it takes a while to get round. We didn't see everything. We got the city pass, saved queuing. Got the bus tour to drop us off, worked well.

We have visited ROM few times with our grandchildren age 6, 8 and they loved it.The dinosaur exhibition is really very impressive. We also visit this place with our friends from Europe on many occasions. Pompeii: In the shadow of the Volcano was very good especially for someone who was already in Pompeii.

It becomes a great surprise as soon as you arrive to the street's corner. Super contrast!Make sure you get there early for the exhibits, but also take a chance to look at the building at night it is great.Take a look at the "Friday's night live".. So much going on!

We really enjoyed our time at ROM - there are many different sections with interesting, well presented exhibits. Some museums can be a bit tedious but each concise section here has just the right amount of exhibits and detail to keep it engaging.The front desk ladies were so helpful and enthusiastic about what we should see and the building...

The space has been renovated so that the charm of the original is virtually destroyed - the old lobby is abandoned and looks sad. We are on vacation from CT, USA. We went to the ROM today and found their exhibit to be wonderful. However, my experience was tainted by how inconsiderate the lady at the information desk was. You are never to old to learn something new and this is a great place always something new and great exhibitions year round
I am glad that I decided to visit. The museum is well worth the time and money to spend a few hours touring.

I planned to spend one day at ROM. It has free 45 minutes Guided Tours of different topics guided by volunteers . The tours starts at 11 ( am ( 12 pm ?) and the last one is at 3 pm. I joined the first one and found it so interesting and educational that I joined all the tours. The...

We have visited lots of famous museums around the world & this is as good as they get. Great displays, well laid out & clearly explained. However much time you allow won't be enough it's that good - even if you're "museumed out" this should impress. A must - see.
This is a great way to see some very historic pieces. Not very cheap but worth the experience. Also a good rainy day activity.

Nice freebie courtesy of the MAP passes given out in Toronto libraries.Great exhibitions and kids had a great time.Brought a bag lunch and there are nice are to sit.Will get another voucher for this winter...hockey schedule pending ?

Overall it was a good experience. We went for the dinosaurs and our 3yr old was happy. We enjoyed the other displays. The layout out was a bit confusing but we managed. The new addition that some hate didn't bother us, we could see how they needed to expand and the old front wasn't eye catching. There seemed to be...

We were invited to join our membership holding family members for a day at the ROM.As much as I enjoyed the exhibits, my 10 & 12 year old didn't have the patience to walk through the exhibits on the upper floors. They looked, but didn't want to take the time to read all the info.When we got to...
Not my favorite museum. Special exhibit wasn't open and didn't care for the layout. Really enjoyed the expansive dinosaur exhibits.
An odd museum with a bit of everything thrown in: Ancient Egypt, the first Canadians, mineralogy, tattoes, etc, etc. As a tourist, you can easily give this a skip.

Went to the ROM a few years ago thinking we'd see their fine collection of dinosaurs. They forgot to mention as we paid full price to get in that the dinosaur exhibits were not available as they were putting together a revamped exhibit. Seems to me that they shoud have offered a discount on admission because of their ommision. After...
We purchased a city pass this was included in the deal. It's a nice large museum it is well laid out. There is lots to see.
We loved the huge sculptures, it was fantastic to see items from all over the world in one place, and great variety!

Not the most jaw dropping with big flashy pieces but it was a nice place to stroll. I would think it would be good on a cold winter day or a rainy day to get out of the weather. We were on a time table and rushed through it and it still took a few hours. We could have made...

I have gone to the ROM more times than I can remember. It is truly one of the more fantastic museums, with a wide and highly interesting collection. If you like museums be sure to give yourself lots of time to enjoy!Great for kids interactive play!!
Very clean. Lots of exhibits. Many interesting items. Did not like that the tattoo exhibit was not included in group admission.

I visited this museum on a Friday. I spent 4 hours touring it. Had a simple but nice lunch at the lower floor of the museum. I had visited more than 30 museums in the world but I find this museum is large enough to contain all the exhibitions and small enough to spend sufficient time to cover lots of...

Place to visit on a rainy and on a sunny day. There are 3 interesting exhibitions happening at the moment: the Art of Tattoo, Edo Era in Japan and the life of the First Nation. I was blown away by audio intros on the 3rd floor. Don't miss it!

I am a teacher and took my 3-5 year old kindergarteners to the ROM for a field trip and it was a huge success. My advice to other school trips would be to ensure you book early and email/call to get a lunch time before or after the rush! Around 12pm all of the tables are completely full and very...

we are from NYC and we probably could have skipped this in favor of something else in our limited time. The Canada room was interesting but the NY museums have similar/better Egyptian Exhibits. We are also there with lots of school kids (great that they go) but they were running all over.

The first thing you see is the giant crystal entrance for the ROM. Inside you can see thesize of the dinosaurs from the second floor openings. A lot of interactive things for smaller kids to learn and see. There is also free tour guides that take you to the different special exhibits that are being shown that month. Also...

The permanent collection is excellent and wide-ranging, but the special exhibits (such as the one I recently saw about the culture of tattoos around the world) are always fascinating. They are so informative and usually have special lectures on the topic, to make it even more interesting. My membership is worth every cent!

The ROM has a multitude of objects and artefacts covering a spectrum of cultural and natural history. So much to see and experience and well worth a visit. Allow enough time to see everything plus any special exhibitions.

Plan on a min of 4 hours to see some of the museum as you cannot cover it all in less than a day unless you jog thru the buildings, and if you saw it 4 years ago new features some out all the time, as inventory is rotated all the time.

This is an awesome museum! We loved everything about it, and our girls, aged 11 and 9, were interested, and kept wanting more! It was a busy day (Easter weekend), but we never felt overwhelmed by the crowds. Cafeteria meal was affordable and edible, so that's a bonus! I love the new architectural entrance, just wonderful!

This is a big museum with lots of exhibits. There are hands on areas and play areas for the little ones and lots of things to see for the older ones. Plenty to learn and talk about. The section on Canada's Indians was good for those of us not from Canada. There are Roman, Egyptian and European exhibits as well....

I love going to museums so of course we went to the museum here. Great place to visit and they had some good food. I love the way the museum recycles they have a bin for everything, from food to paper to plastic. This place is big so expect to spend 3 hours if you love museums too. Short lines...

What a fabulous place. History, culture, art and science all wonderfully displayed. Around every corner is something new. The interactive displays keep you interested. There is no way to see it all in one day. We will be back many more times.
My 5yo's favorite was the dinosaurs and the hands on finding fossils. The hands on are perhaps not for teenagers, but for smaller kids they will be occupied for an hour.

Spent a few hours seeing the sights of this museum. I think the range of objects and the layout wasn't quite on par with, say, the Field Museum in Chicago, it's still very nice. In particular, I thought the Greek and Roman areas, and the mineral area was very interesting. There's a really wide range of exhibits here, and I'm...

The native american exhibits at this museum are reason enough to visit! This is a very well done establishment and the people of Ontario should be very proud of what they have. Great curating. Do not miss this museum on your visit to Toronto. It is not your "typical" museum. Great dinosaur exhibits as well!

I have introduced many people to this experience. In my opinion it's still the coolest venue. I'm sad my membership has expired. The last time I was there things seemed a bit scaled down. My friend got a membership thanks to me.She was so inspired by the atmosphere.Staff are generally courteous and helpful,with the exception of few snooty...

We arrived on a Saturday around 11am and found street parking a block away. We paid for the maximum 3 hour parking, thinking that that would be plenty of time. We were wrong. We ended up running out to the car to add hours.The museum houses and amazing breadth of collections. dinosaurs, antiquities, decorative arts.... All well curated. We...

I always get stuck looking at gems. This museum has an excellent collection of gemstones (rivaling the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History in DC), displayed in an appealing way. I wanted more local history, but this museum has a wide array of exhibits for all ages.
You visit Toronto and it starts raining, up in the street cars and make a stop at this great museum. You will spend 3 amazing hours with you kids and among grownups.

Having visited a few museums of this type in the past, we were really looking forward to seeing the ROM as it looked to be similar to the Natural History Museum in New York. Some parts (dinosaurs, minerals) were really interesting, but the cultural exhibits weren't exactly inspiring. We normally really enjoy museums of this type, but we're slightly disappointed...

We like visiting museums when we're on vacation so it was a no brainer that we would end up here. We had to walk thru the University of Toronto campus to get here. The front of the museum is rather odd, there is a modernistic glass structure connecting to an older building. A stark contrast. It's not the best museum...

My favorite section was the Group of Seven. We took a walking tour with a lovely last volunteer who choose paintings with a story. Honestly what's not to like about a world class art Gallery. Stopped for a glass of sparkling water at the cafe and some lovely homemade crisps and biscotti. We loved the wealth of fantastic art.
There are some interesting and well displayed exhibits and the museum is very well laid out but only worth a prolonged visit if the weather is bad.

I paid my money, the woman behind the counter was surly.I went to the Native exhibition, I couldn't read the labels for the lack of light and the small font size.I went to the Canadian galleries, which consisted almost entirely of 17th ad 18th century French Canadian furniture and silver, with a smattering of 20th century design at...

We had a day to spend in Toronto prior to our VIA Rail trip across Canada and we were pleasantly surprised to view as many exhibits as time permitted; we've visited a lot of museums and my husband thought the mineral exhibit was outstanding. It was a busy Saturday and we could see families really enjoying the museum.

We had not been to the ROM for some years and decided to spend a couple of hours with our General Admission tickets. We picked up the map at the entrance and went up to the 4th floor.We were rather disoriented by the layout and odd shape, with its dead ends and limited signage. The map was not much...

We came here as a pre-booked group (of 30) and were subdivided between 2 guides. My group's guide was fantastic; tremendously knowledgeable but, I personally felt, that what he managed best was linking one topic to the next, seemingly unrelated, exhibit. We learnt a great deal in the time we were with him.With a museum with many different galleries,...
My wife spent the afternoon wandering the many exhibits and exploring learning about Toronto, and Canada's history. Only regret is the ran out of time!
Free Friday evening Museum TorontoThis is a very unique and at the same time building full of interesting and beautiful pieces. There are continuously itinerary exhibitions.

I love this museum. There is so much to see, you have to dedicate a few hours in order to be able to see everything. The special exhibits on the fifth floor are always interesting as well, and they change often.

My husband and I enjoyed exploring the museum. We enjoyed the Third Gender exhibit and the tour of it. It was great to learn about Gender/Sexual Diversity in Japanese history and how that connected to the present. The last part of the tour really brought it home about gender/sexual diversity across the world.

Bats! Dinosaurs! Ancient Romans! Gems! The ROM has several floors filled with some wonderful exhibits on natural history, ancient civilizations, biology, and more. It can be pretty exhausting to take the whole thing in at once, so your best bet is to plan your visit and prioritize the exhibits you want to see first -- then see the rest if...

Enough cannot be said about this museum. It has one of the most extensive collections in North America and is a must see attraction in Toronto. Our guide, Judy, was second to none. She made the experience great.

We arrived at the museum about midday on a Wednesday afternoon and there was no queue for tickets. It covers a wide range of history and topics, and there's something for everyone. It wasn't too busy either, apart from in the dinosaur section where there was a school trip. The price is very reasonable, $17 for general admission and you...

We haven't been here in awhile. We paid extra for tattoo exhibit and was disappointed in the size of that. Seemed like there should have been more to it. Very nice exhibits with maps everywhere helping you find your way. Kids will enjoy the animal exhibits and the hands on area on that floor. Also the dinosaur hall with the...
One of the spots with the Coupon bookFun for the kids, and good for a rainy day projectsIf you bring your own food, the cafeteria is located all the way in the basement area, and not very clean.

I am a being who likes to discover things through past and present and future time and Royal Ontario Museum gives me all, there is both historical stuff to find out and both some cool themes( it is changing time to time) like Tattoos which is their theme nowadays. We have visited there recently with my family and really enjoyed....

The R.o.M. covers natural history, anthropology, both fine and decorative arts plus sections on the Americas, Egypt & China. The original building dates from the early half of the C20th, but has had massive makeover surgery by international architect Daniel Liebeskind. The resulting Michael Lee-Chin Crystal facade on Bloor Street is externally stunning and appears in all guide and souvenir...

We had not been to Toronto for over 10 years and had not seen the new updated museum. The exhibits were very well done with many interactive exhibits. It took us one afternoon and all of the next morning until after lunch to see it all. We can't wait until our grandson is old enough to truly appreciate it. We...

We went to the Royal Ontario Museum, which is near the St. George TTC stop. We used our City Pass, which granted us general admission, but we had to pay extra to see the current tattoo exhibition. We were in a rush so really only walked through the tattoo exhibition and the first people's exhibition, but both were great. I...

The ROM has a huge collection organized into 'galleries' with certain themes. On my last trip I spent about 2 hours and only did the top floor (of 3) so a good tip is to focus in on what interests you. This is a popular spot for children and parents, note that some sections are like playgrounds.There are free...

Depending on what you want to see, you can do it quickly. There's half a floor of dinosaurs, and the largest exhibit is the gallery of biodiversity which features stuffed animals with interesting facts about them. The bottom and top floor features ancient cultures- Rome, Greece, Egypt, ChinaThe largest attraction is the Bat Cave, which is a must at...
Tickets are only $10 on Fridays and it was also not very busy, which was surprising. Great date location.

My sister and I booked a game of Urban Capers that took place at the ROM. We had a blast trying to solve a murder mystery while taking a fast paced tour of the ROM. Once the game was completed, we had lunch in the basement cafeteria then spent several more hours looking at everything we didn't get a chance...
For the price they charge it is a joke. I have been to British museum, Louvre, Metropolitan, Smisonians, etc. Half of them are free and half are cheaper, exhibition ROM is a joke - so provincial...
A great place to spend the day.Knowledgeable and approachable staff.Well laid out - brilliant exhibitions.A lovely place.

We went to see the tattoo exhibit, which we very much enjoyed. I was a little underwhelmed with the ROM overall though. The staff seemed more than a little disinterested with the guests. There was also very little effort put into making the areas that were under construction or being reset properly separated. The restaurant upstairs has been closed, and...
we had a wonderful time here. there was so much to see . The dinosaurs are always popular. My son loved the Canadian and Greek sections were 2 of his many favorites.

A national museum in my opinion should be free. There is so much to learn here and to see not just about aboriginals but about changes across the universe. A meteorite, Sitting Bull's moccasins and headdress, a Roman gladiator's helmet and dinosaurs' skeletons are proudly on show. There is something for everyone. There are several tours which will suit every...
It is a fun place to visit with the family. Many dinosaur exhibits which my kids love. Many new exhibits are added pretty often.

Great museum with lots of historical, geographical, biological exhibits. Dinosaurs. Special exhibits now about tattooing art and another entitled Third Gender. I found the latter interesting and educational. Lots of school kids. Something for everyone. You won't be able to do it all in one visit. The direction change of the ROM was a bit disappointing. We had a couple hours before we had to check out of our hotel across the street and we had the Citypass so decided to check out the ROM. We were impressed. Lots of things for kids and adults to see. I really enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit. We didn't have time for anything past the 2nd floor. Make time to...
SO much to see and so interesting, room after room of artifacts! There is something for everyone one here. There is also a nice cafeteria to have lunch and take a break.
One day is not enough to take your time and enjoy everything the ROM has to offer. What a fabulous variety of displays housed it this unique building.

Saw this as one of the top things to do in Toronto and it was very enjoyable. You can't visit it properly in one day. There are many things to see about different civilizations. If you're patient to stop and read. You will learn many things

I was in Toronto for work and was invited to a Friday night party here by a friend. It was a blast. What makes a museum visit more fun? how about Bars on each floor, live music and hundreds of people having a great time.Good work ROM keep it up.
Too great for words. Very unique and one of the top exhibitions in the world. Very educational and informative. Looking forward to going there a few more times.

A group of us went to the ROM last year. Wow! What a fabulous museum. You can spend a whole day there to see everything. Between the dinosaurs.the artifacts and the special showings whoever it is they choose it is well worth the visit. Very well done and I wouldn't have missed it. Fabulous!!! There's something for everyone.

We went here on our last morning in Toronto and wished we had had more time. Was unsure if our young boys would enjoy a museum but the animal and dinosaur displays are amazing we only were able to see a small part of the museum and will have to go back on our next visit.Great place to get...

*Free on Tuesdays for students!*I've been going to the ROM for years, and I've always loved the variety in their exhibits. Of course it's biased towards European history/pursuits, but there's also a section on Middle Eastern, Asian, African, and Indigenous histories (a single section, mind you). One of several great museums in Toronto.

Very nice museum. Try buying the city pass if you plan on going to CN tower, Aquarium and ROM as the purchase is heavily discounted with the same features as buy regular tickets. If you like history, art, anthropology then it's a nice treat.
This museum is huge, so plan on spending. A few hours here. We found parking a block away next to Victoria University, which made for a nice walk to the ROM if your into architecture.

Great time, great exhibits! Affordable gift shop! Confusing layout. Couldn't find a map for anything! Got lost in couple exhibits trying to find my way out! Great dinsaur bone exhibit and the tattoo exhibit was very cool!

We used the city pass and got greatly reduced-price admission. Thanks to our city pass, we went right to the front of the admission line. Me an my son and sunny day decided to go :) we are little bad suprised. We hoped that we find a something more bigger museum. To understand the history of ontari is quit enough. Specially old indian things were wonderfull. Real canada people !
There have been many amazing exhibitions which make me keep visiting this place. It has become part of my Toronto life. It is big so plan well in order to maximize the efficiency of your visit.
I seriously felt bored in ROM! In the end we left 2nd and 3rd floor left side portions and we went back to home straightaway. But I clicked some pics which I am sharing.
We only had 1.5 hours here because it closes at 5:30pm. We tried to go to the exhibit on the 4th floor but they were charging more money. Thought this museum was going to be cooler.

We stayed at the Delta Toronto and although it was quite a hike we decided to walk to the ROM and get a feel for the city and see things along the way. Well worth the walk. The ROM was wonderful. Well laid out and easy to follow maps. Almost more than we could take in in one visit. I...

Nice museum but also very similar to many natural history museums. Most of he displays are behind glass and there didn’t appear to be many interactive exhibits, so it might be a bit much for very young children. They do have a great collection of dinosaur skeletons though. The building itself is very interestingly designed, though some parts were a...

We've been there many times and keep coming back. ROM has great programming for March breaks and PA days. Special exhibits are outstanding. We have a membership but Costco has reasonably priced tickets.

If you like classic museums, where everything is behind glass, then this is the place for you! If, however, you prefer more experiential museums then you may want to look elsewhere. My friend and I went to the exhibits on dinosaurs, First Nations people, Canadian history and more. We chose not to spend the extra money to see the special...
The best museum in Canada, I was totally impressed with the exhibition there, fully amazed and thrilled with the structure and information...
Really very informative. but 1 day is enough to visit each section and enjoy. We loved the birds section.
I loved this museum--it is both a fine art and natural history museum in one. Small enough to see all of the exhibits in one afternoon. I especially loved the Canadian specific history and artifacts.

On our last morning in Toronto, we had to spend our last free time at the ROM. The dinosaur section is world class! They have collected several of each type of dino discovered to date, often with eggs, babies and young ones of the species. Great for kids and families, as well as women like us -- who just love...

Great design from the outside but a horrible use of space on the inside.The exhibition is good, but the architecture of this museum is deplorable.Another thing I didn't like at all is that they rent the space for weddings, so the day I visited with my son, they closed quite early. Aren't museums supposed to be for the...

We most enjoyed the dinosaurs, but the Asian artifacts and gemstones were wonderful as well. We ate in the cafe and the food was reasonable and the selection good. You can have your picture taken with a Tyrannosaurus and then can e-mail it to friends!

First,i am not a museum lover.That is why please consider this fact when you read my review.I live in Toronto for almost 2 years and never have been to ROM.There are 4 levels and each of them is dedicated to a certain topic.On the last level it was a separate exhibition which was about tattoos.That level was quite interesting and...

Blocking off areas for private parties is only one example of how the atmosphere of the place has changed from a museum to an exclusive part place for big donors. Whatever happened to having just a Museum?
What a cool place to walk around in ... Great for all ages ..lots to see ... Even if you think you won't like ...go and take a look around ...
Fun fun fun, amazing place to be at, we didn't have enough time to stay as we liked. Very interesting, the museum offers free tours, beautiful building too, recommended!
Great cross section of many disciplines. Something for everyone in the family. So many cultures were featured which we found very interesting.

A huge museum well laid out in a mix of old - wonderful architecture- and modern building. Good signage and support staff. We focussed on the First Nations exhibit - really interesting - and then couldn't resist those dinosaurs. Some huge exhibits. Especially good as included on the City Pass

We visited here while on a recent trip to Toronto. It's a nice museum with a lot of variety of items but it seemed to us to lack continuity. There were a lot of random collection of artifacts. The collection of Asian items was the most impressive but we didn't see how that related to Toronto or Ontario.The tattoo...
Beautiful piece of Architecture with a comprehensive overview on several human communities.As an Architect i loved the building the most.It is easy to be found at the down town.

Absolutely brimming with history of different regions and time periods, there will be something that fascinates everyone. The addiitonal "tattoos" exhibiton on display when I visited was definitely worth the extra money. I had to skip some parts out before it closed even though I allowed for three hours - get here early and plan to spend a whole day...

I had no idea just how large this museum was. If your into museums and history this is the place for you! I found it to be exhausting and really overwhelming. Make sure you see what you want first! We took a free tour however everything covered you can find out by reading signs so I'd skip that!
Permanent and temporary collection at outstanding level. I strongly advise to get the discount card, good for various entrances to museums and touristic places in Toronto.
everyone should visit this place. learnt something new..lots to see and learn! lovely pics outside this beautiful place

I have spent the day with the whole family and with just my 2 y.o. son. Always have plenty to do and enjoy ourselves. You can leave for lunch and go back or grab something at the little cafe there. Parking can be a tad tricky but it is available, just look for the round green sign with the black...

Takes about two hours to walk through all the exhibits and they have a little of everything. Quite a good collection of dinosaur bones, as well as collections from Greece, Roman, African, etc. The Asian wing on the first floor with the Korean, Chinese and Japanese collections was especially nice. Something for every one of these 10 adult tourists! Inside and outside, ROM offered art, history, walking tour, sciences like anthropology, and beautiful architecture of old and modernity. Well traveled and experienced folks and small children all found lots that was well-presented and enthralling. Highly recommended that you check out ROM on your trip to Toronto!

This museum combines cultures, natural history, earth science arts and more. The building itself is of much interest. Free overview tour was worthwhile, Far too much to see in one day so plan ahead. They had a tattoo exhibit which I thought I would whisk through, but it was extremely well done and proved to be of much interest. Would...

This was my first visit to a museum, but I was not impressed at all. The Museum is huge from the outside; however, it looks empty from inside and there isn't much to see. The section about the Pharos is not impressive at all. Overall, it was an OKAY experience.

We often take our Granddaughters to visit the ROM they particularly enjoy the Dinosaur area and the hands on activities, the bat cave and looking at the Egyptian section, plus all the different minerals on display and of course the Canadian section. There seems to be something different going on every time we go. They never seem to get bored....

I have visited the ROM multiple times over the years. It always impresses. They have a fantastic collection of Asian ceramics and art, really impressive pieces of decor, and plus, a dinosaur. The docents are wonderful and it's one of those places with a little something for everyone. Well worth your time.
Enjoyed the museum, especially all the historical information of Canada in it's early days which was new to us. Some of the signage could have been more explicit.

A must go place during your stay in Toronto. Fun for young children and mom and dad.Bring your launch and enjoy your food in dinning area.low cost Parking available, easy access by TTC and subway.Many activities available for your children while enjoying visiting the museum.

I've seen a lot of museums and this one is still one of my favourites. We really liked this museum. It was our second stop of the trip and definitely something for everyone.
Loved visiting this museum , so did the kids! Lots to see and lots to do , the kids loved the dinosaurs and so did we!!

This is a magnificent museum focusing, primarily, on Canada's cultural heritage. It is, for the most part, well laid out, exhibits well designed and large enough to accommodate large number of visitors without feeling crowded.Out only problem came with navigating some of the floors that were on multiple levels separate by stairs. Nice museum, but avoid March break. Lots of different areas to see. I liked them Egyptian mummies section the best. Seemed to be more for older children (> 10 yrs old) but that can be said for most museums unless they're specifically for children. Close to good shopping on Bloor.
Good rainy day activity. Many interactive exhibits for children and even some adults. The only thing that wasn't good is that some the interactive exhibits didn't work.

You will need a few hours to see the entire museum - it's huge!!They have it all from wildlife to different cultures. They also have a special event going on - when i went it was a tattoo exhibition, which was great!The dinosaur gallery was also amazing!
Spent a good few hours here and definitely didn't see everything. Loved the Canadian first people exhibition and the tattoo exhibition. Kids loved dinosaurs. Lots to see on a cold rainy day.
Tons of stuff to do great for touring. Native history, Chinese etc. Love when they have their specialty periods recommend to all.

Visitors to Toronto, so we got a CityPass! Ticked this one off today, and I was a little disappointed. Definitely a should see when visiting Toronto. They have a very good collection of artifacts from east to west and back. Reserve at least half a day for the visit
This was an interesting mix of art and natural history. The displays were interesting as well as the building itself.

We went to ROM to see the dinosaur exhibition and did not leave disappointed. There are many real dinosaur skeletons reconstructed into the real-life size animals. The museum also has an "exploration zone" for children where they can look for skeletons in a sand box and dress up in costumes among other things. The museum's location is also very convenient...

I have spent here 3 hours and my friends laughed at me and said you need 3 days here An amazing collection of art,historical pieces , but when your time is limited at least visit 3-4 hours here, you will not regret.
Toronto museum has huge collections from East to West. Almost need one day to visit.I like sit in cafe when you felt tired.

There is so much to see in this massive museum it would certainly take more than one day to explore it. We were fortunate enough to arrive shortly before a tour began and I would highly recommend doing one before you begin traversing the floors. This museum is excellent, I have visited multiple times, and it always amazes me. For a museum that focuses on natural and cultural history it does a great job at representing both parties. I can't nail down why, but the tattoo exhibit was kind of lame and just not very interesting. I guess I was expecting photographs of really weird or unique tattoos and was underwhelmed as a result. I found the entire thing kind of lazy and uninspired.The rest of the regular ROM stuff is pretty interesting I guess, when there isn't...

As visitors from afar we were mostly interested in finding out more about Canada, so didn't look at all the exhibits. We found the First People's gallery an excellent and engaging display, the European side of the Canada section less so. This is a large, echoey museum that would be hard to see in depth on one visit. Wow all i can say is this is one museum you must see! Everything from the exhibits to the staff is everything you should expect

We went to the Royal Ontario Museum as part of the Toronto pass. We watched the tattoo exhibition and I was pretty amazing. The museum as a whole is good and there is free wifi but the sign is somewhat confusing

We went to the ROM for the first time with the kids this past week. We had purchased the CityPass and it was included so we said why not give it a try. We thought this was a classic museum (don't touch anything style) where the kids (ages 7 & 10) might get bored but we were very wrong. There...

Very good museum that will satisfy everyone's curiosity from dinosaurs to ancient Chinese artifacts, furniture & design to an astounding display of minerals, & beautiful stones. Highly recommended. Convenient to the Toronto underground system.
This was fun for the everyone of all ages. It was educational,enlighten and fun.The building has an interesting shape.

Exhibits showcasing Canadian history was my favorite. Especially the exhibit about the First Nations tribes. It would be difficult to see everything in one visit to the ROM. Lots to see and do for people who are intersted in history. Not much to keep very young children interested throughout the visit but nonetheless the adults enjoyed it!

Also known as ROM, it has a magnificend shows about native canadians - Which were the Indians, the british and france who came to Canada. also a great area with dinosaurus exebition, it appears to be that some few milion years ago, thet ere living there ...
I am not one to normally enjoy museums however this is a definite MUST in my books. There is all different exhibits and galleries which are constantly changing and are so amazingly fun!
Very fun to visit , we learned more then we expect for. love the Canadian section and the bio diversity . worth the visit

Maybe it's that we've been spoilt living in New York or maybe it's because we've been lucky to spend time in great museums in London etc But we really expected so much more from this museum. I took my two young daughters to see what was new at the ROM. I hadn't been there myself in almost 20 years. Some of the attractions were still as I remember them. The ROM has a varied and interesting collection with something to interest a wide range of people. It is located in a great part of town and easy to get to on public transit. Well worth the visit.
Nice architecture from outside, but claustrophobic inside. The ceilings are really low and the exihibition there I have seen in Paris at Quai Branly. The museum store is nice.

This is a large Museum and really to appreciate it, one has to visit it over a few visits. so nice/ clean beautiful and amazing. Take the family. This place is a hit. Egypt to Roman Times to Dinosaurs its all there, just GO :-)

Pretty great, you have to go for more than 3 hours to really get to see everything though. I really love history museums but I think it's a little redundant and long... Great museum, great exhibits. If you have been to natural history museum in NY, it might seem a bit of a poor relation, but still enjoyable.
This museum is worth visiting. The exhibits cover a great deal of eras. The Egyptian, Jurrasic and Roman Bust areas are especially interesting.
Its a wonderful experience there we saw lots of antiques there and it was amazing .It also included a night and day exhibit of animals and plants.
Respecting our golden traditions all over the world.. Visually can be understood how they live.. Jurassic existence are observed..
Great museum covering history for all over the world. With kids it is even better with beautiful things to see and at the same time teach them something.I definitely recommend.

The building is fascinating. The new part seems to come out of the old. The permanent collections were very interesting particularly the Chinese Art, and the Early Inhabitants of North America and particularly of Canada. We had a wonderful volunteer guide at no extra cost.

I have always loved the ROM. I usually pick one section at a time each visit...my favourite being the Egyptian and the Roman. There is something for the whole family. There are lots of trendy restaurants in the area and shopping.
I went sunday morning while waiting for things to open, was not disappointed, excellent displays and helpful staff. Very large museum with great dinosaurs on display

Wonderful diversity of animals.. Floors and floors of things to discover..you will never get bored..lots of fun tho he for children to do as well..just seeing how massive the dinosaurs and sun fish is was good enough..a trip u dont want to miss.

I never have enough time to see everything at the ROM and find new things every time I go. The exhibits are well maintained and always enjoy them. Lots of interactive areas. I have attended lectures and gone on their guided walks and found them very informational. I have stayed overnight twice with my grandchildren and slept under the big...
First impression was woman at door and her smile was as bright as it was outside. Walking in this place you see a big dinosaur and you immediately step inside your inner kid. Loved it
The museum is friendly and has a variety of cultural items reflecting the history of Canada. It is a great place to explore. There is a huge diversity of exhibitions.

Traveled to Toronto while on vacation in Niagara for something extra for our 2 kids to see...This museum has the best dinosaur exhibit I've ever seen! The fossil skeletons are huge and everywhere, and the backdrop is pretty much huge windows letting in a lot of sunlight. Makes me realize I've never been to a real natural history dinosaur museum,...
Great place to visit and have a great collections to see. Must visit one time. Excellent location for tourists and locals. Easy access from attractions and from downtown and all hotels.
A lot of things to see and variety of attractions. Is very good the shop and the building is nice. Close to st. George station

This is a very well organized, world class museum with wonderful permanent exhibits! Fascinating details with every showcase that we just had to read! Very modern, easy to wander about on your own or tour with the staff who were very friendly and well informed. We will definitely revisit when we can spend several more hours!

Had a great time but try and go early (or later in day) to avoid the crowds. Wear comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking. Take your time and plan for a couple hours. Signage could be a bit better.

My wife and I had looked forward to our visit, but were disappointed. Boring place. Exhibits are not laid out in a manner that engages you. There are a lot of exhibits, but after viewing a collection I frequently found myself asking, "is that it?" It would help if they laid their exhibits out in either a chronological order or...

The Royal Ontario Museum is located in the heart of downtown Toronto, Canada. It is one of the largest museum in North American, and the largest in Canada. It is a museum of arts,world culture, and natural history in Toronto. There are so many artifacts to explore; galleries of ancient Egypt, displays of ancient dinosaurs, so much to analyze. This...

Through no fault of the museum, I am certain. We parked on the street, purchased a ticket from the automated ticket dispenser, and had the ticket displayed on the dash per instructions. We still managed to get a ticket for parking in a "loading zone," despite being within a car's length of the ticket dispenser. Noticed no signs or markings...

Canada's best museum [except for prehistoric life which is in Alberta] and quite large. The Chinese and Roman sections in particular are excellent, but some exhibits have not been updated and do not have very good descriptions.

The biggest thing that differentiated this museum for me was the displays: they were large, modern, and gave you excellent view of the pieces (either from all angles, allowing you to get up close, or even magnifying pieces).The layout is a by region, and there are some impressive showcase pieces in each (the ornate Oriental awning is wonderful). The...

My only regret is that I didn't get there earlier in the day. It closes at 5.30pm on a Sunday ( it was my last day in Toronto) and there are a lot of exhibits to get through! Enjoyed learning more about Canada's history, and was impressed by the dinosaur exhibit. Definitely a must do, just give yourself plenty of...

Interesting, world class museum in the heart of Toronto (off Bloor) with good permanent exhibits and the likely place for some of the top traveling exhibitions, as well. For example, recently the museum hosted the Pompeii exhibit. AS we often visit with our children, a family membership is actually a good bargain as it gets you into the museum and...

We went during the Pompeii exhibition and that in itself was worth 5 stars. What a great exhibition, informative, detailed and interactive.The rest of the Museum is also amazing, probably our favourite in Canada as it is well layed out, has amazing pieces and feels modern.The information is easy to gather and read, the staff is helpful and...

This was fairly average as far as museums go. We've definitely seen better but still a very nice place to visit. The Dinosaur exhibit was amazing but also the most crowded with a sea of children running around. We expected to spend about 3 or 4 hours here but got through the whole thing in half that time. It was...

Each collection can stand on its own merits. Add them up and the sum of the parts is more than the whole. It makes for an exceptionally good museum.For once the architecture matches the inventory (Teck Gallery-Earth’s Treasure). The Libeskind designed crystal is a fabulous structure. Maybe… sex it up with stained glass windows, or LED lights to make...

Not a great museum. The new wing is hideous from the outside. It wrecks the architecture of the building and the area of the city. It is un-navigable from the inside with a lot of useless space.It has some nice exhibits sometimes but unless you can't go to a city without seeing the museum, I would skip it.

Very impressive collections. Natural history exhibition has very interesting space for kids. My favorite gallery - Canadian Indians.Only one warning - do not eat there :-) tasteless. Plenty of nice cafes nearby.

As beautiful outside as anything inside, the is an awe inspiring combination of art and history; it took great foresight and imagination for the museum to add this amazing new addition to the old Victorian Museum building. The entrance fees can be pricey for those on budget, and not enough discount for seniors to make a difference.

If you are visiting Toronto, the Royal Ontario Museum is definitely NOT to be missed. The ROM is one of a few major museums in the world with encyclopedic collections spanning across art, culture, and nature. If you are only visiting for a few hours, choose your own adventure wisely, because there is a LOT to see! I go to...

Excellent, excellent experience at the ROM. We enjoyed the natural history collections, and we're thrilled to see species that are somewhat rare to most American collections. We also enjoyed the tattoo exhibit. We were grateful for the complimentary tour of the Roman collection- our docent was knowledgeable and directed our attention to artifacts we may have otherwise missed. Tour times...

Recently went for their special exhibit on tattoos with my Mum, had a great time not only at the special exhibit but visiting old favourites like the dinosaurs or the Asian antiquities. I always enjoy coming back to the ROM and is must for anyone new to Toronto.
It's a big museum, with a lot of amazing collections on art, history and nature. You won't be able to see everything in one visit, unless you run...A must do, when visiting Toronto.
Rom Fridays are always fun. Live entertainment, food and wine, what's not to like. And of course the museum itself is full of interesting stuff.
I always try to visit the ROM every year or so - it's my favourite place in the city! Absolutely extensive collection spanning around the world, it's a great afternoon out in a beautiful building.

For lovers of those creatures of the past the ROM does not disappoint. We visited their display and then viewed some of their other excellent displayed. We also used their cafeteria for a wholesome late lunch. We arrived by public transit so we cannot comment on parking.
good collection of gem stones , China history , Dinosaurs and a lot of others things , it is quite a day to spend there .
The museum is looking rather long in the tooth. Many displays did not have labels to identify what you are looking at and those with labels were very incomplete.
A good-sized museum to spend half a day in. Exhibits suitable for learners of all ages. It's not too huge but compact and easy to navigate. Free on Tuesdays for all post-secondary students.
The ROM is a must-see in the city, they always have fantastic exhibits going on. Great spot to bring kids for a day trip or go with friends!

Just the frescoes from Yuan Dynasty China would merit a visit here. But the depth and breadth of treasures collected from all over the world is simply extraordinary. And seeing the dinosaurs juxtaposed with Daniel Liebeskind's sculpturally complex and idiosyncratic spaces is really fun.
A real old style museum, mixed with modern architecture on the inside. A large space with some fantastic exhibits. Lovely day out.

We are long time members of the ROM and it continues to impress us. They bring in such a diverity of special exhibits and they are all curated so well: Dead Sea Scrolls, Mayans, Mesopotamia, Forbidden City, Pompeii, Wildlife Photographer of the Year . . . just to name a few.Most recently we attended a members exclusive talk with...
This is a very, very old fashioned museum. Nothing much to see. I would recommend to buy a ticket as part of a bundle or city pass so you can enjoy other attractions without paying full price.

My Family and I have been to the museum several times. We all enjoy going and we all have our own favorite section. Be ready to spend the whole day here as it is quite big and their are several floors to explore.
Our favorite exhibit was the collection of asteroids, stones, crystals and minerals. It is one of the largest, if not the largest, collection we have seen. Quite amazing.
The Royal Ontarion Museum is freakin AMAZING!!!!!!! Be prepared for walking as this place is huge with 4 floors. Running shoes required ;)
The Royal Ontario Museum was cool, I suggest purchasing a citypass! The Museum is easy to get around, the exhibits on different cultures is cool

I was on business and we had a reception in the minerals gallery and dinner in the dinosaur section. Themuseum had really friendly and knowledgeable docents around to help you explore the exhibits. It was so different - it will be a memorable event for me. I only saw a small portion and cant' wait to go back and see...

This was included in the city pack we purchased so thought we would pay it a visit, it's well worth going to see you can also visit the Council building and Queens Park on the way as its only a short walk from the center. Lots of black squirrels in the park and if you take some nuts along you...
huge museum, nice canadian native history, good shows, fossils really nice, amazing tirannosaurus, we really have a good time
I love going to the ROM. The exhibits are always top notch, there were lots of activities for children, which made me a little jealous to be truthful.

We took our two year old son to visit the dinosaur exhibition and were amazed at just how much there was to see and do. Our son especially loved the CIBC Discovery Gallery where he could read books, play with the jigsaws and other toys/games, dress up in a variety of costumes and also became a paleontologist digging for bones....

While there are tons of exhibits and things to see at the ROM, I found the whole collection a bit... random? There are the historical sections and the natural history sections and, oh, look a bat cave, etc. etc. If I lived in Toronto, I'd probably give the museum a higher rating but trying to cover the disparate sections in...
We really enjoyed our time at the ROM. My 13 yr. old son enjoyed the dinosaur area. Parking was easy across the street. It is a good family activity.

The large museum is a true educational teaching place for all with its display,organizing & the educational info available on recording or displayed. The Jurassic part is amazing with the actual displayed features. yet other cultures display takes you back to the fact its a museum that is not only meant for Canada but links it to others.

We spent last Saturday afternoon at ROM and really enjoyed it.Dinosaurs of all kinds and sizes were impressive. Mummies in the Egypt display were a highlight.We only had three hours planned and missed some sections.Plan for a whole afternoon to see all the history displayed and learn so much!

If you are someone that loves going to museums you will enjoy the Royal Ontario Museum. There are more than 40 galleries at the museum. And a cafeteria that serves soup and other warming items on a cold day. The Natural History galleries have various displays from the prehistoric era.

The museum is great. I personally went to the exposition "Tattoos: Ritual. Identity. Obsession. Art." which was awesome and also visited one floor of the ROM. The museum is really big and its kind of easy to get lost. You definitely need more than one day to visit all the museum.

This is a must see if you are visiting Toronto. You'll need more than half a day and that is if you run through. It is 4 floors with everything from Egyptian artifacts to dinosaurs to Canadiana. Children and adults alike will find something in each exhibit. I wish I lived here so I could spend more time in each...

This museum is a favourite for families. The dinosaurs are a favourite with children as is the collection of rocks. Be sure to check out the Museum's web site as there are often special exhibitions on display. The Museum has an excellent shop with a variety of things on sale.
Great place to visit....for young and old....things from all over the world to see.....from Egyptians to North American Natives and beyond....and the seasonal exhibits....Love this museum.

For its size, this museum is fairly easy to navigate. We arrived only minutes before the start of a free "Highlights" guided tour. It took about 50 minutes, but the docent managed to take us to one major exhibit in each of the main divisions of the museum. That gave us a good overview and helped us plan our strategy...
This museum is enormous! We didn't realize how much time we would spend here. Easily a whole day activity. There was an impressive variety in this museums collection!
This is a great museum. It was worth visiting. There were so many exhibits. You can spend the whole day here, be prepared.
Lovely paintings and impressionists. Great gift shop. Had someone providing history and detail of specific paintings.

I love the Royal Ontario Museum. The amount of history on display on this museum is vast and wonderfully displayed. There really is something for everyone here: Dinosaur bones, indigenous peoples displays, Samauri armor and ancient civilizations exhibits. There's also hands on exhibits for kids od all ages. Highly recommended!

I went to the ROM with two kids 6 and 9. This is the perfect age to go to the ROM because they are like sponges when it comes to new information. Be sure to wear very comfortable shoes. We had a nice day at the ROM. We toured the entire museum from 10 am to 5 pm. We started...

I've been going to the ROM since I was six years old. Before it had it's face lift of a meteor hitting the original old building. Before they closed the Planetarium beside the original building. So many wonderful memories visiting the museum. This were I first saw dinosaur bones up close and personal, and having them made real rather than...

I took our young children to the ROM for the first time. I was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. The admission is inexpensive. There were a lot of visitors but the wait was not long and we obtained our tickets quickly. The staff are friendly and polite. There are a lot of exhibits so you should plan what you...

My son and I enjoyed our visit to the museum. A great variety to see and learn. It was not the easiest to navigate around the museum, but we managed and it did not take away from our enjoyment of the various exhibits. Convenient to get to with the subway - Museum station!

Our family had a great time at the ROM. Our kids (ages 6 and 7 respectively) were thoroughly entertained (and learned quite a bit) during our visit. The dinosaur exhibits were their favorite and there were some really good interactive displays on the 2nd floor. We stayed for over 4 hours and the kids ran out of energy before we...

The collection here is decent, and somewhat one of a kind, as it includes ancient art, natural history and aboriginal art. It doesn't hold up when compared to the best that the world has to offer (like the Met or the British Museum) but for its size and location, it is pretty good and Toronto's best museum. The Friday Night...

This is a great family-friendly museum. If you like the Field Museum in Chicago, you will like this one as well. They have a very large collection of dinosaur fossils, which is sure to delight young and old alike. There is also a nice collection of Egyptian mummies and related artifacts, as well as an extensive collection of items from...

I have visited many Museums around this world, but I have never seen such a completely random collection of historical "things". From Dinosaurs over padded animals, Chinese, Japanese, Roman or Greek culture just to name a view. Maximum interesting for small school children or people who have never travelled outside North America...For those who are not confused enough after all...
A stunning experience. We only had a week in Toronto and could easily have spent it all in the ROM. It's well priced and really educational.

Grandma loved the Buddha and Monk statues, Daughter loved the Tattoo and Piercing exhibit, Grandson loved the "Bat Cave" and Granddaughter (toddler) loved the imagination play area with horses, dinosaurs, and tea service. We were all amazed at the Dinosaur Exhibits.
Lots of old stuff. New displays. Most well-kept. Daniel Libeskind designed building addition creates a starting point for architectural discussion-think concept, don't look at the details.

We're so lucky to have such a great venue in Toronto. We love going to the ROM as often as we can. We joined as members a year or so ago and are loving the benefits. Great dinosaurs, exhibits for young and old!
ROM is a nice museum, clean and full of great exhibits. Daughter was not very interested so we moved on after a few hours. I could have stayed longer.

The museum itself is great. There are many helpful volunteers; the front desk staff was kind; the exhibits well thought-out. There were many options for kids. But throngs of visitors really upped the stress level, especially in the kid-friendly zones. Such is a visit to the museum with kids, sometimes.

Large, lots of space and walking. Great standard history museum exhibits: dinosaurs, Egypt, China, native people, etc. There is a cool geology exhibit with beautiful stones and gems-great colors and pictures. Building was clean and docents friendly.

I went on a Friday after 4:30pm because it was at the discounted rate and they are open late on Fridays. I recommend that if you do want to see EVERYTHING in the museum that you prepare to spend more than 3 hours there.There was so much to see, that it was a little overwhelming. Lots of interesting things...

Massive venue with so much to see! I recommend planning what you want to see in advance as it's very easy to get waylaid! The Canadian History section was particularly interesting and the dinosaur exhibit is wonderful. You can even take a photo with a T-Rex and email to yourself! If you start to flag there is a very nice...

The Royal Ontario Museum is a wonderful place to go whether you have children or not. It is very interactive. Your children will love going there. You can see artifacts from different parts of the world. There are special exhibition or shows going on sometimes Your children will like digging for dinosaur bones, be an Explorers It gets very busy...
Great way to spend the day! Lots to see, and they are ever changing exhibits. Great cafeteria downstairs.

The museum had their exhibits organized in a very easy to follow manner. My husband and I loved what they had but did not enjoy our visit because there was a group of middle school students that were very poorly behaved and monitored. I would encourage people to go because from what we saw we want to go back. Also,...

Only really went as it was part of the city pass deal but really glad I did. The building itself is beautiful from angular modern ceilings and staircases to classical great halls. The variety of exhibits is huge and you're bound to find something of interest for all in here somewhere. Great gift shop as well with a huge range...

Some interesting artifacts but bewarned, your legs will get very tired and if you're visiting with a group of kids you'll be one of the walking dead by the end of the day. On a few separate occasions, I've found the staff at ROM a little rude, even unwelcoming. I experienced this firsthand as well as observing unfriendly treatment of...
Good. The only critique is they need to update their maps for current exhibits. Friendly staff that really known their stuff!

We went to the ROM on the last day of our city pass. By that time, we were pretty tired and only had a bit of time left before we have to return home.You could spend a full there visiting different exhibits.This time, we concentrated on 3 : the jewels section of the mineral exhibit was beautiful, I...

The museum was larger than expected and they have different sections both from a nature and historic perspective. The architecture both new and older is very nice. Take the free walking tours (40mins) it gives you a quick taste of the different areas in the museum.It's a must see attraction in Toronto . I would definitely come back to...
Excellent museum with lots of things to see. For teenagers to say it was cool, you know it's worth it. Enjoyed it very much and glad that we went to see it.

My boyfriend and I visited here on a recent trip to Canada. The architecture was amazing and the museum had plenty to offer. However, I would rather there was a few more sections on Canada as there was a lot on Europe and Asia.

My boyfriend and I only when to see the architecture done by Daniel Libenskin. I'm not sure if I spelt that right. Anyways the architecture is great and we sneaked into the gift which also had lovely things anyone who enjoyed the museum. It is very close to the train station.
The architecture alone is interesting. My favorite is Chicago's Museum of Natural History. Whereas this museum doesn't quite have the same scope, I consider it very good and worth the visit.

Yesterday we all agreed we'd go to the museum so we did,and when we got there there was a massive hadrosaur (a dinosaur) in the main hall + there was another hall just for China and a big room full of animals and me and my sister went in a cool bubble thing and saw lots of cool animals.My...

No crew. Just come to visit!PS: the Million 100kg pure gold coin is here! Yeah, in 2007 it became the largest gold coin with 99999mark.????????????????????????????????????????????????????????Royal???PS????YouTube??????????100kg?99999?????????????????????????????????

awesome dinosaur exhibit! great for kids, teens and adults! theres something for everyone here. its so big, we need to do it again just to see all of it. the staff are wonderful and knowledgable. highly recommend for kids :)

The ROM is always amazing. There are discounts for students so make sure you use it if you are one. Definitely need a full day to see everything but always recommend to never skip the dino's. Amazing stuff.
Have never been to such a beautiful and well maintained museum... Memorable experience...It is very big...needs some 4-5 Hours for complete Visit...

This was the perfect way to spend a rainy afternoon . The dinosaur exhibit and fun T-Rex photo booth were great. The various floors were accessible. Elevators are available. The boutique offers many art and crafts to remember the exhibits

This museum has excellent, high-quality exhibits that are very informative and enticing for all ages and interests. The only negative thing I can say is that unfortunately admission costs more if you want to have access to any special exhibits they are currently hosting - even for students and children.

Impressive collections along galleries. Rushing there in 2 or 3 hrs is not ideal. Give yourself the whole day to visit it and really enjoy it and overall learn. Some of the galleries require a very patient study due to the overwhelming quantity of history or information.

They have a fantastic dinosaur exhibit, although i was a bit disappointed that some were copies. I love the story of how they found the big dinosaur in the front lobby. This is a great museum for kids too.
I adore ROM and go back often. Lots to see. I really enjoyed the mineral exhibit. the Bat cave and Egyptian exhibits have been updated and are worth seeing again.

There is so much to see here. A great variety of exhibits that will be of interest to those of all ages. Many varied topics are covered and are presented well. It really is a world class museum and should be visited by anyone coming to Toronto.

Very interesting place to visit. We were there during the march break , lots of kids running around. I will definetely go back on a future trip to Toronto. Dinausors, rock display, well everything was well presented.
Great museum to visit in central Toronto. Lots of well presented displays and if you avoid going on weekends lovely and quiet most days.

Our family is a member now for a number of years, we love to check out the exhibits and the store on week-ends. My daughter was so excited to view Ancient Egypt section when she had it as part of the school program. Do try their restaurant. I took there a group of tourists from Russia, they loved it.

Well laid out....world class museum. Permanent collections are diverse and include indigenous peoples exhibit - that was tastefully done....while highlighting many regions of the world. At the time also housed the winners of a world photographic competition. Could have spent another day at the museum, it was that inclusive and world class.

It is not an overly sophisticated museum compare to say the British museum but I find it is a great family museum. There is always something fun and interesting for the kids. The featured exhibitions are well selected. We did the Pompeii and the national geographic photography exhibits in 2015 / 2016, and my children love it and the adults...

We have visited the ROM many times over the years and enjoyed our visits. They have exhibits of all types to satisfy varying curiosities. Observing the whole museum would certainly take a full day, or more. We tend to focus on the kids' favourite spots.Rich in history. It's a lovely place to visit.

It was definitly cool taking my 6 year old daughter here at 42 i hadn't been here since i was 7 or 8 i think i still prefer the old front as to the new stucture, it is a museum after all not a biosphere. Enjoy!

Visited the ROM a few weeks ago with my 4 yr old grandson and daughter . I hadn't been to the ROM in probably 20 years and I wish I hadn't waited so long . I think I had more fun than the little one . The exhibits were great and the staff quite pleasant and knowledgeable. I certainly won't...

While this was a generally good experience for all four of us in our group (two 50+ and two 20 year olds), I think all of us expected more from this museum. It is easy to navigate through the exhibits, but it really did not have the kind of "gems" I would have expected in a museum found in a...

I visited specifically for the"Douglas Coupland: everywhere is anywhere is anything is everything" show, which was great. While there I also visited some of the permanent exhibits. There really is something for everyone there. Art lovers, archaeology buffs, history lovers, and of course, dinosaurs and mummies!Oh, and the building is fantastic.

The ROM is a solid museum with interesting aspects to it. Over the years, it has gotten more sophisticated, however it really feels very 'Toronto'... curation is improving and I'm hopeful one day it will be a world-class museum, but there's quite a way to go yet. Plus, the cost to enter is prohibitive...

Fridays: Open until 8:30 PM with discount admission after 4:30 PM.That when we go! Save a lot of cash! Love seeing the mummy's and the gem vaulted room! It's a lovely building architecturally as well. Have visited the ROM for over 50 years. Glad Toronto hasn't let it slide. Great temporary exhibitions pass through as well. Check out lectures...
We visited during the March Break so it was very busy and very crowded. There were many interesting displays and a lot of activities planned for all the children on break.

I love visiting the ROM!!!! Went to see the Pompeii exhibit with my parents and we ended up getting tickets for the rest of the museum as well!! The museum staff was very helpful as my dad needed a wheelchair, they are free at the front door. Staff was helpful calling the wheelchair lifts. Some exhibits are rather dull, such...

Went to see the Pompeii exhibit a few months ago. I have not been to the ROM for several years before this last visit. Was impressed by the exhibit! Lots to see and we learned a lot. Tons more to do at the museum, we did not have time to do everything.

Worth visiting with children. So many things to see, especially the national geographic photo exhibit, absolutely phenomenal.Always something new to see every time I go, although I only visit every few years.
A visit to the ROM with young family is a must see, a great experience for all ages though! Totem Poles in the centre are huge!

There isn't much to say about the ROM other than WOW! Lots of interesting stuff to see and explore, kids will be happy as well, we've been there few times :-) Make sure you allocate at least few hours for this visit and be prepared to go over there twice or three times as well :-) Highly recommend to everybody,...

Loved the Wildlife Photographer of the Year exhibit, such incredible photos.In general, the ROM is quite large, and has so many different exhibits, you'll be able to find something that interests you. They've got interactive exhibits as well as displays. And it's great that they have rotating exhibits as well as the permanent collections.I've really enjoyed the Friday...

All the exhibits are well done and the information they provide is well researched and usually very interesting.This museum is world class and well worth a visit.This is a great place to go with your older kids.

It was the march break and was really full, so it was not be a fair to judge what it would be like on a regular day.Good balance of displays, talks and interactive opportunities. Kids liked it , but where a little overwhelmed.

My son is very much into dinosaurs, so he enjoyed that exhibit the most. My daughter enjoyed the dress up spot as part of their March Break activities. There is so much more to see, that as adults we would've enjoyed. We will visit again when the kids are older, and can read some of the vast amount of information...
whatever your interest, you can find something here to fascinate! from indigenous art to dinosaur bones to model ships it has it all. great for singles, families, adults, anyone!

Since the remodelling the museum has improved its looks and the environment is brighter and seems bigger. The dinosaur exhibit is a million times better now and the whole experience is enjoyable. Makes going there at least three times a year or more a joy.
Always fun to see dinosaurs. The grandchildren told me all about the different eras. Then on to the Bat Cave, but not the one with BatMan but reproduction of real cave in Jamaica

Came here with my boyfriend who is a huge history nut and he loved it! I also enjoyed the rock/jewel exhibits. There are exhibits on different parts of the world as well as different eras. One of my favourite parts was the bat cave! It's so much fun to walk through!We spent around 2.5-3 hours walking around seeing everything,...

The Rom is always interesting. Lots to see and usually there are special exhibits going on like the Pompeii one we saw recently. Very well done, try to go during the week if you want the time to see things at your pace. The restaurant in the basement has good food but its not cheap

I have been dying to go back since I was a kid and a great chance for a quick visit on a Saturday afternoon last month. Parking was a surprisingly easy around the corner and a quick walk to get in. My old favourites were all there like the Egypt hall of mummies and the dinosaurs, etc. The crowds were...
great scenic walks. alot of trails. beautiful foliage and flowers. friendly zoo for kids. great for any age
We visited the museum as a family. It was interesting and fun. Nice activities for children -- young and old.

We thougt we would spend 2 hrs here. Ended up being 5+ but still hadnt seen it all. Excellently curated and all the info added to the experience.. best choice and should be the one thing you do in toronto if you have time for only one.
Above average collection and decent venue size, but the layout is mind-boggling! The interior design is definitely more style than function, so it looks pretty good but that's it.

Visited with my friend who is a museum nut and this certainly didn't disappoint.The displays are wide and varied and well spaced out. There were a few items out on loan from their displays which was a little disappointing but didn't detract too much from the overall impression of the displays.We were disappointed that after paying the $17...

One of my favourite museums. Imaginative, comprehensive, original, thought provoking and unusual. love the juxtaposition between the old and the new architecture. Interesting use of exhibit space in the new cube section. loved the Dino, bat cave and Egyptian displays. Take your time and go off peak hours to avoid the crowds.
Great museum close to the university. Has permanent exhibits on different civilizations, dinosaurs, animals, minerals and history of Canada itself. Plan at least three hours.

Although the ROM was good, we did not find it great. Most of the rooms were just too old for younger kids. The dinosaur areas were well done but the infamous bat cave was just ok. There was a lot of space with stuff in glass cases with signs to read.
Dinosaurs, oh yes, a full T-Rex! A must go if you are visiting Toronto, a musuem where the crew is there to help and answer your question like a hired guide.

The museum is a fantastic way to spend a day. Fascinating and educational, it is ideal for anyone of any age. Very well laid out, with world class exhibits throughout, I particularly adore the Nature exhibit.A must for locals and visitors to Toronto.

We took 4 teenagers for the day and they loved it, as did we, the adults. I wouldn't think young children would find most areas interesting.There is a lot of hands on exhibits.We ran out of time, and didn't end up seeing everything.The price is very reasonable.There is a lot of walking and standing.

We only had two hours to look around and boy it is huge! I would say that was enough for me, but my husband likes to look at things for ages so he could have done with another hour. Very good museum and worthwhile going to be honest. We used our city pass, which gave us excellent value!

Large museum downtown, they have free admission Tuesdays for Canadian college/uni students. Special exhibits year-round, I personally really like the dinosaurs. They've done ancient China and Egypt a few times as well.
This is the biggest museum in Canada and I think it is also the biggest in North America.It feels like every floor of this world class museum has something to offer.

Really enjoyed the museum and it's a place you can revisit few times solely because of the temporary collections.Leave 3ish hours for it so you don't have to rush as the museum is quite large and you don't want to miss anything.Like everywhere else in Toronto, parking around is horrible or expensive. Best to come by subway.
We spent a few hours here. So much to see and all the different cultures and eras. The favourite for us was the minerals and rocks that came from various areas in the country. So cool.

The Royal Ontario Musuem in Toronto is having a great collection of Crystals and minerals - I thing the Best in the World - Great for any Geologist. The Royal Ontario Museum was well worth the visit.
