This museum, though very busy, was well worth the time effort and see. We had allowed ourselves 2 hours to go through. We only got through half of it. A definite place to return to see the rest the next time we are in Toronto. We loved the variety of different displays -especially the antiques

I have been frequenting the ROM for nearly 60 years and have never regretted moment there. It's both peaceful and enlightening, particularly when I have grandchildren with me. Expect run-of-the-mill exhibits in small numbers but rotating exhibits that will enlighten as well as provoke thought.

A superb museum with extensive and varied collections. You could easily spend a full day inside. Exhibits are well explained (lots of labels, notes, interpretive information). Good for kids and adults alike.

Had an appointment early in Toronto on a Sunday and was not sure how to spend the day. The obvious choice was the ROM. Great museum for a days visit. A wide variety of exhibits to see. Our daughter loved the Butterfly hunt that was available for young school age children. This Museum is beautiful and really well designed. It isn't huge but it does host interesting and very varied collections.

As Canada goes this is the best (and biggest) I've been to. While there are better (New York comes to mind) globally, this is absolutely worth a visit. I could get lost in all the history and story at the ROM and not come out for days! Absolutely love the exhibits on the different countries and the precious stones exhibit.

The ROM has a varied and fantastic collection of different exhibits from natural history to traveling exhibits. It's reasonable priced and you can easily spend 2 hours just wandering around. My wife, daughter and myself just spent 5 hours wandering around the ROM and had a blast. I love museums so this was a great for me to visit. They have a lot of exhibitions. The day I went there was a special event going on, so I got to see some arabic dancing and live music, it was cool

This is, overall, a very good natural history museum with a wide variety of exhibits that will easily keep you occupied for most of a day. There is so much to take in at the ROM you would need a week to say you saw it all. We were fortunate to come upon a guide who was offering a complimentary 45 minute tour. What we learned at the exhibits she took us made us aware of how much history is contained in this building. Much, much...

On this trip, we had limited to time so we concentrated on the Special Exhibit of wildlife photography. It was out standing. It is a must see for those that like the out doors and those that like photography. Be warned, the shots will make you envious.

Spent the day here one cold Sunday. Cost $17 for each of us to get in. $2.50 for each of our jackets at the coat check. The exhibits tend to be dull and un-interesting. In general it is a highly un-interactive experience. As well this museum is a maze... It has no feeling of fluidity throughout, and is incredibly easy to get lost in.

You can spend all week in this museum or a few hours. It has something for everyone and is full of interesting stories from across the globe. I noticed it had many areas set up for children. Went after hours during Christmas and paid only $10. Dinosaurs were truly amazing but seeing the suits of armour up close was the highlight. A historic must see venue when visiting the city
This gallery has something for everone. The collections and special exhibits are visually and mentally inspiring. You can't go wrong paying a visit here.

Fave spot in the area. If you are a world culture and decorative art fan like me, def leave enough time for Fl 3. This is a good place to go with your family to learn, see and experience new things. Time well spent, while learning and having quality time with family.
That's the perfect place to spend a couple of hours or more with kids when outside is cold or gloomy. Get the family membership: it is worthy!

The ROM is a wonderful museum to visit at any time but for a great couples night out check out their Friday Night Live events. Numerous food vendors and bars are scattered throughout the museum. I couldn't believe it took me this long to actually visit the ROM. I am glad I visited once and would recommend if you're in the city and want an activity for a few hours with your family. Definitely go on the free tour it is so informative ang shows you where everything is.is warm in there so don't need a coat. This is a whole day thing to get round.
We had a great time at the ROM. If you are a family of 4 or more, get the annual membership - it saved us money over the one day trip and allows us to return later in the year.
Very nice musuem is for all the family so kids and adult can spend a very good time there very interesting place for everybody

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM), along with the Art Gallery of Ontario, is a flagship component of Toronto's public cultural scene. Conveniently located at the intersection of Bloor Street and Queen's Park, it is an iconic part of downtown Toronto. A huge and lovely collection, from Chinese to Canadians, From humans to animals and nature, For art lovers and nature lovers;Doesn't matter what you like. This museum is big enough to absolutely have tou satisfied.Recommendation: Put one full day for that.
This museum offers a variety of exhibits which is great. It's affordable and reminded me of a smaller version of the Natural history museum in NYC. Fun visit

My husband and I have recently taken out a family membership at the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum) in Toronto. We intend to visit at least once a month. The museum is one-of-a-kind. A recommended trip to distant places, a time to learn about the world and its secrets. Takes more than one visit to explore it seriously.

I really loved the museum. Too bad it closes so early! I was visiting a company and could only go after leaving the office. I love the museum and so does my daughter. She grew up visiting the museum since she was a baby. She is now 21 years old and still loves the museum. I always have a membership tothe museum. I did not buy one yet this year.You can visit the museum for free after 4p.m. on Fridays. There is...
My kids always love the dinosaurs and mummies. As we've been there quite a few times, they have come to appreciate some of the other artifacts, especially the Chinese section.

It's been several years since I visited the ROM. There is always something new to see so I will not go through the exhibits except to say there is always something worth seeing. Enjoyed an afternoon here a couple weekends ago. Used the city pass, which is a good investment if going to all the attractions.Have been here almost once a year and is still enjoyable. Spent a few hrs here w/ my wife - lots of interesting things to see, from natural history to some ancient history pieces it was a nice spread and plenty to see.

Truly there is something for everyone at the ROM. Every floor of this world class museum has something to offer. Great exhibits. Easy to get to. Friendly and helpful staff. Lots of stuff to see and great to bring children to.

An relatively extensive museum filled with natural and ancient history. Not the the most logically ordered museum but certainly plenty to look at. I absolutely love the ROM - everything I remember to be exciting and mesmerizing when I visited as a child still stands true today. I hadn't been in the ROM since I was a child and it was every bit as much fun to go back as an adult. So much to see, great displays and so much variety.

We are members of the museum and go regularly. Our grandchildren, 6 and 9, have been going with us for a few years now, and they love it there. We get great value for our membership and recommend it for anyone with kids - they have awesome programming for children.
wonderful museum with everything you can ask for, like paintings,statues, ceramics, Aegyptian art, art from alla over the world in general, a must see!

I love going to the ROM, it never disappoints! The collection is very diverse. Has easy access by public transportation and tickets has reasonable prices. A must-go activity in the city.
This is a great place to visit with entire sections to offer for people of a variety of tastes. Plan for an entire day, it's so big
Such a cool environment. A lot of fun things to do. Very interactive and interesting for people with a variety of taste.

Great for students, history lovers, science nerds and children alike, the ROM is an excellent and engaging experience that truly enlightens your mind. Yes it is no Smithsonian, but it's getting close! The exhibits are always great, and again, there is something for everyone!

I went when the Pompeii special exhibition was on, which was totally worth the extra cost on top of the admission price. The museum has other exhibits of which I managed only to see a few (First Nations, Canada, endangered animals, etc). Museum lovers could easily spend the whole day (or two) here!
Free for students on Tuesdays! A nice place to hangout if your friends want something cultural instead of catching some movies

Love going here and checking out all the cool things. I go with friends every now and then and we make a day of it by going for coffee in the neighbourhood and then browsing the museum for a few hours before going for dinner.
Small yet large enough to hold attention and offer a variety of art, European, Indigenous and Asian. Also special shows.

This is an absolute must see if you're in Toronto!!! We went to Toronto for the day, our first stop was at ROM, my wife has always wanted to go there.It was very interesting and so much to see. We gave ourselves three hours. With a specific area for kids, a great aquarium and a bat cave this is a perfect place to while away a morning with your little one.

Excellent display- so glad to have got to the display. Went on Boxing Day since there was only a few days for the exhibition. Even though there were a lot of people due to it being a Boxing Day & a Saturday-never feltreally crowded!
This is certainly one of Ontario's best museums; the diversity of the exhibits within is sure to please visitors of all interests. A good idea to save this visit for a rainy/cold day.
After visiting the many museums of Chicago, this place was not nearly as impressive. We didn't do the special exhibit at the time though.

This is Canada's premier general-interest museum, in my opinion. I try to see a bit of it every time I visit Toronto. It would take days to see it thoroughly. Everyone should visit tones of cool exhibits and super awesome atmosphere.Make sure you give yourself time take awhile to get through.

I really enjoyed the museum, there were some really fascinating exhibits on while we were there. It was easy to access by public transportation in Toronto and there is lots to see in the same area so might as well make a day of it!

I was impressed with this museum when I first went, but I have been to other museums that are far superior. I an not impressed by the lack of parental supervision, children are allowed to run amuck and are extremely rude. Overall I would not return.

Love the architecture. The museum itself doesn't change very often. But it is brilliant. Especially for a wander on a rainy day.Had many school trips here as a kid.

The ROM has far more interactive areas than we had expected. The museum is huge! My son loves history so he enjoyed it. We spent about three hours here before we gave in to go have lunch, but he said he would definitely go back.

An amazing range of collections covering science, history & art. First Peoples exhibits well worth studying. You could spend days here & never be bored.
very very cool attraction for kids and adults alike. We spent a morning, you could be there all day. We paid extra for the Pompei exhibit, was worth it

I bought a membership last year after first moving to Toronto and it is hands down the best thing I have ever purchased. My son (now 5) loves it here. I go every year in July. Though most of the museum stays the same, I always enjoy seeing the exhibit that they bring in every year.
Not the same standard as the smithsonian or londons museum's but if you are in toronto it is a great attraction to pass the afternoon, couples, singles or families. August 2014
The Pompeii exhibition was brilliant. I learned lots of facts I hadn't known before. The exhibits really brought to life what must have happened.
Something for everyone! Lots to see and do here. Make sure you have a good five hours and comfortable shoes!

Truly a World Class museum in the heart of Toronto. Really enjoyed all of the available exhibits. Helpful staff and right on the subway line

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) is a great museum that offers a ton of exhibits and interactive activities that both adults and kids can enjoy. You can learn so may staff for dinosaurs. Although is expensinve but i sugest you go and see the museum. I went there in 2014

This is a solid choice to visit with the family - nice variety of collections to visit so there is something for al tastes - suggest go i the morning then lunch in Yorkville and stroll around Bloor/Yorkville for the afternoon

The architecture is phenomenal. Inside the exhibits are well laid out with tremendous variety. Many sections perfect for kids yet others for more serious viewing. Excellent restaurant in the top floor. Good for 4 or more hours. Recommended.
The ROM never dissapoints. The ever changing displays are offered for all ages and interests. A great place to spend your day!

We go a few times a year. It is my site of choice on PA school days. There are so many rooms in the 'regular' collection that you can spend a couple of hours in just one area. The ROM is a great place to take the family and spend the whole day discovering the world and its history...great way to gain knowledge and experience.I will keep going back each time new displays are up....Highly recommended.
It is more a natural history museum for me. I am more a fan of arts. I would recommend for people who enjoy the natural development of the civilization

ROM is a fantastic museum with multiple galleries and collections (some of which are rare) covering areas of art, natural science, mammals, plants, birds, marine life, archaeology, biodiversity and a lot more. Had a lovely tour...the exhibits are amazing and you can cover it in about an hour....kids would love it as well a adults....worth a visit!

I went to ROM at night time with couple of friends. They had food and wine serving. Music playing almost like a club environment. You would go with your wine and walk around enjoy the art. make sure you visit this museum in toronto. the exhibits are fantastic and varied. the native american exhibit on now is superb- you could spend the whole day there.remember that friday afternoon the museum admission is half off- great place to go on a cold day

this is a great museum to introduce people that don't want to spend all day seeing things, those with shorter attention spans.it has a variety of things to see, you can do it in about an hour and feel you got your monies worth

During our holiday in Toronto with family, we visited the ROM during the last day of the year 2015. No queues. Great!We travelled by the subway from Union Station (Yellow line) to Museum. The museum was great.In the restaurant we ate rice and chicken.

Nice morning spent here. This is included in the city pass so you can skip the queues if there are any. It's quite good for children as there are interactive things to get involved with. This museum has different sorts of themed expositions from history to the biology. Great museum with an excellent geology exhibit which is well organised. Other collections of the First Nation people's also very good. Cafe reasonably priced and offers good choice.

The family and I throughly enjoyed the ROM! You can spend hours exploring the various levels. We even dined in the fine dining on the top level instead of trying the very busy cafeteria. Very family friendly place. Kids want to go back!

I just love this place. Many exhibits and very nicely presented with many fascinating items. This is located in nice neighborhood and I have had good luck finding street parking in the surrounding neighborhoods. Definitely recommend you visit if you are a natural history buff.

Fascinating exhibition and very friendly and helpful staff. The ROM is always an enjoyable place to spend a day. Whether with kids or adults, there is always something of interest. I'd recommend it to anyone.

We've had memberships for more then 10 years. We never get bored of the mineral section or the room exhibits on the third floor.

A great museum with alternating exhibits and a wide variety of scultpture, painting and artifacts. Something for each of the history lovers in us. Amazing, highly recommend giving yourself the better part of 4 hours there as there is so much to look at and absorb.

Really loved our trip to the ROM. There's a lot of stuff you can see in other large museums, but the First Nations exhibits are really beautiful. The totem poles are amazing! I've been several times. Always worth a visit So much to see and learn The exhibits are well done and very educational.

We did a family trip to Toronto during the Christmas Holidays. There were a lot of visitors, however we went to the museum a few minutes after the 10:00 opening. Later in the day there was a long queue.

The ROM is a fantastic space and our visit to see the Pompeii exhibit once again confirmed that the ROM is excellent at bringing key attractions to the city. What a way to spend hours looking at history around and world and from different periods. An absolute treasure and a must visit.

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM for short) was nothing short of amazing. You're able to see history from all around the world, and the building itself is quite a masterpiece, combining a 100+ year old building with the "crystal" sticking out of it.

The stuff there was very good - but there wasn't a lot of it, and some of it was very general, and not specific to Pompei. In the main building, it was not obvious to us what was where, and where you could go that was included in the General Admission. We also viewed the mineral exhibit, which had some...

This is one of the best places to take both kids and adults to for a full day of entertainment and education. The Pompeii exhibit was eye-opening, fun and educational with a good mix of somber views and enlightenment. The journey through the rooms was well thought out and enjoyable for all of us (9-year old and two adults). The...

The Pompeii exhibit was wonderful. The only complaint is that the lighting should be brighter to see details more clearly. Visited the animal photography exhibit which was amazing. Some photos were real eye openers especially when bringing awareness to how animals are treated around the world. We also made sure to visit the dinosaur exhibit. That's a must when at...
Reserve a day to explore all the exhibits in this museum. The Friday night ROM events are a unique and fun way to enjoy the museum.

I have been to the ROM several times, but my trip to the ROM in july for the Pompeii exhibit was the best. Incredible exhibit. My son (9) loved it as well. So much to explore, cannot be seen in a single visit. The food here is decent with some healthy options being served cafeteria style. The gift shop is...
I was most impressed with the collections at the ROM. What was interesting is the use of totem poles to identify each level.

Great place. Had a Pompeii exhibition on which was nice to see. Other exhibits were good. Certainly a place to visit time and time again. Only thing was when we were there the museum was open to 8 but the cafe closed around 430

I recently attendend the ROM and even though I don't really find museums enjoying or interesting at all, this museum caught my eye. As you first approach and enter the building the architecture I admit is outstanding the glass walls reflect the city around you and the stonework around the building is a one of a kind. There are many...

The museum was huge, and had options for adults and kids. There was even a separate gift shop for kids, with educational toys. I loved the exibits on the wars, on the egyptian, greek and cyprian cultures. The part on Natural History was also amazing. Im going there again!

We waited nearly an hour to get in and it was really cold. We realized while we were waiting that we could have purchased tickets online from Costco and it would have saved us $40.00. We paid extra to see the Pompeii exhibit, which I feel was not worth paying so much more for it. I'm not sure I would...

This museum is amongst the best in Canada, and is well worth a rain day visit while in Toronto. It contains galleries from all over the world. The dinosaur gallery contains many skeletons, and the Egyptian gallery has an actual mummy.

Definitely a museum worth several visits, no way you can see it all in a single visit.There is something for every age group and interests. Lots of interactive displays.They are always bringing in new displays/shows as well as upgrading existing.

Every time we go, I find that my kids are understanding more and more. This time, my daughter wanted to see the Pompeii exhibit as she read about it at school. The exhibit like all their exhibits is well laid out. Great finds from underneath this buried city. Each item has a great explanation that gives you insight into this...

I really enjoyed this museum. There's so much to look at: natural history, dinosaurs fossils, ancient artifacts, paintings, and cultures from Greece, Egypt, China, and medieval Europe. ¡Viva México! was my personal favorite exhibit. This is definitely a must-visit museum.

The permanent collection of art and artifacts at the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) would be enough to rate the museum as one of the best on the American continent. Add the circulating exhibits and you now have a "world class" museum (equal to some of the best museums in the world). The works are well presented and well lit. If...
This is a very good museum, although it is quite large and requires a lot of walking to visit it all. Allow plenty of time, unless you select a few exhibits to visit in depth.
Went to visit the ROM when on a trip to Toronto was very interesting especially as there was a an exhibition from Pompoii there which was fab

Prices very reasonable. Allow a full day for this especially if they have a special collection on show. We saw the Pompeii display and best photographs of 2015 (special exhibitions) as well as normal museum. All were good and museum map easy to follow. A lot to see and scattered seating if you need a rest. Cafe downstairs reasonably priced...

This place is AMAZING!! I would go here everyday if I could! Everything was just fantastic and awesome! I wish I could be more descriptive but I'm just speechless about the place! You just have to go and experience this place for yourself! Worth it! I promise!

Took the kids to explore the ROM and the experience is a life time. We can out and the kids cannot stop talking about what they saw. I had a great time learning the history and how the ancient people live, from the potteries, clothing,armoury, and the lifestyle. Very interesting visit.
learn a lot, rain or shine - been going there since i was a youth - so much to see and learn - please go at least 5 times to learn - the gift that keeps on giving !

This was a wonderful experience for all ages. Be careful with parking. We parked on the road and paid but because the sign was bent we got a ticket. The ROM itself is enriching for everyone. So much to see, explore and learn in an exciting way. Excellent attraction. Definitely need to go here.

This museum, to totally appreciate all it has to offer with permanent exhibits and travelling ones, needs 2 full days.I have been 3 times now and it is amazing how much is inside this place. Recently visited the nat geo wildlife photography exhibit and it was splendid. Don't miss this one.

We arrived at opening time 10:30 and there was a short queue on this end of November date. The Pompeii exhibit is great and love how the story is told, builds up from the history of how the Romans lived before the eruption to the climax of the body casts. This exhibit worth a least 1 1/2 hrs. We tried...
Layout was very confusing but over all okay I guess it's a museum so it's not going to be overly intersting but it was an over all okay time wouldn't go back though a one time thing

The largest museum in Canada, the ROM has tons of attractions for all ages. Natural history, culture, art and much more. You can spend a day there. If you like museum this is the one. They provide free tours for the visitors.

The dinosaurs are great! Probably the largest collection around the world. However, other exhibits seem to lack of the 'wow' factor when compared to the dinosaurs. Quite a high admission fee as well if you buy tickets for Pompeii as well. The Pompeii exhibition is informative but is certainly not worth it. I can get the same information on internet.
One of, if not the best encyclopedic collection in Canada. This is Toronto's MET so come here if you love museums and have a full day to spend learning about Canadian and World history!
It's best museum in Toronto. A traveller must see it. Won't be disappointed.Had a wonderful time there.

I went here while they had/have Pompeii. It was terrible seeing all the death and sadness of the volcanic eruption. There is so much history and so many historic objects, and people in this place. The best place to visit is the Egyptian area. The mummy they have on display is so unbelievably realistic, you would think it's fake. There...
The ROM is known for its expensive tickets but it is worth the cost. The exhibits are good without being overly crowded. Dinosaur exhibit is probably my favourite and a must see.
This day excursion will satisfy all ages, couples and families. It is well displayed and presented, and tour guides are knowledgeable and friendly. What an amazing way to spend a rainy day.

Something for everyone. Would have liked to see more in the Canadian section. Nicely laid out. As someone who has some trouble getting around - a few more rest stops strategically placed around would have been beneficial. Will go back.
Check out their theme exhibit, or, you won't be disappointed just to spend a day at the ROM. Don't forget their souvenir store. Kids, wheelchair accessible.

The ROM is huge. You can never see it in one day. The current exhibit of Native American artifacts, and the stories that went along with them, was outstanding. I was able to do the first floor, and started on the second level, but my back, and the swarm of school kids visiting, cut short my planned 2 1/2 stay....

The ROM has the best exhibits. Regularly the have a featured exhibit which is generally only for a specific length of time. It is not far from the AGO, the University of Toronto downtown campus which could all be seen in one day. Well woth an admission fee.

Great place to spend a few hours (I actually recommend multiple visits). I don't think there's a bad exhibit at the ROM. Make a point of swinging by the original entrance area (by the gem gallery) to look at the gorgeous ceiling. I've been here in the past with young kids and they were engaged and interested, although obviously more...

The ROM as it is known in Toronto is one of my favourite places in the city. It is full of fascinating exhibits from Egyptian mummies to gynormous dinosaurs including a cave with simulated flying bats. The collection of rare gems is a must see. There are also visiting collections from all over the world that are exhibited several times...
One of the best museums I've ever seen...very valuable information provided. Amazing dinosaur and pre-historic collections. Needs almost full day to thouroughly enjoy it.
This is a must see visit - and if you go you can approach two ways - an in depth visit to a particular area of interest or a broad walk through. Either way you can spend hours and hours here.
Best day to spend time with kids,lots for them to see and do they always enjoy seeing dinosaur's and mummy's.
There is so much to see at the ROM that one day wont cover it. We saw the Pompeii exhibit and that was very interesting. The Dinosaurs are always a must-see
The outer building gives you a good picture of what to expect -- it's contemporary merged with traditional. A good museum to visit.

We have a membership and have had for years. This is a fantastic place for summer camps, snowy cold winter days, rainy weekends, sharing with friends and visitors to the city. We really enjoy all the special exhibits too.
The ROM is very unique to experience!Architecture is an absolutely must to experience.Incrdible selection on display,Dinosaurs to Diamonds!!!

I love the ROM & have frequently visited ever since receiving an Annual Membership as a present! The exhibits do change, so there is always something to see. Definitely recommend as a date activity - we had so much fun & there is something so romantic about this museum.

My grand son (age 12) and I visited the Pompei exhibit. He was anxious to go as he had seen a video on the subject. I was eagerly anticipating the show as well from articles with pictures I seen years ago. I was not disappointed. It is incredible that this ancient city buried in volcanic ash can yield so many...
beautiful place .. we've spent around 5 hours there and even we could not finish the tour .. nice gift shop at the end .. and they had a nice simulation for Pompaii

Loved the museum. Displays were nice, lighting could be better in the Egypt display. Hard to tell what is real and what is reproduction. Make sure to take all day to visit it. Lots to view and learn about.
I had the opportunity to visit Pompeii a few months ago. The exhibition was really well staged and it did remind me of the visit we made there with my husband.
But the displays are beautiful and the architecture fascinating too. Spend all day here. There is a lot of variety and is definitely a big city museum, well worth the visit.
Both my wife and I have an interest in paleontology and the evolution of life generally. In that regard, the collection at ROM is not to be missed.

Went for the Pompeii exhibit, had never been before. It is amazing how large and great this museum is. The architecture of the building (old and new), the artifacts, the exhibits, the volunteers, the cafe, it was all great! So disappointed we didn't plan more time!We decided to take in the nature photography one as well - wow! Definitely...

Simply amazing. I went to the ROM with the specific purpose of seeing the Photo exhibit and ending up taking in Pompeii at the same time. I went on a Tuesday and it was not crowded. The Photo exhibit was amazing...the talent of these photographers was overwhelming...I wanted to go through it again and again. I will probably go back...

Make sure that you visit this fantastic collection of genuine objects from Pompeii before the exhibition closes.The tastefully displayed artifacts are complemented by an authentic audio and video that will make you experience the eruption of the Vesuvio in person.The early closing hours, 5:30 p.m.,shouldn't make you run towards the volcano, as two hours are sufficient to...

The Royal Ontario Museum is home to a large collection of Canadian and international artifacts and the ones on display add considerably to the value of any visit. A trip through the museum literally takes one around the world and across time.I recently visited the Pompeii exhibition and it enabled the members of my group to visualize what happened...
We had a great time there. There was a couple of interactive experience for the kids...would have been nice to be able to go through and read everything, but kids don't help with that.

We went to see the Pompei exhibit and were impressed with the show. It is very comprehensive and it took over an hour to view the one exhibit. If you are in Toronto this exhibit is really worth a visit.
Buy the city pass and check out this amazing museum on the cheap. The kids went nuts over the dinosaur bones. Close to the subway so just take public transportation.
This is a significant museum with a diverse collection. There is something here to keep members of the family of all ages engaged. We found the Gallery of China to be especially impressive.

I always enjoy visiting and each time I spend a little time in other sections. Pompeii was interesting and full of lots of information. The Wildlife Photographer was good and I always wonder why there are not a lot of North American photographers showing their pictures. I know there are many Canadian ones and it dumbfound me that I did...

This is a lovely museum and a nice way to spend an afternoon but don't expect anything mind-blowing. Once you've seen one Royal *insert province here* Museum, you've pretty much seen them all. The special exhibits are also generally not worth the extra cost, so look at separate reviews for them before deciding to go.
The various exhibits boggle the imagination and is a showcase into both history and the evolution of the inhabitants of earth. Wondrous!

I always like to try and head to the museum that covers the history and development of the city and area I am visiting. The ROM fulfilled this role perfectly. Some fascinating exhibits about the local tribes and colonisation of Ontario. So much so that it has encouraged me to return to Toronto.

We went to one of ROM's Friday night events. 15$ /person to get in. You need to buy tickets for drinks and food, 6$/drink ( max 4/person) & 6$/food item. drink options were limited but drinks were easy the get. Seemed like there was lots for everyone, bust a move next to the dino bones, sit and enjoy some food...

Toronto is lucky to have such a terrific museum of world culture and natural history. The current Pompeii exhibit is well worth seeing. Suggestion: focus on the items, which are remarkable/beautiful/haunting, and don't be distracted by the multi-media razzle-dazzle.
we came to see the annual wildlife photography exhibit which we usually catch in London. It was great!

My wife and I had toured the pompeii ruins in Italy a few years back and were amazed at the depiction of lifestyle that the people enjoyed at the time of the volcanic eruption. To think that the whole city was somewhat preserved to allow us to visit thousands of years after. When we did our tour, the guide had...

for $17 general admission for an adult, I was hoping for more. I came here to see the dinos. The exhibits consisted entirely of mounted casts of fossils. No lifelike models. The Ottawa Natural History Museum and the Royal Tyrell Museum in Drumheller are much much better.

I have not been to the ROM for several years. While visiting TO, we were excited to visit. The thing I really like about the ROM is the breadth of topics, there is something for everyone. The Pompeii exhibit was very interesting. The dinosaur exhibit is always great. We took a mid day break in the cafeteria which has a...

This is one of the most interesting museums I have ever been to. It has pretty much everything: dinosaur fossils, Egyptian mummies, Greek statues, sculptures, paintings, Chinese artifacts, totem poles, meteorites, stuffed animals and many more! I strongly recommend the tour of the museum highlights. It is short, informative, and will help you appreciate some things that otherwise you may...

I didn't like so much this museum, it just didn't stand out on their collection, i became very bored. The day i arrived they closed very early and the exhibition of Pompeii i wanted to see was already closed.
A lot of artifacts from Pompeii but British Museum did it better. Nothing as good, though, as seeing Pompeii itself.
We purchased the City Pass booklet, it is well worth the investment. We were able to get in without waiting for the ticket lines, we had a great time there is a lot to see and a nice store.

The ROM has wonderful special exhibits like the Wildlife Photography one. Fabulous back lit photos that include some from young people too. Just remember to ask directions as the building is confusing to get around. There are lots of people to ask like Security people who are happy to direct you. Use the map provided at the front desk to...

Dinosaurs are a must to see!There are lots of other items which were collected by wealthy folks time ago and then donated to the museum, so it is a mix of fascinating genuine artifacts and collectors "treasures".Bring a lot of time - or come again!
From mummies to dinosaurs to diamonds to totem-poles, this place has a bit of everything. For the best experience...skip it when you see school buses lined up outside. Your nerves will thank me.

I was invited to a preview with canapés, drinks and speeches. It reminded me good speeches are short and interesting.The exhibition was spectacular. There was a separate section for early-teenage photographers. They were just as good. This is a very much worthwhile event at the ROM. Do not let the boring old architecture and frightening clash with the new...

Conveniently located close to the subway. A bit pricey but worth it. The dinosaur exhibits were impressive. The huge Totem Pole needs a lot of time to explore. I was amazed at its height, about three stories high.

My husband and I visited the museum to see the Pompeii Exhibit. It did not disappoint. Excellent exhibit. The ROM had much more to offer. We hadn't been here in awhile. The displays and exhibits are amazing, particularly the Dinosaurs and Mammal sections. We did not have the excuse of " taking the children" - no need - there is...

The renovated ROM is an architectural treasure but a vacant museum Some of the exhibits are 50 years old. It lacks imagination and interaction..Overpriced and under staffed The liine up to get in was 20 minutes. I took my extremely bright 5 yr old. He was bored Enuf said

This is the biggest museum of its kind in Canada. So much under one high roof. It is a science museum, a cultural museum, a natural history museum, and a historical museum of Canada, all rolled into one. You could spend a week here, going slowly and carefully through the collections. We rushed around in four hours, and saw a...

We first went to the museum with a tour group which focused on the First People and a whirlwind tour of some of the highlights. This taste prompted us to return the next day for a more in-depth look and it was well worth our time. I believe we pretty much covered all the galleries. The Gallery of Gems and...

ROM is a place to experience with your family. We went to see the Pompeii exhibition and it was unbelievable! The exhibit was hands on for children, engrossing and educational for the adults. We spent three hours in this portion of the museum alone. We only managed to see two other sections and will need many follow up visits to...
Amazing dinosaurs and a truly impressive building, full of surprises. Certainly worth visiting, particularly on a cold, dank day.
Wow! The amount of artifacts and displays here are out of this world. We unfortunately did not plan accordingly. You definitely need the entire day to get thru everything!!

I frequently visit the museum with my family and look at the newest exhibits with them. For example, the Pompeii exhibit was really well done and interesting. I learned a lot and the interactive portions weren't cheesy but fun.

We visited the ROM to see two exhibitions, both of which I can recommend highly. One is the Pompeii exhibition, the other is the nature photography show. The Pompeii show is very informative, but I thought the nature photography was even better: many absolutely gorgeous images. Make sure you see both exhibitions. If you have time for other ROM holdings,...

The museum is well organized and hourly volunteers organize guided tours for free and make available to visitors all their passion and knowledge about the life, the science and the history in the museum. Children and adults are going to have fun in almost all the sections. Unforgettable
This is for sure on my list of places to visit every time I visit Toronto. I never tire of going there. A fabulous place for people of all ages.

I spent a few days in Toronto lately and decided to see the Pompeii exhibit at the ROM.It was not my first time there. Last year we visited and did the museum highlits live tour. It was great. This time it was wonderful. The guide, David, was a soft spoken, articulate and knowledgeable individual, who made the visit that...

Our main reason for visiting was for the Pompeii exhibit which, as usual, was well done. I really enjoyed how they provided a detailed insight into life in the city and not just the history of the city. Just a few of the sections were on the market, entertainment, sex, cooking, beauty and so on. We also visited the Mexican...

I loved this museum a lot. Could have spent the entire day here. The exhibits were very nicely displayed. The layout of the building was a little confusing but we managed to find our way around. The best thing about this museum is the variety. There is truly something for everyone. My personal favourite is natural history and there was...
It's architecture and its collections are marvelous. I found many things about Middle East and India in this museum.

Though it is officially the top museum of Ontario and allegedly the largest museum in Canada, by far not my favourite. The classical old part of yellow-brown brick building is daringly flanked by the famous architect, Libeskind's crystal design but it has never been completed according to the original plans due to budget constraints so the interior parts of the...

the museum offers a very instructive collection of pieces about aborigenals and first nations, alongside with pre-historic skeletal remains. Altogether is offers a valuable resource to understand the territory and part of the history of this land.

It was $35 per person because we decided to take the pompeii tour and buy souvenir books. The tour guide was friendly and informative and i enjoyed the tour. The ROM itself has 4 levels, gift shop and cafe. My favorite was the dinosaurs! There is a lot of stuff there on each level and information to read for each...

The last time I visit was back in the 80's, if not for visitors, it would be another decade or two. However, one would need a few hours to actually take in all the exhibits. So pack some lunch. This place has a lunch area for visitors who brought their own lunches. Any new exhibit will require extra admission fee....

I had limited time to visit this museum so chose to concentrate on their First Nations collection and am so thrilled I did.The collection was diverse from contemporary living artists to textiles and artefacts of early pre and post European contact First Nations life.It was fascinating to see many beautiful treasures all in one space and I longed...
Great exhibits and you lose yourself in time and pondering the past. Lighting is great and it lets you focus on the exhibits. A little pricy though but if you have never been you should go.
The best part of this museum for me was the mineral and stone area, you get to see lots of minerals and precious stones there, very very nice

The ROM is super! A general ticket costs around $17 and there is lots to see! I loved the dinosaur section the most. It's also got exhibits from all over the world! Make sure you go early coz you will most likely not be done checking out the entire thing. There is so much to see!

The Exhibit is very well laid out. It is designed to appeal to all ages. It is informative, interactive and very interesting. Well worth an investment of a couple of hours of time. It is just a shame that the famous plaster casts are replicas.

The ROM is pretty big, so the three hours I had free to see it during my (first!) trip to TO was not enough the to really take it all in. I skipped the Pompeii exhibit, and focussed on the history exhibits. I'll take in the natural history another time. What can I say, except WOW there Is a lot...

As with many top museums, the ROM offers a variety of exhibits that cater to both history buffs and first timers. Personally I love the dinosaur exhibit. Who doesn't love looking at fossils and giant T-Rex bones?! Kids will love all the interaction available and parents will appreciate their kids being engaged and learning. There are 4 floors of exhibits...
The ROM has a very special event on Fridays. Come explore the amazing expos but do it with a beer in hand and music blasting! It's really fun and worth the long line up.
Loved the dino exhibit. Very educational for the kiddies. We went during March Break. It was a bit crazy there so I would suggest to go during a time when not every kid in Toronto is out of school.

My kids love this museum. There is so much to do and sometimes half a day isnt enough. There is so much to see and learn. We love the natural history exhibits / animals, the bat cave, and the dinosaur fossils collection of course.

I just toured Pompeii last June and seeing the special exhibit at ROM was enough to justify a visit. It was awesome to learn more about what they've uncovered in Pompeii and the amazing history. Then we explored the upper floors spending several more hours. You need a minimum of four hours here if not a whole day to see...

I visited this museum as part of my vacation in the Toronto and Montréal visits, I live in Florida. The museum is very big and has exhibits concerning world history, art, prehistory, biology, and a very large area for almost everything Canadian. If you don't know much about Canada, this would be a great place to learn about the country...

I visited it twice over the course of three days in the neighborhood. There is a LOT to see, too much for even two visits. Pick a couple of things that you are interested in and you will be satisfied. Its world class You won't be disappointed.You will also need a map of the floor plan to find what...

This was my favorite thing to do in Toronto, it was very accessible using the hop on hop off tour bus, the museum was filled with anything you could ever want to see and the dinosaur collection was amazing!

Surprisingly, the Friday Night At the ROM event really impressed me. The music was great, the drink stations frequent, and the food selection delicious. I would definitely recommend this event for couples and by the looks of it, single gents because there seemed to be a ton of ladies. Leave it to the ROM. Haha

I had a sort of rainy afternoon to "kill" in Toronto and the ROM was in walking distance of my hotel. I'm so glad I went. I did the general entry only (I'm going to Italy and may well go to Pompeii proper there, so I opted not to spend the extra money on that exhibit) and had a great...

This is a museum to be enjoyed both by kids and adults alike. With animals, cultural artifacts and works of art, there is always something for everyone.Expect to spend many hours inside, and go to the café if you need to recover your energies to continue the visit.

Every time I visit Toronto, I visit the ROM. The building is beautiful, the exhibits are interesting and presented in an interesting manner. The special exhibits are always amazing, and the scope of the museum is stunning.

I was planning to stay here for most of the day as I heard their was plenty to see. Their was and it was well laid out but I felt due to the size of the actual museum (its huge!) you had to walk quite a bit to get to each main exhibit. Its not as good as the British...

Hey there! I have been here during my stay at Toronto and i wanted to share that the museum is worth to visit since they have many different expositions and can learn you something about Canada, the first people in Canada and how living-principles where back in the old days. The non-changing exposition is worth two or tree hours, but...

I suggest you get here at opening because this place is HUGE. There is something for everyone. A section on dinosaurs, minerals, old civilizations, animals, etc...Every so often they have a different exhibition that they change so make sure to find out what it is before going. One time it was about Mexico and another time it was a famous...
1. Royal ontario museum building itself is an art.2. A must go, when you travel to Toronto on vacation.

I primarily went to see the Pompeii exhibition but having had a good look round that set off to discover the rest of the exhibits.Unfortunately I did not have enough time to see it properly so I will have to go back again!

I've seen the Pompeii exhibit twice now. Both were great. but my first time I did the exhibit with a tour guide. It was $5/pp and I think it ran every hour on the hour (not 100% about the time) I strongly recommend the paid tour...it made the exhibit come to life and so much for meaning. and more enjoyable....

Some very interesting things but hard to concentrate with screaming kids of all ages and tour guide literally shouting a description of every item. Does every museum exhibit these days have to have an "interactive" element, are kids incapable of learning anything without dressing-up or playing some kind of game ?

I had not been to the ROM in years (as I live overseas) but wanted to see the Pompeii exhibit when I was on my last visit. A spectacular display! I had visited another Pompeii exhibit when it was at the Sydney Museum many years ago and it paled in comparison to the ROM version.The permanent exhibitions have been...

we wanted to see something in Toronto that was famous for many different reasons. the ROM fit the bill and was very enjoyable. It is a large place and towards the end I was ready to be over it but during the time that we were there the exhibits were very entertaining, informative and well designed.

I love the ROM, so much so I became a member so that I can go anytime. There is no doubt that it's worth the price of admission, either for their permanent collection for for the many exhibits that pass through. Of course that's only part of the story, check their website for presentations and even entertainment - often included...
I went once with my son, we had a great time. Going with younger ones i find you dont get to take the time to read everything.

This building is absolutely stunning ! As a design lover I stood in front of it for 20 minutes just admiring the beauty of it :) Lots to see inside also including helpful section for children ! Recommended highly !
I think that in this day age the museum needs a face lift to bring the people in. They will always have a nice to see factor,but kids need to be able to interact.

For a senior and a student, we paid $51 for afternoon at the ROM. That included the featured exhibit about Pompeii and our general admission.For that fee, we could spend the entire afternoon and evening there but settled on viewing the featured exhibit and two other displays. As always, the dinosaurs were exciting. All of the displays were well-lit...

I went there yesterday and if I knew it was so big I would have gone there from the opening! It is spectacular!! I have really liked the part of the minerals and rocks and part of the animals and of the dinosaurs!! Sometimes the rooms are.so big that you don't know where to start!I have really appreciated the...
In spite of a bizarre new addition, architecturally speaking, the ROM is one of Toronto's pearls. Interesting collections. Don't miss the mineral room.
Plan to spend almost a full day here to see everything properly. We had a few hours and missed a lot.What we did see was very interesting.
Newly renovated, full of amazing stuff. Too much to list-visit their website for current traveling exhibits. Dinosaur exhibit is amazing.

If you ever visit or live in Toronto this place is a must see! The ever more interesting displays with lots to see from mummies to enclaved body armor the museum will get you wanting more! Very much recommended!
We visited the museum and were very impressed! The Pompeii Exhibit was very thought provoking. This was our second visit and we still haven't experienced the entire museum. Highly recommend!

an excellent location close to the high end shopping region of Toronto it is an excellent place to visit to learn much more about Canada. It has an excellent kids section and there are tours going on all the time. Some of the staff have appeared on TV shows because of their expertise. It is a wonderful place to spend...

Like most people who visit the ROM in Toronto, I am always impressed by the collections and how they are presented to the visitor. There a couple of things that grate, however: I still have to convince myself, each time I pass or enter this great museum, that the crystal on the north end fits the grand old lady opened...

Went there as a student and then took my daughter there when she was growing up.The ROM is a perfect experience for a family.The location in historical district certainly bodes well with the museum. It's very much a perfect experience for any yound family.
The best museum I have been to for dinosaurs. Better than NYC, London, Paris etc. Really good displays and plenty of light and room to get a sense of the scale of these ferocious giants.

This is an eccelctic museum with collections of just about everything and displayed in an interesting and informative way. A real gem worth seeing and there are hands on things that can be done. Give yourself plenty of time to view all of the cultural, historical, and scientific displays.
Highly recommend, great activity for a rainy day, so much to see and do. Yes Yes Yes just a great place

We spent 3 happy hours here and didn't see half the exhibits as its huge!Cost $44 to see the museum and the Pompeii exhibition which is there until January 16. It does have cheaper rates for teens and children though. I think it feels expensive as museums are generally free in the UK. However it is worth the entrance...

The ROM is a large museum with a massive collection of items from all over the world and from different eras all the way from prehistoric. There are so many different things (dinosaurs, ancient coins and jewelry, art deco furniture, Victorian items, suits of armour, precious gems and minerals...and so much more!) to see that you might want to check...

I dared to try to visit when there was to be some sort of meeting! Staff were downright rude in shoo-ing me away like the riff-raff I apparently am in their eyes. Shows me for trying to give them my money and look at their exhibits.
If u like museum then u will like this one. But if u just visited the MET museum in NYC, then this might be a disappointment, but still, it has a lot to show u.

We visited the museum when the Pompeii exhibition was on, but, as we had been to Pompeii, we went directly up to the second floor, the Biodiversity floor, to see the animals, the Gallery of Birds and the Bat Cave.A staff member was there asking visitors about the skull of a small bird that she held in her hand....

Great variety and amazing collections of all their different galleries. Would have loved to have had a bit more descriptions of all the animals in the natural history sections. It would be nice to see what animals would have looked like with fur/skin in the descriptions (esp of the giant sloth!). Great collection of ceratops. Bat cave could have had...

pick and choose what you are interested in before heading out to the floors, that way you can spend more time looking at the stuff you find more interesting and speed through the less interesting stuff.

Went to the Rom with my senior friends in my art class at West Scarborough Community Centre. Had a wonderful time. The exhibits were wonderful. It has been a long time since I have been to the ROM but I will go back soon and often.
Good combination of wild life and history. China collection is really good but the dinosaur part is fantastic.
An awesome day to spend if it's cold outside or you just want to take some time out of the busy city. Frequent visitor here and the special exhibitions are great value for money.

We went here mainly to see the temporary exhibition on Pompeii (as you do in Canada!) but we went round some of the permanent exhibits too. They were all very interesting and we'll put on. Give it a try!
What a great day at this museum. It is world class. Anything you can imagine is there. Lots of interactive activities for the kids, and the dinosaurs were amazing.
What can I say but "WOW". I was in constant amazement with my jaw dropped to my chest as I went from display to display. I Totally recommend visiting !!
The Pompei exhibit was interesting but very repetitive. It is always fun to see the dinosaurs, the stuffed animals and all the rocks and minerals. Great family trip.
The special exhibit on Pompeii was great, with several well preserved artifacts, but the regular galleries were not very memorable.

I visit this musuem every other month because my daughter and son always love playing here.Like best.- various exhibitions and hands-on activities.- not so crowded on Saturday- especially good for young children, at least 3-8 year old kids, which is in my kids' case.List least.- ticket price- parking feeIt's a particularly great...

The museum is an amazing cross cultural exhibit. We took the 11:00 highlight tour and it was VERY helpful. Lewis the docent was quite informative and very pleasant. We were time limited, so only spent 3 hours in the museum, but the exhibits were wonderful!!!
Many of the exhibits were kinda corny and dated. Although small, their collection of dinosaur bones is cool and well posed. We had fun, but there really wasn't much there to see or do.

We had a CityPass so was able to skip the queues.The architecture is pretty awesome, as is the metro station!Plenty of displays which range from Dinosaurs to Canadian History to Egyptians. Egyptians was pretty disappointing but I am comparing it to London's Natural History Museum.Lots to see, and well informed of each display. Only gripe is not...

Barring few sections most parts of the Museum are outdated in terms of presentation.There are several sections where the information provided is factually incorrect. Areas where they have tried to show a chronology, there are parts that are missing and it is difficult to put things together. Big disparity in the information provided throughout the museum.Dinosaur section, however, is very...

I went to see the Pompeii exhibit, which was excellent. There is plenty to see in the museum and is well worth spending several hours in.There are excellent art and historical exhibitions which cater to a wide range of interests.A Toronto highlight.

If you are a frequent visitor of museums all over the world, then this one will not blow your mind. Mediocre. The section about the aboriginal people is very nice and interesting though. But how history really went in treating this people, is told just supperficially. Another missed chance to straighten up history just a bit.

We saw the pompeii exhibition which was lovely. The museum is great but what I enjoyed the most were the voluntary workers you would find at each section happy to explain further with artefacts. Made it a much more educational. Definitely go! You won't regret it. It also has free WiFi!

We went specifically to see the Pompeii exhibit, which was fascinating and has caused us to put the city of Pompeii on our list of places to go. After the exhibit we wandered around the museum which is extremely well curated and interesting. We really liked the bat cave.

Very cool museum! So much to see, I wish we’d had more than just a few hours to spend there, but we loved checking out all the different displays, especially the mummy! My husband was giddy over the medieval armor and swords, while I think my favorite part was being able to enter and stand in a replica of an...

I grew up in London, England. I grew up with 'Tier One' museums. The ROM seeks to position itself as 'significant'. Sadly, my experience is that it is 'provincial'. If you want an interesting - and educational - experience, make your way on public transit to The Ontario Science Centre (Eglinton & Don Mills).Even after the addition of the...

This is a great place to just wander around or aimlessly and learn about different time periods and history. There is a lot to take in because it's so big and there's so much to see but it's all so enjoyable! If you are going as a family, make sure to not lose your kids. You can really run anywhere...

Lovely place to visit and good value as we bought a Toronto City Pass ( one price allows access to the Museum, Science Museum, Aquarium, C N Tower). Saved s lot of money.Museum didn't have any one era in depth, but lots and lots if different and interesting exhibits. Recommended

My wife and I specifically went to see the "Pompeii" exhibit. Not worth the entrance fee. Having visited Pompeii and Herculaneum in person, I expected to see something that mirrored my experience. Not so. Lots of artifacts in cabinets with lots of plaques to read. The only memorable exhibit was the one huge screen and timeline showing how the eruption...

Went here on the Friday night event where food & drink can be purchased with ROM bucks and you can stroll around most of the museum cup in hand. The exhibits are world class, and nowhere else have I been able it get so close to the exhibits. What a treat!

An excellent collection of dinosaur bones, Canadian and world artefacts. Spacious and well laid out. Good cafe as well! Don't be tempted to walk from the town centre with younger kids - it's a long hike.

The ROM is in a lovely old and new building and retains much of its original - Victorian - style. As tourists we were most interested in the Canadian exhibits. The first people'soexhibit was full of artefacts from different peoples but I found there was very little context provided. It needed maps, better explanations (with less detail!) and some...

At $28 per person, the exhibit us very over-priced. It's not very big, and the info provided is simplistic. It might be of interest to children, or adults who have never heard of Pompei. But anyone with a moderate amount of previous knowledge about the disaster, and the Italian site, will be very disappointed, especially at the whopping price.

The ROM has long been an excellent museum. Recent visits have been enhanced by special exhibits that are particularly well done. I especially enjoyed the one on Pompeii. The standing exhibits are of course, excellent and make the ROM a great venue to visit for Torontonians and tourists alike. Stroll down Bloor St beforehand or afterwards for a nice selection...

Plan several hours to do it justice. Younger children will like the dinosaurs but likely be bored with most of the other extensive exibits--this is a world class museum suited for children aged 12+. Easy lay-out to follow. Indoor parking just N. Of Bloor on Bedford Rd is closest lot--5 minute walk to museum.

The ROM is an amazing place to visit. The museum is very well laid out and there are lots of people walking around to answer any questions you have. You can take the entire day to see the museum. Lots to see. Will definitely go back some day.

This is a typical regional museum with all the usual suspects (dinosaurs, geology, ancient Egypt/Greece/Rome etc). Hellish cafe like a screaming creche/kindergarten. Excellent temporary exhibition on Pompeii.

I think the Royal Ontario Museum is quite excellent. In particular, this October I went to see the Pompeii exhibit. I thought it was extremely well done, and it was fascinating to see all these artifacts from a civilization that was so well preserved. Definitely educational, and very illuminating. I also took a gander around the rest of the museum...

What an excellent way to spend a cold Sunday in Toronto! Begin with the early peoples of Canada including Sitting Bull's feathered headdress and war shirt - he and his Sioux followers crossed the border into Canada after the Little Bighorn.....to black and white footage of the exploits of Nanook of the North! Work your way through the Egyptians and...

I had no idea, when we walked in the door, how special this place was. It's perfect for a family, or for discovering solo. DO take the time to delve into special exhibits, as well as wander the regular ones. A lifetime here wouldn't be enough.
my daughter went on a field trip with her class to the museum and the me and my family went together and my son loved the dinosaur exhibit

It was so poignant to see the personal items owned by people in Pompeii. We live in such a fabulous time in history to be able to see such items in our own area. I learned a lot about the physical effects of the eruption itself as well as the lives and time of the people who perished.I wish...
You can find everything in this museum, from crystals to dynasors to all kind of art.I really love going there and spend time the energy and their atmosphere are so welcoming.Don't miss it...

This museum has many interesting exhibits to visit. To my surprise, the interior is bigger than it appears on the outside. I went during the afternoon on a week day and it was very quiet inside, which was nice. Many of the exhibits had interesting historic items to showcase, such as Egyption and Roman artifacts. The location of the museum...
Fantastic Museum, Pompeii exhibit was in Town, very good. Native America rooms were fantastic, food hall was also very high standard
This is an excellent place to visit to learn much more about Canada. It is also in an excellent location close to the high end shopping region of Toronto.
ROM holds considering historical items from China, Rome and even Egypt ,the pleasure of watching renaissance era and Indian clothes and other belongings very educational

The ROM is one of the top Five Museums in the world. It has an excellent kids section and there are tours going on all the time. Some of the staff have appeared on TV shows because of their expertise. It is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon...is in a great part of town within walking distance of hotels...

I love going to the ROM. I learn something new every time I visit. This is an all day kind of excursion, if you are the type to read everything. There are a lot of interesting things to see here, so wear comfortable shoes.

We went on the general tour which while informative was hard to hear in a large group. The Pompeii exhibit was amazing. We had a great time and purchased a family membership, well worth the cost for sure

We were fortunate to be able to visit the ROM and experience the Pompei exhibit. This is a very well presented exhibit to provided much historical information about Vesuvius and the destruction it caused. All in all a very pleasant evening once again enjoying this beautiful building and its top notch exhibits.

Great location, Bloor and Yorkville shopping right there for you. The Royal Conservatory of Music is right beside it, so make sure you take a quick walk through it as well, the renovations are a stunning improvement. The ROM glass extension isn't as bad as people make it out to be. Restaurant dining has pretty good food.And yes, the...

Toronto's ROM is a beautiful & sophicated Museum. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, it embraces the very old and very modern architecture. Easily accessible by the TTC, as the subway stops right at the ROM. It houses many famous and unique artifacts, displays and antiquities. Accompanied with printed material, one can definitely take ones time while viewing everything....
ROM is renowned for many things including Dinosaurs, Gems, Nature, the China exhibit, and special exhibits. It will a number of days to see and hear everything, so plan ahead.

The Pompeii exhibition is excellent. The art, mosaics, sculpture and metalwork retrieved from the site are stunning and well set out. There are good, and not too lengthy, explanations of the exhibits as well as a dramatic reconstruction of the eruption. The plaster casts of the victims are tastefully displayed at the end of the visit bringing home the consequences...

The museum is huge and has many activities for kids. Can spend an entire day here, and if with kids you can have more than one visit. Well made and maintained place. There is cafeteria inside along with shop with souvenirs . Real fun for kids.
We loved the diversity of this museum and also the friendliness of the staff, how well it was maintained, and the shop too. There were plenty of places to sit and have a rest too.
The ROM has wonderful visiting exhibits and world class displays year round. I enjoy every chance I get to explore the ROM and see something different every time I visit.
Absolutely outstanding but do consider spending at least 4 hours here.Toronto pass worth it if you come here plus c n tower
We were fortunate enough to be here for the Pompeii exhibit which is a fascinating study of the event and its effect on the city due to the type of volcanic activity that occurred.
Museum visit with a difference.Fantastic exhibits contained within a great building.Try visit Friday evening when they host a nightclub wth eats.

Enjoyed the exhibits, learning about dinosaurs and seeing the Pompeii and Greek mythology sections. The staircases were impressive as were the Inuit art exhibits. Could have spent more time but we were in a bit if a rush but I would go back for sure.

This museum is large enough to keep you busy for a day but not overwhelming. I especially enjoyed the section on weapons and armor. Second on my list of high points would be the large dinosaur bones collection. There is something for everyone if those things are not your thing. We found the lunch room to be very nice. As...

Similar to the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam, or the British Museum in London, the ROM tries (and succeeds) in being a catch-all Museum of history, both natural and human. The exhibits are well put together and the layout quite interesting. We were fortunate to be there for the Pompeii exhibit and would recommend that anyone who is in Toronto while it...

I could have spent all day here. A really well thought out museum. When we were there they had on a Pompeii exhibit. I think we paid about $28 all in, but really worth it.Dinosaurs were particularly good.Free WIFI too.

The ROM in Toronto is an absolutely fantastic place to visit. You can easily lose an entire afternoon or morning there. The museum is massive and is split up into different themes so it's easy to visit the sections that will interest you the most.My wife and I loved the dinosaur exhibit and animal exhibits the most! For people...

This is a great museum. It has an entire floor displaying ancient Greek, Roman and Egyptian artifacts, including statues, pottery, hieroglyphs sarcophagi with an actual mummy. I don’t get to the ROM that often but when I do I could spend the whole day there. Can't rate the ROM, but on the best museums ever. Love the collection and for the exhibitions they organize and get to Toronto, they are really good. The collection covers all aspects of history, geology and arts. The artifacts, the pictures you can get very close to them. Really nice place to spend time at.

The Royal Ontario museum will keep you and your family busy for the whole day, and more. Several trips may be needed to see everything. There are so many things to see that to list them here would take all the space Trip Advisor has, :).Go to the ROM and be surprised !
the number of dinosaurs you see there is insane , I didn't expect that honestly , you can seriously find all kind of them and there are so many :)

The ROM has very good collections in a number of different areas and usually has great special exhibitions. We focused this time on the First Nations' exhibit (which probably deserves a museum of its own). There are special admission prices for students and seniors. We lived in TO 2012-2013. Our 2 young children (1 and 3) LOVED this museum. It was the perfect place to go on cold winter days. We would always watch the fish swimming. The kids area was excellent. Went this year and the exhibit of Pompeii was on display. I had seen pictures over the years, but with the artifacts there on display it adds a lot more live to it. Also went through some of the rest of the museum. The place is large and there is a lot to see, and you should allow a fair...
Wonderful place to visit, well worth spending a few hours for all the family, a fantastic selection of dinosaurs and fossils.

Paid the extra to get the guided / narrated tour and it was worth the money. She was knowledgeable and pointed us in the right direction to see the main points. Quite an interesting piece of history. Did not spend time in the General Museum so it became pricey. The Pompei tour only lasts about an hour so to make...

This is a large and bright museum that covers human cultures from around the world, paleontology and flora and fauna. There is also a large area for the traveling exhibits. I was lucky enough to catch Pompeii - which was very interesting. So devastating.I liked that you can see just the areas that interest you and you do not...

I stopped here with friends because we had purchased the CityPass and thought we might as well check it out. This was an incredible museum! We only had about an hour and half to go through it (which is about a day too short, it's that big). We were moving pretty quickly and only saw the first two levels. There...

The dinosaurs exhibition is a must.The rest of the exhibitions are comprehensive and in a descent size.The Pompei exhibition is very interesting and impressive but since its a bit pricy I would only recommend it to visitors with prior interest in the subject.Mind that there are guides with red jackets scattered all over the museum with great...

Perfect place to spend a whole day looking and reading all the information. Funny story.. there were these camel statues and my friends and I decided we were going to pretend to kiss the camel.. when it was my turn, i lost my balance and lips went right on the camel!!! I felt so gross just thinking of how many...

The ROM is an excellent museum with lots of things to see. At the moment (October 2015) there is an exhibition called "Pompeii - in the shadow of the volcano" which is worth the admission price on its own. Fascinating!

What an amazing place! So much history there. It's central to lots of other neat things to see. The outside is.... well you'll have to judge.One thing I'll caution you against is that if you buy online there is no mobile entry. If you waste your time trying to buy online the site will only tell you this at...

This was my second visit to ROM. Would highly recommend signing up for one of their complimentary tours. The volunteer guide was personable, knowledgeable and seemed to really enjoy her role. My daughter and I benefited from her wonderful knowledge of the museum and the artifacts she led us to. It gave us far more insight than if we were...

The building itself is worth seeing, just walk through it. Purchase the Toronto pass and its included in the price. Spend some time here. The first time I went I went alone. It gave me a great amount of time to just enjoy and scope out where I wanted to bring my kids. The second time, I brought the kids...

This place is HUGE. We didnt get to see it all in our visit.Highly recommend you look at the map and pick the zones you really want to see and do them in order.Pompeii exhibit was very good.Dinosaur display was brilliant.Really enjoyable morning, weather was rubbish so this was an ideal activity

Vast and interesting place to visit, too much to see in a morning, looked a bit daunting but once you worked out the floor plan wasn't too bad. Spent 3+ hours doing a cursory tour of all exhibits plus lunch in the Deli. Lots of things I'd seen in other major museums. Amazing skeleton of one dinosaur about 30m long nose to tail. Interesting paintings in the Canadian section.
A first class museum without a doubt. A great selection of arms and armour, natural history and some really cool interactive exhibits which change frequently.

I am rating this review based on the Pompeii Exhibition which I toured with great curiosity and empathy.I was so moved with all that was on display.The exhibition was presented well and had the ability to absorb me into the civilization that was.The facts are complete and illustrations demonstrative for us now in 2015 to envision the...

You could spend a whole week going through the massive collections at the Royal Ontario Museum. There are some incredible works from Asia on display, including a detailed look at how Buddhists practice.Getting to the museum is easy using public transit. In fact, there's a subway station named "Museum." Go figure.

I went to this in an effort to use up our Citypasses. Boy did I underestimate how interesting it would be. We should have left more time for this attraction; note there's a good breakfast place right across the street, Over Easy, so we paired our visit to ROM with that. Every time we travel to Toronto, this is on our list to see and the museum is always our highlight of the trip. A person can easily take the subway and get off on the Museum stop. There are discounts for senior citizens and students. The Pompeii exhibit was here but since we had seen it elsewhere we didn't see...

Enjoyed the ROM, some good exhibits, really enjoyed the dinosaur hall in the new extension. So often dinosaur skeletons are presented in `regular' rooms which remind us that they are extinct, but the freedom...
A marvellous museum. Such a wide range of subjects. A very tasteful gift shop. Pompeii exhibition proving to be a major drawcard now so book online to avoid queues.
The Native Canadian Totem poles were magnificent! I also liked the Pompeii exhibit and don't miss the mosaic ceiling!
Nice,Well Organized Museum with huge collection.Very Educational and informative .Good to spent time with family.situated in convinient location . I parked our Van in Kipling and use Subway

So many exhibits and there is something interesting for all. Prehistoric history, cultural history of many peoples. Interesting nature exhibits. I could have spent whole day here. Another great remodel of an old building.
Incredibly organized, engaging and informative. We needed at least 4 hours, but we could have spent all day here.

Went to the ROM specifically for the Pompeii exhibit, all I can say is WOW!! The exhibit was well displayed with alot of great info on the events of Pompeii, culture and everyday life.
