On a recent very hot afternoon with some free time, we escaped the heat and explored this museum for a few hours. We were rewarded with an informative and interesting visit to Pompeii and some interesting art and artifacts from Canada and around the world. Even though busy with families and tourists, the museum did not feel crowded.

Relatively expensive and extra for the PompeiiPerhaps since I have been to Pompeii, I found it underwhelming.Very hard to navigate and find the attractions you want to see. I came in around 11:30 and asked the info desk where to start - they said Pompeii. I wish they would have said the noon orientation tour which I discovered...
amazing place ever i loved it so much overall something wow , i went for many different musme non like this

Neat museum with plenty to see and do. There is a really nice exhibit on China and the Arms and Armament was very spectacular. I would say avoid the ridiculously over priced gift shop which seems to be 2 or 3 times higher priced than the average tourist attractions.

If you went to several museums in Europe, you have seen it all here. We wanted to know more about Canada, not Europe. The only thing you won't see in Europe is the T-rex bones they have here. That's the only thing you can't see in Europe, yet. It's great for North American tourists which havent been to Europe before,...
The ROM is great for special exhibitions. The Eternal Eggpt and the Pompei exhibit were outstanding.However tbe everyday collection is kind of small and I didn't find it super interesting.
Good museum, plenty of things to see. Search online for discount codes, before you booked. I saved $$$
ROM is a very interesting and educational place. I would recommend a visit here. We loved it. Plan on setting aside at least 4 hours to take in the entire exhibit!
Our guide was very informative about the museum and very likable. we only got a quick look at some of the displays and overall it was good

I took my kids to see the dinosaurs, animals, and the Chinese Imperial treasures. They loved them all. Each exhibit was rather small, compared to similar exhibits in larger European cities and their older museums, but it was an enjoyable experience. Given the small size of the museum, though, it was not really worth the high ticket price. Families should...

Magnificent- if u love museumsI was totally engrossed in the exhibits especially the European Floor...2 hours flew by, and I came out of the museum feeling refreshed, and happy....The feeling you get when u have spent some time doing something worth doing..the only con- the signboards are a little confusing so make sure u take the Map at the...
Went to their Friday night live and it was awesome. Museum with a bar on certain Fridays in the summer and fall. I can see why Toronto has so many cool spots and this is one of them.

The ROM is one of the best museums in Canada. The Greek, Roman, Egyptian and Asian antiquities collections are excellent. The mineral gallery is also impressive. Dinosaurs are fine as well. However, the Canadian section is one big yawn and the First Peoples exhibit is a let-down. I kind of wish we spent more time on Canadian history as the...
Way too much to see for just one visit, make sure you wear comfortable shoes! Ticket buying on line is a must, as the lineup was very long and we bypassed it entirely. Don't miss Pompei!

We tried to Cram the ROM into one day...and 4 1/2 hours. It was a lot to take in. We should have split it into two days! Enjoyed the Druxy cafe in the basement! Lots to see! Love the Animals floor with the Dinosaurs etc!

We took our clients to visit the ROM. Unfortunately did not realize the tactile tour was only Mon-Fri. Our clients are deaf/blind. They did however have a lot of fun. They have so many things for them to still feel, and what they could see. They have a lot of new things coming out, the staff were amazing with us....
I visit the ROM frequently as a member. Exhibits always have attraction - some are new; some you see in a different perspective on a additional visit.
The museums in Toronto is very good . My family enjoyed them all highly recommend to visit that one .
Great Pompeii exhibit. Take the tour with the guide and headphones. Really enjoyed the mineralogy. Not as good as the Chicago museums
A really interesting place to visit. You need a full day to really benefit everything that the museum has to offer.

This is a wonderful museum! As our time was short we spent 3 hours (and we're glad we did!) walking through the excellent Pompeii and ancient Egypt exhibits. It was enjoyable and informative. If you do plan to check out ROM be sure to purchase your tickets at Costco. They include entrance to both the museum and the Pompeii exhibit...
This attraction is part of the Toronto City Pass but they charge you 11CAD extra per person if you want to enter the special exhibition (Pompeii when we were there).

Great museum and within walking distance from the city centre. Modern, interesting and gives you a real feel of Canadian life BUT for me the Dinosaur axhibits were the starts of the show - I loved em! Well worth the price and a visit

This is an amazing museum filled with so much, you could spend days in there. So much history and wonderful artifacts and education, truly wonderful exhibits! A must see place when in Toronto. Plan a lot of time for this stop, you need several hours to be able to go thru everything.

i went to this museum with my daughter. Wanted to know how Toronto got started and was not disappointed. The information is presented in objects, writing, pictures, artifacts - very interesting, colorful, and informative - most suitable for young children too. We were very fortunate that the display on Pompei was on when we visited. There's lots to see and...
I hadn't been there since I was a kid. But this place is stunning. Great architecture, excellent exhibits and the grounds are immaculate. Great for families, couples, dates.
It's a beautiful place to be to spend time with the kids. We always have a good time. The kids has all these sigh and scene while absorbing knowledge without knowing it. Fun fun fun

ROM certainly has great exhibits but the experience is really ruined by lack of sign posting and the rabbit-warren like corridors that now exist because of the front extension. As well a number of the exhibits in the ethnographic section, although numbered, don't have specific descriptions, and sometimes the numbering is missing from the information boards - all very disappointing.

This exhibit Is outstanding, it actually takes your breath away, especially the casts of the people and animals that seem petrified.The ROM architecture alone is worth the visit.The gift shop is one of the best museum shops and those always have really neat treasures that you never get anywhere else. Very good variety of exhibits ranging from natural history, ancient Egypt, Greek, Chinese and Canadian history (just to name part of it). Free student admission on Tuesday is a grand bonus
Great place to take the family. When we went it was free on Friday nights. Much to see for all groups.

My husband and I visited the Museum whilst on a holiday in Toronto. They currently have the Pompeii exhibition there which is very interesting. The museum is huge with lots of artefacts including Egyptian section and Greek. It would be easy to spend at least half a day there. It's a brilliant museum and we would recommend a visit to...
The Pompeii exhibit was well done. Learned a lot about volcano damage and the life at that time. We also went through The Canadian Exhibit. Loved the furniture.

My bride and I travelled to Toronto in September and we visited the ROM. This is a must see museum if you are a museum lover. The ROM is a great place to visit while in Toronto (especially on a rainy day). The museum has several notable collections including an extensive Asian art collection and surprising large dinosaur exhibit. There's some interesting stuff here for sure, and quite a diverse range of things to see, but a lot of it just wasn't too my taste. To be fair though, I didn't quite get around the whole museum as I was limited on time, but I did see most of it. As with any museum, it's a good idea to...

Went to the ROM after visiting the Ripley's Aquarium. We visited the Pompeii exhibit and wandered around the rest of the museum after we were finished. You can easily get lost in this huge building. It's a nice place for curious kids but if you're not into physics, engineering, biology etc. you won't understand certain things and you'll get bored.

Came for the Pompeii exhibit and was very impressed with the whole museum! Beautiful place and all of there exhibits were wonderful and well worth it!Tip - we bought the tickets online through Costco - more than half price off!
Extremely organized, informative, and detailed. Provided outstanding exhibits and artifacts-with valid facts.

We went to ROM with bunch of kids (ours and neighbors) as they wanted to see Dinosaurs section. Very reasonable admission price (although you have to pay extra to visit the volcano exhibit), but well worth the visit. The dinosaur exhibit was the best and very large.....this museum has a lot to offer......
There is a lot to see at this, Toronto's main museum, even without taking in the temporary special exhibitions. No visitor to Toronto will want to miss it.

Each time we go there we're ending up spending more time than we planned. Honestly, could spent there all day! Interesting place, great special exhibitions and much more. Very friendly, helpful and welcoming staff. If you considering to visit this museum more than once I hardly recommend you to buy an annual membership - you'll save money + you'll get...

This is a have a little of everything museum but with a very poor display and in a very awful architecture. I heard the temporal exhibit of Pompey was good, but I only went to the permanent collection. Highlights: four totems that are difficult to appreciate as they are surrounded by the staircase.
Well organized with a thoughtful informative tour guide to point out the artifacts and answer all questions. The Pompei exhibit is a must for the curious mind

We spent a few hours, and could have spent all day. The special exhibit on Pompeii was excellent. Thorough, interesting, and a variety of media, including interactive activities, made it consistently engaging and well-paced.

Went on a Saturday and expected it to be so busy that I would not enjoy myself! I was wrong!Had two children with me and I was unable to see everything in the day - but fun was had by all (adults and children)Dinosaurs and gems were the biggest hits! Definitely want to go back

I never went here when I was a kid but over the past couple of years I have spent multiple hours just wandering around this placeThey have a bit of everything including dinosaur exhibit. It was so hot extreme heat warming that when I got here on the tour bus stop 10 I went in to get out of the heat there is loads to see with things from all over the world good for family's and people on there own like me I had the Toronto Pass so that meant no waiting in...

Do not mistake or misunderstand my words. There is enough information here to fill courses found in many university degree programs dealing with specific topics dealing with many aspects of pre-history, paleontology, natural disasters, early civilizations, extinct animals, and the like. that was a great load of fun for our kids.and... it was totally fine to just go there for two hours. you dont have to plan a full day. that might be tiering for the kids anyway. but if you go there for a couple of hours its great
The Pompeii exhibit is incredible - chock full of information new to us! The Mexican fabric and clothing exhibit was very interesting and well done. Loved all of it.
Came here with my sons who were 17 and 13 at the time and they were completely entertained. Large collection of historical items you can take at least four hours strolling through each corner.

Get there early lots to take in! we showed up in the afternoon at it closed at 5:30pm so we missed a few exhibits on the 2nd floor.But a great place to visit! Stay clear of the gift shop! Very expensive!The exhibits were great. The did an amazing job in the production and lay out.The floor maps...

The ROM is my pill for travelling back to the age of Dinosaurs. You want to know about endangered species, you should go here. If you want to learn about European culture, then you should go there too. If you want to know about the Chinese history and Buddhisim then this is your destination. I was slightly underwhelmed by the Royal Ontario Museum. They have decent exhibits on dinosaurs, natural history and biodiversity but you are not likely to see anything new if you have been to the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History. I wanted to go to the Volcano exhibit, but did not feel like paying extra for that.
Absolutely terrific. Get there first thing, and be prepared to be thrown out when they close. We visited the Greek, Egyptian and Chinese galleries, but there are so many more.

A few floors crammed with jewels from Ontario's past. The Museum goes back to antiquity and more recently to pioneering Canada. Highlights are the collections of furniture (Art Deco), minerals, colonial artifacts, and the building itself. Easy to lose a lot of time here and a downstairs cafe and shop completes the experience.

Have been to the ROM before, primarily to see special exhibits. This time we went to see the Pompeii exhibit specifically. We did have to pay extra for this event. We have been to the ROM many times in the past so we don't usually bother with the regular areas. This exhibit was very interesting with many artifacts and displays....
We saw the Pompeii exhibit and it is definitely worth seeing. First-rate in every way. Plan for two hours to see it.

all museums take time and you can only get a taste each visit. The ROM has a very good selection of short tours offered for free. The Pompeii exhibit on at the moment is excellent and well worth seeing.

My main purpose was a visit to see the Pompeii exhibit on a Summer Friday night. I enjoyed the artifacts and learned a lot about that time and place in history. There are interactive aspects such as putting on a toga and viewing the site on a tablet. I also visited the art deco and glass exhibits. I have given...

The ROM has some reasonable, though not world class collections. What a pity that you have to be offended and nauseated by the disgusting architecture that attempts to house the exhibits. This museum has a lot to families and small groups there are many interesting displays to experience and study. The dinosaur exhibit is quite amazing. The First Nations exhibit is very interesting and has some beautiful. Exhibit is very interesting and has some beautiful articles to examine the totem poles on the stairways are spectacular. Enjoyed our visit to the ROM, but a bit disappointed in the additional cost for the main exhibit. I felt the layout was a bit disorganized and the map was lacking in providing appropriate direction. Definitely not enough time in day if you are visiting ROM with kids. Even if ROM would have more business hours (10:00 am – 5:30 pm). Because we came with kids and for a whole day we were interesting to eat too. Museum have one big lunch room for somebody who bring a food with you (but I don't remember...
Saw the Pompeii exhibit on tour. makes the remarkable museum all that better. Go early on a weekday as the displays are small and intimate and nice to have to yourself. Cost an extra $11 to see.

Ok so after having read some reviews about the place and just returning from there i have to agree woth some review and disagree with others:1. A lot of the dinosaur exhibition is in fact real bones while other parts are reconstructed - means i disagree with a lot of the reviews ranting about "its all plastic"2. The...

We went because it was a part of City Pass. Museum's don't appeal to us and this one was no different. But if you like visiting museum's and learning about history, ROM seemed like a nice place. It's quite big and has a lot to explore.

This is a must see for any visitor to Toronto. We had a lot of fun looking around and taking pictures, there's so much to see and experience that you could easily get lost for a whole day here.There is a restaurant inside the museum which was OK.

We had a really great time at the museum during our first visit to Toronto. There was a lot to see and there was enough variety to suit the differing interests of myself and my boyfriend. I'd definitely recommend.
I visited the First Nations art and anthropology exhibits and found it very fine. I looked briefly at some other exhibits and found them reasonable but not exceptional.

This has a nice collection of world history including ancient Asian, ancient Roman, Mesopotamian, Egyptian, and natural history. I have loved this museum since I was a child. This was the first visit for our grandson who is 6. He loved the dinousaurs and the bat cave. He also loved the mummies.We went to see the special exhibit Pompeii. To our suprise, this was his absolute favourite part of our visit.

I hadn't been to the ROM in probably close to 20 years and thought we should check it out because the outside of the building looked really cool and modern now.Once inside I saw the same mummies, the same dinosaurs and although the building is bright and modern, it was the same stuff I saw 20 years ago, I...
One of the better museums in North America, 2nd only to the smithsonian in my opinion. Dinosaur exhibit is stellar and the Gem exhibit was one of a kind.

Went to the ROM on a recent trip to TO. It's always wonderful but this time there was a Pompeii exhibit and it was amazing. So many wonderful and fascinating peices to see. Wish I could have spent more time there. Saw many other exhibits too. If your going to go plan to spend the whole day. You won't regret...
Lots of exhibits and a great way to teach people about cultures and time periods that you are intrigued by.

The ROM is a story -- every time we visit (at least 4 x year), it is like we have opened a new book - always something new to see, try or visit. The ROM is a family tradition - definitely worth buying a membership -- especially if you are a family of 4 or plan on visiting frequently. Take...
So much to see! It's practically an entire day trip, but very much worth it. It's also best to get a City Pass that includes ROM in the price.

Recently went to see the new exhibit. Not only is it great but the museum itself is awesome. For anyone who loves to learn this is the place in Toronto to be. A little bit of everything for everyone. A lot of fun.

We visited Pompeii (the one in Italy!) a few years ago, so I was eager to visit the Pompeii exhibit at the ROM.The story told at the ROM was complimentary to a visit to the actual site. Obviously in a couple of hours to either location you can only tell a small part of the story. I think the...

The displays are wonderful, historical lessons everywhere. You need lots of time or several visits to see and study. We enjoy our annual visits. You can have a refreshing drink or a good sit-down lunch. Be sure to pick up something from the great gift shop.

I'm not a frequent ROM goer, but I was interested in the Pompeii legacy, of what happened during the time that mount Viseuvius erupted . What a great exhibit. So well explained. And the casts of the bodies caught in the crossfire of the Volcano were truly something to be seen. Fun, I think for the family that likes history...

We started with the Pompeii exhibit that was right on par with being there in Italy. Very well done. Lots of funny photo ops with Togas, spears and such, amazing finds, emerald necklace my favorite. After that we spent the rest of our time in the Geology Gem room, gorgeous! and the Native Peoples exhibit was fascinating. We had no...
Museum is small has interesting exhibits for children. Do advance booking to avoid que. Not too crowded. Can we seen in 2-3 hours.
The ROM holds a special place in my heart. Having been here nearly every time I visit Toronto, I never get enough. The architecture is really cool too.

Beautiful building with many, many interesting exhibits-- too many for my attention span-- so we took a "natural history" tour with a very knowledgeable docent, then spent another hour or two poking around the Canadiana exhibit (so-so) and the First Nations wing (excellent). Highly recommended. Included with the CityPass.

If it wasn't for the 3 following issues I have with the museum I would give it a 4/5However.1) no maps or lists of what is on each level in any of the elevators. There was lots of people going round and round.2) no map given to me as I paid.3) no napkins in the cafe....
Interesting, only one floor though - Pompeii ExhibitOther floors - Chinese Art, Dinosaurs, Canadian Culture

Visited with with a baby over labour day weekend. There was a promotion for $5 off all tickets. There was a bit of a queue to get in but it went through quite quickly.We had lunch in the Druxy Cafe downstairs. Had a nice time visiting and enjoying the exhibits. Enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit the most. If you have time I would recommend it; however, I feel once you have seen one museum you've seen them all.

This was my favorite museum in Toronto. The Pompeii exhibit was especially interesting and worth the additional admission price. This is an excellent museum for families as kids love the dinosaurs and natural history. The bat cave is well done and the series on extinction was a great learning experience. Beautiful gem displays and great artifacts. The cafe was very...

By far this was the best museum we saw as first time visitors to Toronto. This is a comprehensive art museum. While this might not be as famous as others like the Met, the Louvre, or the British Museum, etc, the quality and interest of the collection is extraordinary. A must! So amazing for adults and kids alike. The dinosaurs are incredible. My 6 year old loved it! We will be back.

Although we had a great time our children 7 and 10 started to get restless a couple of hours in. We had free children admission with adult and paid extra for the Pompeii visit. We went to the museum after 4 on a Friday evening paying the reduced prize. The museum was open till 8 which easily gave us enough time to have a good look round. There is a huge variety to look at from the natural history, local history and the traditional arts. I particularly enjoyed the exhibit about the Inuit peoples...

Great place for all ...especially those with physical/mobility challenges.This facility honours the "Access to Entertainment" card making the entrance more affordable. I was surprised to see that this museum had an entire floor of dinosaur skeletons as well as more traditional art. Well worth a visit and it is one of the...
A very interesting museum, contrasting history, culture, science, technology and arts and brining all into one place. Not to mention the stunning architecture

This year i went to visit and decide to get a family membership. i am looking forward to spending time with my children at the ROM. my only wish would be for them to change the children's section up a bit so it is not repetitive every time we come (12 years have been going)

Make sure you visit early on a Sunday morning before the crowds arrive.The Pompeii exhibition is excellent and a number of other areas well worth the entrance fee (even if museums are free to enter in UK)
We mostly had time just to see the Pompeii exhibit plus a couple quick walks through others. Great museum and Pompeii is explored so thoroughly, it's great.
A great and very interseting experience. Art, science and more. Great for individuals, children, families and groups.
We loved the Pompeii exhibit a fascinating insight to this city. The museum has an amazing range exhibits it takes a good day to get round, but well worth it
Great place to take the kids particularly if its raining.. Incredible dinosaurs and exhibits. The taxidermy didn't impress my children.

The museum is well set out, with an interesting selection of artefacts from around the world. You could easily spend a day here, or as we did just a couple of hours out of the heat selecting the sections we were most interested in.

We went to see the Pompeii exhibit. The signage was poor so it was hard to find the exhibit. We enjoyed seeing the exhibit as it was professionally displayed. The cafeteria restaurant upstairs served an excellent lunch which was healthy and moderately priced.
I love the ROM. Tons of great exhibits that will easily fill a day. It is a bit too much to keep my 6 and 8 year olds interested but they enjoyed it for the first few hours.
We only had time for the Asian art and the First Nations exhibitions, but they alone are well worth the visit. Well presented and comprehensive.
Really a fabulous museum with a huge range of exhibits. Great to lose yourself in for a few hours. Pompeii was worth the extra entrance fee in my view - very interesting.
Hardly any staff around to ask questions. The best display was the Mexican costumes and fabric section on the fourth floor. A fairly basic but cheap cafe downstaitrs.

I really enjoyed this place! I can not believe how huge it is!! They have everything you can imagine there! My kids really enjoyed the dinosaur fossils and bones! Defiantly worth every penny!! Defiantly recommend!

We really liked the ROM ending up staying much longer than planned with so much to view. My partner even enjoyed it and is not a museum person for more than a couple hours. There is a vast array of things to see with the dinosaur exhibits being enjoyed by adults and children alike.Staff were pleasant and happy to...

I hadn't been since I was a young child, and it was just as memorable as an adult, especially with the new (to me) glass shard entrance.If you love dinosaurs and natural history museums in general, this is not to be missed.

My children and I went to see the Pompeii exhibit which was very educational, we enjoyed visiting other exhibits including the Mexican and the Canadiana section. One of the city pass tickets. first time and won't be the last. great collection. amazed with the Egyptian, Chinese artifacts. Nice Dinosaurs, minerals and animals collections too. plan a good 3-4 hours.

I love the ROM. The architectural design is stunning but the exhibits are also educational and interesting. I do find it is a little dumbed down and I wished there was more detail for some exhibits. As New Yorkers we're accustomed to fine museums. The Royal Ontario Museum is top rate, for sure. The Royal Ontario Museum is a must visit on your trip to Toronto. Plan your time wisely as there is a lot to see in there. I spent a whole afternoon, but you could certainly spend the whole day. I wasn't expecting to stay here for a very long time, but surprisingly I spent the majority of my day there. Everything seemed so amazing and time went by so quickly! Came with a five year old who wanted to see the dinosaur bones and the mummy. After that lost interest quickly. I found the collection fascinating, but didn't get much chance to look.They are making attempts to offer activities for small children, which is a good start. Its name is perfect for what it has to offer. My favourite section was the minerals, while my partner's favourite were the aboriginals section!
We went to ROM when there was the Chinese dynasty special exhibition and it was amazing! I also love the dinosaur area which has some of Ontario's best dinosaur fossils

Allow at least a full day to enjoy this attraction (and that still won't be enough time) I highly recommend the guided tours...they are fun, informative and give you access to areas a general ticket won't include. You will also learn some incredible facts that are thought provoking and encourage conversation. Each exhibit is phenomenal. The layout is great. Clean...
We enjoyed our visit to the Royal Ontario Museum. It is centrally located to other attractions - shoe museum for one.
Interesting place for kids and adults. Amazing exhibits and never feels crowded. Great value for money in a time where that is often not the case.
Most informative & well displayed & educational exhibit. Better than any similar I have seen in other national museums worldwide.
I came here for the "Forbidden Palace" exhibit, and it was truly wonderful. I got to sneak in on a tour and was told that this was the first time the show had ever left China - really amazing!
You could spend all day here. There is so much to see.Be aware that this is a popular place for children's field trips, so expect to run into lots of children.

One of the first things you notice about the Royal Ontario Museum is its mix of contemporary and Victorian Architecture, in both the interior and exterior. The exhibits range from dinosaurs to modern art. There is something for everyone to enjoy.

Went as a family with our 7 and 10 year old. I want to say that the museum does have some amazing pieces and top notch displays. With children, it would be ambitious to think you will get through the whole thing and while some static displays will quickly become boring to children, there are kid centric stations scattered throughout....

We went to visit ROM for the Pompeii exhibit having been here before many times. The Pompeii exhibit is interesting to see especially since we watched the movies so the kids know what they are about to see. It is very dramatic on the visual display of the volcano ash as well as the human remains. It's worthwhile to see.

Affectionately known as ROM and part of City Pass which is a good deal. Also on easy subway line running north-south. Perfect day trip would be ROM and Casa Loma. Get a family pass for subway on weekends. Two adults and two kids ride all day for $11. Most interesting exhibit to me in ROM was the Oriental section. Helpful...
Really enjoyed the Pompei exhibition but alas time did not allow us to fully explore the dinosaurs or all areas of the museum.

This museum covers a lot of area (square feet) and areas (history, biology, zoology, art) and does most of it well. My favorite was the second floor, where curators and staff have done a great job of presenting animals, plants, nature--and creating wonderful interactive displays for children and adults. Other floors, while impressive, need better design, with more helpful signage...

A bit far out of Toronto and really not s place for adults. This is in the City Pass so we gave it a go but wouldn't advise unless it's a family visit. The museum itself is very well done and the staff very enthusiastic.

I planned to be there for an hour or two, but I ended up staying for half a day. Wonderful museum! Smart Canadians have it so the school kid tours end up in a different cafeteria than the regular tourists, very efficient. Good food, too.
We went to the Pompeii Exhibit and also the main displays in the General part of the ROM. You can spend hours here and take in the history and displays and artworks.

Fantastic museum, great exhibits. The new wing's architecture is an experience in itself. My favourite exhibits are the minerals and the dinosaurs. Even these two are well worth the visit. The Pompei exhibit alone was worth the stop. It was very powerful. It is amazing how a civilization could just be buried like that. We enjoyed the rest of the museum as well. All the displays had the right amount of information. It is a very beautiful museum similar to the Natural History museums in DC and NYC.

I must have visited the ROM over 20 times in the last 2 decades. The magic of this place never diminishes for me. If you plan to visit more than a couple of...
Ruined by the the architectural atrocity scabbed onto the northeast corner of the building. Again, the collection has taken second place to the box it's in.

This was by far one of the best museums I've ever went to. There was a large source of information. I just found the information was scattered about the place, it was like a maze! There were so many halls that I couldn't find the exit.

We began our time at the museum with a tour led by a very knowledgable docent, Janice. I saw a lot of interesting facts. It was fun. The place is big so expect to some more time than assume. They have special attractions. I went when Pompeii was their special exhibit. Nice.!.

Went there for a date.The newest addition has the strangest architecture, it actually distracted me from the displays. Our time got away from us, we were enjoying it so much! Time flew by!!There's something for everyone!I can't tell you my favorite! Many, many favorites!
So interesting and you need to start when they open to experience it all! I was there with my family 4 years ago and want to go back to see what we missed.
A really interesting museum with a variety of artefacts and exhibits - a good 2 hour visit. Nice cafe in the basement

I am hooked to the exhibits and can never finish exploring everything the ROM offers!! I usually visit 3 to 4 times a year and am always drawn to the dinosaurs and 1 million dollars gold coin LOL!!! Highly recommended for everyone to visit there!

This is a lovely museum spread on 3 levels with some very nice pieces of art from China and Egypt. A lovely place where to spend a few hours at least indulging into the past. It seems to get targeted by schools too so try to come around midday when the kids are having lunch for some tranquillity.

We are allotted about 3 hours for the visit to the Royal Ontario Museum.Mistake number one, we did a few of their included tours that lasts about 45 minutes each. Each was different but very informative lots of great detail that you normally would not have known about particular exhibits or pieces. According to one of the workers you...
Since I was small I have always come to the ROM. I love everything about it and will continue to visit in the future. One of the best museums that I have been too.

My friend and I paid our admissions and went our separate ways, each of going to the exhibits we were interested in, and our paths never crossed. A show on Mexican textiles was the best I've seen anywhere. Not too many people here, and no kids. I went to the hall on Canadian history which was fascinating. The 2 Giant,...

The ROM, as the Royal Ontario Museum is more commonly known has collections that pull no punches to inform, educate and enrich. The Samuel European galleries are very well curated. We went to the rom today! As my 2&a half year old grandson is dinosaurs mad!!!after watching dino Dan! We had the most fantastic time what a place! Something for everyone have never been to a museum like it! Just beautiful & very helpful staff! Would recommend a visit to anyone of any age!
I went see the special Pompeii Exhibit and enjoyed the other sections of the ROM. I would visit it again because there was so much to see that I didn't make it through the whole museum.

A very nice museum, well organized and kept. Many interesting exhibitions. By September 2015 the main attraction will be the one dedicated to Pompeii - absolutely fascinating. A great lesson of history and not only. Also the Asian Art, the one regarding the Canadian native Americans. The place is pretty big so give the needed timing. It pays back...
There are some exhibitions that are quite amazing, but the new design of the museum makes for a very non friendly feeling with very angualr sharplike walls.The temporary exhibits tend to be great ...

Dinosaurs! do i need to say more? The ROM has always had many excellent exhibits that have stuck around and it sees many that pass through. Beautiful building with a fun layout for exploring. Loved it as a child, and it still holds up as an adult.

Looked forward to visiting the ROM and its special exhibit. The best admission deal if you can do so is to purchase through Costco. Great ticket price that includes the special exhibit entrance fee. Walking through I was blown away by the volume of beautiful artifacts and natural history. It takes a couple of visits (at least) to really take in everything. Very reasonably priced.

We spent 6 hours here with a 7 year old - he loved the Pompei Exhibit. Lots to learn and great artefacts and reproductions.As well the dinosaurs always fascinate and the bat exhibit s great even though of course it's all synthetic.The restaurant is OK - a bit expensive but this is Toronto.

I've been to museums from Stuttgart to Vietnam and ROM is by far my favourite museum. If you're bringing along your lil ones, i highly recommend this museum. The Pompeii exhibit was worth the price! That was an easy favorite for me, and my second favorite area was the Treasures of the Earth area with all the crystals and gems.
Interesting but Too much readings. Impressive collections dinosaurs.Better place for teenagers and adults
Went to the Pompeii exhibit it was ok the other areas of the museum were incredible several days are needed to go thru the museum. Definitely worth a return visit

We visited the ROM in Sept 2014 whilst staying in Toronto, we really enjoyed the day here and still didn't see it all as there's so much to see, we really enjoyed the Age of the Dinosaur Gallery as well as the Jewellery and Precious Stones Gallery. Have been visiting the ROM for over a decade. Very interesting and a lovely museum. Can be a little busy at times, but its also right beside the subway so getting to it is easy.

I loved every second of my visit there including the YPC (Young Patrons Circle) PROM I went at the museum.There are so many things to see! The Royal Ontario Museum of art, world culture and natural history or the ROM is said to be one of the largest in North America. It is situated in the University of Toronto district in downtown Toronto next to Queen's Park. Wow I am so impressed! Beautiful building and accessible. You need a good day to go round everything though - take your walking shoes..lol.The day we went we paid extra to see Pompell. I found this museum expensive to visit. That may be because British museums are generally free to enter.I can understand why they do it, but cased artefacts are quite dull. everyone in your family will find an interest in something in here.Ask about family season passes, they has a sale on the day we were there and it was better price for us to get a family season pass than it was to pay individual for the day

We were very impressed by the Royal Ontario Museum!There is a huge variety of exhibits.There is plenty of seating.The facility is very clean, and the staff were very friendly.The on location staff made the exhibits more interactive.There is something for all ages here!I could go back a dozen more times, and see something new...

My fiancé and I went on our last day in Toronto. Do NOT go if you have already had a busy vacation. There is so much to see in this place, and you need to be in the right mindset and have enough energy to really appreciate everything in there. I went to the ROM to see the Pompeii exhibit. There were over 200 artifacts from Pompeii. It was cool that there were little signs along the way in the ROM letting us know what hashtags to use for take pictures of Things. The exhibit in itself was OK I was expecting a little bit more of a wow factor....
Plan to be here all day if you want to see everything. The Pompeii exhibit was quite remarkable. Kids enjoyed most of the exhibits.

A very nice large museum. It is great for people of all ages (families, couple, single, elderly) I went on Friday evening, which is when it is 10 dollars. There are 3 floors in the main museum. I didn't go to the Pompei exhibit. If I did I would have ran out of time. I would advise people to dedicate...
Take your time here- there's a lot to see. The dinosaur exhibits were probably my favorite. The bees were fascinating and there's an exhibit with an autumn scene in the forest- beautiful.
We recently enjoyed the special Pompei museum exhibit. Wonderfully interactive, informative and good photo opportunities. So much to see! Great place to spend an afternoon!
Fantastic afternoon out - the exhibits were excellent, food hall was a bit of a zoo, but with the throughput in the museum its understandable

I took my 2 grandsons to the Pompeii excibit because the older one was interested to see what it was all about. He liked it but the youngest only liked the gift shop! A great look into the lives of the poor souls from Pompeii. Lots of items to look at but it seemed to be over too soon. I...

This museum is a real mix of collections, some average and some excellent. The Pompeii exhibition was excellent and really told the story of what happened as well as educating about volcanoes. There is also a very large collection of dinosaurs, as well as many ancient animal fossils. On the whole the signs were good and explanations easy to understand....

Plan for a lot of time here.. If you are museum buff and i am, it is going to take a lot of time because there is a lot of exhibits to cover. I did the top down tour and every floor has something special that will catch your attention. Kids will love the dinosaur exhibits so dont miss it....

Yes museums can be boring but not this one. An amazing building which combines the original museum with the crystal addition is just as spectacular inside as outside. The exhibits are first rate and laid out to allow you to get as deep into the information or not. Plenty of WOW factor exhibits visually for the kids, especially the dinos...

Very nice general museum, not as large or had the breadth of say NY's Met museum but very good. Pompei exhibit was well done. Way too much to see in one shot unless you have a lot of time and energy. One great thing they do is they have little kid friendly areas and touch exhibits all over the museum,...

ROM is amazing. The building architecture lets you know the treasures on display inside. The space is brilliant. You can get lost for the entire day. Lines move quickly. Staff are competent and polite. I have enjoyed permanent exhibits and visiting exhibits equally. I love the permanent Korean ceramics display. I have visited for many years and see new things...

If you have never traveled to Italy, then this exhibition should be seen. Although there has been a lot of research and work into putting it together, including a plethora of activities for children, I found it was like eating a cream puff: filling yet empty at the same time. The ROI (Return On Investment) was not worth the $28...

The spot just lacks heart and soul. The majority of exhibits are warehoused behind glass. You feel more like an observer or taking a history class. Definitely underwhelming considering the price! Tickets are nearing $30 mark for general admission with special exhibit.
This is a world-class museum with many good permanent and traveling exhibits. The Pompeii exhibit was magnificent.

Although I have visited Toronto several times, this was the first time that we were able to go to the ROM. Unfortunately we did not have sufficient time to see the whole museum but did see the very well put together Pompeii exhibit and the Canadian exhibit. My wife and I found the Pompeii exhibit very intriguing especially since we...

Went to the Royal Ontario Museum as part of a tour group. Our event was an after hours tour & catered dinner. The tour we had of the museum was excellent - our tour guide was a delightful, pleasant & enthusiastic young lady (she usually does tours for children). Just wish we had more time so we could have seen...

One of the reasons that we visit Toronto (from San Francisco) is to visit the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) which in addition to its excellent permanent collection always has mounted exciting temporary exhibits. On this occasion we chose not to include the Pompeii, but nonetheless found plenty to occupy us for the three or four hours we were there.

It has been a while since I visited the ROM and we were not disappointed as it had something for everyone: dinosaurs, bats, crystals, Canadian history, animals, ancient artifacts from Greece, Rome, Egypt, Europe, etc. .... We also had an opportunity to see the temporary exhibit Viva Mexico! and enjoyed it too. While wandering around, if we ever were lost,...

If you haven't been to the ROM in awhile, you are in for a treat. The permanent exhibits are excellent and made better and more interesting from our guide, Jodie Louth-Gray. We had the pleasure of experiencing a tour of Rome as well as an overview tour of the entire museum. Jodie made this tour lively and engaging. I would...

This museum has some extremely interesting things to see. My husband enjoyed the native American display, especially canoes and clothing of these first North Americans. But the Pompeii exhibition was a show stopper. So glad we paid the extra amount for this as it didn't disappoint. This is truly a must see!

Its one of the best tourist attraction in Toronto. We really enjoyed all the relics and fossils and all beautiful creatures also while we were visiting we have seen the actual Pappilon exhibits which definitely was awesome
Amazing collection. This is a combination natural history and science museum with just insightful and visually stunning exhibits. Great place for children and adults.

The ROM is already a beautifully laid out museum full of great exhibits. But I particularly wanted to see the Pompeii exhibition and I was not disappointed. Fashion, music, theatre, food, sexual preferences, politics, sport, art and religion of the inhabitants are presented using the artefacts from the ruined town. There is a lot to see in this museum, and I don't think I saw it all even though I thoroughly tired myself out walking around! The natural history (i.e. dinosaurs and other animals) section is fantastic and there are knowledgeable staff around and artefacts to allow you to get more hands-on. The Pompeii exhibit is well worth the time and extra money. To see melted artifacts and carbonized food was fascinating as well as pieces of façade and casts of people caught by the eruption. A great visual of the events that lead up to the explosion was very good.There were a lot of old coins and items from different...

Went to this exhibit last evening with my great-niece. A wonderful collection of about 200 artefacts from Pompeii and several nearby towns. Well worth the visit. Captions are in both English and French.ROM offers a lower price on Fridays between 4:30 pm - 8:30 pm ($21 adults | $19 seniors/students | $13 children 4-14 years - toddlers 3 &...

The Rom has a lot of cool field trip stuff going on. But it is expensive as hell. It used to be free one night a week, but they cancelled it! One thing that has been totally worth the money though is the "Friday Night Live" events, they are incredibly fun! I have been twice. It's way cooler than going...

The ROM attracts great international exhibits and the Pompeii exhibit is the latest example of a world class exhibit. The display encompasses an in depth look into Pompeii society up to the destructive volcano eruption that devastated the city and it's inhabitants. Well worth a visit to the ROM!

It's been a few years since I last visited the ROM and it's better than I remember. I was very interested in visiting the special Pompeii exhibit so I went with my daughter for the day.I didn't buy online which I normally would so had to wait in a long line. We enjoyed a Sunday morning visit to the ROM - what an amazing place! You need a few hours to navigate and enjoy and maze of interesting displays. Cool gift shop with nice products at reasonable prices too - still enjoying the ROM with a piece of amethyst on my desk!
This is an amazing place...enjoy the sites and learn new things. What's even more awesome is when they have an event going on and their are bands playing and various activities!
Good for everybody ....its very educational ...what i like the most was the photography..they are amazin

We bought a City Pass for Toronto and then went to as many things as we good to make it worthwhile. This seemed to be a good way to go in Toronto although not Montreal or New York. The Royal Ontario Museum is worth a visit, whether you live in Toronto or you are just visiting. From its amazing architecture to it wide variety of exhibits and galleried. There are dinosaurs, Mummies, bat caves and totem poles. The restaurant in the basement is good too.

A must do! I was pleasantly surprised with their exhibitions. This was my first trip to Toronto so I wanted to know the history of the Canadians and the museum had a good display of its early settlers and the Native American Indians who crossed the border to settle there such as Sitting Bull. Although I'm not a huge fan of museums the Pompeii attraction was totally amazing and worth the visit! We didn't miss any of the 4 floors, and on each floor there were things that caught our attention.
As a family who loves the occasional museum, we all enjoyed the diversity of the ROM. Art, sculpture and natural history intrigued all of us. (And a great cafe stop for lunch)

The ROM is huge and there is plenty to see. Whatever's your interests, you should find something you like there. I really enjoyed the Pompeii exhibit. Really nicely done with alot of interesting pieces.I would warn everyone though to plan your visit accordingly because it will take a lot of time to see everything. Me and my wife spent...
It was one terrible museum!No history about Canada at all. All exhibitions were just plastic. If you wanted to se the exhibition about Pomeji you had to pay another 11$.

It has been awhile since I was at the ROM and last week I went with friends to see the Pompeii Exhibit. I highly recommend anyone visiting Toronto to go a see this exhibit. This museum has it hall. The kids loved the dino area. With the city pass you skip the ticket area and go on through to the ticket takers. We only allowed a couple of hours to visit, I would say go there for longer. It was really busy when we were there with various day camp groups, so noise level...

The Museum has become very user friendly with lots of animation and technology that children will find absolutely fascinating.The dinosaurs as well as the full scale marine mammals is truly awe-inspiring.Come in good walking shoes - so muhc to see - so little time in one day.

One of the MOST WONDERFUL museums one ever been to. Spent 1/2 day here, BARELY skimmed the surface. I want to revisit Toronto and spend AT LEAST a full day there if not more. The exhibits are fascinating - the collections are spectacular. Can't say enough good things about this place!

We only visited for an hour, but spent 3 hours and had also lunch at the cafeteria. There are lots to see. My family enjoyed visiting this museum lots of things to learned & my kids enjoyed the fossils & dinosaur skeletons. Their kids play area is good & my children love it!

So many excellent exhibits. The Pompeii exhibition was excellent. Very hard to absorb all in one visit. More dinosaurs than you've seen in a long time. Limited time, make sure you include this on your itinerary.

So many things to see. Something for everyone. Kids always love the bat cave. The kind of place you can go to again and again. Easy to get to by transit as well (better than driving and parking!). Not to be missed!
I adore this museum. I could LIVE in this museum. Wonderful exhibits, tons of things to see and do all the time. A must see for any traveler to Toronto

This was my favorite part of the Toronto City Pass, I could have stayed all day! There are so many interesting things to see and learn about at the museum. I love this place. I visit every few years. Although most of the exhibits are the same.. It always draws a breath of newness. Visited on a Sunday to see the Pompeii exhibition. Well worth it! Advise that you enter before lunch when it is less busy

Start at the bottom and work your way up through the museum-the Pompeii exhibit is in the basement and not to be missed! The half-loaf of carbonized bread, the mosaics, glassware, and the paintings that survived are fascinating. Many interesting things to see and learn. If you are a full-time graduate student in Canada, you can even enjoy it for free on Tuesday afternoon.

My husband, daughter (7) and I spent 3 hours here. I highly recommend the introductory tour - it highlighted some of the exhibits and gave a good overview of the layout of the museum. Our guide was very knowledgeable, as were other employees who were in the different exhibits. Exhibits also have interactive touch screens which have a lot of...
Definitely worth going to with either your partner or family. allocate approximately 2-4 hours to completely see the entire Museum. Very educational and fun.

As you can see from the photo of Daniel Libeskind's 'The Crystal', which to me appears as some kind of metal monster besmirching the street and the beautiful classical architecture of the original, the ROM looks like a frightening place to enter. Yet once inside, the wealth and breadth of the exhibits is superb. I won't list them all or...

A great place to spend a few hours. You won't be disappointed. Parking in the area is somewhat limited, so if you are driving, be prepared to park a long ways away and walk. That said, there are many fantastic exhibits to see here. My favorite was the gold and gem area. You will enjoy seeing a real mummy and...

Although we loved our visit to the Royal Ontario Museum, I do have to mention one letdown. If you're ever in the Toronto area and are in the mood to learn and marvel at things you'd never known, then the ROM is the place for you!The building itself is great. It's well-maintained, clean. Offers restrooms. There is a restaurant that serves great meals.The exhibits are very interesting and extremely informative. There are a lot of...

If the fascinating look at other times and places is your thing , or maybe even not , this should not be missed.To peek into a part of the world that you have never looked at and find yourself with your mouth hanging open is great.Worth the price of admission with every room you explore.

When my family and I went to Toronto for a vacation everyone had high expectations for the Royal Ontario Museum. It was everything and more of what we had expected. When I'm in Toronto, I always make a point to visit the ROM. Frequent traveling exhibits mean there is always something new to learn, though I never tire of wandering through the old familiar halls. Pompei: In the shadow of the Volcano. Price $28.00 per person, price includes Pompei special exhibit and general museum admission.If you have not been to Pompei it is worth seeing.The exhibit features 200 artifacts, outlines the history of the City buried by volcanic ashes for 1600 years.

We're members of the ROM (for two years now) so have been to the ROM frequently (adult couple) and grew up going there as a kid. Have been to this museum a couple of times always something interesting to see for the whole family. Highly reccomend visiting at least once if you are going to be in Toronto even on a short stay!
We visited Italy before and we stilled enjoyed the Pompei exhibition at this museum. This is one of the most interesting museums I have visited in Canada.

We have been going here for decades, and love how at every visit we can see something new. The Pompeii exhibit is another fine example of the world class exhibitions you can see here!My neice loves the dinosaurs, my kids loved the First Nations area and we all enjoyed the variety on display from all over the world. A...
Out of towers and locals will enjoy this adventure. Amazing things to see. Plan to spend the whole day and see everything.

We have a membership and its wonderful. It allows us to bring guests at no additional charge which is nice. It really is a great place for kids. We go almost every week in the winter and my children have never become bored. The dinosaur exhibit is fantastic and the children floor is full of interactive activities. Highly recommend!
I've had just couple hours, but I wish I would spend whole day there. The next time I'm coming back to Toronto, I'm planning to spend whole day in this museum.

The museum is one of the best places that i like going to in Toronto. Very welll organized and interesting exhibits regularly. The displays are so well placed that one can spenmd a lot of time or hurry along as per the preference. This one is for sure a place i woudl keep going back to.

$17 admission might be a bit offputting but it's worth coming here just to see the striking frontage. You can get as far as the main hall with dinosaur skeleton for free but if you venture further this is a varied museum which will give you a pretty good understanding of both prehistoric and more contemporary Ontario.

The ROM is a top attraction in Toronto. It's a little unusual in that it's really two museums - one of culture and one of natural history, but in many respects the two go together (as they also do to a lesser degree in the American Museum of Natural History in New York). Great museum with interesting displays. Plenty of things to keep you occupied for hours. We managed to spent at least 4 hours in here and we still hadn't seen everything.When we went they had a great exhibition on Pompeii, with lots of things to look at!

I liked the museum, but there was not much to do for kids. The 4 and 6 year olds were bored. The teenagers liked the exhibit, especially Egypt and Pompeii. Perhaps I'm a little biased having seen the originals years ago....we were not impressed with this particular special exhibit. Not worth the extra $11 in addition to the $18 for general admission. Even the gift shop was lacking in comparison to past events.The ROM itself is still my favourite tourist attraction. The bathroom facilities have improved a bit. The...
Pompeii exhibit is historically interesting and a little unsettling. The vulnerability of humans is captured and tastefully represented.
The Royal Ontario Museum has a excellent collection of pieces covering natural history and world cultures. The "Pompeii: In the Shadow of the Volcano" exhibition was worth the extra admission fee.

I love the way the ROM looks from the outside and the inside. Located on Bloor, there on lots of things to do around the ROM as well. Bloor St. East is Koreatown and Bloor St. West there seems to be lots of boutiques and shops. Definitely a great tourist destination!

The Royal Ontario Museum was a bit of a letdown. While the building itself is beautiful, and they certainly have an amazing collection of historical artifacts from around the world, the presentation of the materials leaves something to be desired. I’m the type of person that wants to learn more about the time period and context of the artifacts that...

The kids enjoyed the animals (dinosaurs, stuffed animals on display) much like the zoo as well as the interactive play area. It was easily a 2 day trip for a 5 year old and a 3 year old but they are naturally inquisitive kids anyway asking lots of questions about the natural world. It was a bit pricey for a...
I loved the ROM, great both inside and out. They really inspire interaction and participation. I'd recommend taking your time to look around. The First Nations exhibit is beaut.

An excellent place to spend a whole day, but when there's a special exhibit it's even better. The Pompeii Exhibit costs extra but with that admission price you can see the rest of the place as well. A lot of the things displayed have never before left Italy so it is well worth the trip.

A mishmash of not very interesting replica artifacts. If you enjoyed being dragged around museums in the 70's and 80's this will be right up your street.Our kids 3 and 10 were very bored.Upside: Pompeii expo was good and they have a droxy's.In summary it's very out dated and expensive.

Worth a visit. The architecture of the two buildings is contrasting and, to me, both are beautiful. We went during the Pompeii exhibit which was okay. The Chinese and Asian exhibits are wonderful as was the earth exhibit with lots of geodes and other precious metals.

I had a great time at the ROM museum with my boyfriend.The collection of the museum is impressive. It's really diverse.There's almost a whole floor dedicated to kids. You can find dinosaurs, animals, bird, etc. I will bring my nephew there when I get the chance.Only downside is that we went on a rainy Sunday (bad idea)....
Rather small museum and it was very crowded. Perhaps we were just expecting more, but this is a very underwhelming museum considering the price.

Would give a 5 star, but didn't get to see everything. You definitely need more than 6 hours there. Lots to see and it's laid out well. It's been more than 25 years since I've been, quite an impressive improvement!

We went to see the Daphne Cockwell Gallery of Canada: First Peoples. This is an excellent collection of the native people's history. We also spent time enjoying the middle east gallery. There is lots more to come back for.

If ur lucky the Pompeii exhibition will still be running. It is absolutely amazing !! It tells the story of Pompeii the Italian city that was hit in the year 78 A.D. by the eruption of the Vesuvius volcano. When you enter the main hall, you are greeted by a massive Chinese dinosaur skeleton; they also have an amazing collection of dinosaur and prehistoric mammal skeletons in their fossil gallery. Such a neat and must-see stop. The entry fee is low and there's plenty of space to walk around with or without a stroller and rarely bump in to anyone. I don't tend to read every single exhibit so I was in and out in about an hour. If I had my kids with me, I'm sure we would have...
Spent nearly 3 hours here as part f the Citypass. Lots to see and more importantly interactive screens which the kids thought were great,
Very well done displays and lots of information, but we had only allowed about half of one day for touring the museum and only skimmed the surface. I hope for a return trip.

My family and I spend most of the afternoon of our second day in Toronto browsing The Royal Ontario Museum and it was spectacular. There is something for everyone to see. Although we didn't see all of it, my son did get to see dinosaurs exhibit and loved it. My daughter and I couldn't get enough of the Egyptian and...
Plan for a whole day. There was so much to see here that we just didn't plan right and missed so much. The building itself is beautiful but the exhibits are set up and arranged perfectly.

**Tips and Suggestions Summary at Bottom**I visited the Royal Ontario Museum at noon on a Saturday with a friend. This place was a nice surprise for us and a must for anyone visiting Toronto. We traveled to Toronto for the PanAm Games TO2015 and bought the city pass with 5 attractions. There are more artifacts on display at this Pompeii exhibit than at a previous Canadian exhibit a few years ago. You're going to need more than one day here. There are just too many exhibits to take in at once. This is a definitely a must-see for history buffs. There are exhibits on natural history and human history.
This is the natural history, archeology and cultural museum of Toronto. Phenomenal place, nearly overwhelming for this first-time visitor, but I loved it. Docent tours provide a good overview.

The ROM is huge and there is a lot to see. Our favourite part was the Pompeii exhibition, although you have to pay extra to see it.The rest of the exhibits were interesting, but there is a *lot* to see, so make sure you set aside plenty of time for your visit. Some of the exhibits are a little...

We walked from our hotel to the ROM, it was a beautiful day, and enjoyed the street scene. The ROM had a great exhibit on Pompii, which we really loved and the Dinosaure in the hall entrance was awesome. The building mixed the old and new architecture beautifully and it was a wonderful experience.

Great museum for adults and children alike. The dinosaur exhibits are great. The mummies, bat cave, etc. all good. Just wish they didn't charge a separate admission for the Pompeii exhibit. Great gift shop.
Some parts were very interesting to us, others not at all (furniture displays). Sad that you have to pay extra fees fir certain exhibits - seemed like another money grabber

The museum has a large collection from a number of different cultures. Huge museum full of endless exhibits on every topic imaginable: Native North American History, Dinosaurs, etc... During our visit there was also a temporary exhibit on the history of Mt. Pompeii

We took our kids to the ROM this past weekend (age 10, 8, and 3), and had a wonderful time. They have a very complete area of Canadian history and it helped me to know more about this country. It also has an special area for Kids that is awesome. The special exhibitions charge an adittional fee.
Went with my 7 and 10 year olds. Had a great visit with lots to see and do. Kids liked the dressing up and also the bone handling areas spent 5 hours there and could have spent longer.

The museum has a great collection for a city like Toronto. There are grander museums in bigger cities but the ROM is good especially for families. Our children spent lots of time here when they were young and they enjoyed it - the dinosaurs, the bat cave, even the middle Eastern and Roman collections. I still enjoy the Samuel European...

What first attracted me to the museuam was the architecture, but the Pompeii exhibit was the true gem and well woth the extra price. The museum itself was interesting, though similar to other Natural History Museums I have visited.

Huge collection of incredible exhibits and artifacts that could take you days to see. Very informative tour guides, and friendly staff. A must see in Toronto, but not the best for kids. Not very interactive, much better for a date or adults to enjoy.

As someone who works in cultural heritage, I'm usually hyper critical of museums. Our family of 4 recently visited the ROM again in order to see the exhibition on Pompeii. Brought the family to see and learn of different cultures. They have a lot various times and cultures represented but some of the exhibits have small collections. Loved the whole thing. Could be hard to find parking. Cafeteria is very good. The children enjoyed the rocks and minerals very much.

We came with our 2 children, 7 and 12. The 12 year old became a little bored. However, the discovery area for children is excellent - they both spent a lot of time in there. This museum is amazing. It has the most amazing Collection of Asian Art and artifacts. The building is pretty cool with a very modern entrance. It is one of our favorite Museums in the world(we have been to some all over the world). Plan on spending a whole day there. There was enough to keep teens engaged and interested. Special...
I loved it! It is huge, so make sure you have plenty of time if you really want to see everything. I could have spent the whole day there.

This museum must rank with the best in the country. It can be overwhelming, so leave yourself at least three hours to go through it, although for this visit we only had two hours so could not see all of it. One of my favourite places, and one of the best museums I've seen. There's always a new feature exhibit to be explored. So much to see and do!
We've seen a lot of Museum and this one has a clearly Canadian flare to it, especially in the First Peoples section. Great place to visit.
Great museum and we loved the Canadian expo . Spent most of a day here and really enjoyed it. Loved the Pompaii exit.

Visiting the ROM brings back so many great memories of school trips, that I continue to visit just to see my old favourites.The Museum itself is massive, and there're so many different halls & exhibits that there's something guaranteed to make you say WOW!Charge-up your camera battery, because you're sure to take lots of amazing pictures while you're...

I don't believe that the ROM is open anymore, well at least not for Laser shows.When I was growing up in Toronto they would periodically have LASER shows there along with music, it was a great place to spend a boring Sunday and listen to awesome music and see a great laser show as well.The shows I went...

Very comprehensive in the exhibits in terms of spanning the ages from the prehistoric to the modern day world. Especially liked the area concentrating on Canadian history as well as Ancient Asian civilizations. This is a museum which can be enjoyed by all ages and is well worth a visit.

Being a member is amazing - The ROM offers so many interactive activities for the children; especially during school break times. We love the bird shows, the dress up, Earth Rangers and the Bat Cave! The special exhibits are always a favourite! A fun day any day!

AMAZING!!! A TO MUST SEE!!!! Full size Dino skeletons! Knights Armour! Great for kids & adults! The 2015 special exhibit of Pompi is worth the extra too! JUST GO!!! I did find the map confusing tho ... the flow could be better. With the TO city pass a GREAT DEAL!!!! :) GO!

I loved this museum. So much to see and take in. I was particularly interested in the Pompeii exhibit and it was amazing. Great museum! I love that it's in the heart of the city and is easily accessible. Great exhibits and special exhibitions. I would say that ROM is similar to a Museum of Natural History in NYC (my favourite museum), somebody might find it a even more interesting. It is smaller but some exhibitions are more interesting. If you are going there in summer I highly recommend to bring a sweater along as the AC can be (after a few hours) very...
Nice, the best part was the Canadian history wing. Some things cost extra, which is always a downer.

In June of this year, we had visitors from Dallas, Texas and visiting the ROM was on their wish list so we went. I've lived here for 33 years and have no idea why I have never gone. Thoroughly enjoyed it! The Pompeii exhibit was the featured exhibit; it was absolutely fabulous! Never thought I would enjoy the ROM but...

The ROM pretty much covers everything-Ancient Egypt, Mesopotamia, Ancient China, Japan, Medieval times, Gothic, Baroque, natural history & ecology, Canadian history, the World Wars. The artifacts are great, as is the information provided.

I was really surprised to see the variety to things displayed at the ROM. Very well laid out and coordinated. Grab a free map which is colour coordinated and you can choose to spend time where you are interested in. It is nearly impossible to see the whole museum in a day if you want to admire all the artefacts....
I've been to the ROM many times & always thoroughly enjoyed myself. The Pompeii exhibit was truly enlightening but it did appear many of the regular artifacts weren't on display.
This is a huge museum with very diverse collections -- there is something for every age group. And a fun café in the basement.

I love going to the ROM and try to visit at least once per year. This year I took my husband to see the Pompeii special exhibit. I have been to Pompeii and to the Naples National Archaeological Museum, where the artifacts collected from Pompeii have been on permanent display, and I wanted my husband to have the opportunity to...
Huge Asian exhibit, nice Canadian exhibit & now the Pompeii exhibit makes it so worth your time! The outside of the building is a blend of old & ultra modern architecture.

The museum is good with LOT to see. Personally I am not a big fan of museums and have a lot of patience. If you have time then you can easily spend the whole day seeing and appreciating the displays. A bit difficult to navigate (usually most museums are) but with Map you can get around. Children would have fun....

The Royal Ontario Museum is always a wonder to visit and even though this was my 3rd time there, I always find things I don't remember seeing before. The building itself is beautiful, that staff is very friendly and helpful, and the selection of artifacts is enormous. Plan on spending several hours here.
I loved the dinosaurs, and all the other exhibitions, worth a visit, for sure. Don't remember how much is the entrance ticket, but if you like museums, you should go to the ROM.
My daughter has an annual family pass to ROM and we spent a whole morning roaming the ROM. I am impressed at the Chinese collection.

When I was in Toronto, this is the place that I love the most. I could spend more than a day there. There's so much things to see and learn... You don't realize how much time you spent inside the museum. It's wonderful, really!

I must admit that I have visited a number of nice museums in Paris and London (England) and this is not a museum of that caliber. But as for Toronto tourist sites, this is a nice place to spend an afternoon if you like history (of cultures and culture). I must admit, that I was tired when I visited the...

There's something for everyone here (kids will love the dinosaurs) (actually, everyone will love the dinosaurs) and it's very easy to find you've spent a good few hours wandering through it. Great shop, too.

enjoyed my visit to to the rom. rather espansive muse that takes more than three hours of your time. right now they have an exbitit on an old roman city detroyed by a volanco. well worth the extra cost. my only complaint about the rom is that you need to turn down your air conditioner. it was really cold. i...

The exterior architectural design is unique. Went there with my fiancé during a Friday evening when the price of tickets dropped to $10.00 for adults after 4:30pm. There is lots to see and truly requires a full day to see it all. We checked out the mineral, Canadian history, dinosaur, gallery of birds, Egypt and a couple others before it...

The ROM was a very interesting place with lots of cool interactive experiences that kept everyone entertained. Tween liked the real honeybee hive that can be viewed inside the museum! Tween and teen enjoyed the mining game in the minerals section. We were lucky to catch the Pompeii exhibit which has something interesting for all ages. Although we don't live...
Fabulous museum for the family. Many exhibits to interest everyone. Takes at least a day to see most of it.

This is a huge museum and a nice place to visit. This place holds cultures from different countries. It also has a science part.a very nice cafeteria to eat and drink on the first floor.I loved the European part because you could actually sit and listen to a recording explaining a different eras in European history.

Excellent Museum and well worth a visit. Easy to get to at the Museum stop on the Yonge (yellow) subway line. Open daily from 10 am until 5.30 pm with late night opening until 8.30 pm on Fridays. Much to see so plan at least half a day and don't forget to take the camera.
Excellent collection and layout of the museum. The China section is very impressive. I spent four hours and didn't finish, as there was so much to see!
If you have children, it is really educative and intuitive for them, but if you are simply interested and want to discover new thing, then it is a place you need to go to.

This place has something for everyone, stones & minerals, dinosaurs, fine china, statues, native history and belongings and much, much more. The only thing missing was a place to eat, I recommend packing a lunch and some water. Plus, plan on being there all day if you want to view everything. I truly enjoyed it there, it was very interesting...

Except for the prime nation section, most of the other sections are of very little interest. This musuem does not compare with other natural history museums in Europe nor Us and not to mention Chicago which this city tries to mimic, but still miserably fails though.
outstanding and you can spend the whole day here so much to see and do. Great for kids. Gems, peoples and cultures, art.
Loved the Rom. The best overall museum in Canada and great for either adults or children. Sure to ignite a love of learning and history in the little ones.
Very disappointed, walked into a room with a dinosaur sign. Room was empty. I enjoyed the "First People" exhibit and the rooms with the natural gems and stones.

I've visited Natural History Museums in UK, US so was expecting a bit more here. The ticket price was good because we went on a Friday after 4.30pm when they drop adult tix to $10 until late closing at 8.30pm. Usual opening times are 10am-5.30pm other days. Adult tix are $17 and kids are $14 (4-14).We wandered around the...

At first the admission seems high for a museum, but by the end of your visit you will feel like it was money well spent. This place has something from almost every country. The kids favorites were of course the dinosaurs and the hands on areas. The staff were friendly and took the time out to talk to the young...

My family buys annual memberships here, and we are never disappointed, whether it's just my wife and me or the whole family. The kids always gush over the fossils; and my wife and I always enjoy the featured exhibit downstairs. I am so grateful to have fellow humans whose passion is knowledge and contributing that knowledge to others in the...

I took my boys, 10 and 13, to see Pompeii: in the Shadow of the Volcano while visiting Toronto. It’s a well put together exhibit with several different aspects to explore. Some of our favorite displays were the volcano itself; the casts of the bodies, and the jewelry. It was thoughtful of the curators to place the phallic and eroitic...
This museum is very big and great, even for kids. We spent half a day but easily could have spent an entire day here.
Our museum is truly the same caliber as any European one .Nothing to dislike in the museumBat cave brought back great memories for us as did the dinosaur exhibit
I think there is a bit of someone for everyone's interest whether you like looking at rocks or artifacts. At the time we were visiting, there was a special exhibit on Pompeii that was worth seeing.

The ROM is a must visit. if possible, more than once. There is something that would interest everyone, young or old, male or female. I suggest you go there early in the morning so you can really explore and learn the whole day.
There is something here for everyone. We especially liked the display on mummies. The dinosaur bones were interesting too!

This museum is almost unique in the fact that it is both a museum of natural history and of world cultures. If you want to do the museum ''properly' then plan on being there for the whole day. During the summer they have late events on Fridays. Part of the Toronto CitiPass.

There is so much to this museum, you need more than one visit. The Far Eastern exhibits are world class, as are the dinosaurs and the natural history section (e.g., more than one stuffed Passenger Pigeon), but there are lots of other things to see as well.The design of the modern addition is daring. I think it's ugly but...

The ROM is huge and full of different galleries and displays. It it as complex of buildings, really, and not the easiest thing to navigate as a result, however, once you understand how it is laid out (and if in doubt, ask the volunteers) you can really enjoy it. It is impossible to see everything in a day. I am...
