Always a great time at the ROM. My boyfriend took me and we had such a great time. There is lots to see and lots of things to do. I a meager to return again because we had such a great time.Staff members are around to help with directions, and were always eager to help. The museum is massive...

We have been members of the ROM for years, and the kids have always loved 'the dinosaur museum' in its glitzy crystal renovation done a few years back. But the focus on the renovation had left out the real fun of the place, and leadership wasn't completely convinced that the ROM was for children. (I remember entering the elevator with...

This museum is huge, since when you get with the building and see the amazing structure. you will need all day if want to explore the entire ROM, but you could take a fast trip also, there are very cool expositions that you need to pay apart, it is so big as the MOMA, and has diferent floors for diferent...

This museum is not about artistic masterpiece paintings, it's more practical than that. It has a Jurassic section, a bat cave, world crafts, curiosities, a great cafe and the Pompeii special exhibit was FANTASTIC.

While not being a massive fan of museums I decided to visit the ROM during my trip to Canada. Firstly, it's big so if you want to see all the exhibits be prepared to do a lot of walking. During my visit some of the halls were closed due to setting up for new exhibits so that did take the...

The ROM has done an amazing Job over the last few years to hold a special exhibition to make you want to visit it more than once per year.I like the rock and precious stone collection, dinosaurs and normally they have some special exhibition that you must see.Check it out. A treasure in Toronto and if you have...

My husband, 11 year old son, and I visited in July and we enjoyed it very much. The museum has lots to offer...'natural history', dinosaurs, gemstones, Chinese historical artifacts...this was part of the CityPass- one of 5 attractions and the one my son really wanted to do. You could easily spend 3 or more hours or do it quicker like...

There is so much to see and do at this museum. Of course the dinosaurs are a big draw, but we all really enjoyed the gems and minerals exhibit as well as the Egyptian exhibit with the mummies. We did not see the whole museum , ran out of time,had two tired children. Definitely will return to see other exhibits....

Dinosaurs, Egypt, Rome, you can see everything here!Lots of special visiting exhibitions which makes a membership worthwhile if you live in the city.Great stop for tourists as well, but do plan on a rather full day here.

My son and I recently spent an overnight at the ROM sleeping in the grand Atrium and having access to a vast portion of the museum. What an incredible experience it is to enjoy a late night snack; visiting exhibits with the interpreters present to answer questions in the evening and on the next morning and be served an early...
An absolute delight - the exhibitions are so beautifully curated that you are drawn to the art work unconsciously. The architecture of the building is even more spectacular :)

Ok it is not the Louve or the Met but it is worth a visit, the staff in there are awesome they know there stuff. Location in the centre of the city makes it awesome do some shopping in Yorkville after !

The ROM is a wonderful place for exploring history. The fashion exhibits were closed for new exhibits. I'm eager to return and see what's new. There are often special exhibits like the Dead Sea Scrolls or Body Works. As a resident if Toronto I like to bring visiting family and friends for a few hours of intrigue.
Young woman telling about her own personal journey into old traditions of her ancestors and her ambition to pass values and culture on to her son. Very special moment

I went to the ROM specifically to see the Pompeii exhibit and it was great. The show was well designed with different themes and some hands on activities for kids and adults. The show was really planned out well and I really enjoyed it. I didn't get to see the rest of the museum but it looked like a great...

We have been many times when our likds were little, by ourselves and with other adult friends, and most recently with grandkids aged 4 and 11. There is always something interesting for folks of any age. The play area is particularly good when the kids are getting tired of walking around. There was something to suit everyone's taste in the...

We enjoy the ROM There is always something new to see and the special shows are interesting and exhibited well.Even if you have been there many times seeing things again are also fun We try to take visitors there The restaurant is very good both food service and price

Reservedly, we decided to take our 6 and 4 year olds to the museum, mainly for dinosaur exhibits. It had been a long day already, so maybe that is tilting this ranking, but we all were less than enamored with the dinosaur and mammal exhibits, and even the bat cave, as the 2nd reason to go, left us disappointed. We...

This museum has different exhibits for different publics, my kid loved the dinosaurs one, they have camps for kids in the summer, and the organization of everything is great. You need to organise and plan in advance. On Fridays they have a special rate on the afternoon.
Visited during the Pompeii exhibit. Very nicely laid out with pieces that everyone will recognize. The museum is very friendly and has very good design and layout. We will be back.
So suitable for the young and old. There are so much to see yet so little time. A whole day spent there would be very nice. The museum guides are really friendly and knowledgeable too~

Okay, right up front I will say that I'm not a huge "museum fan", even though I've visited many of the great museums around the world. I grew up visiting the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) at regular intervals and I believe it to be a world-class attraction, albeit on a smaller scale than say, the colossal Met or Museum of...
Two of the most fascinating subjects for all ages as well as all the other exhibits in a museum, the Pompei exhibit is well done and what child would not love the dinasaurs exhibit?

This museum covers much more ground, literally and figuratively, than I anticipated. Some exhibits are quite easy to navigate - dinosaurs, for example. But others are more nuanced and flow among geography and/or periods without much of a warning, so it might be beneficial to make a plan in terms of the path you want to take. The bulk of...
we spent half the day today at the museum. we watched the viva Mexico and Pompei show. great learning experience. kids loved it.

I'm not a huge fan of museums so knew what to expect and it was standard. Lots to see on many floors, the dinosaur collection is impressive and I could have spent hours in the gem/stone area. I personally like the building on the outside but if you take the City Sightseeing bus they give a good debate on the...
A excellent museum with great exhibits from many parts of the world and well explained. Allow plenty of time.

I had been to the ROM in the early 2000's before it's most recent renovation. Boy, what a difference it makes! The ROM is so much brighter and open! We spent about 2.5 hours at the ROM and we barely touched the collection. You could really spend a lot of time here. We focused specifically on the European Galleries, the...
Theres so much to see and do here, hours of exhibits, Stuff you will never see anywere else.If you have a few hours to spend you will not be disappointed in the museum
Very large and lots of things to see but not really what I would consider a great choice for a family outing. My family and I were kind of disappointed in the section on Canada.

The ROM has something for everyone. I really enjoy looking at our history as a species and find that nearly all aspects of the ROM are well appointed and cover the basics. Their special exhibits are always pleasant when one wants to delve deeper into a specific culture or historical path.

I'lll admit to a bias in visiting the ROM. I had discovered a couple of years ago that my Great Great Uncle, George Crofts, had been instrumental in the establishment of the ROM'S extensive collection of Chinese artefacts and the prime reason in going to Toronto was this connection. I wasn't disappointed as the George Crofts Collection was massive and...

What a fabulous building and exhibits. After not visiting for many years...it was incredible to see the renovated ROM building. Where the dinosaur exhibit is...is purrfect with the open windows and diamond point of the building as background. Great photos to be taken there!

What a great museum.. They have a little bit of everything. The 2 main exhibits we spent a lot of time in were the dinosaur bones, and the rocks, minerals section. We only had about 2 hrs to tour it before it closed, and we missed an entire floor. I would set aside a good 4-5 hrs to see everything.....

What a beautiful, well-organized museum! We were fortunate enough to get to see the Pompeii exhibit, which is totally worth the extra $10 when you make it to the end. The rest of the museum is so well laid out and easy to follow from early to late exhibits and the map is easy to understand what can be found...

This is a very large museum that has something for everyone. They have vast collections from Canadian history to ancient peoples all over the globe, gems, fossils, fashion and more. They also have special exhibitions every year that are excellent and encourage multiple visits. They have had really neat ones such as the Terracotta Army and African Dinosaurs. The latest...

The mixture of the old and new makes the ROM visually compelling from the outside. This continues inside as you visit the dinosaurs up through modern times in Canada. The collections, with a focus on cultural significance of various regions of the world, made the visit meaningful to me as an individual. Wonderful. The focus on the First Nations added...

The museum is good , but not excellent. The museum has variety of items and it reflects different cultures across the globe.But the collection is not that excellent.Although it is a good time pass for the kids.

i grew up going to the ROM on a regular basis for field trips and with my dad on PA days. We moved away from the city, but I didn't leave my love or fascination behind. The exhibits are fantastic. So well done and interesting. You could easily spend a couple of days in there without seeing everything there is...

Good museum with varied exhibits from dinosaurs to African modern art. Took the free highlights of the museum tour. This was interesting and took me to areas of the museum I would usually not have visited.

If you are visiting Toronto, put the Royal Ontario Museum on your list things to do. Many floors to explore. so much to see. best to take a half day to see everything. Best of all the yellow line subway drops you off at the Royal Ontario Museum.

I enjoy museums, and it had been quite some time since I had been here. I skipped the Natural History parts of the museum and concentrated on the other parts. I enjoyed it a lot. I especially enjoyed the Asian art section. Cafeteria offered good healthy food (salads) that I enjoyed.I'm always torn about the kind of rating to...

This was the one place we wanted to visit on our trip to Toronto and it did not let us down from the mix of modern and old architecture of the building the the displays on show it was brilliant.We could have spent more than one day here as we did not mange to see everything the museum had...
Very impressive collection for a Canadian museum. Well organized and displayed...with more sitting benches than any museum in the world (relative to its traffic). Toronto can be proud!

Visited the museum in fall of 2014, forgot to finish this review at the time. Was particularly appealing due to the way they set up the exhibits to be able to be seen in relatively short order. Employees were especially helpful with explanations

Mom, dad, grandma, and a 7 and a 9 year old little boy with short attention spans absolutely loved this museum. Lots of dinosaur displays and hours of other things to see. Pompei exhibit was worth the extra few dollars.

We toured the museum on a rainy day, four floors of exhibits, ranging in Chinese, Mexican, Canadian artifacts. Dinosaurs, etc.I especially enjoyed the Canadian exhibit with history, as well as paintings, furniture, etc.
Pompeii exhibit worth the admission. We always get something out of our visits. We go to the ROM whenever there are special exhibits. Easily can spend a half day.
Mesopotamia exhibit was outstanding as are all of the usual displays and especially liked the striking outer facelift.

Nice variety but it would be great if they had some more kid-geared activities throughout the various exhibitions, like I spy look for's, or some more audio / interactive features to keep kids interested while parents explore. The kid section is nice, but geared more to young children and parents are limited to that one area while the kids play....

Now, this museum is great! But if you know your way around many museums, this isn't really much different. It holds small artifacts and pieces from a wide variety of eras and settings, but not too many for each. It has a big Dinosaur exhibit which is wonderful for the kids, and several rooms about Ancient Asia; Egypt, Japan, Mongolian...

I have a family Membership and I suggest this is a good way to go. You support a great museum and can attend often. I never tire of the permanent exhibits and the feature exhibits are always wonderful. Wonderful place for children of all ages
The displays and collections are fantasic. The new entrance is awful. The old entrance had so much more character and grace than this new architectural monstrosity.
Love this museum - best in the city! Fabulous gift shop too with many wonderful things to buy from all around the world.

The museum has free walking tours every Wednesday and Sunday (rain or shine) in the summer. The tour is about 2 hours long and starts in different parts of downtown. The guide is very informative and gives history of the neighbourhood and points out the unique architectures.
The ROM always has interesting exhibits and great staff. There are attractions there for all ages and demographics.

There are so many exhibits at the ROM and they change their special exhibit once per year. We had an annual pass and it was definitely worth the money because we were able to go back many times and really take our time in each exhibit. Really well presented!

Only a short distance frm the Toronto Downtown core by the metro you will find the ROM and you want be disappointed.. Has great exhibits for the family and history buffs alike, from First Nations to Dinos you find it..
I don't go there very often. This is why I am always excited over there because there are so many things to see and learn.

We only went to the Pompeii exhibit, but it was beautifully curated with a lot of interactive elements. First, you got to know the people and their lives. Seeing the casts of their forms at the end felt more moving because you could imagine them, at that point, as people you could know.

A trip to the ROM as Torontonians affectionately call it, is always an adventure. While the permanent exhibitions are not to be missed, special exhibits are always a must-see. Viva Mexico, Clothing and Culture is visually stunning. I wandered among the exhibits, marveling at the intricate sewing work of so many beautifully designed traditional Mexican clothes. It's a fascinating tour...

I had visited the ROM last Summer. I have visited many museums in Canada, Europe and The USA, and I thought for the size of Toronto I found the ROM a little disappointing. Not bad, I just expected more.
The ROM has so many great attractions for parents and children. The displays are informative and interactive.
I was astounded with the quality and the diversity of the collections at this excellent museum. I love this place as a semi-regular place to visit! Great job, people!

This is a fantastic museum, definitely worth checking out even if just for the dinosaur exhibit and the gemstone/mineral exhibit. Absolutely amazing! Coming from London, I have to say that the ROM's dinosaur exhibit beats the Natural History Museum one by far.

not bad, great selection of exhibition. However, if you previously visited european museums, such as British Museam, the one in Paris, Berlin... you will not see nothing new and won't be impressed. But it is nice place to spend time in.
My husband and I often go to the ROM and it never gets old there's lots of history and natural history to explore and of course the bat cave! Great fun for everyone who loves discovery.
If you like museums this one is nice. The collection of Dinosaurs - many from the North american Continent was intriguing. The Bat Cave is one of the coolest attractions I have ever seen in a Museum.

Took in the FNL (Friday Night Live) event at the ROM this past weekend with friends and it was a ton of fun.Several bar stations are scattered around the museum, each level has a "club" area with dancing, tables and a bar, and you can wander most of the exhibits (some are closed to beverages, so you can't take...

Your journey to the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) begins with your disembarking at the Museum TTC Station. The station is outfitted with faux pharaohs, totems, and other museum quality items that get you in the mood for a day of museum discovery. Situated in an ornate older building, the ROM has recently added a very modern front entrance that lets...

Another must see when visiting Toronto. A little advice: When visiting reserve the whole day for the ROM because there's just so much to see that if you try to fit it into a half day you won't appreciate it as much.
I've been to the ROM many times and I always manage to learn something new! They have great special exhibitions that come on from time to time. But their regular exhibitions are cool too!

I purchased the adult admission plus the Pompeii admission. Keep in mind that if you are a student, you can get the student rate. Although it says ages under 25, presenting a driver’s license to prove you are under the age of 25 is not enough, you actually need your student card.I went as a group of 7 people...
Excellent to bring kids learn about the Museum good tour in there teaching kids about our history so fund to go with groups and kids
ROM offers so much for every age. Be ready to spend the day exploring, learning and having fun! Easy to get to by subway or car.
This is another family attraction and must see in Toronto. This is a whole day trip huge museum with too much to see. Very clean and organize museum. Nice to see the Pompeii exhibit just amazing.

This museum is first class. I took a small group of high schoolers and we spent hours and only left when our feet got too sore to go on! The visiting exhibit was engaging, and the rest was as good as museums in major cities around the world. I will go back.

I was there for an evening function - several floors (not all) were open to us to wander around. The place looks very good… many interesting exhibits - different kinds and different styles. If one is interested in details, one can spend a lot of time there. It is not located at the best place to walk around in dark...
Always so much to see and do at the ROM. A great way to spend a weekend or even a week day if your off. City pass is a great idea so you can see the whole city as well. Enjoy! xx

Good museum with some excellent elements. We especially liked the exhibition on the people of Canada and the dinosaurs. The orientals areas seemed too big in comparison, would have preferred it the other way round.

We really enjoyed our visit to the Royal Ontario Museum. The exihibits were beautifully displayed and there was so much to see, we did not see it all even though we were there for more than 4 completely engaging hours. Children of all ages would love it as there is something for all. The volunteer helpers and guides we met...

We were very disappointed with the museum closing at 5:30. We had plans earlier in the morning so could not get there until lunch time, with so much to see 5 hours was not nearly enough time :( The cafe in the basement was really great for taste, cost and selection!

Very good museum huge collection of many culture of different parts of world; chienis, korean, indian, iranian, japaneez,, and many more. A vast collection of nature animals and birds and small incest to large downpours. A very good place to learn socioal life and history. You will need 3-4 hours if u like all this still you could nt finish....
We found the museum to be a bit disappointing. It has dinosaurs, stuffed animals etc but it didn't really do it for us!
the best exposition of this museum is dinosaur, kids will love that. for the rest its the same thing as other museum

Primarily went for the Pompeii exhibit, which was awesome and highly interesting. Unfortunately, I had to catch my flight home to Edmonton so we did not have much time to see the rest of the the museum, but we did walk through the dinosaur exhibit and I was not very impressed. It was small and limited. My friend, who lives...

We have visited the ROM countless times and there is always something new to discover. Not just new exhibits but even the galleries offer up new revelations of something you have stared at for years. The ROM never ceases to amaze me. And I will always be grateful for that.
the varied architecture of this great Canadian university is totally worth a walk around! Modern and traditional are blended in well balanced proportions!
We visit every year for the special exhibits. The rest of the museum is very accessible. Something for all ages.

This is definitely a day's visit in itself. There are many floors and exhibits for everyone, from dinosaurs for the little ones to ancient Greek, Roman, Egyptian ruins for the adults. Glassware and furniture for the crafters in your family to enjoy. Coins, mummies, and a giant Loonie coin. Everything was great.
Strange building. Yes, I love modern architecture, love Guggenheim Bilbao etc, but this ???Can they please remove the modern part ?Did I say : please ?

soooo much to do here!...something for everyone...Ancient Cultures, Fossils & Evolution, Canada, Textiles & Fashions, Biodiversity, Earth & Space, Contemporary Culture and World Art & Culture...Kids can enjoy the Dinosaurs and Bat Caves...fun for adults too! :)We had our CityPass for admission (saved money) and the front desk was helpful because we had limited time so we asked for...

The ROM is a fascinating museum. It has a very varied and fascinating collection that could let spend days inside top see everything properly, but even a short visit is worthwhile. On top pf the collection there is the added attraction of seeing the new extension of the building, which though controversial, is quite interesting!
Always has great galleries. The permanent collection is well curated, the temporary galleries are always interesting.

Overall this was a great find and experience while I was in Toronto. Plan to spend at least two to three hours here going through the exhibits. There were lots of fascinating discoveries most notably the Pompeii exhibit, which was worth the additional admission charge and the highlight of this museum experience. I walked away learning so much more than...

This is a great generalist museum, everyone who goes can find an exhibition that appeals to them. It has everything from dinosaurs to ancient Roman coins. Moving about the museum is a bit confusing as you move through doors that look like emergency exits and stairways pretty often. I also would have liked more written information in certain areas and...

It was very pleasant to walk amongst the dinosaurs and the mummies, but the crowds of school groups made it a little hard to feel that I could linger. On the one hand, I would have been hard to get up close and stop to read (or ponder) given the bustling rush of excited kids; and on the other hand,...

Overall good experience. The building itself is the most interesting and surprisingly effective marriage of disparate architecture styles I have ever seen. The children were enthralled with all the dinosaur skeletons. Check out the giant sloth. They have a very large exhibit of taxidermied birds. Some may be sensitive to this exhibit. There was a wonderfully talented harpist playing in...

The ROM has always held a special place in our family's hearts. Our kids grew up eagerly anticipating their visits to the Bat Cave and the Dinosaurs. This is a gem for visitors to Toronto and Toronto area residents.
This museum has a great, expansive dinosaur exhibit. There is also a good kids' interactive (play) area. However, beyond these areas, there was not much to hold my family's attention.

Visited the ROM during a murder mystery from Urban Capers. The museum is home to a large collection of fascinating objects and the exhibition pompeii had just opened the day we visited. Excellent collections and full of information, highly recommended visit.
There is a lot going on for this Museum. Every Friday night you can come drink and party with friends! Its called Friday night at the Rom. And their stuff is amazing. I recommend this.

Do not miss this attraction if you are visiting Toronto! Well worth the admission fee, we all thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the Royal Ontario Museum. Honestly we could have gone on multiple days to make sure we saw everything. Go now so you can see Pompeii, what an amazing look into this ancient city.

column3: Washington, District of Columbia, District of Columbia, United States
column4: In fairness, we went when the Pompeii exhibit was on display. It was a great experience and I literally felt taken back in time. The rest of the museum is also pretty cool with numerous artifacts from all over the world (including numerous coffins from Egypt). Seeing a real mummy up close (with a toe sticking out of its shroud)...
This was for sure a must when I was visiting Toronto. They had some amazing exhibits up when I got the chance to visit and I was so glad I could! Would recommend the ROM to everyone.

We started off strong with our comfortable shoes & map in hand. We made it through the dinosaur exhibit before we all grew tired. The museum is nicely curated & dare I say "cozy". We were sure to take lots of breaks & enjoyed the bee exhibit & the expert lessons along the way.
Very informative and insightful view of both the culture and people of Pompeii and the disaster that befell them.

We spent almost six hours here and still did not see everything.This has to be one of the best museums we have ever visited.The staff are friendly and informative and in most areas you can take pictures.The highlights for us were :The Pompeii Exhibition, The Dinosaurs and Europe:Evolution of Style.The building both old and new...

This is an excellent museum with plenty to keep all ages entertained. We paid an additional charge to visit the newly installed Pompeii exhibition which was excellent. We spent 5 hours (including a break for brunch) and could have stayed longer. Particularly liked the dinosaurs and the Bat Cave which was something I hadn't seen in a museum before -...

Nice museum with a singular design and good infrastructure (there is a great cafeteria underground). Its collection is large and quite varied, including mummies, Greek and Roman busts, several specimens of typical local animals and plants. A highlight is the fossils and the gigantic dinosaur skeletons. Easy access by the sightseeing tour bus, as well as the subway. Good attraction...
Not to big not to small. You should be able to tour this museum in less than 3 hours. Easy access by train ir walking depending on your hotel location

I spent at least four hours looking and could have spent four more. Its a history museum, everything from dinosaurs to tribal Indian life and on and on. Kids love it, old people love, It's a great way to spend the day.
This summer, don't miss the exhibit on Pompei. The permanent exhibits are also very extensive but you have to take and have the time to fully appreciate this facility.

After getting burnt during our outdoor brunch, we needed a shady activity and the museum was perfect. Exhibits were quite interesting and engaging.Best exhibit? Leave it to the Canadians to make a parallel of the ice hockey gear to the armor of knights. It's brilliant!

My 14 year old grandson and I went to visit the ROM on Saturday June 13/15, we went because my grandson actually asked to go. It was a very good experience - so much to see we were lucky because we actually went for the opening of the POMPEII exhibition. There is so much to see and enjoy a must...

We visited the ROM to see the new exhibition, "Pompeii, in the Shadow of the Volcano". The exhibit was really interesting, not too creepy or upsetting for young children. The quality of the artifacts was amazing, and the displays were thoughtfully layed out with lots of room to view them from all sides when called for. The whole museum had...

The ROM is much too big for a single visit. I'd pick one or two areas of interest, concentrate on them, and plan to come back. Membership is not expensive and lets you sign your kids up for Saturday morning club and summer camps where curators give them first-hand exposure. Dinosaur fans will love the ROM but we'd also pick...

A great museum, one of the best natural history museums I've been too. I mainly visited the fossils, biodiversity and rocks/minerals exhibits. Not too crowded, though unfortunately there were several groups of young school kids tearing around and yelling, but it was otherwise quite nice.Staff in the gift shop were great, and food in the restaurant was good.

The museum was featuring a Mexico exhibit when we went and I don't believe I ever saw anything Mexican. Instead there were lots of statues with "do not touch" signs and children with their hands all over them. I was overwhelmed with the sheer vastness of the museum but unimpressed with the collection as a whole.
So many different exhibits here - geology, archaeology, and more! I've been back twice since my first visit and I always find more to see when I go. Definitely a must see if you visit toronto.

It's new look makes it more appealing and the urban position is easy to reach. It is a great museum that offers many historical and scientific exhibitions. You can go there any day and be amazed of its content and artifact as you can go in groups or by yourself. The special exhibitions are worth the extra price on top...

Dino exhibits are great there is a lot to look at and we only really covered the 2nd floor in our 5 hour trip with a break for lunch in the basement cafe which had a good selection and ok prices. Don't miss the $1,000,000 gold coin on 3rd floor.

I liked almost everything but the collection of rocks and stones was most impressive. Better than any art gallery. You will be amazed to see the collection. Then, almost always, there is a touring exhibition. You might get lucky to catch one of your interest. Do not miss the Dinosaurs and other related skeletons
Certainly an amazing place with lots of things to see! Could easily spend a whole day here learning about history, culture, environment and much more. Worth the visit!

At $17.00 per adult this is one of the best attractions in downtown Toronto. Reading other reviewers I would agreed that layout was challenging and the flow on each floor was awkward with doubling back. That aside, I loved this museum. The building itself is amazing with the clashing of two very different architectural styles. The bird exhibit was great...

There is a lot here. From the bat cave (our kids favourite) to giant dinosaurs, gemstones, suits of armour, interesting widgets. Its all here. This is a must visit location in Toronto. You can spend a whole day and more. Great gift store.
Unique designed museum with lots of different theme is good for all range of ages. But the direction is not pretty clear, sometimes I got lost in the museum.

I have a soft spot for buildings whose architecture clashes with itself, and the ROM is a good example: an ultra-modern glass structure tacked on to a staid, granite early 20th century main building.The Canadian history section was meh, unless you really like provincial furnishings. The section on First Nations, though, was much better than I expected, more informative...

Museum contains a wide variety of exhibits ranging from Greek/ Egyptian archaeology to stuffed animals. It is spread over 4 floors and covers a lot of the Canadian history. Th use of the floor space means you find yourself doubling back and good luck trying to find the lft to the 4th floor
I was impressed by this museum. Its very large and, in my opinion, you could easily spend a full day here. They have many great exhibits. I really enjoyed the dinosaurs exhibit.

My first introduction to the ROM was Robert Sawyer's book, Calculating God. Aliens land in front of the museum and command: "Take me to your palaeontologist." From that moment on I wanted to visit, so when I found myself with an afternoon to kill in Toronto, the ROM was my first choice. I'm sure the CN tower is really cool,...

I chose this museum as I read quite a lot about its natural history exhibits and thought it sounded good, well bits of it were good ie. the dinosaurs were really cool and they have quite an extensive collection. I expected more in the way of modern taxidermy animals but the maple forest really stood out, as you walk into...

The museum overwhelmed me. It was too much for me to see all the arts on all floors in a days visit. I concentrated more on the Chinese, Japanese, Korean arts which is located on the first floor right side. The chairs are also quite impressive.

This is a large, well appointed museum. It has a very dynamic and varied collection that spans everything you could be looking for; from culture to art, natural history to ecology, it's all here.Plan to spend a solid full day at the museum to enjoy it fully. It is well arranged and organised, with lots of information on the...
Overall, this museum has diversified itself by juxtaposing its dinosaurs with with contemporary architecture, in a very Canadian way.

I feel compelled to visit museums whenever I visit a new place so it only makes sense that I'd visit one in Toronto. Nestled in the midst of the bustling downtown, this place is a driver's nightmare. But once you manage to get past the maddening traffic, you'll love the experience. ROM continues to update the galleries which always makes...

Just took my four youngest grandchildren (aged 8-11) to the museum for the first time, and they LOVED it !! They couldn't have been more excited than if they had got a free trip to Disney World (in fact they said they would rather go to the museum any day !!) We spent nearly six hours there, and never once...

The management of the ROM has spent a lot of money on flashy additions that look like they would have caused numerous expensive, technical challenges. That is money that has probably contributed to very high entrance fees and a lack of money available to develop new exhibits. They have the same exhibits I saw as a child fifty years ago....
You could spend days at the ROM and still not see everything. There really is something for everyone- make sure you plan out your visit to make sure you get to the exhibits you most want to visit.
So much to see, but also beautiful and amazing things to see. The kids loved it. The dinosaurs were fantastic. So many of them and so big.Definitely a must to do for a day.
So much to see, lots of excellent dinosaurs, good restaurant on the lower level, too. A must-see when visiting Toronto.
This museum has excellent dinosaur and cultural exhibits. I could not recommend it more! I wish the pass would cover 2 days instead of one.

By far the most disappointing place I have visited in Toronto very confusing and no real flow to the museum at all. We thought that this would be a better place than theScience museum to visit, more adult but the museum itself felt very disorganised and puzzling. The only bit in this museum we felt was any good was...

Friday Night Lights is the bomb! It's a great night out. It's a classy mix of art and style with a little bit of a club feel. There's awesome food and beverage (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). There are cool shows and exhibits throughout. Live musicians and performance artists, DJ's and lotsa people. Food and beverages are not allowed into many of...
Think of it as of Toronto version of the British museum. Focus on natural history, various ancient cultures. The building is very nice too, both the older and a newer part.
Great place to visit for everyone. Sections dedicated for little ones with hands-on activities and showings. We have an annual membership and it's worth it!

Mandatory for those who are visiting museums. Has some interactive boards to simulate animals sounds and texture (very amazing). The architecture of the museum is a mix of old and new, old and modern, really impressive.Easy to get by car, bus or walking (my choice).The museum has so many sections and, culturally, fills so many aspects of history,...

If you have been to the Louvre or any other museum worth its salt, the ROM looks like a confusing collection of donations. Kids will have a great time but its not a museum for serious adults as they dont have any attraction which can be called a masterpiece. There is a section which has furniture ?? that too early...

Went on my latest visit to Toronto only because the pricey entrance fee was discounted half price on a Friday evening. The museum lay out is most confusing - not even the help desk knew exactly where things were. Was able to finally locate the Canadiana section which was what interested me the most. Don't know if is even worth...

The entrance fee of only $17 was a bargain.Exploring only the Canadian exhibit on my first visit including watching the fabulous 1912 film Nanuuk of the North took 3 hours. Plenty of strategically placed seats to rest, and lots of very excited school groups visiting. The ROM is noisy, busy and fun - as a museum should be -...
Well worth the visit but plan a full day as we could only spend a portion there due to commitments but is very large and spacious and lots to see.

The exhibits at the ROM are world class. I go to museums everywhere I travel and the ones here are as great as any where. We happened to walk in as a lecture was starting about the dinosaur triceratops. It was well worth the stay. If you are taking kids you must see the dinosaur exhibit. They have a great...
The Royal Ontario Museum is a must see when you are in Toronto. A fantastic building, there are many great exhibitions to be seen inside. Enjoy the Dinosaurs!
Big museum. Its very crowded in the summer. Go early to be at the front of the lline to get in. Be ready to wait to see displays.

Rocks, minerals, gems, precious stones and the dinosaur displays are areas where the museum really excels. The animal sections are only slightly less interesting. Other sections of the museum include Chinese, Korean and Japanese culture displays. European history is also quite significant within the museum. You can easily spend 3.5 he's within the museum seeing the most interesting areas and...
So much history to explore through art. It was very well done. My young daughter did not think she would have a good time but the fashion exhibits won her over. We will be back.

I'm not really a museum going person, but I LOVED our visit to the ROM! It was so much fun and I learned so much on our visit!!They had an exhibit of Chinese artifacts, a dinosaur exhibit and one on Rome whilst we were there and we both found it so interesting and fun. It's a great place to...
The ROM is in the heart of downtown, only steps from the subway line. Exhibits are interesting and presented well. The Egypt exhibit is outstanding.

after many trips to Toronto over the last 10 years(hubby's from ON) I decided that I needed culture while on vacation! I spent an amazing 3 hrs at this place and I could have easily spent a full day there! Loved all the knowledge and different points of interest this museum holds!I am already planning my next trip back!...
There was so much to see! My boyfriend and I spent most of our day there and loved every second! Loved the diversity!

The ROM was nice, but it was just another museum. I wasn't too impressed with the collection or current exhibit on Mexican textiles. Not that I am a museum or history buff, I think it just pales in comparison to some great museums around the world.
After going to the museum in Ottawa it is hard to enjoy this museum. Lots going on but to me another museum with lots in it. \I did enjoy the Canadian section.

The ROM is beautiful inside and outside. It needs plenty of time to see it all. The sector with the minerals and the ores is amazing. The museum's shop has very nice things and the prices are low. A must see.

Don't leave Toronto without a visit to ROM. The fossils are marvellous as is the collection of minerals / crystals. Unfortunately the display cases are often a bit blurry by un-polished glass, so sometimes details are difficult to observe.

The Royal Ontario Museum ROM is well worth the trouble to go to .We went on the free tour they have them all through the day on the different parts of the museum.This is a big museum so give your self some time to look around .We had our lunch in the museum cafeteria surprise surprise the...

We enjoyed a wonderful visit recently to the ROM as a group. We also enjoyed a guided educational visit focused on textiles through the ages which included classroom time! There was an outfit on every table from an assortment of decades. It was fun as we were encourage to wear gloves (to protect the fabrics) so that we could touch...
This is a spectacular place, a joy to visit. The building itself is interesting with old and new wings and the collections are magnificent. Be sure to check out the mineralogy exhibit.
The hands on interactive sections for kids were fantastic!!! The volunteer stationed at the former main entrance was informative and age appropriate for adults and young kids.

they had a great array of real dinosaur bones and put into the actual size cast of the specimen. You can spend about 1-2 hours here we just went to the natural history, dinosaur exhibit and the Mexican special exhibit.
Loved the museum lots to see from Victorian furniture, to china for the far east, the native people to dinosaurs, more than one visit maybe need to see everything.

Without doubt, the best museum I have visited. So much to see, amazing exhibits, fantastically friendly staff and contributors and not too busy, even on a Saturday afternoon so plenty of space to enjoy all that's on view. The kids had a wonderful time, would love to return.

If you go to London, UK, not only do they have amazing museums, but they are all FREE the ROM is mediocre the actual new extension I feel is a carbuncle stuck on tot he old building, and they charge a fortune to get in.

This museum is really good and deserves at least 3 hours of your time.Their Rome and Greece sections were great as was Egypt. There is also an interesting Japan and China section as well. Something I really liked about the ROM was their videos next to most of the exhibits. They are really in depth - I particularly enjoyed...

The last day of our week in Toronto and we almost didn't go. How glad we were that we didn't miss this treat. We've seen a lot of museums but this place really shows how it should be done. Fascinating exhibits, many of which were open to view, rather than encased in glass cabinets - just a low glass barrier...
Disliked that we missed the guide. A lot to try and see with no directionLiked - a lot of diversity - much to see.Lots of places to sit, rest and reflectLovely, friendly staff

I take my grandson here once a month. He's now almost four, and we've been going to the ROM since he was 2 and a half. He finds something new to explore and learn about with every visit, and I always enjoy my time there too. He's become fascinated with dinosaurs, and is hungry to learn more and more about...

column3: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
column4: Didn't go inside the museum, but the exterior architectural design is amazing. Worth going to just to see the beautiful way that the architect joined an old building with a new and very modern structure.
My friend and I stopped here on a visit to Toronto a few years ago. It was a great place and had some special exhibits going on that were extremely well put together. Absolutely outstanding place!

Great for taking family to visit the ROM. Its a real treat to have a great museum in our city. Exhibits are absolutely gorgeous. We had a lot of fun. Be on look out for deals on tickets as it makes the visit much sweeter.

We visited ROM as a family of 2. The museum is big enough to explore for hours. In fact, we only be able to explore 1/3 of it.The collections are interesting, specially dinosaur fossils, children activity and bat cave. Our kids surprisingly really enjoyed the visit.The only problem was finding the parking lot, which for us a bit...

Wandering through the halls of the ROM is like being transported back in history.Started by exploring Canada past; stood in awe of the relics that had been recovered in my own City, in fact in my own neighborhood.We then wandered over to see the exquisite artifact from China, Korea and Japan!Seeing fashion from medieval time to the...
Great for both kids and adults. Much more besides just dinosaur bones. Architecture is a Toronto landmark. Good location near other sides such as Bloor Street and University of Toronto
I really like the temporary exhibitions they have. An the Friday night parties are very cool too. The scavenger hunt is also reccomended
Hands on interactive adventures await one and all from the history of man and all he has encountered in his world throughout time.

Although the layout was quite good and wheelchair access was also quite good, we did not find the ROM stimulating. One child enjoyed it and the other was very bored. The architecture in the dinosaur exhibit, while interesting, was very dizzying and we found ourselves uncomfortable after a while. We, as a family, just didn't find it stimulating or interesting...
The ROM is a great museum where you can not just study but also have fun. Great for all ages, even really young kids can have fun there.
Excellent exhibits.stroller/wheelchair accessible.Lots to see and great for all ages. The kids really enjoyed the interactive exhibits.

we had hear much about this museum and for the admission price (CAD17 from memory) it was profoundly disappointing. The indigeous exhibt was good but we learnt very little about toronto or ontario and it has the worst museum cafe i have been in in a developed country for many years

I very much enjoyed the ROM and spent a wonderful day exploring the exhibits. The Douglas Coupland exhibit on the top floor was a lot of fun; I knew his Microserfs and Gen X, but not his visual art. The mummies and dinosaurs were must-sees; I very much enjoyed the decorative arts and the Amerindian collections. Great giftshop—I brought back...

We have been to many museums around the world and to me the ROM most corresponds to the British Museum in London England. There is a great collection of dinosaurs and other fossils, as well as great exhibits on Rome, Greece, Nubia, China, etc. From time to time the ROM brings in special exhibits like the Terra Cotta Warrior exhibit...

I last visited the ROM about 20 years ago when I lived just a few blocks away. The horrible glass and concrete tumour was even worse when viewed up close. I used to enter from the other side, which felt grand and important. The Bloor Street entrance was dark and felt like entering a bad club with even worse lighting....

If you have been around, you may want to skip this place - Except for 2 sections. Even been-everywhere types may want to take a peek at the world-class Chinese collection, and the Amerindians of Canada , both conveniently located on the ground floor. The building itself will charm fans of fin de siecle historicist architecture.Design buffs may also...

An amazing museum especially for history buffs. Aside from artifacts like mummies, Roman, Greek coins, Japanese swords and armour, the museum of holds exhibits like the Forbidden City exhibit which is worth the extra $10. I would strongly recommend you to buy the Toronto cityPass as it is a very good deal and also includes ROM.

We visited this as part of the citypass deal and had a great time. We thoroughly enjoyed the dinosaur section and the Egypt section. We spent a good 3 hours walking through the museum and experiencing what it had to offer.

We have membership of ROM for years, one of my family's favourite place to spend a day during march break or summer. They do a great job to bring in new exhibits, and keep the members coming back over and over.
It had great exhibits and a wide range of art and interactive exhibits. It is definately worth another visit

The ROM has quite extensive galleries, everything from dinosaurs to Ancient Greece to Ancient Egypt and so on. Of course kids will love the dinosaur exhibits, so it's worth taking them just for that; I know I was fascinated by it when I was 7 and still am. Canadian post-secondary students get in free on Tuesdays, so that's always a...

My daughter and i visited this museum as part of the City Pass offer. It was well laid out and the section on Canadian History was very impressive, especially the totem poles. If you wanted to see it all you would need a full day.

Very good collection specially of natural history. I got there around 1:30, and I didn't even had time to look their entire exhibition by the time it closes, 5:30. The museum is huge, so I recommend to spend the day there. If you have an student ID it's free on Tuesdays. Totally kids friendly too, they have a lot of...
There are some fine exhibits here, the dinosaurs are great. You could easily spend all afternoon exploring all the rooms, lots of which have signage and interaction for children.

when we got to the Museum our first stop was the cafe for a late lunch. I've been to a lot of museum and art gallery cafes in the world and this one was the most average I've been to.Next we went to look at the specifically Canadian displays. They had some impressive items on display but there was...

There are several levels and it can be a bit confusing getting around. We had a great time looking and the museum staff gave us some information on some of the exhibits. There is a great hands on place. We could have used more time, but it was our last day.
The buildings are a rare mix of old and new architecture. The front facade is a real landmark. Inside the exhibits are overwhelming in amount and in depth information.
Great place for the paleontologist within you...They also have a great website about the latest in fossil discoveries..anthropology..etc.
We enjoyed going with our kids - they have several interactive displays so the kids learn about history while having fun.

You would need seven days to view the wonders contained within, from the dinosaurs, through the Mycenian, Egyptian, Greek, Roman periods, to the fascinating period furniture rooms this is a thought provoking museum.
Think I liked the dinosaurs the best, however there is so much to see here. The natural history section was also impressive.

I was here with a group of school children and found there is much to explore and learn. You will find sufficient information in all the galleries and exhibits. There is also an exhibit on First Nations people and a huge display of the Earth's Treasures. We particularly enjoyed the dinosaur gallery. Give yourself at least half a day to...

We visited with a school group of 38 students. We had a fantastic tour with a very informative guide. Students were allowed to sit on folding stools which helped with focus. Such a big place that you either need a guide or a full day to visit all the exhibits. Great place to visit and learn.
Easily accessible and the exhibits are very well laid out. the staff very very friendly and helpful.

This is a truly outstanding natural history museum. Somewhat eclectic with heavy emphasis on Egyptian/Roman/Greek, probably reflective of the interests that predominated at the time of the museum's founding in the early 20th century.But there's also a terrific gem and mineral exhibition as well as a very well done "development of style" presentation that begins in the medieval period...
Large museum, very well laid out. Feel like the curators could have told the stories of the artifacts a bit more. Way too technical. Was disappointed that the Pompeii exhibit hadn't opened yet.

This is a wonderful and inexpensive way to spend time with your children on a rainy day. I was very impressed by the layout and the architectural engineering of the building itself. Has interesting exhibits for all ages and It's located in a great area for walking. Easy access by Subway. Certainly worth the visit.

This museum has a great range of displays. The Chinese section is especially impressive, as is the various furniture displays including art deco windows. Gift shop good and would allow half a day to see everything.

Really enjoyed our trip to the museum, lots of things to see and really interesting. We particularly liked the dinosaurs, lots of bones!Would advise going later in the afternoon to avoid school parties, good that the kids are there to learn, but man they're loud!

The Friday Night Live Events run from now until the end of June. Live music, hands on exhibits, dress up in the kids area. Drinks $7 for wine of beer or spirits and a dash is well priced. A T-Rex selfie is obligatory almost. The Museum comes to life on FNL! Don't miss it, admission is competitively priced too.!

I have always loved the ROM and now that the kids are old enough we decided to take them. My kids are 4 & 2 and they were blown away by the dinosaur and animal exhibits. They also enjoyed looking at the bee hive and the dinosaur dig area. It is a great place to go as a family and...

my husband and i are museum freaks. we always visit museums on our travels and this one was a cute one. definitely check out the gem/precious stone collection because it will take your breath away. i loved the ancient greek section as well.

I had a very short visit, so I only went through 3 exhibits: Dinosaurs, gems and minerals and Douglas Coupland. I wish I had so much more time at this museum, so I hope to return. I noticed that this museum had several interactive kids projects, so that's great for families.

The exhibits were excellent, staff very friendly, and we especially enjoyed the First Nations exhibits and the mineral display was great. Interesting to both children and adults and a perfect way to escape any weather.
Need at least 6 hours to explore.Free highlight introduction tour is useful and help to spend shorter time there.

I liked the diversity of the exhibits here. I also actually felt engaged enough to read the placards and learned a thing or two about Buddhist symbolism, ecology and archaeology. Beware of elementary students run amok on the natural history floor.

I have been to the ROM a few times as a youngster and remember having a lot of fun. Visiting the museum in your 30s is quite different.The new addition looks great but doesn't go with the existing structure. The mix of new and old architecture looks awkward.The layout was confusing and we ended up going past some...
Many topics to explore, many things to learn. Amazing structure.However, it is expansive but it actually worth it. It is good for every age!
it was a good museum in a good building before they added that ugly structure of glass in front of it. The collection is still awesome, though. I am very fond of Mesoamerica in particular.
There is an excellent dinosaur exhibit, also featuring some great mammal skeletons etc. If you are into giant and ancient animals, this museum is great!

You will find something to amaze and inform you in his fantastic museum. The totem poles are amazing as are all of the other exhibits. The gift shop is unbelievable and you can't miss it as you have to leave through it.

The ROM offers a unique experience to visit the Musum at night. You can walk around and sample food (for cost) and drink. In each exhibit there is either a DJ, Band, Food Vender or Bar.It is 19+ only and great for a girls or a guys night out!

I had pretty high expectations of ROM, but was very disappointed. The exhibits are simply OK nothing spectacular I actually became pretty bored. The museum has a poor layout seemed like a maze. In comparison to the Smithsonian museums in Washington D.C. or even the museums in Pennsylvania this was very mundane (Perhaps I was just fooled by the grandeur...

Great museum, easily could have spent the whole day there. Reminded me of the chicago field museum but a little better. spent 2-3 hrs with kids and they were beat. a great hands on kids area there too to keep then entertained. Would go back again.

I really enjoyed the ROM as I went with a group and did a scavenger hunt like activity provided by (I believe) a third party. It is a great way of seeing the large collections. I love the breadth with the dinosaurs, the Egyptian and Chinese relics, etc. I could spend hours there and I would highly recommend it.
Love the ROM, always something interesting and new to discover. The only negative thing I have to mention is their café; very poor quality. The food there is worse than at a high school cafeteria.

Located near the museum station. It is for long walks. Try to come on Tuesday. If you are a student, You are free to come only on tuesday. Very educational, and it is very big inside. I spent 4 hours there.

I've been to the ROM a number of times now and have yet to leave anything but impressed by the content and quality of the exhibits there. It really is something to behold - a beautiful old building that is part of Toronto's history in and of itself, with an incredibly tacky piece of "art" bolted onto the front of...
No different than any other "natural history museum" in any other city. Will not go again unless there is an interesting one-time-only exhibit

I have probably not been back to the ROM in about 10 years. I decided to attend on a Friday after work with a friend of mine to check out the Douglas Coupland exhibit. Friday nights are actually cheaper ($10 for adults, $9 for students). If you are looking for a great time to go to the ROM without the...
Since i'm in love with the world history, i loved this museum so much. i will absolutely be back to toronto in the nearest future and i will visit this place again.

It has been over 2 decades since I've been here. It was great to come back with my family, it is clean and entertaining, however the cafeteria was painful, they tried to reheat the hotdogs on the grill and it was still only room temperature and very dry. Costco hotdogs are half the price and twice as good and large....

We visited in February 2015. The museum was not that crowded. This museum is for someone who likes history. The artifacts are mostly original but some artifacts are replica too. The bio-diversity display and the mini tropical forest is amazing. A nice day out with family and kids.
Great Chineses collection the second biggest outside China. All in all good in its class, but I hate the Michael Chan extEnsion. Full of wasted space

Fantastic museum, the artefacts are beautiful and well displayed. We especially enjoyed the dinosaurs, it's good to know what parts of the skeleton are real and what is replicated!! The layout of the museum is a little confusing but we had a map to help us out.Cafe is canteen style food like burgers, soups, sandwiches, chicken, fries, salad etc....

Lots to see and do.I went using a Toronto City Pass so great value - there is so much to see, not in the slightest bit boring either. Given the cold weather it is a great opportunity to do something different.

We recently visited the ROM on a Friday evening. Admission is cheaper after 4.30 pm.($10)There are many exhibits but we particularly enjoyed level 2 where you will find displays on bio-diversity, dinosaurs, sea animals and Egyptian history.There were lots of families enjoying the museum.
Only spent a couple hours there but enjoyed this museum.The dinosaur collection is very good and extensive.Also enjoyed the Canada exhibits.
Something for everyone...go through quick, or linger long. Every time I go I see something new. This time we participated in the Murder Mystery Scavenger Hunt..it was fun and challenging.
Give yourself plenty of time to see all the exhibits, this place goes on forever, you don't want to miss anything, and there's something for everyone.

This building is amazing! We took a few hours but still didn't get to see it all- you could spend a full day here there is so much to see- and stuff that you would actually want to see!The native American stuff is fascinating and the pictures of the leaders of various peoples from the Wendat and Iroquois and...
The customer service was excellent! It took about 2-3 hours to go through the entire place. I loved all of the exhibitions. The space is vast and insightful

The museum is quite big and the collections are sizable ( but definitely not like the smithsonian museums). Kids would love the dinosaur section. And there are lot of resting chairs throughout the museum (important if you are traveling with Kids and grandparents).If you are touring Toronto, get the city pass which lets you visit 5 places with much...

I have bought the CItypass with tickets to 5 attraction. The last one I have been there was the Royal Museum, the museum is beautiful, huge, but I didn´t like too much, as I like the Smithsonians museums in Washington, maybe my expectation was too high, anyway, I recommend the visit.
We went on one of the late nights and it was perfect it was not crowded. Sometimes we would be by ourselves in exhibits. It was nice and peaceful!

There is so much to see at the ROM and so much for the kids to look at and do, that this museum is a part of almost every trip we take to Toronto. It's easy to get to by subway, and close to plenty of other attractions.My only warning is the food at the cafeteria. The museum puts...
What a beautiful collection of natural history pieces. The Dinossaurs were absolutely fabulous. The biodiversity gallery with interactive experience was amazing.
The kids loved the dinosaurs. Well designed and very easy to get to by the subway. Many different displays and it appealed to both adults and teens.
This museum is great for kids, excellent display of dinosaurs and lots of interaction with exhibits and very informative.

the exterior is this old and new building fused together so I was expecting a modern museum. It's actually got a very traditional Victorian layout down to the Dinosaur-in-the-lobby. I preferred the top floor ancient history stuff. The second floor was animals and packed with kids screaming so skip that unless u have kids. The main floor was a strange...

I went there because it was one of the attractions from the CityPass which I purchased in Toronto. I must admit that I'm not a big fan of museums, but the experience was pleasant. It is huge and worth visiting if you like those type of tours :)

Great place. Did a free 45 minute tour first which showed us the highlights. We then wandered round on our own and spent 5 hours there. It was really well laid out, bright and airy too. Sitting Bull's headdress was the highlight for me. Lovely and fascinating place.

Very large museum with lots to see. Next time I will plan two days here (not kidding). I got spit out in the Chinese section on my way out of the bathroom and my intent was to walk through on the way to something "more interesting". I was shocked when my family found me, hours later, and told me it...
Très grand musée et beau, plein de chose à voir/ big museum, a lot of stuff to see! Nice if you are a family but okay if you are with friends too

We went to the ROM as part of the City pass. It was interesting, with things for the kids and parents alike. The staff at the entrance were very helpful in giving us advice on what to see and where to begin

I spent the whole day here by myself, it was so interesting, and there is so much to see and take in. The exibits change so check the website to see what is going on. I have also been at an event in basement (?)of the museum, there was large rooms with theaters and a gala was held in another...

A very large museum with different variety of exhibits. I went there for three hours and it's not enough!!Save more time for the upper level and avoid going there at weekends, many Chinese stay there and sit there. They chat very loud as well which is very disturbing.

Do yourself a favour and visit this modern spectacle. This gorgeous space is a proud Canadian testament and a breathtaking monument to pass through.Every space will inspire the senses and bend your craving for knowledge and wonder. Emerge yourself in history, explore new and old worlds alike, and breath in the tingling sensation of fascination.Oh, and wear comfortable...
There are many different exhibitions to pick from. The kids will like it too. My only advice would be to plan to spend at least half a day at it unless you want to run.

We have had a membership at the ROM for several years. Well worth the price even if you're from out of town. The Jim and Louise Temerty dinosaur exhibition is always a treat. Our boys love the interactive nature of the place and the fact that staff are not all over patrons. Lots of different things for all sorts of...
this is a lovely museum , it is child friendly and the staff are nice. there is a good range of items , something to interest everyone.I particularly enjoed the dinasaur exhibit.

We enjoyed our visit to the museum. It was very clean, nicely laid out, and had plenty to see. Neither of us are huge history buffs, so we can't really comment on the content of the museum. We found it to be a good variety of exhibits.

The ROM has an impressive number of different high quality galleries. Too many to list here, but you can get more of an idea at http://www.rom.on.ca/en/exhibitions-galleries/galleries. The dinosaur and Roman galleries stood out for me, but all were impressive. I agree with other reviewers that it you'll spend a minimum of 4 - 5 hours to see everything. All exhibits...

Mythbuster's Adam Savage spoke very highly of the researchers at the ROM, so despite having visited all the museums Canada seemed to offer in Ottawa, I decided to drop in to see the ROM. If you're at all interested in natural history or cultural history - the Royal Ontario Museum has something for you. When I went, I explored artifacts...
There is an amazing gallery of stuffed and preserved animals. The Gem's are a must see. Such an asortment of sizes and colors could only have been created by a Creator.
I had a brilliant time wandering round the museum, especially the Egypt displays. Would recommend to anyone.

We took our 8 and 6 year old for their first visit to the ROM and had a great visit. They really enjoyed the dinosaurs (of course) as well as the Asian areas and Egyptian treasures (they got to see their first Mummy!). They also really liked the hands-on children areas, and the staff on duty there were very friendly...
The musuem is quite big and have a good mix of different art. There was a photography exhibit when I went and it was gorgeous. I would recommend going here.

Liked it all. Nothing to dislike. Just make sure you have time to see everything. You need a full day, at least, to take all the artifacts in and be able to read the associated descriptions, listen to the commentaries, view the videos, etc.

Great visit! Sooooo much to see and enjoy. Enjoyed the exhibits, especially the dinosaurs and prehistoric section. Very impressed with the amount of work that has gone into each restoration, the catalogueing of each piece and display. Excellent!

We were passing through Toronto on our way to India and decided to visit the ROM. A special exhibit of award winning photography was under way. The museum did a great job displaying the works which made it very enjoyable. Large, back lit displays with easy to read text. Afterwards, we checked out the permanent collections, especially the Indian and...

The ROM is a must see every few years for their visiting exhibits. We recently saw their photography special exhibit and the children loved it. The photographs were taken by both children and adults and were vivid and exquisite. The mummies are also a favourite with the kids. Although the main exhibits haven't changed much they are still fun to...

It seems nobody really gets to understand this museum until they actually visit. I am telling you now, if you wish to visit and learn about this museum, please plan for a two day timeline. You cannot really enjoy or see all of the museum in one day. Each section is vast and detailed. Nobody goes to a museum to...
Its a huge Museum, that had lots of history from every culture. I found it to be very educational to both kids and adults.

You can find a diversity of exhibitions, from biodiversity to ancient and world cultures including textiles and costumes, paintings and other art artifacts.A huge collection of fossils and natural history.

The ROM building is like Marmite, love it or hate it. Personally I love it, it's a lost silver Rubix cube in an otherwise nondescript street. The ROM is huge with empty spaces that could benefit from some wow factor exhibits. The collections are extensive (particularly the Asian section) but I regret to say a little dull. Not much interactive...

Visited here with our 2 children, 11 and 8. There was plenty to keep these interested-in-science children interested, especially the second floor. Very nice display with not just dinosaurs skeletons, but also mammals and other creatures. My son and I could have easily spent another hour in the rock and mineral area. We were there on a weekday afternoon, so...

If you are a museums enthusiast this is the museum to go. The ROM Museum had a large collection of pilfered goods from a wide variety of countries and eras, you will love the ROM!There is so much to see but I don't recommend for families with young kids because is really big approx. 4 to 5 hr walk....

Our family membership (year + 1 month) was bought so that it spanned two March breaks. Took in the Copland exhibit, new dinosaur from Alberta, and photography competition photos.Really enjoyed our visits, especially knowing that we did not have to try to see it all during one visit. Highly recommend a family pass for year if coming in from...

Very good value for the money. You can spend all day here if you want. There is so much to see. I live in Washington, DC where most of the museums are free so I rarely visit museums in other cities but this museum is worth the money. There is something for all interests.

The minerals and gems collection is wonderful. The aboriginal peoples exhibit makes one think about how they have been mistreated and how their situation might be improved - a real challenge inn the current situation. The life-size dinosaur at the entry was great. The Japan and China exhibit was a bit limited but what there was is OK. The Canadian...

The ROM is a fantastic experience for all ages. You can be in here for hours and hours if you wanted to or you can explore certain areas depending on your personal interests. The dinosaur exhibit is great as well as the animal exhibit featuring hundreds of stuffed animals. Kids would love these areas and explore things they may have...

An outstandingly elegant, imposingly spacious , architecturally interesting building, this museum has valuable Asian, Middle Eastern and many more collections of artifacts, jewelery, statuary, to appreciate the many cultures, civilizations of the world. A few good hours are well spent here, covering its floors, its new addition, without ever getting lost, for signs and people to guide you are everywhere.

We visited this museum with our 4 children while on vacation. Very nicely set up, lots of artifacts. The 2nd floor has the animals/dinosaur bones/rocks and is what our younger kids liked best. Wasn't particularly busy the day we went (Monday). Not much about Canadian history which I found odd. Cafe with wide selection of food, reasonably priced for museum...

We really enjoyed the sections of the museum we visited. The dinosaur section is excellent with some of the best fossils of insects and plants I've ever seen. Also v informative. The Biodiversity section was ruined for me by groups of primary age children running around shouting, (especially in the bat cave) largely unchecked by their teachers. Don't get me...

This museum has a little bit of everything and is huge. Every couple of years I come back to see what new displays they have added and to check out their special exhibits. There are dinosaurs bones, animals both extinct and not displays of bones, ancient Egypt displays, ancient Europe displays, ancient Asia displays, rocks and minerals presentations and possibly...

Art to European artifacts, and lots of dinosaur bones (yet I learned that none have been found around Toronto itself?!). This place was easy to get to from the Subway. A great way to spend an afternoon.

I arrived only 2.5 hours before closing time, so had to be selective. I headed straight for the Bat Cave. But on my way, I got distracted by some of the wonderful dinosaur skeletons. The route to the Bat Cave is well marked, and the Bat Cave has many interesting facts about bats. I've seen live bats - in caves...

This museum was fantastic - the mineral room was a favorite of everyone and we also really enjoyed many I the exhibits. Lunch was extremely reasonable and they had an outstanding selection. An easy walk from the Museum subway station. We were glad this was on our City Pass.
went on the free student day on a tuesdaygreat value for all the exhibitions there are!there are many galleries that will interest you

I love the ROM and can spend hours circling through the same rooms and still find something new to look at, read, study, be grateful for ....It's great for family to learn and appreciate both past and present history, culture and so forth....

I have been to many National Museums in Europe but this one was absolutely spectacular. Really nice, no queue if coming with Toronto City pass which is really handy and you are saving money on this as well.
It is a very beautiful place I love the construction of the building it is a place of beauty on bloor street. It is a design where people can recognize it and it's worth to be in toronto.

The ROM is an excellent museum. The best parts include the dinosaurs, mineral and gem collection. The animal sections of the museum are also interesting but will seem anti-climatic if you visit the best parts of the museum first.The somewhat less interesting parts of the museum (personal opinion) are the ancient European culture sections. These sections are quite large...

There were so many wonderful things to see like the rocks, gemstone; various types of furniture, fixtures, etc from different time eras; historical items and info from all over the world; the Egyptian mummies with other artifacts, etc. There is a wide variety of artifacts to see. Too many to mention. The museum is a must see.
Between the set exhibits and the rotating ones you will be sure to find something that peaks your interest. Great way to spend the afternoon. Be careful on weekends a lot of kids!
I love the ROM. My wife and I were benefactors for many years. The exhibits are interesting and the staff helpful. It gets the average rating because I, intensely, dislike the new exterior design.

Any trip to TO should include a visit to the ROM, even when it is packed. The dinosaurs are a favourite attraction for our little boys. We were disappointed that the textiles were under renovation but the March Break activities for kids was a highlight.

I was visiting Toronto during March and did not know it was the school break in Ontario. The museum was full of children! It was easy to get caught up in the excitement of naming the 'new dinosaur' or looking at the back of some sancai platters only to discover they had little stout feet. Elevator access so good for...

This is perhaps the only world class museum in Toronto. I have a great interest in antiquities and ROM does not disappoint in that respect. I love their collection of Chinese ceramics and bronzes, one of the best features of this museum. Dinosaur display is fabulous. And its architecture is worth experiencing as well. I strongly suggest experiencing the stairwells...

By the time I got to Toronto, the historic facade of the ROM was already being taken over by Daniel Liebskind's abysmal "Crystal" addition. This new facade renovation juts out onto Bloor Street and is horrifying in every sense of the word. Most people would find it "funky" or "cool" or would label it as contemporary architecture. Well, if you...

If you or your kids - or grand kids - just love rocks & minerals like I do, get down to the ROM. They have an absolutely astounding display in the 'Earth's Treasures' gallery. Indeed, there are many other excellent exhibits and visiting exhibits (extra charge) at the ROM. So if anyone in your group isn't nearly as avid, you...

This was my first trip to the ROM, and I wasn't sure what to expect since I read there were so many different things all in one place. First, my husband and I enjoyed the special exhibit of Douglas Coupland. The works were very diverse, interactive, and interestingly displayed. We also enjoyed a trip around the world, essentially, seeing things...

The ROM is easily accessed by subway and then close to Bloor street and Yorkville high end shopping. Good Chinese and Egyptian permanent exhibits, a spectacular totem pole rising several stories wrapped by the wide staircases. Extensive exhibits, multi-floored, lots to interest children 6 and up!

The museum building itself is beautiful and there was even too much to see if you do not wanna spend the entire day there. The mummies were something I haven't seen in any other big museums around the world and the bat gave replica was also a lot of fun.
Our youngest son loved the dinosaur exhibit. This is a fantastic museum for people of any age. Will definitely go again and again.

Being from the states, I wasn't sure what the ROM would be like or how it would differ from museums such as those I find in Chicago. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the ROM is unique and diverse. As for location, parking is easy, shopping/food is all around, and there is a load of paths for those that...
Lots of variety, a wonderful dinosaur exhibit, the Chinese exhibit is amazing..! It was a great leaning experience and a great place to visit in the city.

Visited during March Break - very busy with kids obviously but March Break activities made it interesting for the kids. Couldn't believe it though that they don't have lockers!!
