We found out about the coat check (which was right at the entrance before you go in) after we already went into the museum. Ended up having to carry our coats...

The ROM is a high-quality museum that is not overwhelming in size but certainly big enough to keep you occupied for many hours. The Chinese art and artifact collection is excellent and there are very good items from ancient Egypt as well as other cultures. The biology section ranges from dinosaurs to contemporary animals. The building itself is a unique...

Learn and have fun. Lots for kids to do. Starting May get to enjoy the Friday night live entertainment.It is modern, unique, lots of intensive displays and great new special exhibits to enjoy throughout the year.
Lot's of interesting things to see. A bit of a maze thou. Some of the exhibits are close together making it difficult to navigate. Was very busy during March Break.

went during the march break... was still able to see the displays even though there were kids everywhere..of course.My only complaint was that the vending machines in the brown-bag lunch area were broken... machine took $10 for a bag of chips and provided no change. the $1/$2 slots were not working.

I went to the ROM with my Girlfriend. An overall great experience, You have everything from art, Dinosaurs, sculptures to meteorites, whatever interests you it's there. Oh and they had Egyptian mummies too. Reasonably priced admission but the gift shop is overpriced and parking is difficult.

Excellent venue. Fantastic displays. I cant afford to take my kids.Prices for admission are too much for a normal family to pay. I agree that the museum was losing money , but raising prices is not the answer. Lower prices and attract more visitors. Better to sell 500 of something for 2 dollars than selling 100 for 5. Also there...

I have been visiting the Royal Ontario Museum for several years, since I was probably still in a stroller. Over that time there had been many changes in the museum but the thrill of the experience remains the same.There is something for everyone here; if you love natural history, that's here with a fascinating collection of fossils to taxidermied...

You could spend all day at the museum and never get bored. There is lots to see and do from the Senior to the Child. The museums special exhibits are especially good to take in. Definitely a place to get to by transit.

I enjoyed the permanent and special exhibits, finding the layout easy to follow and the educational information illuminating. The African/Oceanic/South American area was an exception; it was a jumbled confusing mess.

We went during March Break and it was BUSY! We thoroughly enjoyed the Earth's Treasures and Batcave areas, along with the Dinosaur section. There was a scavenger hunt that our daughter took part in, and lots of staff were around to answer questions.The only real frustration we faced was that even though we had a map, we found it...

Whatever culture you are interested in - Chinese, Korean, Indian, European (covers from 1100 up to present day including the Reformation, Industrial Age, Victorian Age and even modern day), Canada's Indigenous people, Byzantine, Roman, you name it, the ROM has a collection for it!!! If you are a student researching any of these themes, or a history buff, you will...

you can specialize your visit or just generalize an historical adventure at the rom and you will never be disappointed. whether you need expert, micro viewing of the smallest details of an historical nature or whether you just want to peruse a wide view of the planets varied lifeways, the rom has it all covered. a great days outing guaranteed.

As a tourist I was excited to visit the ROM as ti is world renowned, The dinosaur exhibit was on at the time so we decided to go and see that due to the fact that the museum was dead. There were no interactive learning tools and the dinosaur exhibit was hyped up in posters but fell a little short...

The exhibitions are very eye catching, in particular the dinosaurs and fossils. It was a bit of a bummer though that some of the most exciting fossils from the cambrian explosion were hidden in a dirty little corner next to the emergency exit. This does not do right to the biological importance of this collection.
This is a great museum suitable for all ages! It is quite big with lots to see so expect to spent at least 3 hours if you want to see everything. Well worth a visit.

I do not consider myself a museum lover, but the ROM definitely has something to interest everyone. I've been here 2 times since I've moved to Toronto, and both visits were not long enough (Our fault for going in the late afternoon).As with all museums, some attractions were more exciting than others, but the layout, transitions and information presentations...

First advise to wear comfortable shoes. Second one to keep jackets in the car if you have such possibilty because you will need to pay for wardrobe extra fees. Do not forget to take your library car maybe they will accept it and attendance will free.There are very comfortable couches there you can sit to take rest. I went...

Located downtown Toronto. One of the nicest museums we have ever been too. The Egyptian collect was fabulous. Plenty of fun for the whole family. Fairly big café in the basement area. Parking is fairly expensive. Would recommend having a hotel shuttle drop you off. Very nice assortment of collection. Expect to spend a good 4-6 hour if you casually...

The Royal Ontario Museum is an absolute must for any visitor to Toronto. The Collections are amazing, the staff is extraordinarily creative in organizing special exhibits and the Museum itself is a work of art. Whether a casual observer or keenly interested in art, the ROM will suit every taste. Very highly recommended.

The Royal Ontario museum is a fun place to enjoy with family, lots of fun things to see for children to enjoy.It definitely is a big museum so I think that you should probably take the afternoon to see it.Nice place to visit.

We used this venue for a corporate dinner party and it was OUTSTANDING from the appetizers to the space itself I cannot imagine a more perfect place to showcase Toronto for groups of more than 100 people.

We rushed through in about 3 hours, because we had reservations for dinner that afternoon, but we could have spent all day here. It is so much bigger than it looks from the outside and they have so many interesting things to see!
This museum is really interesting and fun. It has something for everyone. It is a great way to spend a day with kids , friends or alone.

The ROM is a great place to take your children. The building is spacious and can accommodate all ages. The price is reasonable and it will be an enjoyable day out for all.Last time we went there they had a fire alarm and it still didn't ruin the experience.Great attraction to visit. Check out the dinosaur bones and...

Wish that ROM ticked could be valid for two day. We wanted to see all and spent app 5 hours in ROM and did not manage to see levels beneath the ground. There are so many interesting artefacts, svulptures, paintings and stuff from all over the world collected in ROM and if you want to see them all - visit...
ensure the exhibit you want to see is open...because they bring so much in sometimes there administrative delays....also theres a cheap day

While there are modern fused with old architecture, The ROM has continued to develop into a fresher museum experience. No longer content to be staid and stuffy, there are things to look at, things to touch and more app - savvy ways to learn about some of the items here.I will confess I am a museum supporter with an...

On the 4th floor there is a contemporary gallery of changing exhibits. This is where I go first. Maybe because I have seen the rest. Otherwise, there are so many rooms filled with artifacts from all parts of the world and all through the ages. Enjoy

The ROM blend of old and new architecture is jarring and unpleasant to the eye., one of the worst blends of old and new anywhere. They often have good exhibitions but their displays and information are terrible. E.G. on a recent Chinese exhibition they had a life size figure of a horses with the rider on the left side. Obviously...

We went to the ROM and spent a few hours - we left because we wanted to get lunch and see something else but wished we could have purchased a mutli-day pass to go again the next day. We saw a few of the exhibits and highly recommend the Canadian First Nations exhibit as you wouldn't see this as much...

This is another must-do attraction in Toronto. My family have visited about twice yearly during our day trips to Toronto, and the ROM remains popular with both adults and kids. The permanent exhibits are always fascinating and I learn something new whenever I meander through the artefacts (always enjoy the Korean exhibits). Special exhibits are thoughtfully displayed and never fail...
Loved the dinosaurs, found the bat cave underwhelming, enjoyed the guided tours. You need a full day to really explore everything.
I went there this winter and was pretty nice,you travel around world culture, from China to dinosaurs!Another good point is that I went on a Tuesday and it was free for students.

The ROM has excellent special exhibits. However, the China exhibit with the numerous beautiful artifacts are impossible to match up with the descriptions set up off to one side of the display cases. We always used to enjoy dining at C-5 Rooftop Restaurant which is now closed. The snack bar in the basement is never kept clean. We have never...

I have been to ROM 5 or 6 times since 2010. I took there all my relatives who came to visit me in Canada. I like every exhibition. I like that I can take pictures. In my blog I put 3 articles about ROM for my friends and everybody liked it. I like that ROM has some special stuff for...

I had parted with friends on a day's visit to TorontoFreezing cold windy day , I had more time to spareFound myself on Bloor Street at Avenue Rd, wasNot enthusiastic to go to a shopping malDecided on the ROM, I am a senior , i was tiredSo first visit to restaurant , nice soup an...

The "ROM" is a fantastic place. Even if you have been here before, there is always something new for you to discover. It is friendly for all ages, and I highly recommend this attraction to EVERYONE willing to learn something new!

I went in mainly to see the first people exhibition and ended up roaming for three hours at which time I had only seen a fraction of it. I would love to go back and see more.Highlights: the bat cave, crystals and rocks, totem poles and the shop.

The museum is not only an architectural marvel, but an incredible collection of valuable artifacts from different periods around the globe. Plan to stay for at least half a day. For a break you can go out and walk along Bloor avenue and Yorkville. The museum's gift shop is also very nice.

We went here on a visit to Toronto with my inlaws. We had a pleasant visit but this museum does not measure up to other world class museums like the Smithsonian or other nature museum we have seen in Chicago or London. Overall, not a bad way to spend an afternoon, but not a world class museum.

I love the ROM! I have been numerous times over the last few years, and always find something more to see when I return. They get in some really cool special exhibits, so be sure to check the schedule for that, as they do change fairly frequently. I loved their textiles exhibit last summer and saw the red fur coat...

This place is HUGE. Tons to see. When we visited they had a really amazing Ancient Asian exhibit, with some beautiful Buddha statues and paintings. Really cool dinosaur fossil exhibit, and mineral exhibit as well. Was definitely worth the trip out here, would highly recommend visiting this place.

There really is a lot to explore here. You can look at art, which is appealing to adults, the bat cave is always a favourite for everyone, and there is a cool area all about animals that is good for younger kids. Including a kiddie area where you can try on suits of armour and dust through sand to find...
the ROM really is a fantastic experience. One that you should make sure you plan on doing every couple years as it's constantly evolving.
You can find something interesting for everyone here, even the babies. My personal absolute favorite is the minerals section, can't stop being fascinated at how diverse and colorful nature can be!
Lots to see and experience- Check out the main exhibits, usually very interesting and well prepared by curators

This museum is in the heart of the city. It is a treat getting there and seeing the vibe in the area. The displays are always wonderful and it is a go to place when you are in Toronto. Walk in Yorkville ...grab a coffee and then head to the museum. The ROM is good for couples, singles and families....

I have taken my 3 year old to the museum several times and it's a great place for kids. He can dig for dinosaur bones, do a life size Seek and Find, and learn about history and the animal kingdom all at the same time. The museum itself is beautiful, a great day out in Toronto.

The ROM, as it is affectionately called by Torontonians, is a great place to spend a rain or shine day whether you live here or just visiting. It has the requisite dinosaur exhibits that the kids will love. But it also has a great bat cave that kids really enjoy too. For adults, there are wonderful exhibits of ancient Egypt,...

I've been to this museum so many times over the last 35 years, but it never gets old. I've been back a few times over the last few years and it is still fabulous. I always see new things in the old displays, and I always really enjoy the shorter-term displays. Thank you ROM. My last visit was as a...

I love the old exhibits from when I was younger and new exhibits alike. Feature exhibits sure do keep things fresh from year to year. Great for all ages and I recommend doing the audio tours as they can be great if you just want to lose yourself in the history and not in the hustle and bustle of Toronto....

you'll never tire of the ROM. It's a great experience for kids of all ages, always something new to see and experience, helpful staff and even the food isn't the usual dreadful fare offered at large institutions. In fact, the ROM doesn't even feel like an institution.
Well designed exhibits. Lots variety. Worth the effort of public transit with a subway stop right there.

My partner and I visited the newly renovated ROM last weekend and it left us a bit empty, I'm afraid.The day was bitterly cold but the lobby/entrance design has not included an interior barrier from the cold when doors are opened.Even some staff were wearing hats and coats.We found the signage and directions rather lacking. Yes, one...

Lots to see for young and old. Subway station right at the front door. Only downside is the site of most recent ugly addition. Found a lot of wasted space in the interior of that new addition due to the weird angles. Money wasted on that addition.

Be sure to get to the new wing called Crystal designed by Daniel Libeskind. Interesting from the outside and works as exhibition space. The current exhibit of nature photographs is interesting and well displayed.
Many things to see in there, enough to keep adults and children occupied for at least 2 hours. Try to get the e-tickets to avoid a long lineup at the front counters.

Went on all day field trip as parent volunteer to Gr 4-6 classes ... Everyone had an amazing time - learned so many new things about Canadian peoples, their habitat, culture, life ... Including dressing & armour, homes, etc.; biodiversity section was much more than a little interesting ... A lot of "touch me" hands-on guided opportunities; prehistoric section probably...
I always like to visit the ROM periodically, there are frequently new exhibits and the building itself is interesting.

All exhibits I have attended have been well-organized, enjoyable and informative.If you do not enjoy crowds (and children) - choose weeknights over weekends and avoid school holidays.On the other hand, a lovely family day out with the kids.Definitely worth a visit!
I totally enjoyed all of the exhibits at the ROM. I found the docents especially helpful. The Henry Moore exhibit was marvelous -- would have been worthwhile just to see that.
the ROM is just as it says, Royal. But not stuffy. It covers a whole host of artifacts, places and times in history and does it very well with class.

The ROM is a great place to visit on your own or with a friend. It is also very family friendly and a good place to go on a date. No matter how many times I go to the ROM in one year there is always something new to see at the ROM.
Fabulous and educational and interactive. I really enjoyed the helpful staff and the ease of access to all the displays.
Loved the Gem exhibit! Such a large variety and some lovely jewels too. Don't miss this one. The museum is quiet large and it's not possible to do it justice in just one visit. We will go back.

It's been quite a few years since I've been here and certainly my 1st time without my kids.We went to see the Douglas Coupland exhibit. I was concerned since i hated the Pompadou modern art museum in Paris this summer.This was different. It had some very cool things here. The coolest by far were the pictures that looked...
It´s worth the visit because it is a very well organized museum with amazing exhibitions about natural history and other subjects.

Did this during family Day February 2014 - but I lazy man that I am didn't get around to writing a review until February is no longer an optionso obviously crowded to the gills - but once you're in this place is full of nooks and crannies - a staff member was pushing a cart with artifacts for preservation...
The ROM is always worth a visit. Right now there is an exhibit of stellar wildlife photographs. It costs extra, but is worth the money.

Good place to visit as a couple - see some living history - from dinosaurs and early man to fairly recent canadian / north American artifactsIt puts your life in perspective TimewiseLook for discounts online certaindays after five they are freeA lot of nice restaurant spots nearby for dinner or lunch
The museum has some collections like Rocks and minerals or animals but nothing comparable to other museums in the world or in Washington D.C. Is good if you have kids.
limited genuine articles, go if you enjoy plastic display, but if so better go to toys r us they have better plastic collection.

Many great things to see here. We have been members for years, and the favourites are the Tech Gallery of Rocks and Minerals and the Dinosaurs. The special exhibits are very good. If you love learning and have a sense of wonder about the world, then the ROM is for you.

Program contents and internal exhibit signs were not helpful.Batcave was disappointing.Floor plans in the brochure not organized properly to reflect exhibits and contents.Wildlife Photography exhibit was good but cost extra.General admission expensive compared to what we paid for admission to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC which is a bigger bang for the buck.Several exhibits were well laid out...

Great place to go. Over the years one periodically goes back to the rom. It's constantly refreshing. Informative and lively.The exhibits are superlative. A wonderful way to spend a leisurely day during inclement weather.

If you have a few hours the ROM is a great place for all ages. My grandchildren particularly enjoy the nature science section and the bat cave as well as the fabulous Dinosaur exhibit. The gift shop is also a great source of interesting books on native plants and animals as well as other treasures.

Excellent museum, I would recommend it to everyone. The dinosaur and gem stone permanent exhibits are my favourites, with the Egyptian permanent collection being a close second, but everything is great. The temporary exhibits are usually fantastic as well.

A visit to this excellent museum is well worth the time. There are many incredible displays to see. In fact it would take at least three or four full days to get to see most of what the museum holds.there are always new shows being brought in ,it is a thrill to be a member and future volunteer at this...

Three hours in the ROM are invariably three hours well spent. This time the chief attraction was the exhibition of wildlife photography, which features some of the most beautiful images I have seen in recent years. Also very good was the "Design in 1914" exhibition. The Douglas Coupland show has arrived from the Vancouver Art Gallery, but in spite of...

my wife and I hadn't been to the ROM in at least 15 years when we last went with our kids. Lots to catch up on. We are now members and expect to visit on a more regular basis given the new (for us at least) exhibits and the lineup of guest speakers we saw scheduled.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a fantastic attraction for the history buff or museum fan. The diversity of the galleries and exhibits make it a safe bet for fans of history, dinosaurs or just good old fashioned learning.The museum is definitely geared towards older children and teens instead of the little ones. There is very little to do for...
i always try and visit whenever i am in town - i enjoy the special displays and events they host and the continious changes they make to improve the experience

They have such great exhibits, we're lucky to have the ROM. I miss it when I'm away from the city. It's great to wander the park around the museum as well as the grounds of the University of Toronto. Gorgeous.

We spent a full day at the ROM and managed to get through all of the exhibits, but without stopping to really enjoy and learn from most of them. We were impressed by how much there was to see. A nice combination of cultural and natural history. There's some hands on stuff, but the majority of displays are for viewing...

This is a super complete museum that will engage everyone despite their background or their interest!The whole museum is loaded with information so you can understand very well all the exhibits.They also have some shows of environmental education that are very good for the kids.If you like, history, animals, religion or just life you must visit it!...

We purchased a membership over a year ago and have found it to be well worth the price. The scope of the museum is such that you can visit it several times before you see everything. A great range of exhibits for everyone from small kids to adults, and the changing exhibits make return trips a new adventure. The recent...

Being a student, it was free to go to the museum on a Tuesday. I haven't been there in a very long time so it brought back exciting memories and it changed so much. Great date idea if you're into history.

If the exhibits do not impress you, the layout and the architecture of the building will give you a great sense of awe. The arrangements of the exhibits are meticulously planned. There are just so much to learn in this wonderful space.

That's a perfect place for adults and kids. They have a collection about everything : dinosaurs, Rome, Byzance, Egypt, China, Japan, Stuffed exotics animal for studying, furniture, tea artefacts etc.It's so big you need to be there almost 4 hours if you want to see everything. It would be far more than 4 hours if you read everything. The...

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) may not be the best museum in the world, but it is a reasonable comparison with The British Museum, Le Louvre and The Hermitage. There are premium museums and the ROM in that club, just near the bottom-middle.Like most of the world's great museums you get tired, hot and sweaty after a couple hours...

The amount of exhibits is truely amazing and everybody is able to find something that suits his/her taste. The ROM shows everything from dinosaur skeletons over ancients objects from all part of the world to a room full of an amazing gemstone collection and much, much more!If you are a student, the entrance is free for you on tuesdays!

So Everywhere I go I tend to visit Museums, and I did the same when I went to Toronto and I was not disappointed. This amazing museum is so diverse that it will keep you hooked through out your visit. Dinosaurs, Animals, Ancient History that relates to every culture.They also have these awesome areas for kids where they can...

The breadth of the exhibits and pieces that are contained in the ROM is incredibly impressive. I do enjoy museums and had a good time here. My only complaint is that everything just seemed fragmented, and there wasn't too much of a cohesive narrative through the exhibits to help you learn. I'm not sure that makes much sense but if...

To see this museum properly you will need 2 or 3 days- not the half day or so recommended in Travel sites. I spent 6 hours wandering around this beautifully laid out museum and didn't see all of exhibits properly.There is floor plans supplied which helps a lot- but with 3 floors to view, to see all of exhibits properly...

The museum is VERY big, with A TON to see, with some of the most fascinating things inside it. The museum is laid out very well, with one exhibit following another. Spend the day there, you'll have a great day! The cost is quite reasonable, and is good for kids, teens and adults.
Great day super layout and designGive yourself a good day here lots to see and do.. Recommend for kids 7+... And very reasonable cost!Will def be returning without 3 year old:)
there is an exhibit for everyone to learn something new. every level offers a learning experience. i would definitely want to go there again.
Soooooo much to see. Each floor brings new displays and adventures. In the bottom there is an interactive room for kids. Get there early, it gets busy.

The ROM, located downtown Toronto, is a world-class museum with exhibitions that cover the histories and cultures of places around the world (as well as contemporary exhibits), as well as biodiversity and natural history exhibits. There are also quite a few exhibits on Canada and its history. The museum is quite large (4 levels), so it takes a while to...
We had a great day taking our time wandering through the exhibits. Very easy museum to navigate through and we really enjoyed the interactive exhibits such as the bats and owls!
check out the amazing crystals on the 3rd floor and don't forget to check out the incredible original documentary; Nanook of the North hidden at the back of the area with the first nations exhibits

Never get tired of visiting the ROM whenever I'm in Toronto. The collection has a good range of works from across the world, with items to interest both young and old. Architecturally the building is nice to look at and spend time in, and the exhibitions haven't disappointed yet.It isn't cheap to get in, but Fridays nights are discounted...

The ROM is a good museum. Not a great one but a good one. The temporary travelling exhibits are often well worth checking out. Special events are good too. Museum could use more interactive and new material. (I have not seen any updates or changes in the Egyptology section in years.) Staff are quite good, informative and friendly. Summer camps...

Culture, exhibitions, history, sculpture... ROM has so much to offer. I love to visit there not only to check out the exhibitions, just to walk around and feel the atmosphere is fun. Every time I went I felt as if I had a big buffet for my eyes and brain. The building is huge and quiet for the most of...

The Royal Ontario Museum, or 'The ROM', as it’s more popularly known, has been extended in size over the years and most recently in 2007 with the latest addition, the Michael Lee Chin Crystal, marking it as a symbol of a ‘new age’ for the soon to be 101-year-old Museum. Don’t miss the Galleries of Canada and the First Peoples....

This museum is a jewel! in the heart of Bloor st, great location! near a subway station and close to shopping and restaurants in Yorkville. Great exhibits yearly! more than 6 million items and 40 galleries to blow your mind! I loved the dinosaur gallery! don't hesitate to give it a try, its around $16 only and it doesn't disappoint

Spent about 3 hours today going to the museum. Nice displays, we started with a tour but then peeled off because the lady was whispering. You might want to skip the tour unless your guide can project their voice.

This Museum is very good. The building itself is very interesting, its worth going there just to see it. Exhibitions inside are very good. Dinosaurs fossils are very interesting. Asiatic exhibitions too.
Beautifully designed inside and out. Really nice place with lots to see and do. Great for kids and teens. Well worth it in Toronto.
I have been here twice. It is fun and they have cool exhibits I liked but if you get the chance to see it then I would recommend you check it out yourself.

I have heard a lot of good and wonderful storied about the ROM, perhaps that was the downfall, that I went in with very high expectations. Very descent Museum with good variety of exhibits however similar to many around Canada, nothing is a breakthrough or breathtaking.However still a must if you are in Toronto.
Went back when i was in grade 8, i remember it well, there were mummies, and all kinds of other artifacts. was a good educational stop along our trip.

I have been to many exhibits at the ROM. The building has been renovated several years ago, lots of space to view. Love the Rock/jewels area, that sis always there. The children's section is. Unbelievable. Allows lots of time for the kids to interact with games etc.Clean, spacious Lunch area. A definite to attend especially with exhibits from. Around...

Nice museum. Many artifacts from various cultures, era, and subjects. Took a few hours to visit and get a good overview. Suggest you go after 16:00 as price is reduced. Enough time was remaining for me.
Love the outside of the "crystal" buildingThe inside is ridiculous use of space. It leaks in pleas and the angled walls can bump your head or trip you.

It's not the Met, but it is a good bet in Toronto. Special exhibit of photographs of every nook and cranny in the ROM is outstanding. Ask about it. It is time consuming to follow this massive exhibit and worth every minute.

Overall experience is great! You need a whole day to visit this place. We went last year and we did not complete the tour of the place because we are all tired and hungry :-). We will be back tomorrow to see the rest of the exhibit.

I went with my family with 3 kids. It was very good. Kids loved it. We stayed for 6 hours. Alot to see with 4 levels. Many kids friendly areas to hang out play and learn. Living outside of Washington, DC, my daughter and I are spoiled by the opportunities to visit the various Smithsonian Museums. We had both read about the Royal Ontario Museum and added it to our to do list. The ROM is a beautiful building and definitely worth a visit. I was disappointed that the admission cost didn't include all the exhibits...

We were looking for a more grown-up Museum, with more paintings from the masters. If you have younger children this is your stop. If you are looking for a little more mature scene - try the Art Gallery

I loved the trip to this museum and it was so enlightening. The exhibits are one of a kind and the place definitely has something for all age groups. So many artifacts that are intended to please all tastes make it a fun visit. The food at the place is also good and goes as another advantage for the place....

Join the ROM immediately, you won't regret it. It is filled with unique and spectacular art, exhibits are perfectly presented and the dinning room offers great, affordable food if you've a mind to spend the day!

Not matter what age you are, you'll enjoy it! they has a little bit of everything for everyone, you just have to be ready to expend the day and be wowed with what they have to offer, there are a lot of permanent exhibits and special ones like "Pompeii" coming soon, but what it caught my attention the most, was...

The ROM is a great place for children and adults. I visited with my children aged 6 and 8 during the Christmas holiday. We went here mainly to see the dinosaurs. My kids all love the "night at the museum" movies and I think they were expecting so much more. Not for them to come alive,lol, but just the over all exhibits. We went in the afternoon which you get a better price but found we were rushed trying to see as much...

The museum is fun if you just go to look at things. We spent a few hours here, and tried to methodically view each exhibit. Some of the older exhibits were quite easy to follow - you knew the period and origin of the artifacts or display. The newer sections were incredibly difficult to follow - the signage didn't really...

Starting at 4:30 pm on Fridays the price for the museum is reduced. This is the best time to visit if you are interested in saving money. The museum is like any other museum in terms of exhibits. It seems like it would be a great place to take children as a lot of the displays are geared towards a...
I went there on a weekend. It took around 3 hours to complete a round of museum. It has multiple levels and brochures are available in English and French. Must visit if you have curious children ;-)

We had a good time exploring the museum. We found the price a tad high however. The building was very loud and crowded, the acoustics plus lots of children. So while we did enjoy it, it was hard to focus. The enter acne to the Aztec section was confusing but we found it eventually.

The ROM is conveniently located at the corner of Bloor Street & University on the Yonge/University subway line. Adult entry is CA$ 19.95 .plus additional fee for special Shows ie; The World Naturalist Photograph exhibit. Great, interactive museum for adults , families or school groups. Downstairs cafe or you can brown bag it & bring your own lunch etc..

It was an enjoyable visit, but after a while, it seems like we rushed to see as much as we could and not be delayed for the rest of our day in Toronto. The dinosaur parts were great, as well as the geological stuff. Everything else seemed like most other museums one has visited before.

My kids loved digging after dinosaur skull, in the activity room as well as the chinese warriors. The bathrooms were very clean even though it was a busy day, don't forget to leave your coat & luggage at the entry, because it's a lot to walk.

I hadn't been the the ROM in many years, so I was eager to see what changes had resulted from the renovations a few years ago. You now enter off of Bloor Street through a very modern addition. This will take a full day and depewnding on your interest mabe another...it helps if you have a focus re: the exibit and have done some homework before your visit
The museum's architecture is a masterpiece on its own, combining the old and the modern, overlooking the nicest corner in Toronto, Bloor and Avenue. Must see.
This museum has lots to see. Overload hit after 2 hours however. Lots of dinosaurs, much from India and China. Great way to spend an afternoon.

I recently visited the ROM during a 2 day stay in Toronto. This place is definitely a must see for anyone visiting. My only advice to anyone planning to go is plan to be there for 4 hours at least if you want to see everything. It takes a good hour to explore each floor. There is lots too see...

Took my 18 month old and 3.5 years old to the ROM. Beautiful museum, but this is no place for toddlers. Lots to learn but lots of walking. dont have to visit india or china they have it all there.need energy to walk around.
Great place for both adults and childrenWell organized exhibitsThe Egyptian mummy area has a vast number of pieces and is a must see

This place is just a joke. It looks like they collected all kind of stuff, but in limited and scarce quantities ( let alone quality ), from all over the world in put in this place in complte mixed-bag type of fashion. Don't miss the wildlife photography exhibit. The pictures are breathtaking and very well displayed, I was there during the week, so it wasn't too crowded. ROM's permanent collection is varied and generally well-presented. They currently have a special exhibit on nature photography. It was very interesting because they provided information about how each shot was captured and presented, and also had works by very talented teen photographers.

So, I love this place. Well I should first tell you I am museum goer. Taught my kids since they were newborns to love museums too. Anyhow.. About the ROM.- The best way to do it is to go online and check out their map. You can pin point all the "must sees" and the "if the kids aren't...

The ROM has eveything - something for everbody. If you can find it. A first visit is confusing, due to a more or less successful amalgamation of old and new, the new looking as weird as it gets. The ROM is definitely one of my favourite places to visit in the city. It also helps that I get free tickets to events and exhibitions for the most part since I know someone that works there. This is a museum located in Queen's Park shaped like a cube or something. However, the entrance is impossible to find! Before actually going into the museum, I visited the cafe at the basement. I must admit , I don't like how the ROM was redesigned and reorganized. It's counterintuitive. The museum has many interesting exhibits.Tip: don't waste your money in ROMs cafeteria - the food sux and is overpriced. Cross the road to a bar- restaurant to get a nice lunch for half the price :-)

This is a major museum with lots to see but somehow it just doesn't live up to its goal. The exhibits (other than special travelling exhibits) seem tired and haphazard. The amenities are definitely not up to snuff. It could be much better.

The Royal Ontario Museum is huge, which I claim to be it's strength and weakness! There are too many exhibits with descriptions, which makes viewing and learning about everything in one day almost impossible. Absolutely brilliant displays, tours, an amazing collection of animal, mineral, & plant specimens. Was a great learning experience. Just goes to show you a never to old to learn something new.Was a wonderful experience & we have been back quite a few times. You need to go many times to see different things. Went to the museum with high expectations since it is one of the largest museum in north america with world class standards. Lots to see and do, I was there for approx. 3 hours and I felt like I ran around, its all so overwhelming.

As a New Yorker, I was impressed by the immensity of ROM. The displays were interactive and informative, would've liked to see more on Canada other than the European and Native American History. Perhaps it could have more information on Canadian history after independence. Great for kids and families, parking is difficult so best bet is to travel by foot...

Terrific museum even if you are not Canadian. Doesn't get it's proper due. Kinda expensive to enter, but worth 4 hours of time even on vacation. Gives you a great feeling for the depth and breadth of this great country. People need to know more about Inuit culture and the sad way even this great land treated their ancestors.

This museum is huge and requires more than one visit to do it justice. The photography exhibit that is there currently is fabulous and definitely worth a visit. Did not find this museum that engaging. We took the family and that was our best idea yet we had a blast the first floor is Herman Levy gallery Chinese Japanese and Korean antiquities and architecture and next was prehistoric area and the chin crystal area and then we enjoyed some historical art and then the top floor animals animals animals we absolutely loved it. One can easily spend a whole day looking at the various artifacts from all over the world that are on display in here. The displays are really nice and the explanations are wonderful as well. Another of my favorite places I have never been to or even heard about. But in line with being a good TAer I submit this review, because they asked me to. So, I dunno...you might want to read some others before deciding if this is the place for you or not. But keep in mind, it is a museum, so...
I like the ROM it is not the Museums you see in Vienna but for Canada it is pretty goodI thought was a bit expensive

As is always the case we walked away from our trip to the ROM feeling very good and wondering where the time went. To visit or leave in Toronto, ROM is the best place where you can spend and enjoying your all day. I have been there many, many times and will go again and again. Always is there something new to see, especially when a new exhibition is there with a famous artists.
My daughter had her 13 th birthday at the ROM....with Six of her friends. They participated in the scavenger hunt, which was very mind stimulating and was enjoyed by all.

At trip to the ROM is a must. This is a world class museum!. It offers something for everyone. I have been going since I was five years old and have enjoyed witnessing the many transformations over the last 50 years.My favourite exhibits are on the Dinosaurs, Egyptian, African, and Chinese. I recently went there with my daughters Girl Guides Troupe (ages 4-6) and her siblings aged 16 months and 10 years. It was lovely to see how the museum has set up exhibits to hold the attention of all ages. The tour guide was especially wonderful and held the attention of 20 4-6 yr olds for an hour and several...
Was going to tour, but didn't want to pay $16 to get in; gift shop is nice though. Perhaps they have a free day oncd a week/month.

We stopped by on a Sunday morning and happy that the crowd was minimal - especially because we were running behind our toddler.The museum is huge and has tons of great exhibits, but we tended to focus more on the children's activities (The First People's exhibit was amazing, btw). For our 2yr old, we spent some time in the...

I've visited the ROM several times to see exhibits and have most recently visited for the "Friday Night Live" nightclub style event. The venue houses many great exhibits and I always enjoy seeing different parts of history. The nightclub style event was definitely an interesting and unique experience and I will be back!
This is one of the great museums of North America. It has all that you would traditionally expect to find in a city museum, but it also hosts excellent exhibits of world-class quality.

This is one of the best museums I've been to. Exhibits not only had excellent collections, but were well-displayed and explained. Saw the BBC-sponsored exhibits from a nature photography contest. Best I've ever seen - GO!

When I was growing up, I would go to the ROM almost every weekend during the winter months. It is still one of the best ways to spend family time in the city as there is literally something for everyone. Your kids like dinosaurs? the ROM's collection is world class with dinos visible from Bloor Street before you even enter!...

Lots to see and do for all ages; large gift shop; large deli in basement [no ambience, but many food choices from hot burgers to cold sandwiches & everything in between].An absolute 'must' if you are visiting the city with children.

Checked out the ROM during its Friday Night Live event. What a great time! It was such a thrill to rediscover some of my favourite exhibits, with a glass of wine, great music and a group of fellow university students. Very affordable, and would make for a great night, whether for the whole night or as a first destination. Been...

I had some young visitors for an afternoon, and took them (ages ranging from 8 to 14) to the ROM. It's a wonderful place to discovery so much of the far reaches of world and to go back in time. The collections are excellent, and the educational spaces top notch. It can be a little pricey for non-members, so be...
Liked the beauty of the Royal Ontario Museum and everything it had to offer, in the heart of the city.

Museum has lots to see for everyone, but almost too much. We ran out of time and stamina as we were there while killing time waiting for a train out of the city. My 4 year old son particularly loved the dinosaur exhibit and the bat cave while my 20 year old daughter loved the precious gems section. Facilities are...

I just visited the Royal Ontario Museum and was impressed by the diversity reflected in their collections, as well as the aesthetically pleasing and informative way in which these collections were presented. It took us about 3 hours to explore the museum, and we probably could have spent more time there except that they were closing early for a special...

Really great museum and well located on Bloor, ample parking in the surrounding areas, good collection of Dinosaur's etc, well worth a visit if in Toronto.Recommend online purchase of tickets as Lines can be quite long to "buy at the door".Food is ok but pricey.

This is an excellent all around museum, like the British Museum on a much smaller scale. It is centrally located, and the Bata Shoe Museum and Gardiner Ceramic Museum are close by. I spent about 1 1/2 hours here, but you could easily spend more, depending on your interests.

We were visiting Toronto in November 2014.. We always like to see local museum. ROM has so much to offer. You can easy spend day to browsing through exhibitions. Dinosaurs,Egipt,Romans ,geology ...But we will highly recommend to take free guided tour in museum. They have 3-4 tours in day. It is 45-60min. We have been on two of them...

Our kids love to see all of the different birds in the display, as well as the dinosaur bones... Disappointing that there is not too many interactive displays or live animals. A must visit with something for all interests. Educational and awe inspiring. I am always impressed by the dinosaurs.

In an architecturally diverse setting, young and old alike will enjoy a day at the museum. A nicely organized and displayed collection. Interesting special exhibits (I was there most recently for the treasures from the Forbidden City). Buy tickets on-line to avoid line-ups. Check website for reduced admission times. The bat cave is a favourite with youngsters, as is the...

It took me a whole day to go round every exhibit but it was worth it. ROM was one of my fav attractions. The Dinosaurs and the Geological room were probably my favorites, but also the Egyptian stuff they had were wicked. The Chinese and the Buddhas were also humongous! Very good for Canadian history, too. Absolutely loved it

The Royal Museum of Toronto is a small but very informative one.The best expositions deal with Canadian Indians, their traditions, clothing, hardware, etc.Second best is the section on world peoples, which shows the same features in a nutshell.There sections on Canadian history, dinosaurs, and other animals.

I've been to the ROM a number of times, most recently for their "behind the scenes" tour last spring. This is certainly a world class museum and I have yet to visit every exhibit in one day.The geological and Egyptian exhibits are always my favourite, and I have a hard time leaving the gift shop with my hands empty....

4.5 hrs was not enough time to see everything at this magnificent museum, but we enjoyed every area we visited. The design was really weird but the exhibits themselves were incredible. If you're family or kids are into dinosaurs, this is a great place to go. It has great architecture, is easy to get to and has lots of hands on exhibits for adults and kids.

Have been here many times. World class museum. This is BIG, GRAND & has INCREDIBLE EXHIBITS.I would advise any and all to visit.Personally, I think it's important to introduce kids to museums. It's an important family tradition to start and you couldn't do better than this

We visited in November 2014 as this was part of the citypass that we had purchased earlier in our trip.We were amazed at the huge range of exhibits within the museum but the stand out has to be the bat cave! ROM has grown up along with the city of Toronto into a world class facility. I would suggest a minimum 4 to 6 hours to see just the highlights. I would also call ahead and ask when they expect not to be busy as it's much better when it's quiet and not crowded.

I recently made a trip to Toronto to see this museum. For the entrance price it is well worth it. Lots of artifacts on display, and a broad range of topics covered. So much to see in a day, so I suggest getting there as soon as they open or else you may not get to see the whole thing...

Simply put, The ROM is a monstrous museum. There is an awful lot to see. Too much for one day. Some very interesting exhibits. Loads of stuff well presented. Cafe on lower floor has interesting selection of food although room looks a bit utilitarian. Service was good.

Enjoyed the Rom museum, beautiful building on several floors with a modern new addition, amazing artifacts, wonderful photography exhibit great to visit when in the Yorkville area and you need a shopping break.

Currently there is not an exhibit so we took the time with our annual pass to start reviewing the collection. It is interesting to note this is the 100th anniversary and they have 100 fun facts - worth reviewing.Also was interesting to see who has contributed to the collection and how. Would be a full day to see everything.
good place to learn about science, detailed information about everything in each museum. the organizers put signs everywhere
Kids and adults will enjoy their time here! Everything here is kid friendly and is still interesting to see, staff are friendly and the gift shop is pretty cool too!
You can spend as little or as long here as you'd like. There isn't a great variety of food provided in the cafeteria but the food that they do have is really yummy.

When going to the ROM it might be better to stay in the older parts of the museum than to venture into the "Crystal" addition or the basement exhibits below the "Crystal". We loved this place while we were living in Toronto. Our kids wanted to go there almost every other weekend. The exposition of dinosaurs was the main attraction to them. We spent literally hours and hours in this museum. For families like us, the family membership is a must.I can only recommend.

This is an immense museum. You almost need a carry a plan (map) with you to keep track where you've been. This is a toned down version of the British Museum, but nonetheless impressive. Artwork and relics from around the globe from full scare T-Rex skeleton bones to dinosaur eggs, Japanese soldiers armours to Chinese Buddahs, Egyptian Mummies to Greek...

Been here a number of times. I enjoy special exhibits and lectures on various topics. I was sad when they closed the Planetarium. Little known fact, a movie theater in the basement seats 200 and has movies showing all year long. I usually go during he Film Festival. You can hear the subway running by which made the movie even...

The Royal Ontario Museum is a place where children can get really excited. It has a wonderful dinosaur collection which is quite awe-inspiring as it is displayed in the new addition to the building. Apart from these displays, most children love the bat cave and the many animal displays. And when they are tired parents can allow their children time...

Well worth a visit. Very good dinosaur / natural history and aboriginal galleries. Nothing to dislike though if you are from Europe, that particular gallery offers little of interest if you are a museum visitor in that part of the world.
You need time to see everything.Therefore several visits will be required.A great place to take your children.back and back and back

There is a ton of stuff at this museum, including dinosaurs, mammals, cultures all around the world, and a room full of gems. I took the free tour which helped get a feel for the highlights, though the guide spoke way too softly. I've been to a lot of natural history museums before, but I definitely learned some new things...

Every few years we get an annual family membership at the ROM (we cycle through rom, zoo, and science centre) and I'm always happy to come back. Get a kick from seeing how my kids become interested in more types of displays than just dinosaurs and the bat cave as they mature. Nice handson stuff and crawl thru spaces for...
Exploring with your children, there's nothing better. We had a great time, the dinosaurs were absolutely incredible.The bat cave was very cool. It was a lot of fun

We loved it, they have a way to make learning fun and interactive most exhibits put you in the scene. The bat cave is awesome. Historical exhibits have you wishing there was more. Allow several hours to completely tour the museum we were a family of six and we walked for three hours and could not finish in one visit.
It is very informative and entertaining, excellent place to spend as a family. They also have good cafeteria.

As a resident of the Greater Toronto Area, I've had the pleasure of visiting the ROM several times and have always enjoyed it. This visit was no exception! It's a wonderful place to go as a family, with something for everyone!

We are Family Members at the ROM and always try to take any visitors from out of town.The exterior art structure of the ROM is quite interesting and so are the artifacts it holds within.Our personal family favorite area is the Super quiet but awe inspiring Gemology area. A great place for a family outing. Lots to learn and interesting things to discover. You won't be able to take it all in with just one visit. I am already looking forward to the next time.

I used to go to school right across University Avenue from the ROM and found it a wonderful place to loiter in the 1970s. Always a treat to visit. I try to make it every year. Huge halls for display. Lots of natural light. Treasures vary from Japanese, Korean, Chinese to Egyptian, Greek and Roman, to North American.

From the diverse and arguably contentious architecture of the facade, to the majesty of the main hall, this world class facility doesn't play second fiddle to any other. Th permanent installations are breathtaking a provoke thoughts and conversations - and the visiting exhibitions are always guaranteed to delight. A must for Torontonians and tourists.

Visited with my 7 year old in the summer - and he was super excited to discover the dinosaur exhibit and the other treats in the museum. The museum should consider a special program for kids lasting 30 minutes that will help them get more out of the exhibits

Sheer volume of exhibition material is overwhelming/huge. They often have interesting exhibitions going on as well.Worth checking out if you're in the area on vacation or a local.Outside architecture is worth a few pictures also.

for children something you should visit. tThey have a wonderful collection of dinos, but as well about Inuit and asian culture. And the architecture by Libeskind makes it attractive for adults as well.

An architecturally interesting design, and plenty to see inside. Lots of hands on and interactive activities for young children. Didnt stay as long as we thought, and ran out of things to see before long. Thought it could be much cheaper than it is. dinosaur exhibits good. though we were allvery disappointed they werent real bats in a real bat...
The museum is huge and if you like visiting museum then definitely ROM takes away your entire day! The staff is very friendly and knowledgable.

I don't think I have ever succesfully been in and out of the ROM in under 6 hours. The overall collection that is on display is incredible i would love to have the opportunity to spend a few days seeing the collection behind the scenes in their repository. An absolutely incredible museum!

Great place to get to know more about the history of Canada. If you're the history or museum buff, definitely don't skip out on this. Unfortunately, there's nothing incredibly memorable about the place unless you really love history.

For a great day trip take the train into Toronto, then a quick subway ride to the ROM. Hadn't been to this wonderful gem of a museum since high school. Great physical recreations scenes of Canadian life, in all its variety. So much to see, exhibits of pottery, wonderful natural history section. Wonderful shop, with gifts for people of all ages.

Visited ROM in this their Centenary year. Coming from London England, ROM is arguably up there amongst the most fully equipped and interesting museums in the world.From the first dinosaur that greets you at the entrance to the Egyptian mummies to the ancient Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Greco-Roman, Indian, Inuits pieces, Canada history section, including the animal kingdom they hold...
Excellent collection. they have very big collection of Dinosaurs. And also lot of Asian collection is amazing, specially Chinese & Japanese. Europium & Rome collection was very unique..

We spent a couple of hours in this museum. The dinosaur and Canada's first people exhibits were interesting, although not as good as the major museums in London or New York. Plenty of places to sit and rest weary feet. Fairly quiet other than a few big school groups.

My husband and I visited this museum on Saturday. Very interesting. As adults it really kept us entertained and before we knew it we had been in there for 2hrs! Time flies when you're having fun! great experience, and fun had by all. will return in the future and recommend and the best part is that it is one of the cheapest things to do as a family in the city

It's been years since I've been to the ROM and I enjoyed myself again this time. I'd never explored the dinosaur exhibit before and made it a point to go to that area of the museum this time. Even the new Libeskind entrance has a tired and shabby feel. nice museum lots to see we bought tickets as part of the City Pass which is well worth the money. My son enjoyed the dinosaurs the best!
Loved it, the dinosaur section was fab for small and big kids alike, it's definitely worth spending at least a couple of hours checking the place out

There are few areas of this museum that I really like - and I've been to many in New York, London, and Paris. The Royal Ontario Museum has wonderful exhibits. All very interesting. I was amazed at all the various exhibits. The children's section was great fun for the kids. We ate at the museum restaurant and the selection if food was good, all different varieties to choose from.

This is a full day's adventure. We spent several hours at the ROM and did not get through all the exhibits. The dinosaur exhibit was impressive. The rocks and minerals display was fabulous- my kids loved it. Easily accessible by subway, and even the subway station has been "museum-ified". The dinosaur exhibits and the "first persons" exhibits were awesome! I expected to be there for an hour or two and it was probably closer to 3 1/2 hours. I think it is a world class museum and I have been to the Louvre in Paris and the new museum in Athens. Of course it can't compare to those two...

We visited on a Saturday afternoon with no crowd. Most of our time was spent on the 2nd floor which had lots or animal displays and interactive displays for the kids. Visited with my kids as part of a trip to Toronto and was immediately impressed by the striking architecture. the exterior is amazing.. From far, you'll know it's ROM.Came here for FNL (Friday Night Live) and the experience was great!Visited all the floors.. just a historical scene, the Diamond room, The Dinosaurs and the dance floor..worth it, worth your time!

It definitely should be on your to do list while visiting downtown Toronto! I love the design of the building, the pieces in there are very interesting... Easily spent 2 1/2 hours here and wanted to stay much longer! Must visit!

There were so many things worth seeing inside that wired looking building. Spent there for around 4 hours and visited every corner. Crystal section was awesome. And they have a nice restaurant inside. So many things to see. Must visit.

Well, you can't visit downtown Toronto and not spend a few hours at the ROM, it's just not an option. There are lots of great family options, and my kids have always loved the gems and stones there. The ROM (or Royal Ontario Museum) in Toronto has been my second home since I was a child. A bit confusing as much of the collection would be in an art museum (ancient Greek, Roman, Egyptian, Byzantine etc.) but then there are also endless dinosaur bones and stuffed bird dioramas. My husband and I enjoyed walking around and see the different culture items on display. We were able to enjoy a casual afternoon taking in the sights and learning about the history of some places around the world. Definitely worth a visit.

A visit to Toronto without visiting this famous museum is a sad waste. There is so much to see inside, all well displayed and laid out. One can spend easily a good part of the day in there. Inclusion in the Toronto City Pass brought us to this fantastic museum. Spent a morning at the museum and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Lots of excellent displays on a wide range of interests. We especially enjoyed the Roman, Egyptian and Greek areas! Like all History Museums there was much to view. The building is amazing and the dinosaur displays are great. Do not forget to see the totem poles when touring the first floor or climbing the staircases where they are installed.

From Galleria, Canadian art, design, Alex Collville exhibit, kid activities, solid collections, this is a must visit. I suggest a break and walk to Chinatown (next block) to re-energize viewing pleasure
WOW. This is a must see. Although I am not a museum go-er on a regular occassion, this is one of the best I have seen . Plan on speding some time however. There is alot to see .
Museum is good, But there should be shows and tours in this Museum in normal days.As its too big , some times it gets boring..

A brilliant building in a very accessible position. The collection is varied and well worth seeing.The 'crystal' extension is for me the star of the show, an amazing design brilliantly executed. Every gallery is surprising in layout and design but shows the exhibits off beautifully. Don't miss the staircase of wonders.Nowhere better on a damp day.
Must see place in Toronto! Reserve time to see all. Dinosauruses are the best part but lots of other interesting stuff to see. Building itself is marvellous.
Great exhibition on first nations. New and oldbuildings are attractive, but a challenge to navigate. Very disappointing cafe.

From the impressive façade to the wonderful collections this museum has it all. We spent a good 4 hours wandering the building and could happily have spent longer. Plenty of child friendly exhibits and activities, including a bat cave (sadly not with real bats) and an impressive section on dinosaurs. Pretty good café too, with free coffee on the day...

If you are in Toronto make sure you visit this. Great exhibits and well laid out so you dont miss anything. Make sure you have a few hours to spare to get the most from your visit. Quite central, we walked there from the harbour front where we were staying but is on the metro and bus routes. Good gift...
I like museums with dinos so they had a good size section for that. everything else were modern animals along w/ geology. there was also a chinese architecture section which was neat.
My family loved the visit... Especially the Dinosaur, Gems and stones and Egypt section at the ROM... Lack of a good map was the only unpleasant part of the trip..
While in Toronto do not pass up the chance to see this place. Great exhibits. Well laid out. Reasonably priced. Very modern interior.
Big and very complete. Plan on at least 3- 4 hours there. Exhibits could have displayed more info. Centrally located.
On the metro and bus lines so no reason to not go here. Well laid out museum that has wonderful displays covering the history of Canada and especially the Toronto area.

Amazing exterior, first off. Price is decent. So many different things to see. Everything from the ancient world to modern. And I still didn't get to see it all. You can spents at least 2 hours or more in this building. Definitely worth a look.
if you want another place to visit in the wonderful city of Toronto, then go to the Royal Ontario Museum. it is really brilliant, and so much to see and do

It's definitely worth a visit if you're into history. The Chinese, Japanese, and Medieval exhibits were my favorite, especially all of the armor and weaponry. A very unusual exterior really catches your eye before you even enter this museum. Certainly worth a visit. The museum has a number of galleries specialising in different subjects. We particularly enjoyed the first nation gallery.

I have been coming here my whole life and grew to love this place for what it was originally! However since the renovations, it has lost all it's charm. Very surprised at how well maintained and detailed this museum is. Much larger than we thought it would be with more exhibitions. Saw very rare gems and minerals, dinosaur skeletons, first ancestor exhibition and extensive wild animals (stuffed Ofcourse).Great place to spend a rainy or cold day.

What makes this museum so enjoyable are the many knowledgeable volunteers, that make one's museum experience so different. I was very fortunate to have had a guide in the Korean art, and then in the Japanese gallery. Both ladies were exceptional; interesting, lively, and VERY well prepared. I thought the ROM was going to be just okay, but I was wrong. This place has so much history from every era, and LOTS of cool and interesting stuff from all these completely different eras. We went as a family and had a good time. The dinosaur, mammals and bird areas are the ones our 3 year old liked best. The kids area is great, and where we spent the majority of our time. Visited the ROM while staying on Toronto on business. There was certainly lots to see and the exhibits were generally quite well described by accompanying plaques. This was OK as far as museums go but I would put it at the top of my list to visit again. The biggest attraction for me was the exhibition on Dinosaurs. For the first time I really got an impression of the size of these things that used to inhabit our world. A great collection.
Here's a natural history museum with a striking new addition that let's you know there is more to be amazed about once you enter.
A multi room museum with a varied display of artifacts ranging from dinosaurs to space exploration. I'd only go if you like museums and it's not a modern interactive museum.

A friend had recommended this museum and what a great find! The layout was great and all the attractions were lovely. We spent almost the entire day here looking at everything. It is one of the best museums I have ever been to and have been recommending it to people visiting Toronto ever since I got home. Would definitely visit...

This museum has an interesting layout and covers a wide range of exhibits with enough for everyone in the family to stay engaged. There is also an app for the Museum – ScopifyROM that is useful. a real jumble of stuff from all over the world, it has the feel of a victorian era collection with piles of stuff in cabinets. it is a great place to while away a few hours, the ancient cultures such as the egyptian gallery is great

World-class exhibits, phenomenal architecture, excellent staff, and something for all ages. Very nice architecture. However the museum is not well organized. You can find a little bit of everything there: the china collection close to Canada one, a bit of Egypt, middle east, Europe, etc... Liked it, nice pleasant way to spend a few hours. Its a good museum and the dinosaur exhibits was well done. Cant fault it, its a good museum.

The ROM is a wonderful museum! The Egyptian section was of particular interest. When I arrived they were just about to start a 45 minute tour, which I joined. The guide was informative and very passionate about what he was showing us. Made what could be an overwhelming exhibit into a very interesting and informative viewing. The mineral section was...
Plan to spend around 4 hours in there. There is a lot to see. Very recommendable is the second floor with items of all aboriginal people from around the world.

Great museum! combines several museums: Archaeology Greece, Rome - GREAT findings. Paleontology, Geology, amazing minerals, Natural history- Dinosaurs, birds, marine. Culture - from Korea to china, Inca, Islam and even a bit Judaism. GREAT museum, don;t miss (especially in rainy days, but not only, go anyway)/

I have been going to the ROM for years. They continually bring in new exhibits to please the mind and the eye. It brings out not only the kid in me, but also my imagination and curiosities.They also have real good day-time activities for children which I find very unique for a museum.
A great place to go and experience something cultural. I like to check out any new exhibits when I'm visiting Toronto.

So much bigger than I thought it was! We only had 2 hours until they closed and we only got through three quarters of it (by rushing and not reading anything). I'm definitely coming again but I'm going to take my time and actually spend time reading about the exhibits.
A great tourist must see this is a world class offering of antiquities that combines both early North American and ancient world quality pieces that will enthral young and old.
The exhibits at the ROM never fail to amaze. This facility stands alone as Canada's most treasured historical/cultural experience

The ROM is first off, a truly stunning venue for what it holds. The Crystal-style architecture on the outside is quite something. The exhibits of dinosaurs and mummies are very interesting and the rotunda and stair of wonders are fascinating. The bat cave is a highlight.

This is a place to explore. Prices can be steep for a day visit but worth it and even worth it to get a family annual membership. A friend and I visited mainly because we wanted to see the travelling "Wildlife photographer of the year" exhibit.While the exhibit was great, it is impossible to buy a ticket to a special exhibit only, so we ended up paying the regular entrance fee plus the extra for the special exhibit, something I didn't like too much. Colossal Art Museum. Gorgeous Architecture. Something for the entire family to enjoy! Great gift shop. We really enjoyed our afternoon at the Royal Ontario Museum. It's in the shopping district on Bloor Street and next to the University of Toronto. Twitter@NatalieMcBee
Lots of different displays, very large museum, very informative. Very average café, food could be better.

It's a wonderful museum to visit. They have lot's of collection on their topics. The ROM is really a gem in Toronto. The Michael Lee Chin Building really stands out. The Museum is modern and really amazing. Highly recommend it.

Great museum, you can spend 4+ hours here if you like the content...Poorly laid out I felt left you wondering if you missed something in the nooks and crannies of the building's layout... BUY THE CITY PASS, totally worth it
A museum with large collections on different topics from Ancient Greek culture to biodiversity threats. We had a good time there!

I found this to be a nice experience, but the parking is so poor. you have to park quite far across the street and if you are not from Toronto, it is hard to find. you also then have to walk quite far as the parking is always full. There were a lot of cool exhibits and the kids loved...
I liked all the exibits, just parking was a hard one to find. It was a fun experience, well laid out and gave us great all day value for the price.
We visited this museum in August 2014 and loved everything about it! So many fantastic collections! A must see for everybody!

A huge, amazing, continuously self-reinventing space where we can learn more about this amazing Country called Canada. Everytime you go there it's shure you'll find something diferent or new!For shure one of the place to go to in Toronto! A must!!!
I'm not sure what I was expecting but it was very enjoyable and impressive. There's plenty for people of all ages.
The "ROM" is another do-not-miss Toronto attraction. It's not just for history buffs, but if you are one you won't be disappointed. A beautiful building in itself.

There is lots to see here, just wish we had more time to see everything. Would definitely go back if we were in Toronto again to take the time to see everything. We particularly loved the dinosaur exhibits- this was actually the reason why we went there in the first place.
I have not been there for 2 years and when I went there I found out some theings that I did not know about and others that was the same

Surprisingly a decent, diverse collection. A significant amount of artifacts from Canada, Asia, and Europe, esp. the Mediterranean region. Though the descriptions of the artifacts are rather overly leftish, it's a nice little museum.

Loved the dinosaur section the best, but it was all pretty interesting, lots to see and very clean, quiet, gift shop had a nice variety of items. You could go with a guide or on your own which was nice, don't know the price as we were with a bus group and it was paid for in advance.
there is lots to see here, just wish we had more time to see everything. would definitely go back if we were in Toronto again to take the time to see every thing there. love the dinosaur exhibits.
Nicely laid out, easy to get around. Good for history of Canada. Cafe expensive but there is an area set aside for bringing in your own picnic.

We spent a few hours wandering around the ROM. There were lots of interesting things to look at. We enjoyed the dinosaur exhibit as well as the other animal exhibits and the gem collection. The ROM did not let me down at all. It was one of the best museums I've ever been to. Absolutely huge, I spent almost the whole day roaming around it. There are alot of exhibit and interesting things to read and see.
The Forbidden City! The hidden treasurers and the explanation of the lifestyle was eye-opening! Opulence! Even our teenage grandchildren enjoyed the exhibit!

Have been to the ROM several times over the last couple of years with our grand son. The current construction on the first level a bit disappointing but did not impact visit. Go, go, then go again. An amazing museum with so much to see. Always a pleasure to explore. Their special exhibitions are always worth the time and are enjoyed by young and old alike.

It's classy and most ppl there were all in costume and were all there to have fun and dance. They had a live band that played throughout the night along with individual food stands. Great history!Great food choices!Produce,cheeses,meat,seafood,ethnic foods of the world!Apples to soup nuts and much more!
The regular exhibits were extensive and comprehensive, and the special exhibits were very well thought out and interesting.
I used to go here as a child and I went in the spring for the dinosaurs exhibit and it still amazes me. You nee to checj this place out at lest one every few years.

Have not been to the ROM in ages but very much wanted to see the Forbidden City and that is what the display was all about - the content was the Forbidden City. After we saw the Forbidden City we ventured to the other areas of the ROM but there is so much to see it is difficult to see...

my wife and I visited the ROM today with our 1-year old and we had a great time. The museum has a high variety of expositions which are quite well laid out by themselves. A decent museum suitable for kids, with a glassy architectural growth on it that we locals call The Carbuncle.But seriously, the ROM is a great place to while away time on a rainy day with school-age kids, with its natural history galleries. Dinosaur and armour exhibits make little boys smile.

We visited the Museum in August 2014. Part was under construction but was still easy to move around. Some exhibits were more interesting that others, but I'm sure that depends on your taste. Unfortunately we had only an hour before the closing time. Visited the third floor with lots of asian art and history. ROM needs at least a day and a half to do justice to it.Student discounts are available.Don't forget to visit the museum store on the ground floor. Interesting artefacts can be purchased but at a price.

Well there are times you think you've seen enough museums for a while, and then you come across a place like the ROM. Special exhibits, dinosaurs. GEMS that you can't believe.gotta spend the day and then some.

Been coming here since I was a kid. I remember being TERRIFIED by the skeletons hanging everywhere. As I grew older, I learned more about them and love them now.
