The expansion has given new life to the facility - the subway station makes it very easy to get to, even for fancy events.

At the moment there is a special exhibit on China's forbidden city. Each year these special exhibits are of high quality. This one appears well researched with surprising detail. It brings to life a topic that might never otherwise be researched.Apart from special exhibits its standing exhibits such as its dinosaur fossils and exhibits on ancient cultures are also...
Beautiful, informative and inspirational. Wonderful family afternoon and it is really easy to get to on the subway. We'll be back next year.

We booked out hotel with ROM tickets included. We liked the variety of exhibits and were happy to see a special fashion exhibit (one of our daughter's passions). The complaint was in the layout. Found it hard to find the exhibits from the map and very easy to lose someone. Felt like we went in circles.
Lots of different things to see and experience . We used the Toronto City pass worth the price, Something for most everyone

This is such a family friendly museum. Lots of interactive exhibits to enjoy as a family. Even though I was traveling alone for business, even I enjoyed the massive dinosaur exhibit. In fact, I am not sure I have ever seen such a great exhibit before. Some of the other artifact areas were a little dull, but overall this was...

Most museums I have been to usually focus on a specific subject area (nature, human history, etc.) but the ROM has a great deal of variety which makes it a nice place to visit for groups who have differing tastes. I liked seeing ancient history best of all while my wife liked the dinosaurs and natural history sections. The mummy...

Was somewhat disappointed as the ROM had some interesting artifacts but not well presented in some areas.They could benefit from some marketing specialistsGood thing we had the Toronto City Pass or I would not recommend people paying the retail rack price as its not worth the fee.
What a stunning exhibit. Congrats to the ROM! So much to see, great interactive pieces. I truly did not know! Am reading the Empress Dowager CIXI now. And the western world thinks it is so advanced!

Admission is free on Tuesday for university students. We stayed about 4 hours, but it needs at least a day to visit highlights. They have some (free) tours every day, those are very useful if you have limited time to spend at the museum: http://www.rom.on.ca/en/activities-programs/events-calendar/search?field_session_date_value%5Bvalue%5D%5Bdate%5D=&keyword=&tid=224

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our trip around the museum especially the exhibition showing items and pictures of the early indigenous people as we knew little about the original inhabitants of the country.The exhibits overall were well laid out and had sufficient information. It was good to see school classes there learning about different cultures and peoples.The...

Great museum,excellent exhibit,some of the art &clothing of Emperor were truly breathtaking!! Other exhibit were wonderful. If Ihave one complaint , it's that a lot of glass cases were dirty & may some pieces very difficult to see.

We spent the whole time learning about how Canada was founded and explored and about its early Indian inhabitants. There was a wonderful collection of artefacts and stunning photographs all displayed with thoughtful narrative. We learned a great deal about life in the early days of Canadian settlement.
An amazing place to take your family, or loved one(s) and friends! You could spend the whole day in there.

My family enjoyed walking and viewing the artwork here. The museum gift shop was great. We met the visitors ambassador there and he was so friendly and informative. Great day trip and nearby restaurants are good too.

This peek inside The Forbidden City has breadth and depth into the Chinese Emperor's court and lifestyle is highly unique and takes about two hours. While not exhaustive by any means (only a sampling of Emperors), it's easier than going to Beijing to see a large quantity of artifacts. Be aware of the separate admission fee for this special exhibit....

This was a nice treat, but honestly, unless you're going for a specific exhibition or you just really like museums.. it's a little bland and nothing you wouldn't have seen in other major cities and major museums.

We decided to see the ROM our last day in Toronto. We couldn't spend too much time there for many personal reasons, but we managed to get in about 4 hours in with an additional 30 minutes for lunch in the cafe. They have a special exhibit for the "The Forbidden City" about China's Emperors which was very good. We...
Just go and see what the ROM has to offer. Take the subway and get off at Museum - it's a fun stop. You can't do the whole thing in one day, so don't try. But come and give it a good shot!

I am almost embarrassed to admit that I thought this was going to be an art museum, not a science museum. We only had time to visit the section on rocks and minerals and the dinosaur display, but we can say that we learned a lot and the displays were well done. The staff was friendly and helpful.

amazing history and artifacts. The BC museum has or had a two day ticket which is great if you don't have the energy to spend the long hours to truly take in and see all. The RIM was much more Worldly than the RBCM and we font have cute anagrams either.

Under renovation but still great. Some beautifully designed and curated new sections. Fasciinating. A few of our favourites, Greece and Rome, Egypt, China, First Peoples Hall, Dinosaurs, Biodiversity (natural history) Halls.

ROM is one of my favorite places in Toronto - I like it so much that right now I have curator membership and often take family and friends for visit. There is so much to see and learn - fantastic place for younge kids to discover our world - past and present. Forbiden City exhibit is so informative and interesting...

Excellent Museum, Dinosaur exhibit is the biggest I've seen and presented well.Kids enjoyed it but eventually got too tired to see it all.Even for adults without kids it would be a struggle to see it all in one visit.
Nice museum great visit, really worth it. You will need alt least 4hours to visit it. Nice for childredn

We went here primarily for the Forbidden City exhibition, which was excellent. I'm glad we went to it, because otherwise I think I would have been a little disappointed with our visit. We found the layout terribly confusing, and there were some areas closed (not clear why). We did enjoy the dinosaurs and the Asian collections but other parts felt...

Huge collection, amazing stuff to see but my most favourite thing is DINOSAURUS !!!!They have also pretty awesome guests that talk about different stuff so there is a lot to learn for kids and adults.I WOULD RECOMEND THAT ANYONE WHO COMES TO VISIT TORONTO GO AND CHECK ROYAL ONTARIO MUSEUM.

I have fond memories of visiting ROM on my last visit to Toronto in 1996. Unfortunately the visit this time didn't make as much of an impression, though the Forbidden City exhibition is very interesting and well resented. My mobile phone was lost/stolen during my visit, so perhaps this was why I don't have such good memories this time around.

If you're visiting the city, this is pretty much a must see, in my opinion. However, how much time you devote to it depends on you. You could easily spend an entire day here, but most people don't have the patience for that. The museum is well laid out so you can skip eras of history that you don't find...
First time I've been to the ROM in about 40 years. Lots to see. Impressive collection. We wished we could have gotten into the special display without paying more money.

I have visited the ROM many times over the past several years and there is always something wonderful to discover. Their permanent dinosaur exhibit located in the modern Crystal addition is extensive. Their shorter term exhibitions have always been simply amazing. Plan on several hours to even get a good feel for the treasures the ROM holds. It is a...

We went on family trip and though it has cost to enter its worth it. However extra cost for China- forbidden city exhibit- unless you like this don't waste the moneyabsolutely amazing dinosaur exhibits covering two large rooms.Rooms on early Canadian history also well laid out and very interesting.Canteen area- so much to choose from and so...

Having visited China a few years ago, I was looking forward to refreshing good memories. I was not disappointed. This exhibit displayed many of the fine objects that indicate what it was like to live in those times. Things that were not shown on the trip as a tourist in China.Now I wish I had gone to see the...

We only had half a day and saw about 2 / 3 of the Museum. Highly recommended, give yourselves time!Café was too crowded for us, we got a late lunch in the Mediterranean café on...
The museum was well laid out and easy to explore. Everything was labelled and easy to read. The exhibits were interesting and very enjoyable. Would definitely recommend a visit.
I am not a museum person but I was absorbed by the various exhibits. Well worth a visit when in Toronto. Kids would love it.

I agree with another reviewer and am perhaps spoiled by the museum in Victoria BC. I found the layout of the museum to be challenging to navigate and confusing. Make sure you leave ample time to weave your way in and out, up & down. Great day of adventure for family. Can also agree with others that the cafeteria was...

The only reason we drive to Toronto Canada from North Carolina was to go to this museum! It was worth all the traffic jams and the hassle of finding parking in downtown Toronto, to go to this museum. The exhibits are awesome! The museum is clean, the exhibits are modern and easily seen. The architecture of the museum is beautiful....

We went to see the treasures of the Forbidden Palace in Beijing. We enjoyed it and so did our 13 year old daughter.We love this museum and always find an exhibit we haven't seen in the past. It can get crowded though and the flow of people are impeded due to construction.
While it isn't NYC's Museum of Natural History, this museum has lots to take in. Don't miss the Inuit sculpture carved from a whale vertebra!

We went here after a long day of travel and the museum still wowed us. In particular, we enjoyed the dinosaur/mammal areas, the Japan/China/Korea sections, and the ancient sections on the higher floor. We even ran out of time and were unable to see the one of the rooms. Some interesting pieces throughout the museum. We did not do the...

My husband and I visited ROM today with kids, 5 and 4 yrs old. We thought it was highly impressive and offered so much for all ages and interests. We will definitely return before we leave. Level 2 is entirely for kids and offers them a superb opportunity to learn about animal and plant life as well as much more....

I guess the name of the museum really raised my expectations. I thought we were "museum loving" people but maybe "spoiled" museum people is what we are. This museum is pricey with the special exhibit fee and we felt like it was a bit disorganized. Too much repetition and not very interactive. We really did not enjoy it but our...

Great place to visit!!! We the exhibits, especially the dinosaurs and Egyptian exhibit. The museum is currently undergoing some renovations, but we able to navigate without difficulty. There are many places to sit and rest.
Great exhibitions although as a european tourist I thought there was not enough on Canadian History. Super cafe with great choice of lunch.
Didn't have enough time to do all of it, but never do. Got to see the dinosaurs, the Egyptian exhibit and a little of the Chinese exhibit. Such a wonderful place!! Gift store is beyond amazing.

Enjoyable on the whole. The exhibits are many and varied and the staff very helpful and knowledgeable.The wait to get tickets was long, however. In fact many people left the line as we were waiting. In this age of the Internet it is nice to see children enjoying a museum. Our children found this place amazing! My son love the mid evil weapons display and my daughter loved the Egyptian area. My wife enjoyed the minerals and metals section. I still can't decide what I liked the most. Overall it was information overload. The displays...

This museum has changed so much over the years, they have done a really great job renovating it.The travelling exhibits are always very well done and worth a look! And the permanent exhibits never get old.Overall, most definitely worth a trip!
We had an awesome visit at the ROM. I could have spent much more time here if my non-museum fans were more cooperative. The dinosaur exhibit rivals that of the Museum of Natural History in NYC.

We enjoyed re-visiting the ROM since it had been many years. It was interesting and informative! We had a wonderful lunch/snack in the cafeteria style restaurant which offered many delicious selections and an array of health conscious choices...it was hard to decide what to have :) A great way to spend a rainy day!

wonderful museum. my 4 year old loved the children friendly exhibits especially dressing up in historical costumes (e.g., knight costume) and the dinosaur dig. it was very large museum and we didn't even make it to all the floors.

Took my 3 year old grandson to the ROM to see the dinosaurs. It was a very interesting and extensive exhibition with good labelling and play area for children. A very educational experience with helpful staff.
This place is great.. It was our first time there and I must say it is one little gem,, During our time they had this acient chinese exhibite and it was so cool to see..Can't wait to go back :)
It's fun to have science, art, and history collections all in one place, but be aware that there is a lot of remodeling going on, and whole floors may be shut down if there is a private event.

I'm in town on business and have been looking for things to do that I don't normally get to do so I thought I'd check out the ROM. I loved the outside of the building and couldn't help but hear other tourists talking about how cool it looks also.I was kind of annoyed from the get go when I...
Very interesting place. For the young to the old. We brought our own food but the cafeteria isn't too expensive n food doesn't taste to bad.
Husband and I did a quick tour of the ROM. Was fun but could have spent more time (we only had 2 hours). Nice for adults, some neat stuff for kids too.

A wonderful place to spend 2 or 3 hs among origin of earth and life, first peoples, dinosaurs, mammals, birds, etc. Plenty of hands on places. If you visit the chinese exhibition about "the Forbidden City, which is simply fantastic, it will take more a couple of hours.
It is a cool place to spend an afternoon. Lots of different ancient artifacts to look at with a wide variety. They add new exhibits very often to keep things interesting. A fun time

There is so much to see and learn in the ROM. It's been there for a long time, and they've always kept everything possible up to date, and are constantly renewing the exhibits. My particular favourites are the ancient Mediterranean culture exhibits on the topmost floor, and the first nations exhibit on the ground level.Although I can't necessarily recommend...

The ROM is a fun and informative experience for children and adults. Its permanent exhibits wear well - interesting visit after visit. Its special exhibits from around the globe and its own vaults are truly world class and engaging. Cameras are often welcome - check with staff.We go several times a year and take our grandchildren every few months...

I could spend weeks in there. Unfortunately, I only had two days in Toronto so had to spend my time judiciously in the museum.Ranging from mineralogy to paleontology, to history and civilization, it was very educational
Love the ROM. I keep renewing my membership because there is always a reason to visit. Interesting and fun for anyone. Thank you!
There were so many floors and it seemed like endless rooms. I would highly recommend it. Nice Roman and Canadian sections too!

This is a combination museum, art, history, and natural history. The Chinese and Korean ceramic collections are fantastic and cover thousands of years. There is currently a special exhibit of things from the Forbidden City, not to be missedAnd, of course, the dinosaurs are always fun to see.We spent 3 hours but you could be there 3 days...

Yes the ROM can be boring, however, if you want excitement attend the ROM on a Friday night from May-June and October-September. Music(DJ's-Live Bands), food, alcoholic beverages. Go early and be prepared to have fun! See you there!

Something for everyone's interest at the ROM. Loved it and wished I could have spent the whole day there. Definitely will go back if I go back to Toronto. Excellent if you love geology (minerals, fossils galore)!

Around every corner in this museum there's something wonderful waiting to be admired and appreciated. We only viewed the permanent collection and that took us over 4 hours. Well worth the prIce of admission.

One of the best museums I've ever visited!The exhibits cover many areas, you will always find something that interest you in ROM.The minerals exhibits in the 2nd floor is BREATHTAKING!!! Do visit there first!The museum is quite large, if you try to read every sign and plaque, you can barely finish all the sections in one day.

I went to see the special Forbidden City Treasure exhibit last week. It brought back many memories of our trip to China and our visit to the actual Forbidden City. The exhibit was very interesting because there were objects on display that used to be in the empty rooms we saw in Beijing. It was well organized with information about...
Bring your kids the'll learn and love it. lots of dinosaur stuff, Mummy's and there pets and lots more.

2 weeks ago we went there good for teenagers to learn in science, tech and nature.For kids they have area too so they can have fun.Its good for education purpose.Not for pleasure.so if u like to learn go there u will learn something.

Well if you are tired and looking for a way to fall asleep check this place out. Also if you like looking a pottery or old furniture this is the place for you. The only reason we went as it came with the City Pass.
Always have new exhibits. can spend hours walking around all the exhibits.TIP - If you buy your ticket online you can skip the lines which can sometimes be really long!!

Really interesting museum, only saw a small part of it. Had an exhibition of the Forbidden City, well organised and informative.Cafe was reasonable and very ecofriendly with all tne different recycling bins. The dinosaurs and other fossils well presentedOverall a good experience

Enjoyed a great visit during the Emperors do China exhibit. It was great and very informative. I was going to visit china shortly after this and I learned more at the ROM than on my tour. After this exhibit, went to see others and found the setup very confusing and all the exhibits quite overwhelming. Would recommend doing one or...
I thought the exposed objects were well chosen and well explained - however I only had 2 hours to visit this museum and I must return. My guess is that you need at least a day per exposition.
We found something for everyone in our family of 15 to enjoy-ages from 5-years-old to 90-years-old. The dinosaur exhibit was outstanding.

This is a different category of museum for sure. I think that you have to be a museum person to fully appreciate this one. Admiring impressionistic painting one thing. Experiencing a melt down of appreciation while looking at a Cezanne or a Renoir is admirable - something to put on your resume of visiting museums. But be prepared for something...

The permanent collections are nice, but the exhibitions are really something else and must be seen. The Mayas, the Mesopotamia and now the Forbidden Palace exhibitions were wonderfully designed, both informative and extremely enjoyable for kids and adults alike.

We bought the Toronto CityPass which includes 5 attractions. This was the last one we went to and, honestly, I think by that point, we were pretty "museum-ed" out. I have visited many museums and I can truly say that the ROM is the best I have ever been to. They have everything from one of the best Dinosaur exhibit to a really wonderful Ancient Egypt, Greece and Rome exhibit. I would recommend that if you plan to visit you dedicate most of your day to this place. There...

We went to see the Forbidden City exhibit, for which there is an extra charge over the museum entrance fee. Although we have been to Beijing and visited the Forbidden City, we enjoyed the exhibit and learned more about the life inside the city during the reign of the many dynasty's . This is a great museum. I would have liked to spend more time in the nature area but it was crawling with little children running all over the place. We also wanted to go see the Forbidden City attraction but it was an extra $11/person on top of our City Pass so we decided not to go. The Evolution of...
The museum is great and huge. The food at the restaurant is mediocre and the staff at the restaurant seem to hate their jobs.

Great for 1-2 hour visits, informative for children and adults. Features a bat cave and touring exhibits. For adults, I'd highly recommend Friday Nights at the ROM. Where it's basically a fun themed dance party with cocktails for those who are not into the club scene and or like to party with dinosaurs as the backdrop. Often there are different...

Last year I visited the ROM with my friend from the United States. This year, I took my husband, having extra time in the morning before we visited Ripley's Aquarium. For some reason, this year, I found it difficult getting to the exhibits I wanted to see. Perhaps it is that we had limited time, but dollar for dollar, the...
The kids got bored relatively quickly (7 & 9) but I thought it was fascinating and well laid out. I'd like to return by myself one day for a more leisurely tour to soak in the culture and history.

I have seen quite a few museums. After seeing museums in Washington DC, all being free, this felt like a rip off. Nothing special really, except for the shape and structure of the building from outside. It has been less than a week since I visited and I am trying to think hard what stuck with me from there. I...

The ROM is one of the better museums I have been to. Its collection is amazing, with artifacts from China, Rome, Byzantium, and Egypt just to name a few. We spent several hours in this world renowned museum. All very very nicely prepared and hands-on for kids. A special kids section allows for further exploration by the small and was highly appreviated by our daughter and others.
We only looked at certain areas & it still took at least 2 hours plus. There was art, natural history, artifacts animals, first people. There are also hands on things for the kids to do.

I have always loved museums as a child so I decided to take my son to the ROM. The lay out is very confusing, you never really know how to get somewhere or how you ended up where you are. The dinosaur exibit is always a favourite... Until I realized most of them were fake. We did not enjoy our...

I was really surprised by the price tag on this museum. Without the special Chinese Emperors exhibit, it was one of the best value events we've done in our 26 days in Toronto. The first and third floors and mostly the "dry" historical items; art, armor, furniture, weapons, glass, sculptures, etc. The second floor is the best for kids, with...

We did not find this museum to be interesting for any of us and it was not laid out well at all. Of all the things we did in Toronto with our 11 and 12 year old, this was our least favorite and we typically do like museums.

me and my 14 year old daughter visited rom , and we both find it attractive . all its different chambers were nice , and well decorated. but for not definitly a very rich museum. we bought the whole city pass tickets and rom was one of tge must to see.

Our family has been to the ROM many times over the years and we like it a lot. It can be overwhelming if you try to take it in all at once. Massive collection, crowd just nice not too squeezy, seems like one of the main attractions there. Could be more interesting though. There is a van, seems permanently there selling v nice ice cream, made the visit feels better.

Very interesting museum! Loved the dinosaurs and Japanese & Korean displays! Lots of kids there for summer camps ,but the guides kept them together and focused. Nice to see them so excited about the museum offerings.
Love the dinosaurs but they were the best part, was hoping for more Egyptian stuff but it's still an awesome place to go and take your kids. Such a great learning experience for everyone of all ages!

If you are downtown Toronto, you should definitely consider going to the ROM! It offers a wide range of history in one building. My personal favorite was the Egyptian mummy exhibit and everything pertaining to Egypt. Another part to check out is the rocks and minerals room. There are so many spectacular things to see. If you are a museum type person, this museum will thrill you! Very spacious, well completed and informative exhibits will take you through different "stories" and keep you entertained. We stayed for over 4hours and did not see everything (but we read ALL the signs!!)
Strange space. Not entirely child friendly. Not easy to navigate around but nice people and good exhibits for adults

Friday night at the ROM is a must-do for anyone who is of legal drinking age. It's a great way to see all the exhibits and enjoy some delicious food and booze at the same time. A fun atmosphere and good price for what the ticket offers. Lots of different food stalls and items to chose from, and the wine...

If you are a museum enthusiast and want to know about the origins of Ontario and Canada, as well as other things, you must visit The Royal Ontario Museum.The layout and method of display reminds one of the London Museums. The Royal Ontario Museum is fantastic. We purchased The Toronto City Pass, and this was one of the attractions offered in the plan. when you walk through the doors, you will be overwhelmed with what there is to see. We only had about 3 hours the day we came this time. Still totally worth it as my daughter is 6 and last time was 2 and she totally got a lot out of it this time. So many things to see so we just picked the ones we knew she would enjoy first. We will for sure return again...

the ROM has always had a reputation as an internationally-respected museum, but if you're a visitor to Toronto (or just exploring your own city), check out ROM Friday Night Live.I've been a couple of times, and the crowd is so amazingly eclectic (as is the music and food on offer)...They open the majority of galleries, where you can wander...

Today, I had the pleasure of seeing a most interesting exhibit at the Royal Ontario Museum. This current exhibit is called The Forbidden City. A great museum with a lot of variety in the exhibits. This is definitely someplace where I could have and should have taken more time. Next time, and there will be a next time, I will go earlier in the day so I can enjoy a more leisurely pace.

I've been going to the ROM since I was a young child, and it's always an enjoyable outing. My favourite galleries are the dinosaurs and Ancient Egypt. Even if you spent a full day, you probably couldn't see everything in every exhibit. even if you are not a history buff the collection here is really amazing - I think best grecco-roman collection in the world. Never get tired of visiting and displays are arranged now so one comes away with an understanding of the society and cultures that produced these works - real learning experience each and every time I visit.

I took a friend who was visiting from Europe here and we had a great time. I hadn't been since my childhood so it was nice to see everything with a fresh set of eyes. I did find that there was an awful lot to do and we didn't budget our time properly so we rushed a bit at the...

We visited the ROM a week or so ago which was when the weather was very sunny and warm but realised as soon as we got into the ROM that we should have worn something a bit warmer!It was so cold in the ROM that it did take some of the pleasure away from the trip but we both...

OMG, so many exhibits to visit. Spend the entire day with my girlfriend and thanks to my history studies, i was able to recall facts and i walked her through most of the exhibit. You cannot finish this museum in a day.But if you on a tight schedule, do not attempt to navigate in less than 6 hours.

We recently saw the "The Forbidden City: Inside the Court of China's Emperors" at the ROM, and were blown away by this family-friendly exhibit containing over 200 national treasures from Beijing's Palace Museum – some travelling outside China for the first time! This show is a definite MUST SEE!

Went here as a larger family so we could check out the Forbidden City exhibit. This was the second time I have been here, but I was a kid last time I was here.Parking was close (right across the street) and a decent price for Toronto.Entry fee was $27 which included the Forbidden City, I would have been...

I'm from Washington and our museums have themes, so for one museum all you might get are dinosaurs and animals. This was such a fun museum as it ranged from textiles to modern art to ancient Egypt to South American tribal collections to photography to gems and jewelry... it was a great surprise.I loved the layout of the museum...

From being a child I would love to go and wander around the museum. The ROM always had a special place in my heart. It was free after 5 or 6 one or two days a week before. I would love to just drop in and wander.

We spent about two hours in this museum and would have stayed longer if it were not for the hordes of children's groups coming through. It is great that kids are able to experience this but there can be too much of a good thing.So... put on your ear plugs and head up to the Dinosaur area on the...

This museum is one of the best we have visited. Tickets are valid for 1 year because you cannot possibly see it all in one day.Wheelchairs are available for use at no cost. This museum was amazing.I just hoped that it would be more interactive. Like my son was really distracted and I wished that they had a map of some sorts so that we didn't miss anything.Also they didn't have an info desk.I really liked the exhibits though. But I wanted to see the Forbidden City exhibit. Didn't know...

We were attracted to checking out the ROM with our 5-year old and 6-year old because of the dinosaur exhibition. The kids had a nice time exploring some of the great exhibits, but we were hoping it would have been a little more interactive than it was. All and all, we enjoyed our time at the ROM
The museum was on the same level as the Field Museum in Chicago or the Natural History Museum in NYC. I would not return, but I am glad I added this to our time in Toronto.

I walked over from my hotel and enjoyed the Asian exhibit on the ground floor. I went on the Friday after Canada Day and it was not as mobbed as I expected it to be. The Forbidden City exhibit was amazing and I was lost for about an hour just looking at everything. Nice museum! The elevators were a bit...
Saw the the Forbidden City exhibit which was beautifully displayed and well worth the money and the journey to see it.

Really enjoyed exploring this museum. There is something for almost any interest. If you try to see everything in one day you may be overwhelmed. Spend time in the sections and exhibits that truly interest you and you will have a wonderful experience! There is something for all age groups.

OK it took two Kiwis and an Aussie to let me know about the AGO. Wed night free admission from 6 - 9 pm. Unbelievable collection of Canadian Artists, Models ships and a special exhibit. In other words only got to see 3 of the galleries and need to go back to see the rest. A must see not just...

I really enjoyed the ROM and do believe that it is worth going to see from time to time. the only thing i found is that i got kind of bored about half way through the day because all we seemed to be looking at the whole time is of antique plates, pots, and head sculptures. But all in all...

I really enjoy going to the ROM because I am interested in history and art. My son, who at the time was about 9 years old, was not as interested and got bored quickly. I love the quirky new addition to the building too, I think it's very unique and looks good. The ROM is easy to navigate and always...

This is as suggested by so many other reviewers an exceptional museum with large spaces and well designed venues for each area of interest. Plan a full day if you wish to see it all, even in a cursory way.

I have seen my share of natural history and other museums, but the ROM by far exceeds most of them! This museum is well worth the entrance fee and it will take a lot longer than a day to even see all things on display - not to mention, diving into them and read them!I very much enjoyed the...

There is so much to see and experience, we did the big dinosaur exhibit and it was worth the admission. Recommend go early on a week day so you can see everything it's a wonderful way to spend a day and totally wheelchair friendly too.

The ROM is one of the best museums I've ever seen .... even the clever architectural juxtaposition of old and new works well and the layout is really clever. The cultural themes are intuitively done and you can get close to many of the exhibits - we particularly enjoyed the ancient civilisations and dinosaurs.

Had the unique opportunity to travel from Los Angeles to Toronto for a wedding and spent part of a day at the Royal Ontario Museum. Wish I had the whole day (and then some). Was able to enjoy the Mesopotamia exhibit. As a fan of history, I really appreciate the Museum's efforts to display different aspects of world history, Canadian...
They had the Forbidden City exhibit while we were there and that was interesting. It was later in the day, so we didn't get to see a lot but what we did see was worth it.
I loved this museum. I was there for a couple of hours and could have stay a few more if I had the time. The Forbidden City exhibit is wonderful. It is a traveling exhibit so hurry in to see it.
I recomend to go there , with family and kids , alot of things to see and information , its clean and well organized .

After battling one the coldest days of my winter stay in Toronto I went to the ROM where I saw for the first time a dinosaur fossils the environment was clean persons where readily available to help, the exhibitions where we'll put together and carefully thought out... I enjoyed the bat cave and the Roman era exhibit, the exhibits on...

Perhaps it's because we're big museum-goers and have seen many around the world, the ROM failed to impress us on our visit. We were there during the last week of special exhibit, the Forbidden City, which was nicely done. The other exhibits weren't all that impressive or comprehensive. To be fair, we didn't know what to expect. If you only...

We did not have much time, so we strategically planned what exhibits to visit. It was spacious but cleverly laid out - we saw everything we wanted in a short amount of time. Everything was well labeled and there was lots of beautiful pieces, especially in the east Asian sections.

We heard that the Royal Ontario Museum was a "must see" in Toronto - we heard correctly. There was some wonderful Asian artifacts on display as well as a large collection of native pieces all well displayed. The museum can be experienced in less than a day but plan on a full day especially if there are kids in your...

I took my three boys to the ROM on a Monday afternoon. They enjoyed the 2nd floor exhibits, interactive, informative and lots of staff around to ask questions. But the rest of the museum was very confusing and disappointing. My eldest son, 10, wanted to see a mummy and I wanted him to see some Greek artifacts as he studied...

recently brought some out of country friends to the museum. We enjoyed the museum to is one of the better museum they have been too. I personally been here several times in recent years I like when they bring in new stuff to explore like Dead sea scrolls etc otherwise it gets boring seeing the same stuff over and over....

I hadn't visited this museum in ages (well before the arrival of the new 'crystal' wing), and I was reminded of what a vast and varied collection it has. Certainly a 'must-see' for new visitors to Toronto. But I must confess I wasn't impressed with the interior of the 'crystal' at all, which struck me as, frankly, rather ugly. And...

Compared to the Louvre or the British Museum, this is small, but extremely well laid out and well planned.It caters both to those who know and those who don't -- so satisfies everyone.The exhibit I went for was the forbidden city -- that was very good and it showed the design, the history and little vignettes of personal...

The museum opened at 10am, which meant we had to wait outside for half an hour and there were no benches by the entrance. It would have been nice if they had opened earlier as there were many people waiting to get in.Once in, we decided to start at the top and work our way down through the floors....

This is a very interesting museum. Probably the best in Toronto. To be honest I felt the city was quite weak on cultural attractions. This place was the exception. It is like the Field in Chicago both a world culture and natural history museum. You could spend days here. The Forbidden City exhibit is not to be missed. I have...

This is by far the best museum I ever visited. It's massive with it's 3 floors plus one extra floor for special exhibitions.Each floor has different themes. On the first floor they have a massive collection of Chinese, Japanese and Korean artifacts. The Chinese collection is the largest outside China.On this level they also have a native Canadian...

Have not been to the ROM in decades and was so impressed by all the updates. The second floor is where we spent most of our time with our two year old daughter. This floor has animals, bats and dinosaurs as well as an interactive play area for kids. There was so much information and great displays that unfortunately one...

I've lost track of how many times I've visited the ROM. It's a beautiful, expansive museum with lots to see and experience. The exhibits are well curated and endlessly fascinating. There's something for all tastes and ages.I love the dinosaurs and the rotating special exhibits. The building itself is a marvel and perfect blend of old and new.

The Royal Ontario Museum, commonly known as ROM, is grand both in size and its exhibits. Located near the University of Toronto, the permanent galleries include: the largest collection of Chinese architectural artifacts outside of China; a fine gallery of Canadian paintings; one the best dinosaur displays I have seen; Nubian, Egyptian, Mid-eastern, Roman, Greek, Japanese, and Korean art and...

I was impressed by the way they integrated the older part with the new construction. When I visited, the temporary exhibition was on the Chinese Forbidden City; very nice. I could have spent more time visiting all the sections. Will definitely be back.

This was number 1 on my list of places to visit while in Toronto and I'm glad I made the trip! There are plenty of exhibitions so everyone is sure to find something fascinating. I loved the gemstone and world cultures areas in particular, but there is more than enough to see! One caveat is that I did have some...

Excellent displays and new features. It is located right down town so it is easy to reach by TTC. It is close to the Archives Library and University of Toronto. Its a piece of Canadian History. Again a must do if you are here and ask about the family packages or discounts for students and kids. They have interactive workshops...

I was last at ROM when I was an Arts student ...spending hours drawing artifacts, furniture, clothing, etc on the cheap nights (Tuesdays). But, to see the new bright, roomy exhibitions were wonderful! I did miss my favourite bird exhibit, but the dinosaurs have a new brighter home, and the children's section was awesome (though we're not children!)

Not quite as comprehensive as, say, the British Museum or the Met in NY, but pretty darn close. Antiquities, archaeological items, world cultures, all beautifully displayed and thoughtfully presented. Plus the strikingly modernistic addition to the Bloor Street facade is worth visiting just for "architourists." Highly recommended!
Very educational and interesting! Would definitely visit the museum again. The museum cafe was great value for money too.
We love to go to the ROM and have a membership. this time we saw the Forbidden City display which provided a wonderful education about the history of China - well worth a visit

I've been to museums all over the world and this one ranks right up there. You could spend a whole day in there and just scratch the surface. The whole place has a great, mysterious vibe to it, and the displays are eye catching and fascinating. I was lucky enough to live close to it in the late 70s and...

The museum has the best front appearance ever! The combination of a modern and classical structures of the museum's architecture makes it outstanding from the crowd. The permanent exhibition on three floors is well arranged and displayed. The museum has a very spacious book and gift store, and quality of store is excellent. The recent arranged show Forbidden City has...

It's an amazing encyclopedic museum but I especially wanted to see the visiting exhibit on The Forbidden City that was there at the time and the regular exhibits on the indigenous people of Canada. It's a beautiful building, too.

a word of caution, this could be the not so much museum in me that's speaking.Anyway, what's good about this Museum is the collection of dinosaurs and different civilizations. Kids can try the different costumes/dresses from asia. I also like the collection of animals. Different land animals that are endangered or extinct. You can also see here the largest...

Much of the ground floor is given over to ta treasure house of Chinese art and artefacts. These ranged from Neolithic to almost modern and were of very high quality. Just one example was the carvings on a funerary monument dated between 200 BCE and 200CE which clearly resembled the form, content and colouring of illuminated manuscripts from Irish monasteries...

The Royal Ontario Museum is a special place just for its permanent collection. A current bonus (big time) is the Forbidden Treasures exhibit from Beijing. Large, well-curated and displayed, the items on view are not just historically interesting, but also individually beautiful. This is a "can't miss" exhibit!

I've always been an avid dinosaur lover since I was a boy, seeing my beloved dinosaurs after more then 50 years was a real treat for me. The first huge brachiosaur like dino or similar as you enter is quite awe inspiring I felt like a kid again marveling at their enormous size and their great mystery. The rest of...

Situated near the University Campus and Toronto's upmarket shopping area the museum is a must see. Main highlights were the early Indian and Inuit display, The Egyptian rooms and especially for the children the dinosaurs with sound effects and the bat cave. This display is situated in the "Crystal" design by a famous Chinese architect. While we were there the...

The museum itself is of interest if you like natural history and culture museums but it's worth visiting to see the architectural mix of old and new. It's apparently a very controversial design but I loved it.

Nice museum, with great collection. Great place for kids because of huge dinosaur skeletons present. Lots of historic items and cultural items, so it is a wonderful place for learning about history and other cultures. Large space, and lots of activities for children as well. Lots to do!

Went to ROM specifically to see their special exhibition on The Forbidden City, and it was marvelous. It was easily navigated with our friend who is in a wheelchair, and the exhibit was beautifully done. I only wish we had more time to spend at the museum, and I would definitely make a return trip to see more.

As part of the Toronto City Pass Book, we got admission to the Royal Ontario Museum also known as the ROM. Along with the ROM, I would also recommend the Toronto City Pass Book which is an excellent value unto itself.My wife and I spent the afternoon at the ROM and we found the exhibits to be both varied...

Wonderful place to go! Is huge and so many cool things to watch. You definitely need a whole day to see everything. Wish gift store was cheaper. Bring some comfy shoes cause there is loooot of walking

I loved the ROM (and yes, I did like the controversial crystal frontage)!. There is something for all the family here. I particularly liked the Charles Rennie Mackintosh exhibit (well, I am Scottish), the Forbidden City (costs a little supplement) and the dinosaurs.

The ROM has so much to see. Right now they are celebrating 100 years with furniture and design from that time period. It is a small exhibit but nice, if you like art deco. They is also a display from the Forbidden City in China which was awesome. Well worth the money.
Lots of stuff to see and talk about, especially for those interested in natural history. There are also man-made artifacts, but those were not terribly interesting.
Incredible museum, both outside and inside. The dinosaur display is so impressive particularly to see the size the creatures were. Great for children and adults.

We went to a Friday Night Live at the ROM - where you buy a $12 ticket and can access the museum at night. They have food and drink vendors, a DJ and it is all adults. So much fun! It felt a little like a night club, filled with University students looking for love - but - an amazing...

I LOVE going to the ROM and exploring the millions of things there. Expect to spend much longer then you anticipate going in. It's a massive place and if you really want to read a lot of the information that they provide then you'll need lots of time! The exhibits are great and staff are kind, friendly and knowledgeable. They've...

I really enjoyed the day there (and you cold spend a day!) but I felt, considering the entry fee that is charged, there could be a lot more interactive and exciting displays.We paid extra to see the Emperors Palace exhibition and did not find it to be worth the additional cost. Again, we felt that so much more could...

This place has so much to offer for all! They recently have ming's dynasty but my favourite is dinosaurs! After a visit on March break was not Much more for a membership so we bought one! Our teen take in their friends! Food was not great there but lots to eat in the area!

Fantastic Museum, much bigger than I expected. We spent the better part of the day walking around the exhibits. It is a shame they stuck that ugly new building onto the side of an otherwise beautiful old museum, but that did not detract from the interesting stuff to see.

When I got off the bus(subway line wasn't running) I saw beautiful building of the ROM with nice old staircase(how a museum should look) It was the back entrance, we walk around the corner, I see this weird ugly glass facade was the main entrance(modern contemporary is not my style ) And I also thought was so weird was the...

We went on Friday night when prices are discounted. Makes it more affordable for a family. LOTS to see for everyone with different interests. Well maintained, clean, and a nice gift shop for the kids to browse!

Price was a bit high, 27$ per person for the museum and was not really worth it.The museum was good, but the layout is very confusing. I felt like I missed a lote even though we were there for 3+ hours.
They have great exhibits and staff was courteous. Entry cost was very affordable and there was a lot of paintings to see.

Children loved the dinosaur exhibits and the bat cave. They spent about 45 minutes with the volunteers in the endagered species exhibit. The volunteers were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and they gave the children as much time as they wanted to see everything. In fact we had to drag them away.

Great museum, amazing exhibits, killed some time downtown and it was a good experience. Really easily accessible with subway and staff are friendly in the the ROM. Make sure to have your camera with you to capture the architecture of the building from the outside.
We did not have time to visit all the exhibits but thoroughly enjoyed the ones on the history of Canada and the special visiting exhibit on China's Forbidden City. The cafe is nice also.
Absolutely amazing in the display and explanations provided. This museum most definitely should be attended by everyone with any interest historical data and artifacts.
My family, including boys age 12 and 14, really enjoyed the exhibit. The boys soaked up a lot of historical information, too.

My main objective was the Forbidden City exhibition, but I followed up a visit to the rest of the ROM. As someone who has visited the Forbidden City, I found the artefacts on display wonderful, a sheer and unexpected delight. They were also, in themselves, very well presented. But I had real problems in navigating the exhibition and found much...

I loved this museum but I am thinking even after the ads saying a great place for kids, that it isn't very good for children under 5 years old. Especially if they like to touch things and our son loves to touch things. You're not allowed to touch anything and of course as most 3 year olds, our son tried...

Love the museum!!! Buuuut that new design of the building just isn't for me! to modern for a museum.. Im personally a person who like to feel like I'm back in time in the museum... not a weird space crystal thing.

We visited on Friday evening. It happened that the ROM was opening late because ... there was a party there. Not having bought tickets in advance, we queued for 1hour and a half to get in. Amazing atmosphere: DJs and dinosaurs. I guess this is a way to get youngsters to learn about art and other cultures, in already a...

We were here for the Forbidden City exhibit, which was extremely well done. Very well laid out with just the right amount of information/walking between to fully digest it. The museum itself is huge and one could spend days here. For us, the highlight was the gem and mineral room. Wow. Very well laid out/grouped. Educational, informative and the display...

World class and well laid out, spectacular exterior design combing new and old. Collections on about everything are very informative and interesting. Some evenings on weekdays are free or discounted admission, fyi
Great museum. Free centenary celebration entry weekend when we were there so got a behind the scenes tour too. Great visit.

It's easy to spend hours here for all ages. The impressive collections are excellent and informative. The First Nations/Native American exhibit is the best I've ever seen! There are ample benches for your acting feet and a great cafe downstairs for when you need to refuel.Saw the Forbidden City exhibit and it rivals the real thing in Beijing! Bravo!
I've been to the ROM many times and never get tired of it. If you like beauty, culture, history and art, go and see! Great for kids!

Visited the museum on our first day in Toronto. Wish I could go back and have a "do over" as we were fairly jet lagged. We happened to visit on the 100th anniversary so it was fairly busy. As we were standing about figuring what to do first, we were told we could go on a free tour. Apparently there...
So much to see - allow at least an afternoon to take it all in - don't go without your camera. Restaurant a let down. Not so much a restaurant as a cheap cafe!
Always enjoyed the Rom.Everything is well organized well displayed and just seems to flow really well. Have enjoyed this since being a kid and appreciate the continue updating of exhibits

I have visited the latest exhibition at Royal Ontario Museum of the Forbidden City. I liked how they managed to present in one place two thousand years of emperor ruling and so many precious artifacts. The concept was to visit the place and the times through important characters of the Imperial court. If you have the chance to get a...
The rom is a amazing place to visit so many exhibits a fun way for the the whole family to learn good place to eat and a shop in the lower level.

I went as it was included with the toronto pass but then had to pay extra to see the Beijing exhibit (no photos allowed) which was not explained when buying the pass.The main museum is interesting though
So much to do, you need more than a day. We bought a city pass which made entrance far cheaper to here as well as four other attractions in Toronto.
The Royal is by far one the best museum's in the world. World class displays, great collections and an awesome building. it is a cant miss if in Toronto
This is a great natural history museum to visit. Make sure there is a good special exhibit showing when you go!
First time since the renovation was fully open. It was fun & educational for the kids and me.We made use of a CostCo deal for the entrance fee, too. I recommend visiting the ROM!
Exquisite dinosaurs, gemstones and relics of other cultures. Good for kids and adults alike. Loved it!
Like a much smaller version of the Museum of Natural History in NYC. Teens may get bored, seemed geared more for the younger set.Ask for AAA discount, it's not listed, but given if asked.

Excellent museum with great displays, often with much creativity.Worth a visit whatever the main display.However, the restaurant is pricey for average fare, and theatmosphere is modern and not impressive.

Very nicely laid out. Not overly impressed with the Canada section. But the dinosaurs made up for that. The only issue I had with it was the lack of control the teachers held over visiting students. ROM personnel need to put their foot down and remove disruptive people of any age.On a side note. Go to Groupon to purchase...

Love the dinosaur exhibits, all those bones! And the Japanese display, especially the swords and armour. Yes, you could spend the whole day there, so go early, and take your time. There are quite a few floors worth of exhibits. Lots of stuffed animals, and costumes, and mummies, just the way any world class museum should be.
A wide choice of exhibits suiting all ages somethingFor every one Busy food hall you need good legs
I liked the dinosaurs it was interesting to know that remains where also found in Ontario. The Forbidden City exhibit was very nice.

The ROM never disappoints. There is always so much to see and things change with new exhibits through the year. From young children to adults there is much to learn every time you go. Hands on exhibits help in the learning process also. Very clean, well laid out.

It's not that I have a problem with taking a stately building of historical artifacts and ploughing a big honkin' crystal out the front of it. No. That's not it at all. I'm all for interesting architecture that pleases the eye or challenges the senses as this one does.It's what's inside that bothers me.It would seem that they...
One of the best Museums in North America!!! You never get bored there is something new all the time. It's a whole day so put on your best walking shoes.
This is a great place to spend a few hours or a whole day! It's easy to get caught up in all the amazing things to see and do here. I highly recommend the ROM for any and every visitor to Toronto.

As we are currently living in the city we decided on the annual membership option at the ROM. This was proved at an amazing $100 for both my husband and I to be members for the year - amazing deal! As we live very close to the ROM we intend to make full use and pay lots of visits.I...

If you are a museum lover and had being in Louvre, or MET or Goya, then this one will look like for kindergardens.it is a good visit for family, 3 to 4 hours and ice cream at the end. Parking can be tricky.

For any visitors to Toronto, this is a must. A massive array of various types of collections, including an amazing dinosaur display and rotating other types, it's hard to go wrong. It's big, so allow a few hours, but it's worth it.
I do the ROM every year. I love the "mummy" room and the architecture is just stunning. Great place to visit with the kids, but I love going on my own as an adult too! Very knowledgeable staff.
If you want both Natural History and World Cultures under one roof in a very unique building, then you must visit this museum.

I live in Toronto and visit the ROM frequently. It is a world class museum and I can spend hours looking at all the wonderful exhibits. There is just so much to see for adults aswell as children!! Its certainly a great way to spend a day while in Toronto!
Many exhibits. There is something for everyone, whatever the age! From Ancient Egypt, to dinosaurs, kids and adults will surely find something interesting.

This is the 3rd best museum I have ever been to right behind the Smithsonian and the Louvre. They have a excellent display of dinosaur bones that kids will love.There displays of the art work from the different periods of time, such as Greek, Roman, Egypt was phenomenal.

Great place if you're interested in history and dinosaurs. Personal favourites are the great fossils that have in their collection and the medieval armours. Great place to visit and I spend more than 4 hours there

First off, great location! My advice is get off at Queen's Park and walk through the university before you get to the museum.We had a heavy night before we went to the museum so it was a great open quiet space to recuperate. Great museum with some great displays, however apart from the specific Canadian art there is nothing...

There was a surprisingly extensive amount of dinosaur exhibits at the ROM, very well laid out and interesting. We also were pleasantly surprised at the amount of Egyptian artifacts, including a real mummy. Very cool stuff, loads to see - and easy to navigate. Sorry we didn't have time to explore the China exhibit.
This is a very well presented museum. The outside is striking and exhibits are well displayed. There is also a good food hall in the basement

A very nice museum for learning our world's natural history. We were able to see the "Forbidden City" exhibition. The tour guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. Also the old fossils were great to see. The wonder of the size, I felt like a young school boy again. If you want to take a break from the enormity of the...

This museum has an outstanding and extensive collection of art and artifacts. Unfortunately, it has a very confusing floor plan - especially on floors 2 and 3 - and there were almost no security guards visible to offer guidance, and the directional signs were well hidden. My husband and I had gone to different collections and had great difficulty trying...
Loved the paintings and dinosaurs! All in one museum! We spent 2 hours in here enjoying the paintings and dinosaurs. We loved the Canada room and the rotating exhibit (African photos).

My all time favorite museum is the Met in New York. This, in comparison, would be the express version. Still plan for at least 3 hours here. It has all the categories of the Met, but just less amount of things to see. Very cool building. They took an old building and added a very modern piece to the building...

The ROM is a world class museum which has participated and rewarded Toronto and its visitors with a great many exhibitions. The permanent collection is in a category rivalling those of many other major cities. The visiting exhibits continue to impress (e.g. the current Forbidden City collection). The building houses some impressive artifacts from throughout the world, including Egypt, China,...

The museum was easy to find with GPS and convenient to downtown. We parked in their garage, directly across from the museum. It was only about $6.00. However before 1:00 p.m. you're likely to find a free space, at least on Sundays.First you see the magnificent design of the structure. The building's geometric shape is a marvel.Yet, the...

The Museum is a building combined old & modern. You need prepare at leat one whole day for the museum, since the exhibition halls will attract your eyes, & you will spend an unforgettable trip. Where you can see many valueless treasures from world, & learn something about Canada. Take the subway to there, & you can enjoy lunch in...

Popped by to this one as I found a groupon voucher for entry and forbidden city exhibition for $14 which was a real bargain compared to the normal price.The museum has a couple of nice collections, especially the dinosaur and egyptian areas stood out for me. The artefacts were displayed exceptionally well, some in very simple displays with lots...
A huge Museum with many different topics. We walked a lot, sometimes was difficult to follow an itinerary. The bat cave is a joke.
dinosaurs was my favorite . Also the Earth's Treasures and the Discovery Gallery. Couldn't see the Chinese Architecture though.
This is a nice and big museum. And there are a variety of things to see. We had a great time in this museum

The price is ok value, gets expensive with the whole family.Always changing different exhibits with new thingsBig spacious best to visit during the week. Weekends tend to be really busy.Can't miss it a must see if visiting Toronto only one time.
My daughter who is 17, still loves the dinosaur exhibit, as do I.I usually do the museum about once every 10 years.Not much has changed (except the exterior) but its still awesome.

Enjoy this museum -- it's got something for everyone, though can be crowded. Everyone loves taking photos outside afterwards, across the street, where you can photograph yourself AS you take the photo of the museum -- the sloping walls all seem like mirrors from the outside (you have to go and see to understand). Then pick up a coffee at...

As non-Canadians, we particularly enjoyed the First Nations and Canada exhibits. I also enjoyed the decorative arts area and the Towards 1914 (I think it was called exhibit). ROM has an excellent gift shop, and a decent though not exciting cafeteria.

If you are only going to do a couple of things in Toronto, make sure that this is one of them. I was so impressed with the content of this museum and what pleased me most was that there is so much for kids to do. Not a boring museum but one that really grabs your attention. Put this on...
Our highlight during the day we spent in Toronto rich and full of history.Do not miss and watch the movie they show especially if you are visiting with children.Long Lines so come early.

We visited the Royal Ontario Museum as part of our city pass and though it was a nice museum it felt somewhat lacking to similar museums back in the UK. To me it felt like a mixture of the British museum, Natural History Museum and the V&A in London. We managed to wander around in about half a day but...
it was one of the biggest museums I have seen in Canada. Full of interesting artifacts. Recommended.
A bit expensive but I guess it is worth paying a visit to ROM. I think they should get some idea from Fields museum or Smithsonians too
We had a great time in the museum. Just the place to send an afternoon. Liked the modern art. This is a must see on your visit to the city.

The ROM has been a fixture in the city for years and is never disappointing. Standard exhibits are always interesting and somewhat different and the special exhibits are excellent whether from their own collections or part of an international tour. If you live in the city, consider getting a membership - they are celebrating their 100th year. Many happy returns.
You could literally spend hours walking through this museum, it really has something for everyone and we thoroughly enjoyed the Forbidden city exhibition

A whole day needed if you're really into museums and stuff.The exhibits deserve a lot more time and attention.From the architecture to the brilliance of the lighting and ceilings and floors,this place really deserves to be marketed.Found the price too high (compared to London where a lot of museums are free).Good place to sit around and leaf through the history...

Small part very cool exhibit. Made me want to go to China to see the real thing Food was good in the cafeteria place.Spent a lot of time reading in their comfy chairs and then checked out the paintings of Niagara Falls

Amazing architecture, free good 1 h guided tours (they start every hour!! in english or french), and good unique things such as GIANT totems, big dinosaurs, etc. It definitely worth a visit for only a 16 $ adult ticket, and dont miss the architecture outise, cuase its quite unique.
We did not do this place justice spend just half a day there. Entrance fees are nominal and the exhibits are really very extensive!

This is a special exhibit. There was a number of small artifacts, many displays of clothing. There was a large model of the city which was coolI have been to the Forbidden City and did feel the displays did not provide me the sense of the grandeur and size. I guess almost impossible to do.The displays were well...

Great place for a family day. The children will love the dinosaurs and the bat caves. Not to mention the mummified Egyptian cats. Hands on activities for the little ones and lots for the adults to appreciate. The Forbidden city was informative as well as nicely presented. Not lots of reading but use of quotes and video to accentuate the...

I went to see the travelling exhibition of the Wildlife photographer of the year which I truly enjoyed , it was a shame that it was packed into such a tiny space though. I also went to see the exhibit on history of Canadian Aboriginal people which was placed in the based and I thoroughly enjoyed. The website for the...
The outside architecture was beautiful! There were so many things to see, and it was very spacious and clean.
Good exhibits which had changed over from the previous year, very fun for all ages. Could of spend more time but unfortunately got there late afternoon, next time will show up earlier !

Having been to the Forbidden City and other places in China, this exhibit was well laid out and most of the artifacts were well mounted... My 14 and 10 year olds were moderately intrigued by the displays, and learned a few new things... Wasn't too busy, either, so we could linger and not have to deal with crowd congestion like...
What a great museum which had just enough but not too much. Also provided a good deal of facts with the exhibits. Well worth a visit if you go to Toronto.

This is an amazing and huge museum! We spent seven hours here and didn't see all that we could have. If you live in or near Toronto I would recommend to purchase the yearly pass and visit more frequently (one section at a time). If you have a GO Transit card make sure to get the discount.
The ROM is a very interesting and a modern museum. Went there as a part of the Toronto City Pass attraction bundle. Look for various themes / specialities during the year.
I really enjoyed my visit here, you never know with museums but we easily spent 4 hours just wandering round interested in the exhibits. Nice café, food prices reasonable.
The museum have a very beautiful architecture, the dino collection is great. It is not very big, but cozy and interesting. I was expecting more about the bats room, but I was disapointed with this.
Very interesting museum, I really like the diversity.Very clean bathrooms, I like they have benches everywhere you go.

Compared to museums in New York City and those of most cities in Europe is average. However, on its own is an interesting museum, specially for the kids to learn about natural history.As we didn't use facilities such as coffee shop, lockers or wheelchair access, not sure if they have these services available. I know they have a cafeteria,...
This more natural history museum than art. Great collection of fossils and geods and crystals.Beautiful building -- huge!

By far this is best museum I have seen till date. it has huge display of various cultures from various parts of world. dinosaurs collection is huge and my son loved it. one is not enough to see this place if you are really interested world heritage. I would recommend to check their site before visiting as they have special...

The ROM is a great place to check out most days. It is very busy on weekends with families and kids, so if you're looking for a more relaxed, less busy day, I would suggest going during the week. It is a touch pricey, but they actually recently lowered the prices. The dinosaur exhibit is year round as well as...

Took a trip to the ROM when we visited Toronto earlier this month.. I had been there before but, of course, exhibits are always changing. We happened to be there during the Forbidden City exhibit. It was fascinating and well worth the trip. Some very interesting artifacts are on display. The rest of the museum is also quite interesting -...

I visited the ROM for the first time as a child in the 1980s. I have visited many times since and I always enjoyed it.The current special exhibition, the Forbidden City, is incredible. We are members and go to ROM several times every year. It is impossible to see everything, but when there is a special exhibit don't miss it if in town. Take a couple of hours to check pout the rest of this amazing museum.
Fantastic place to visit. Alot to see and wish had more time. Would highly recommend. Well designed and really enjoyed all they had to offer. Would visit again.

We have been members of the ROM for three years and it is one of the best things we did here. The ROM was amazing. I am a local trying to put myself into your (the visitor's) shoes. We go there as a family at least once a month. Of the sights to see in Toronto I would put the ROM pretty much at the top. Can not be beaten for all ages I have been a regular for the last 60 years recently my grand son had his first trip The dinosaurs were the hit of the day. Always there are new exhibits
well displayed, informative, museum. Part of Toronto not to be missed. Always something to be learned.

Royal Ontario Museum is the best in Ontario province. It looks Grand and Modern from outside. It is huge inside indeed. A lot of unique collections, great exhibits, plenty things to see for adults and kids!

Unfortunately, we were super disappointed with the new architecture at the ROM. It really detracted from the whole experience. I'm afraid that it was a comment we heard quite a lot while at the Museum..

With a hundred years of history, the Royal Ontario Museum is a very special place with enormous exhibit spaces and significant content. I hate this new building and think it was a big mistake. Especially if you compare it to the new AGO that was done so well. The ROM is one of Toronto's greatest treasures. Viewing the famous collection of Chinese artifacts is worth the price of admission all by itself. Special exhibits are mounted several times a year, and these are virtually always worthwhile. This is...
pricier than it should be. Bigger international museums are free. I don't understand why this isn't.

I like Royal Ontario Museum not only because of the variety of artifacts, as they have special features & showcase things, with emphasis on a particular era or importand artifact/s. I'm impressed with the building architecture & the interior as well, & the design & organization of the museum.

Have been to museums around the world and unfortunately the ROM in Toronto is one of the more boring buildings. Went recently with one of my grandchildren from school. Disorganized and not enough thought to the lectures given for the age group. Exhibits are dull and even the dinosaurs are not displayed with any colour. New wing does not fit...

Good for all ages, underground parking across the road, close to public transportation. Cafe was even good! Their temporary exhibits change often and are world class! We really enjoyed the class like room with the information on the temporary exhibits.
Interesting. Good for family visit. Learning experience. Almost always there is an exhibition there.

The Friday Night Live at the ROM is an amazing way to experience the ROM. Not only is it a very clever business/marketing strategy, it is wildly successful with the younger demographic. The ROM should not be missed when you are visiting Toronto. It is a very educational experience for both adults and children.
We love this museum. It had everything you could want for families or just adults....awesome dinosaur and mummy exhibit.
Excellent place to visit with family, kids friendly, lots of different exhibitions.Every friend of ours visiting us here comes with us to ROM.

The ROM is a great museum that would enrich any visitor to Toronto. In it you tour the world and gain much knowledge. It is within reach, even by underground train. Had nice lunch in the ROM cafe before The Forbidden City exhibition which was great! Exquisite art treasures from the courts of China's Emperors...also interesting news reel footage gave background to the demise of the last emperor. Great for repeat visits. Good lunch room. Interactive kids area. Membership is worth the price. Special exhibits are consistently good.
Great day with our grandson. He enjoyed the dinosaurs, sifting through the sand for bones, playing with other children at the interactive exhibits and seeing the mummies. Lunch was enjoyable too.
Plenty to see and do here. Good value for entrance prices and an interactive area for children. A must see if visiting Toronto.

We Have visited museums and gallery all around he world and the exhibits are second to non. We have visited the ROM many times and they are continuously working on making sure it always has something new to surprise you.

I didn't find this place that interesting. I came here with my husband and teenage girl. The cost was not too expensive, thankfully. I'm sure there is lots of people who will find this interesting but not me. The buildings architecture is really quite cool, I did appreciate that. I will not be back.

This was our first time in a Toronto so we purchased the city pass, which included tickets to the ROM. It is definitely a must-do at least once and the exhibits are all very interesting. The experience is worth the cost, but it's probably not something that we would do again.

I took my kids to see the ROM over the long weekend in February and they really enjoyed it! Great people, great security, great service! Only thing is there's no parking nearby, but otherwise great. The ROM turns boring history into something kids actually want to learn, and I thought that was great.
Love going to this museum since I was a kid and I am a repeat customer. Always still amazed by the artifacts and displays, especially the dinosaur exhibits and Ancient Egypt!

We want to ROM as we had a City Pass and we were glad that we did as we more very impressed by by the quality and variety at ROM. I bought a city pass which covered the cost of several attractions in Toronto. The museum was great,I went there on world heritage day so there were lots of things going on, some really impressive exhibits and well laid out.

Fabulous for all! Kids n parents LOVED our very full day visiting as many exhibits as we could. Too much for one day though. From dinosaurs to gallery of natural history showcasing so many animals - through to the minerals exhibit, we can't wait to return.
It took us that long to walk around this beautiful museum. The exhibits astonished us in the story they told of Canadian life.

Fairly pricey for a family---was $100 for the four of us. As a resident of Toronto I have been a member of ROM for many years and go to see any major exhibits and also occasionally throughout the year to see my favourites. Loved visiting the Royal Ontario Museum. They had a Chinese antiquities exhibit which was very interesting and something you really don't get to see in other places

Awesome! The Forbidden City exhibit was great and very educational for my three children. The two youngest ones loved the hands on activities on the second floor showing how archeological digs work. My oldest loved the Photos of the Year exhibit. We were so impressed we purchased a one year membership. Can hardly wait to go back again!
A must visit for everyone living in Canada and any part of the world. Every visit is a different experience and one day may not be enough if one has to seriously browse through every single display.

Fantastic museum. always clean and very spacious. Great selection on display. there is so much to see that we have been visiting 2-4 times a year for the last 5 years and you still miss things. the Dinosaurs are fantastic.cons: Food selection is bad. bring your own food or purchase from outside and bring in.

We bought the Toronto City Pass and include the CN Tower entrance. My 3yrs old daughter loved the dinosaurs. Interesting!!!

Several floors of incredible history. A whole family experience. If you see anything in Toronto, make this the first stop.

Really good! A classic museum about history, nature, geology, everything! Along with some great architecture! This is the type of museum i'd be a member of if I lived in Toronto!

I have been to museums in 6 countries, this is one of the best I've seen. Kids and adults a like can enjoy this place and It has enough to see for several trips. WOW!

Already in the very big lobby a gigantic dinosaur welcomes you with its head reaching to the 2nd floor telling where a spectacular collection of all kinds of dinosaurs awaits you. This is a must-see if you're going to Toronto. The exhibits are great; we spent at least 3 hours going through everything. The Dead Sea Scrolls exhibit was there when we happened to visit, and it was very cool. They have cool exhibits come through.
Love how they included the kids Nice architecture for the building, nice expositions. Dinosaures was a hit.

Ponderous. We have been here twice and still haven't seen it all. This was my favourite part of toronto. There is something for everyone to enjoy and I give them credit because I found me and my boyfriend got judged by appearance at alot of places so it was hard to enjoy the trip but ROM had excellent service !

I could have spent an entire day in this museum. The buildings are gorgeous, the artifacts, paintings, and other collections of art were breathtaking.It is an absolute must see if you are in Toronto.

This is a great place to go. It's packed with information and history as you would expect from a museum. It's easy to see why it's highly considered the best museum in Ontario there is really no comparison. A MUST SEE if you live in the Toronto area.
