The building architecture is marvellous and great place to take your kids and spend half a day there and as an adult it is just as engaging!
What a fantastic and impressive museum! Took a tour so I can get a general taste for the museum - that was definately worth the time! Well organized layout.

A unique experience with one part old architecture and of course the newer modern section that houses the majority of the dinosaurs and prehistoric reptiles & mammals. The ROM is one of those terrific museums all cities should have. It has a great display of dinosaurs and their respective parts. It can be rented for a private function. Great food.

I take my three year old granddaughter here all the time and have done since she was one. There is so much for enquiring young minds to see and explore. You can easily spend two to three hours here with a little one.

I have only been here for the Friday Night event at ROM. Typical museum I would imagine. Dinosaurs, Rome, Egypt, History, etc. Museum was good, we got a city pass which was an entirely different story. This museum has 1st class exhibits, the layout is very spacious and easy to follow. The museum is a natural history, ancient history, antiquities and cultural museum. It has many fascinating exhibits and artefacts, very educational and definitely a centre piece attraction in Toronto.

When my husband and I told our two children (ages 9 and 10) that we would be visiting a museum, the moans and "do-we-have-to"'s began. Loved the design of this museum on the outside and with loads of interesting floors inside with artefacts. Interesting although did at times feel like too much to take in so perhaps allow a lot of time to truly get round everything.

ROM is an amazing museum for mostly all tastes and interests. If you are into dinosaurs, Canadian history, Chinese, Egypt... pick your favorite... you will find some nice stuff to look for.Good restaurant inside and nice souvenir shopping too.

It was an excellent exhibit, and I'm glad I got to see it under the wire (it closed 36 hours later). Very well curated, with wonderful artifacts and excellent written explanations of the different eras and items on display, as well as interactive/multimedia add-ons.
Great visit lots of interesting minerals and items. Surely needed more time and surely needed more help from the museum carers, but its a definite go again!!

I would rank this museum up with some of the greats I have visited, and there was simply too much to see on one visit. Amazing. The rooms we visited were the gems/minerals, canada room, climate change, dinosaurs, textiles etc. All different all high quality. The space is beautiful. The museum was fantastic. We went in about 12 noon and stayed until closing... We should have gotten there at opening. There is so so much to see. Floor on floors of exhibits. Price was alright... We have visited the ROM quite a few times now and never grow tired of it. The exhibits are well set up and often eye-catching. There are collections to suit many tastes. Utilises all the most modern technology but not just to make pretty pictures/videos - my grandchildren learn as they wonder and wander! The ROM is an excellent attraction for locals and tourists. The recent exhibit on Mesopotamia was well designed, the collection quite impressive, and the supplementary video displays brought everything to life! It was a good escape from the cold weather and easily accessible by metro.

Best Museum ever! The surprise exhibit for us was the minerals/gems. The gold area is amazing as are the meteors. Beautiful display of dinosaurs. Go on Thursday or Friday after 4 for a discounted admission. DO NOT MISS THIS FAB MUSEUM

We have visited the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) many times over the past several years with our children and most recently just the two of us. We are always impressed with the wonderful exhibits well researched and well marked. Easy to get to by transit. Fabulous collections and special exhibits. Saw the Assyrian exhibit that was on loan from the British Museum, excellent!
We were all very impressed with ROM. I would totally recommend it if you are a tourist. Every level there is something to do.

My 8 year-old loves the ROM and it was her pick to return. She loved it again. I'm from the States and was visiting an old friend who suggested the ROM because she knew I liked museums. The layout is incredible and there is so much to look at!! Great fun to visit this museum -- you could easily spend the whole day here. Wide variety of exhibits from dinosaurs to Native American artifacts, to design and furniture. I loved this museum. It was filled with interesting exhibits that seemed really conscious of the social and cultural ramifications of natural history museums from the 19th century, and tried to bring it into the 21st. Great place to learn about Canada.

The venue is superb and it is worthwile visiting per se. The exhibit was great. We were with a 5 year old boy and he enjoyed the visit very much. The cafeteria offers reasonably priced and good snacks. If you are in Toronto, check if there is anything there. ou will love it

This is a beautiful museum right in the middle of town and very near to a subway station. It is a standard Museum of Natural History and Culture, but it has a fantastic early Canada section, which I only wish was larger. It is a lovely place to go and recharge on a busy trip.

Came to the Museum to catch the Mesopotamia exhibition. It was outstanding. I spent almost 3 hours just lingering at the Iraqi artifacts. My husband and I like different types of museums -- I like cultural/social history and art, he likes natural history and science. At the ROM, we both found what we were looking for and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. There is a lot here, but the exhibits are laid out very well. I was extremely impressed by the ROM. My two sisters and I walked through this amazing exhibit on Friday night.Amateur photographers from all over the world entered this contest.The photographs of animals and the environment were exquisite!The efforts that some of the photographers went to obtain the perfect photo were amazing.This is a very worthwhile exhibit to see.

Spent several excellent hours here during a weekend visit to Toronto and had marked the ROM as one of the highlights of the trip. It is very conveniently located off the Toronto subway (Museum stop) and has a extensive display of both historical and natural history items to offer. Lots of interesting things to see for all ages and interests. We spent a lot of time in the dinosaur exhibit and there are many interactive displays and videos to enjoy.

If you want to browse the entire ROM you need to allocate minimum 3 hours to it. And that will only give you time to browse. Entrance was 18.50$ when I visited, incl. the temporary exhibit about Mesopotamia. But I must say it was worth it. Too much to see to describe here, but if I should mention one thing...
Check out Friday Nights at the ROM for a limited time the ROM turns their front foyer into a dynamic club scene with guest DJs and pop-up restaurants. A perfect blend of food, culture and music!

It's a pretty big museum which kept me busy most of the day. I did a tour with a guide first which hit the highlights and got me oriented to the building then I wandered around for four more hours taking pictures and checking everything out. The only thing I didn't like was their makeshift restaurant that was in operation...
A place for everyone at any age. They have a lot of child friendly things to do and exhibits. The vast amount of exhibits and periods is fascinating and easy to enjoy.

A Toronto landmark, the ROM received an ill conceived addition several years ago. A glass carbuncle was glued onto the front of a gorgeous Victorian building, effectively blotting it out.The grand entrance way is gone, and from the inside the addition has the look of unfinished dry wall in a suburban basement, and it is scuffed and dirty to...
It is pricey and parking downtown is difficult, limited and very expensive. I would recommend taking the TTC (public transit).The ROM itself is worth a visit.

Royal Ontario Museum is a good fun and educational attraction to visit. Located accessible to the subway and buses Both families and school or daycare groups and tourists will enjoy the spacious attractions.

Just over two weeks ago, on November 10, to be exact, I went to see a most interesting exhibit at the Royal Ontario Museum (R.O.M). This show was mainly about ancient history, and how it has shaped how we live in this modern day and age. Various periods of time were examined, and from various nations and continents. As well,...

The ROM is fun for all ages. Kids love the dinosaurs. The museum has an large collection [one of the world's best!] including some very large specimens including: Gordo the Barosaurus, T-Rex, Triceratops, and a hadrosaur Parasaurolophus.Don't miss the daily tours at noon: free with admission.The special exhibits are always worth a few hours. The current one "Mesopotamia:...
This is a world class museum. With a decent permanent exhibition and interesting temporary exhibitions throughout the year.

Kids 8 & 10, good Mesopotamia exhibit and they always like the dinosaur & mineral galleries. However, one of our children has severe allergies to some foods. Since the cafeteria does not allow outside food (understandable in a museum) I wrongly assumed they would have allergen info in the cafeteria. They did not. Unfortunately the server we got was not...

The ROM is a treasure to a lot of Torontonians and Canadians in general. And they're justified. It's a rather nice museum and certainly very educational. There's a good cross-section of exhibits giving you a flavour of the world's offerings, which of course is what every museum should strive for.It loses points in my mind because of the very...

Since the ROM has been renovated, this is a very pleasant place to take visitors. The parking is a bit of a pain but is available a couple of blocks away. The dino display is excellent and shows many of the Canadian dinos--from Alberta

Extensive collection covering human civilization, natural history, bio-diversity, geology, art & architecture. Highlights include dinosaurs and the ancient world, and the bat cave! Great teaching and kids programming. Original buildings are beautiful and nicely restored. "Crystal" is impressive on the outside but construction materials and finishes seem a bit cheap on the inside. May not age well. Friday night openings...

If you have kids that love dinosaurs and history, they will probably love this museum. Our 8 and 10 year old boys liked the animal areas the best, but were asking to leave early as we were walking through the rest of the exhibits. It was included as a part of the CityPass, so we decided to try it. I...

Whenever we visit Toronto we are sure to visit the ROM. My son loves their dinosaur mascot Gurgle and the dinosaur exhibit and the bat cave are always must sees. We recently saw the Mesopotamia visit which was interesting for both me and my 7 year old. The museum is centrally located, easy to get to via public transportation and...

Just came back from our first trip to Toronto and one of the places that we visited was the ROM. One of the top Museums in the world with a very diversified collection. We visited the Mesopotamia exhibition and it was very well organized. Lots of info and one of the places not to miss in Toronto.
Awesome dinosaurs, cool exhibits (don't miss the bat cave!), and interesting seasonal exhibits. Worth checking out.
We always try to visit the ROM. With so many excellent galleries and special exhibitions, there is something for everyone.

Went with my wife and 1.5 year old daughter. I found the exhibits were a bit too far spaced out - so you tend to end up walking quite a bit with nothing to see in between. The dinosaur exhibit was as about as exciting as it got… The precious stones exhibit was interesting to me (we deal a lot...

The museum is interesting, it has different exhibitions at every floor. It mixes art and natural history: in it, you find old greek statues and dinosaurs, indian clothes and pieces of meteorite. The Indian exhibition is amazing: objects of the every-day-life, such as shoes, weapons, canoes are there, perfectly exposed. In the natural history sector, the skeletons of huge dinosaurs,...
The ROM has only improved since I was a child and went on school trips there from Oakville. One can never spend enough time there to really take it all in. World class museum.

This was my first time at this museum. One of the tour guides overheard me say that and invited me to join a free hour long tour of the highlights of the museum. We were a small group of 10 that grew and waned as we went as other visitors would drop in to listen. The guide was both enthusiastic...

Wonderful museum! I think we were only able to see about a third of the museum and we will be visiting again to see the parts that we missed. Beautifully done! I have been to museums around to world and this one does a wonderful job. We will be visiting again.

Some nice touches to this museum; a history of native North Americans and their culture, a bit of geology and the influences of English (and French) colonisation on Ontario.But, nothing outstanding except the building in which it's built. Some nice old architecture (with a modern monstrosity on the front).

The ROC is always worth a visit, not only because of the intriguing Daniel Liebeskind architecture of the addition (which, from a "useable" space point of view, wastes a lot of pointed corners ...) and the beautiful incorporation of the original building. The collections are probably unique in Canada and display exhibits from the vast expanse of this country, beginning...

My husband described this museum as "the Smithsonian of Canada" because of its size. We spent over 4 hours inside and we still didn't see everything that there was to see.We were impressed by the sheer number of exhibits and the variety of them - everything from ancient Egypt, to dinosaurs, to First Nations. This is a world class museum and definitely worth a visit when you're in Toronto. The admission prices for the permament exhibits is a reasonable $16 and it's not impossible to spend a whole day in the museum. This is a wonderful museum. There is a bit of everything, from natural history, to cultural history, to a little modern art. I went with all adults, but there seemed to be a number of kid-friendly activities as well.We did one of the tours, and I would highly recommend it. The times are posted just inside the entrance. There...

Great place to visit and lots to see. The museum was very well organized and five floors of things to see made it a bit overwhelming!!! I stayed to viewing only the "old" side of the museum and i still did not get to see half of it in the 3 hours we were there. Beautifully displayed and organized.The dinosaur...

If you go to Toronto, make sure you visit this place, we spent a full day here and had a really good time.the building looks like some thing out of the future, really modern looking with lots of steel and glass in pointed shapes.The Indian showcase on the first floor is really impressive, lots of interesting showcases, from...

Visit recommended by an Indian taxi driver. Fascinating. Could have spent much more than the three hours we had. High points were the section on first people, the minerals gallery and exhibition of 19th/20th century Indian photography. Even the cafe was good. Spotlessly clean with great variety of fresh hot and cold dishes.

I literally traveled from New Brunswick to Toronto just to go to the ROM. 10 years ago I was in TO on business and managed to spend a brief few hours there - what a tease! I planned my whole vacation around visiting the ROM and was not disappointed.There are things here that will have your jaw agape -...
We had an excellent docent for our tour; she was well organized, knew her stuff, and made things come alive. The exhibits were amazing; kudos to the ROM.

The old building is majestic. The addition, the 'Crystal' is an abomination. The Architect really pulled the wool ...fit only for the Mayor's taste. Exhibits don't fit. Michael Lee Chin got ripped. Thanks for trying. Give the Architect a paint brush so he can at least finish the interior ... for free.

I love the ROM. I go every time I am in Toronto because there is always something different to see though I do admit to particularly liking the gem section. The last time I went here it was for the Mesopotamia exhibit, which is well worth seeing. Very interesting and excellent presentation. The Museum also has a variety of interesting halls on various subjects. Be prepared to spend a few hours.

When I bought my admission I asked for a time estimate on the exhibits. I was told about 45mins for the Mesopotamia special exhibit and 3 hours for the rest of the galleries. As this museum is huge- 4 floors- and a popular destination (it's included in Toronto's featured CityPass ticket package), I would recommend getting here early, as it will take you the better part of a day to fully see and appreciate everything. Dinos, mummies, suits of armour, the bat cave, and good times with grandkids and grandpa. The fancy C5 restaurant is great for couples, and the Food Studio is great for kids. We didn't have much time so we only saw that part of the museum.Couldn't see it all. Spent too much time reading everything at the beginning. Go around to see how big it is and then come back to focus on what you really want to learn about.

We took advantage of a promotional opportunity for AGO members and we were not disappointed. We avoided the main exhibit and headed to various side displays. History was fascinating surrounding the individiual items on display in the textile exhibit.

I have been visiting this museum for my entire life and I enjoy every visit. As someone who has a history degree and a teacher, I find this place one of the best places to visit in the city. We were very please with our visit to the museum. The hi-light of our visit was the display of minerals and crystals. We spent almost 3 hours in the exhibit which was very well documented. For anyone studying or just viewing we would recommend this exhibit highly. Everyone should see the Light of the Desert.The Cerussite Gem in the...

This museum is huge and can easily take an entire day! If you have the time, it is very much worth it! Neither my husband or myself are real history buffs and we found something interesting at every turn. In addition, the architecture of the building itself is absolutely amazing and a treat in itself! Wonderful museum...worth a visit ...a fantastic mineral collection! And now? MESOPOTAMIA, a SUPER exhibit!!!

I wanted to see the Mesopotamian exhibit while it was in Toronto and to be honest I was not impressed with what they had on display. The ROM has something for everybody, and some great surprises. The museum is well run, and has a good combination of crowd-pleasers (e.g. dinosaurs) and more challenging material. Both the permanent and periodic exhibits in this modern museum are worth spending a couple of hours with members of your family.

The exterior is splendid, even though many Torontonians hate it,; its very much a hate/love thingBecause of the odd walls, displays are poorly presented in the new sections, with weak lighting.Some of the exhibits are great, such as the current Babylon
Something for everyone! Too much to see in one day. Definitely talk to the interpreters you meet....great knowledge! 10 out of 10!
Extensive exhibition of the ancient civilisations of the area which now encompasses Iraq. Well laid out and utterly absorbing. Not to be missed!

Plan for a full day at the ROM. We went with the kids and found so much more than we had anticipated. It's educational, entertaining and wonderful. The bat cave, dinos, and lion sculptures were favourites. It's easy to navigate and many helpful staff are at-hand to assist. We went to so many attractions using CityPass. Went as part of the city pass. Worth the money with all the other attractions included. For 70 dollars you can see the museum also. The exhibitions are extensive with seeing the additional ones. This Museum was amazing. I would definitely recommend spending at least half a day in here. The exhibitions were really well done - I was particularly impressed by the natural history, and especially the birds which were exhibited as if in full flight.I also really enjoyed the Canadian history exhibition, which I thought was nicely done. My grandson loves this place. We always start at the Bat Cave, to watch the bats fly around inside the cave, and listen to a recording of the way they live. The Royal Ontario Museum was a super awesome place. I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the museum. The exhibits were really interesting and informative. My kids especially enjoyed the Ancient Egypt section and the Bat Cave simulation. I also enjoyed the Dinosaur exhibit. The displays were amazing. I highly recommend visiting the Royal Ontario Museum. Terrific museum with all the natural history basics (dinosaurs, gems, etc.) plus special exhibits. I found it pricey, and I'm from New York. We did take the tour (only $5) for the fantastic Mesopatamia exhibit (have to pay extra on top of general admission) and it was well worth it.

A wonderful museumm particularly the Canadian history section. Make sure you see the totem poles, Ming tomb, Venetian glass ceiling, and the mummy, There was too much to see in one visit. We thought this a great place to spend 4 or 5 hours. From the ancient aboriginal to the more modern and bizarre, like a fish coffin, it was a fascinating journey. We walked to this, from our hotel. very long walk but well worth it. The collection of dinosuar skeletons is incredible, really well arranged, lots of information about them. Tonnes of stuff to do and see, you can spend an entire day.

Thought it would be nice outing for my kids ages 11 and 4, in the end I think I had more fun than they did - and they had a blast! The museum was quite easy to find beings steps away from the Museum subway station, and the experience for us really started when we bought hotdogs from the female...

Our only regret was not planning on more time to spend there. This is a world class museum and we throughly enjoyed ourselves. From the moment you spot it from the outside, the dynamic shape of blending old brick and mortar with a modern flare of what looks like a building dropped on the old one, it is truly a...

Woudlnt include it on your 3 day trip into Toronto, to be honest. The exterior of the Museum is very impressive, and really stands out. On a very wet day in Toronto opted to visit thsi museum. It was $16 admission but worth every cent. The displays, especially the Dinosaur exhibition caught my attention and made me wish we had more time to spend there

Royal Ontario Museum is a gem of a place. Not only are the exhibits well chosen, they are displayed very nicely as well. We were lucky to find some spacial exhibits the day we visited. There was an absolutely wonderful exhibition on Mesopotamia. Then, there was a section showing a rare collection of photographs taken in India during the British...

Well priced, you could spend the whole day there if you wanted, there was so much to see. It was easy to lose track of time as you wandered from room to room. They had an eclectic mix of exhibits, from dinosaurs to photography to three storey high totem poles. There are public transport link right to the door. A...

There is no way to see it all in one day.... just so many displays and each time you look you see more. This is a great way to spend a day finding out cool facts and seeing some artifacts too! Wear good walking shoes.

It is 100% worth paying the extra $5 per person to get the guided tour of the Mesopotamia exhibit. We had Sam and toured as part of a group of three plus guide, and it was brilliant having the opportunity to ask so many questions. The exhibit is on loan from a British museum so make sure you get there...

I took my nefew to see the last day of the dinosaur exhibit at the RoM on St Patrick's day this year. We spent 4 hrs viewing all the museum had to offer. You can also enjoy a delicious lunch while you spend the day viewing many artifacts from all over the world.

Take the tours, the guide walked us past a mummy that we had walked past without being aware that the mummy was still inside. The ROMS claim to fame is that it does not specialize in any one area and that makes it a museum with dinosaurs, mummies and art. We had a wonderful time and we're there for most...

So much to see and there's something for everyone. Collection may not be huge like NYC's Met, but there is no shortage of interesting displays. Good museum layout, not crowded on the weekdays and decent food. Subway stops very close by and also close to local shopping & restaurants. Can easily spend an entire day here, if your feet can...

The current exhibit on Mesopotamia is an excellent overview of the cradle of civilization. You will learn about its contributions to contemporary society , such as why we have 60 minutes in an hour. You will also learn about its gruesome history of war and conquest, innovations in writing , mathematics, agriculture and the creation of cities. The exhibit tells...

Great museum and just a wealth of content from all aspects of cultures around the world. The China exhibit areas are awesome and extensive. The Dinosaur exhibits are great and you can spend several hours enjoying the quality of content and ambiance.

So many things to see, time wasn't enough.Starting from the cool new building (a mix of modern and "old" architecture), this Museum is a crescendo of great illustrations, expositions, pure knowledge.We would have liked to see everything, but we had to choose (we are only human!).First we saw the evergreen classic: the dinosaurs. Let me get my singular complaint out of the way: Parking is a nightmare. It is a major metropolitan city, though, so no surprises there. I really like the entrance to the building-it looks like a massive crystal formation is erupting from the earth through the very classical-looking museum. The museum itself did not disappoint. They had a lot of really interesting stuff like their dinosaurs and crystals from all over the world. The reason why my rating is only 4 though is because it does not compare to the Smithsonians we visited last year. The stairs of wonders were pretty cool though.

I initially wasn't too interested in this museum and only went because I wanted to make the most of my Toronto city pass ticket. However, I was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the place is HUGE - and there were No lines, No crowds, and everything was displayed very nicely in an organized manner. I especially enjoyed the gemstone exhibit...
Worth the time on any visit to Toronto to explore this exceptional museum. We enjoyed the mesopotamia currently on exhibit. It was very well-done. It's a museum for all ages to enjoy.

This limited time exhibit is well presented and educational.The storyline is clear and very interesting. Could have spent double the time in the one location however the rest of the museum is just as fascinating.World class museum.

Exceptional museum very large and varied. A full day out is needed to visit here. Can be visited as part of Toronto City Pass ticket to reduce cost. A place the whole family will enjoy but could be tiring.

We visited the Mesopotamia exhibition as well as the main part of the museum. One day wasn't enough, we had to miss some sections. the beautiful collection of rocks and stones was amazing. Loved the dinosaurs and stuffed animals as well. Great gift shop, unfortunately couldn't buy much as there are restrictions on luggage weight for flights.

(for this review, I have put aside my feelings about the scandalous cost of the ROM upgrade) For first-timers, know that the ROM Gift Shop is excellent. We almost bought birthday gifts for some rather picky relatives there--that says a lot. There are gorgeous writing journals, reproductions of every conceivable sort, plus clothing, lovely printed umbrellas and even Iznik tiles....

We were limited on the time we were able to spend here, but what we saw, we really enjoyed! A lot of artifacts, good descriptions in both English and French (always fun to learn new words) and everything was displayed very nicely. Not any crowding, the spacing was good. We were able to move about freely, and didn't have to...
This is a great museum and has some interactive stuff for all involved as well. Try and explore all the areas of the Museum

An excellent museum to spend some hours in with numerous exhibits from all over the world. Particularly enjoyed the China and Canada sections. Near the Bata show museum also. Plenty shops nearby also for visiting afterwards

An anniversary treat from our son we went along to the museum to pass a couple of hours at the most.How wrong we were. There is so much to see from Canada and all over the world. We had to give up after 5 hours through exhaustion.A spectacular entranceway with a huge lifesize dinasaur skeleton greeting you.We...

I haven't been to the ROM for years so decided to go with some family members. Just one tip - allow yourself plenty of time. There is so much to see and to absorb about this place. I know it sounds boring, that's what i thought too.Finish your delicious hot dog and come in!(the hot dog outside the museum is great...by the way tip ;) )A handful of exhibits to see! So much to see and do! We didn't allow enough time to see all the treats here at all. Well worth a visit. OK - so we ARE rather spoiled in having THE best Museum in the world i.e. the British Museum but the ROM is a good place to spend a day if it is raining or too cold to venture out. The ROM is a bit of a mixture of the Natural History Museum and traditional museum. The display of flying...

what a great exhibit! We were able to see some of the great pieces of Mesopotamia in Toronto. The ROM did a great job in setting up the display and organizing it so that it conveyed the information that was needed to understand the timeframe. It even gave us a better histroical appreciation of the Greek, Roman and Egyptian sections.

On our trip to Toronto we decided, having read previous reviews, to spend a few hours at the ROM. We are a family with a 12 year old son and all enjoyed the museum, easily spending 4 hours wandering through and could have spent longer.It is value for money and we especially enjoyed the photography exhibition and the history...

The architecture is what hits you first but it doesn't end at the entrance. This building was well planned in the use of space without compromising the overall feel. For me, the exhibits were almost secondary compared to the woodwork, the surprises in open spacing, and the acoustics. Look closely at the floor on some levels. There are small slots...

Its nice museum more for children than adults. I like the european exhibition but dislike the fact that I couldn't see the jewelry or crowns. one positive thing is the abstract architecture that makes it unique.

The featured exhibition currently is Mesopotamia and it is stunning. The arrangement of the exhibition is effective and there are even exhibits that may be touched! The option to listen to the audio guide on your phone is great but the wi-fi on site did not seem to be strong enough as it was repeatedly interrupted while buffering. Once this...

We had not planned on a museum visit while traveling to Toronto, but after visiting we wished we had and had more time to go through it! The Royal Ontario Museum covers an amazing variety of subjects and the displays are very well arranged, identified and explained. One could spend hours in the gemstone display alone. The museum also has...
Something for every interest, located downtown, easy to get to by transit, very accessible, close to good restaurants and great shopping.
The evolution of style exhibit is first rate! But give yourself plenty of time. Salad bar at the ROM cafeteria is remakarbly good, very fresh and cheap!
The museum has been thoughtfully laid out and not like any other museum we have visited. It was a delight to wander through the various displays and we had a very enjoyable time.

It was nice to see it once but not for more than a couple of hours. I got the impression that the museum has a little bit of everything but nothing really detailed. From the native Canadian Indians over mammals and dinosaurs to African and Aboriginal culture and biodiversity there was everything! A good opportunity is going in the late...

We visited this museum on august 2013. We absolutely loved it even we did not take Mesopotamia. It was interesting to see pretty much everything in museum. I loved most exhibits of minerals it also reminded me museum of nature in Ottawa. The first nations was very interesting to see as well. In our surprise we even found Jewish staff...
The Mesapotamia exhibit from the British Museum was world class. The museum is well laid out and easy to navigate as well as being very central on Bloor Street

We spent several hours here during our stay in Toronto for a sightseeing vacation. We spent most of our time at the special Mesopotamia exhibit and also checked out the Canada and First Nations (very good) exhibit.This is a great way to spend part of a day.

The museum was absolutely beautiful. The Mesopotamian exhibit was very interesting and there were many different things to see. You can easily make a whole day of exploring the museum. But, the museum was freezing. My family and I were unable to enjoy the museum due to the fact we were so cold. Every area was cold and many other...

If you enjoy history, then this place is for you. Far too much to see in one day, we took a free guided tour, and were rushed from area to area. The section about the Canadian Indigenous peoples was very interesting, never realized the impact they had on the war of 1812. Teen granddaughter was bored after 3 hours. Restaurant...

It was my idea to take our family to the ROM - I thought they would love it, but they didn't....It wasn't as engaging as I thought it would be. I kept thinking that we needed a tour guide, or that maybe I needed to have done more research before our visit, so that I could explain to them...

Been to several museums and I am not impress with this one. I felt museums looks all the same but a great place to spend some time. I bought the Toronto Citypass and this is part of the attraction. I bought the Hop on Hop off bus tour and this is one of the stops. Nice architecture.

MY husband and I really enjoyed the ROM and would have enjoyed it more had there been more to entertain the children, however they did enjoy the second floor and the gift shop (of course). I think teens and adults can appreciate the history here more than the young children but beautiful displays and very educational.
I love museums but I didn't get a great vibe from this place. If you've been to the British museum don't both with the rom... The section about the indigenous Canadians was great thiug
This is a nice museum, easy to get lost here. We found 20% coupons online, but the hop on hop off bus tours also had discounts.

We had a nice time here. Spent the extra money on the Mesopotamia exhibit and it was a waste of money. We have sen a lot of special exhibits and this was by far the worst. Too much of the same thing and poorly designed. nothing to engage you. We should have spent more time in the permanent exhibits which...

I visited ROM with my girlfriend this week and was pleasantly surprised that the museum was able to accomodate interests from child to senior citizen. The only drawbacks were the dinosaur exhibit(which only had majority reproductions of fossils/bone structures) and the prices at the gift shop. Definitely purchase city pass, we saved so much $$$!

We had high expectations of this museum and for some reason it did not live up to expectations. The exhibit of Egypt was very good but cost extra which it should not have. There wasn't much concentration on the history of Canada which is what we expected. There was a great deal of concentration on African history as well as...

I was touched with Architecture of Museum, Crystal Building was well designed and all the furniture perfectly match. Also i recommend all section with explain subject through photography.The picture are awesome!!

I love the ROM. I love the great exhibits, I love the building and the many features it has to offer. I don't however love the price. I find it way to expensive, especially when you consider that most museums in other countries are in fact free to get it. They are world treasures, to be shared with the world.

Love that ROM is along Bloor St which means you can mix shopping and culture all in a day! I visited the Mesopotamia exhibition with my friends and I had an amazing time. Other exhibits in ROM was good too. they also have kid friendly exhibitions and hands-on educational materials. My friends' 2.5yo toddler couldn't bare to peel herself away...

We got a City Pass as a gift prior to travelling. One of the vouchers was for this museum. It is a fabulous building with lots to see and do. It also has an excellent gift shop at reasonable prices and good cafeteria.

The cost of this place is pretty expensive ($27 for the full exhibit per adult). The museum is HUGE! Literally, you could spend an entire day and not see all the exhibits. My biggest complaint about the museum is that most of the dinosaur exhibit is replicas instead of actual fossils. I didn't find this museum to be too entertainting....

Only OK - If your a student don't expect to get the student rate. It only applies to Canadian students and you must be under 25!Needless to say I wasn't impressed but while in Toronto I wanted to see it.

My wife and I only had 2 hours to spend in the museum and we spent all our time in the Japan, China, and Korea room. It was well done and very informative. Saw so many amazing pieces of history from 4,000 BC to the early 1800's. We will go back to see the rest!
Nice museum with a lot of local history as well as relics from around the world. You will need at least 3 hours + to see it all properly.

Museums aren't my thing. I learned that the hard way. Everything there was really cool but it got boring quickly. We looked in all of the rooms and just wanted to leave by the time we were done. Kept the youngest occupied in the game room. Second floor for families are the best place for them. The other part are for older people.

One of the best, if not the best museums I have ever been to. Took the family in August and it was awesome. The place is huge with a ton of exhibits (Canadian history, Dinosaurs, Asian history, European history, Geology and animal species. Great fun but plan of a long day in order to see it all.

This museum is comprehensive, well designed and fascinating. The permanent exhibitions are informative and relevant. This place is worth a stop if you like museums. We didn't have a lot of time so museum guide was very useful with its reccomendations
The museum is very easy to navigate. The displays are extremely well laid out with good descriptions. Wide range of exhibits. Food in the cafe is great, very tasty and reasonably priced.

Great museum!!! We tried to see it all but just could not in one day. If I am in the area again, it was interesting enough that I would go back to see what I missed. This is a must see if you are in the area. Everyone enjoyed this one. We were negotiating over what exhibit to see next....

enjoyed the whole experience, the exhibitions change so there is always something new so see. cafe and a shop which is also interesting

I have only likes about the Royal Ontario Museum. There is so much history behind all the various temporary and permanent exhibits. One travels through various periods of time, and to many parts of the world, so to speak, by spending time at the Royal Ontario Museum. Do not miss this venue!

The museum itself is great and interesting ( if you take the time to read everything ) but I found that during the museum tour, there wasn't much interaction. You just watched and read. Ovtherwise it was an amazing experience and I recommend it to anyone who just wants an interesting, fun day!

After going to the museum years ago on school trips, then years later with my own children, nothing seems to change. Besides the occasional " special feature exhibits", it just feels like a time warp. If you've seen it once- that's good enough.

not to be missed when coming to Toronto. An upcoming exhibit is the artist WEI WI in mid August. You will also see the renovations done by Frank Ghery. Wonderful gift shop.

One of my tests for a great city is that they have great landmarks and public places that are easily accessible to the general public. Toronto fails this test. Everything anyone would want in a museum. You can't see it all in one day. Check out the dinosaurs and more. Great dioramas of early man and beasts. If your curious about history, this is the place for you!

If you are a Grandparent wishing to have a fun place to take your Grandchildren of any age..try the ROM. Lots for the little ones and plenty of room to get about, also inspiring and educational sights for the pre teens and teenagers. All in all a great way to spend time with your Grandchildren.

One of my Favorite museums, it has the ability to transport you to any spot on the globe! It is expensive, so to get your moneys worth plan to spend some time, don't just rush in and out!

I love the exhibits at the ROM. Great for kids but it is very expensive. It is my least favourite museum in the city.

The Royal Ontario Museum is great for all ages. For kids the prehistoric section and bat cave, for adults the cultural artifacts of long ago civilizations. There is something for everyone to enjoy. you need a lot of time if your want to do this so much to see its very hard to get it all in maybe not the best kids place not very much for them to see and would probable be more fun for adults to do on there own

Great for the whole family as there is always something of interest. Occasional temporary exhibits often come here but bear in mind, the R.O.M. is an expensive venture out. Parking is a nightmare so get the spot first before dropping people off.
Fabulous!Something for everyone. Young, Old and in-between.There is lots to see.But it is expensive. No family rate.

For our sanity we choose to only stay a maximum of 3-4 hrs at museums with a nice lunch or coffee break in the middle. Any more time than that and we burn out and lose interest in the displays. The museum is big so we divided it into 'must see' and 'great to see if we have time' sections....
Loved the gemstone/meteorite display. Makes me wish I was a geologist! Absolutely amazing stones there.

ROM is great for literally all ages and is very accessible. It's not far from Spadina / University and is on the Bloor TTC subway line. Let me preface by saying i am not a museum going type, but this is a must see. World class exhibits. Almost every aspect of natural and human history is addressed here. Just make sure you leave yourself a day, minimum. That just scratches the surface.

The new wing is so 21st century and the matching chairs in the lobby are a clever touch. We took a highlights tour with a lovely knowledgeable docent. Although the dinosaur exhibits and the gem exhibits were interestingly, they can't compare with my hometown museum, The Museum of Natural History in NYC.
We got the annual membership and love the kids section. Because our kids can't last more than 2 hours we haven't seen everything yet. Plenty of things to see and learn.
quality collections. would like to see more european art. very well dislpayed art and good staff. will visit in teh future again

I like the ROM because it is just so very interesting. All the exhibits really hold your attention and the whole area is very spacious. The exhibits are very well curated. It is really worth a detour. Kids and grown ups will love it. Dinosaurs exhibit is fantastic and so huge. You can easily spend 3 to 5 hours in this museum

almost 5 hrs of non stop..its the best museum so far I been in, they have everything for "beginning of the earth" to the "20th century" - all equally interesting - breathtaking per say- LOVE IT

This museum is excellent! I live 45 minutes away from Toronto and I've been to the ROM twice. Both times were awesome. The museum is well placed out and is easy to navigate. No long queue. Plenty of exhibits. Only managed to view two levels on this visit so will have to go back again.

Visited today due to the forecast of rain. Pleasantly surprised by the interesting exhibits. The Genisi photography exhibit will stop you in your tracks. Gorgeous. We also liked the BIG exhibit, but it is small. The only food options are cafeteria and not great. The website shows discounted admission for Friday nights.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a terrific natural history museum. Yes, the architecture is a little odd with the new "crystal" building attached to the original museum. I wish there was a vote between "average" and "very good", just "good". I live in Europe, where there is no lack of museums, but having grown up in TO, I've been to the ROM countless times. The past few years developments have saddened me... I'm thinking of the ugly "Crystal", this place should be a museum and not a...

I have not been to the ROM in many years but had my Granddaughter staying with us so we decided on a trip to the ROM. It still brings chills to me when I see all the exhibits of artifacts that are hundreds of years old. The exhibits are well laid out and very easy to see and follow the...

Great building with combining the new and the old, ROM is a excellent museum to visit !!! Next year is the ROM's 100th anniversary as we heard there might be lots of interesting exhibitions held there --- dont miss out :)

The exhibit is quite stunning and it is not a period of history we tend to know much about. The descriptions and videos are good but there are two glaring problems:First, the system to get the audio commentary on your phone is hopeless. It took ten minutes to get started and then checked out after the first session. In...

From the outside of this museum, I never would have expected the beautiful architectural details inside! We only had 1.5 hours to view the entire museum so I feel like we were speed dating a bit. The museum staff was really nice and told us what would be our best bets to see in a limited time - he was...
Our whole family enjoyed the dinosaurs! Each part of the museum has something for everyone. The staff were great with the kids, explaining concepts to them in kid terms!

After walking by a few times, I decided to check this museum out even though I had read that the layout and exhibitions were sort of out of order. Well... that is so but the overall variety of permanent and temporary exhibits as well as the ability to sit a bit in just about every section made for a very...

I guess the new modern wing needs getting used to on this museum. The architects clearly did not respect the architecture of the original. I just wish architects didn't feel need to make a statement.The museum collection is extensive and fabulous and is attractively displayed. Whether your interest is in birds, minerals, dinosaurs or the early Canadians, the ROM does...

Great collection of global antiquities -- a must-see! Current collection is exceedingly well done, and our family found the dinosaur and animal exhibitions user-friendly and interesting. We also particularly enjoyed the ancient Asian artifacts.

Went to the ROM and it was educational. The extra fee for the Mesopotamia attraction that they put on is a bit costly, over and above the general admission. Although I was amazed at what was there. It was nice to see a lot of buses with young kids visiting the museum. I'm glad I went. It would take a...

We had a fantastic day at the ROM! We loved the dinosaurs and the Egypt sections. We went for a few hours and didn't have time to see everything so will definitely have to go back to see the rest. A great educational trip for the kids. If you know someone with a seasons pass they can bring you for...

It's a great spot to take folks of all ages - as well as roam around on one's own. The curators and managers of the museum seem to make constant enhancements - a wonderful thing to do while visiting or living in Toronto - plan on at least 2 half day visits if you're new to the city. The 'cube'...

Being used to London museums this was really small in comparison and didn't take long to get around but it's a lovely museum. The Mesopotamia exhibition, which I missed in London, was truly brilliant. Only downside was that the 'nice' restaurant was closed and so it was down to the basement for me . . .

If you enjoy a 1-2 hours visit to a museum, this is a good option, the dinosaurs are the best part, did not see any really famous thing in here but it has several interesting materials; the map they give is really bad, they should give one with the highlights of the museum, otherwise is confusing to know what you...

The fact is that most museums cater to kids now. If you put the word "dinosaur" in it, you can get teeming kids with parents in tow. The new dinosaur hall is well done, but the real key stuff are the permanent collections of fine and decorative arts and natural history. If you can go without your kids for a...

I hadn't been to the rom in years so I figured I check it out. I was expecting the exhibits to be much more interactive and creative. If you take your kids here instead of the science center expect some upset kids. Half of the exhibits were just boring recreations. The egypt section was pretty cool and the architecture of...
There are different parts to the museum. Some are traditional-like and other parts are very interactive for all ages. There are sections where the kids can dress up and most kids love the dinosaurs.

I love the variety of the displays there. One of the best diosaur displays ever. The arcitecture is interesting but not my favourite but the quality of the exhibits far more than compensates for that. Location is perfect for easy accessibility.
Excellent place to visit with family!!! Children love this place, especially dinosaurs!!! My husband loved the hall with medieval weapons.

I went to the ROM with a few friends for a night out at the ROM. They were serving drinks, DJ was playing and there were local gourmet vendors serving excellent food. This was a very unique experience as you could walk around the Museum with a few drinks and as the night went on the party caught momentum and...
Mesopotamia exibit was excellent and very informative. It was nice to see the history of these ancient people and the seed of civilization.

The ROM as it is called in Toronto is a magnificent rambling building that you can wander about for at least a day. They usually have amazing special exhibits, the most recent being the Genesis photo exhibit, which was showing simultaneously in London England.Costumes, armour, rocks, dinosaurs, you name it is there. It really is fun.Drawback? No food,...
We loved the design with a natural flow for visitors. Each floor illustrates the cultures of the world with emphasis on North American Inuit life. A must see (well for us anyway)

This was part of the City Pass so we took the kids hoping for a good couple of hours and it was. Great building; great exhibits. It is in a nice area, easy to access from the subway and we had lunch across the street. We learned something new and that's the goal. The kids liked the cave exhibit. I...

We had been there before but went to see the special exhibit on Mesopotamia. It was well designed and we were able to spend as much time as we needed walking through the several areas of a fascinating early civilization. It is timed for entry but not for exiting.The Dinosaurs and Egyptian areas interested us as well and we...

This is a very large museum and the current exhibits Mesopotamia and Genesis by Salgado took us almost three hours to complete. This is TMI for most people for a one-day experience. We were absolutely amazed at the quality and the presentation of both of these large exhibits. When I walked in and paid my admission, I wisely asked the...

Went to see the Mesopotamia exhibit. Was glad I did though I had seen many of the artifacts in London before (most are on loan from the BM) the layout of the displays made for an interesting experience. The dinosaur exhibit is a hit with the kids.

This is a world class museum that you can spend hours in. They have a great collection of Chinese, Korean, Japanese art as well as native and Canadian. They have a great gem collection. There are dinosaurs, taxidermy animals, etc.There is a cafeteria in the basement that is good for those who want to stay in the building. The...

Today My friend and I visited the Mesopotamia exhibit at the Royal Ontario Museum in Toronto. Wow! This exhibit is amazing. This is a collection created by the British Museum. It represents the three ancient civilizations of Mesopotamia: Sumer, Assyria and Babylon. While a little long and overwhelming to see it in one visit, it is well worth a visit....
This is an amazing place to enjoy an afternoon and they have dinosaurs- and great other exhibits. Highly recommend you come here for a day with your kids

Just got back from Toronto, made the Royal Ontario Museum part of our whirlwind trip. We were fortunate enough to get to see the limited time Mesopotamia exhibit, it was fabulous and well worth the extra price. We only gave ourselves a couple of hours at the museum and I wish we had more time to dedicate to it. There...

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) is simply overwhelming. I've visited other museums that were only about the local area, the state/province, or the country. The ROM is truly an international historical and contemporary museum that somehow covers dinosaurs, civilizations, cultures (think different countries/eras), technology, geology and other subjects in the same facility! While I was there, the Mespotamia exhibiton was...

Royal Ontario Museum is a great place to visit with kids to get comprehensive idea of Canada's and global history, culture and nature. Exhibitions are clearly marked and divided into storeys of the buliding. For foreigners I suggest starting with Canada's and First Nations sections, which are located on the ground floor and somehow hidden. One can easily skip them,...
Excellent exhibit on first nations of Canada, could have spent an entire day at the ROM! World class collection.

Beautiful artefacts from Assyrian and Babylonian Empires. Fantastic. Was upset that ROM gave confusing instructions as to whether pics could be taken. We were told we could take pics when we bought tickets and then were told off by security for attempting to do so, citing that the exhibit belonged to another museum. Come off it!

Visited the ROM this past weekend to see the exhibit on Mesopotamia. A wonderful and educational trip through time. A must see for sure and do plan a minimum of 2 to 2.5 hours in order to read all the information and listen to the various short clips. If you are interested in the beginning of mankind, the creation of...
Visited special exhibitions Mesopotamia and Genesis, quick look at the Inida picture exhibition. Lots of other interesting subjects but no time. Always visit the ROM when I am in Toronto

Had a great time. Locals call it the most beautiful and the most controversial due to the added design to the front right part of the building. There's alot to see. Mostly it's divided to different parts of the world. The egyptian side had lots of animal mummies and one male mummy, prince of the ancient world. There's lots of...

We spent a morning here which really was not long enough. The building outside was in my opinion ugly but the inside was great with all the exhibits and dinosaurs, definately agood time was had by all.
We visited during summer vacation and it was jammed with camp kids. But the exhibits are fun for everyone. Our 11 and 14 year old enjoyed it as much as us. Worth the trip.
A magnificent selection across time and space! From the most Modern of Modern art to some classic ancient and Romantic pieces, you can't go wrong with the ROM!
The Royal Ontario Museum has wonderful displays. Even if the weather is excellent, I highly recommend spending at least half a day there.
There is a temporary exhibition here on the civilizations of Mesopotamia. I knew very little about this. The display was excellent, and I learned a great deal.
We did not have enough time to visit ROM. It was very clean, quiet and a nice afternoon walk. It had a nice mix of history, art and natural science.
It is a natural history type museum. You can spend all day there or blow through it in two hours or so depending on how much you read.
An excellent world cultural/world history experience. From dinosaurs to costumes to photo journalism to totem poles there is something for everyone.

What an architecture not only exterior but the interior is also very systematically designed. It is among the world’s leading museums of natural history preserved. Great artifacts for Ancient Egyptians, China, Romans and Japan. You will not only enjoy this place but also get to enhance your knowledge. It also offers events on Friday evenings for youths & adults which...

Thie museum was lovely with lots of countries represented. The anaimal and dinosaur exhibits were great and the gem room was amazing, just a pity i don't have the cash to buy the big diamonds lol. Great for children and adults alike.

Friday nights in May and June, the ROM opens its doors for a Late Night event. Drink, eat and dance and check out the museum and people. Good food and good deals on drinks. DJ's could mix it up a bit as it gets a bit to 'housey'. There are DJ's upstairs as well some bands. Mostly 20 somethings but...

Weekly Friday dancing night. What a brilliant idea, raise awareness to the public, create atmosphere for social outings, try unique gourmet good and many more.So proud to live here, I have never heard of such a cool idea for a museum.

I highly recommend the Royal Ontario Museum. It's modern, spacey, airy, not overcrowded - with excellent collections. The building itself is very special as well.The museum offers a 1 hour guided tour for free, with one highligh per section. Join the tour if you have the opportunity, our guide was fabulous.I also recommend a film performance of the...
Good way to spend an afternoon if the weather is too hot or too wet. Lots to see but the same things as most other natural history museums. Kids will enjoy though.

Excellent to see the dinosaurs , first time seeing a T rex and all the other saurus's worth a visitWill take a day to get round it all and a bit rushed if you do what we did and think this'll be 2 hours ... It's pretty big and loads to see and do

I was disappointed with the ROM. I was expecting more. While the ROM does have some interesting exhibits, they are not organized well. Things seem to have been thrown together randomly, and there is not enough context provided for a person who just walks in. I love listening to the stories behind things, and there was no audio guide/tour provided...
ROM is a well maintained museum with a variety of activities. Docents give guided tours on the hour and make the trip enjoyable. The dinosaur exhibit, Egypt and China exhibits are outstanding.

Not to be missed, educational and fun with lots to see. Granted, the day we visited the ROM it was packed with kids on school trips so it took a longer to get around. Having volunteers around to give information on exhibits was very helpful. Would recommend! Funky looking building too, got some great pics.
Loved this museum, being from a small province I was blown away by all of the exhibits. Especially the dinosaurs and the Egyptian exhibit.
Beautiful history from all over the world. Educational and friendly staff. Definitely one of the places to visit when you are in town. AND love the extension and architecture.
Make sure to go with volunteer docents on their talks, They explain all exhibits in detail and it is worth doing that rather than trying to do the whole museum,

When in Toronto, you shouldn't miss the ROM. It is a great little museum for adults and children. There are workshops, exhibits and activities going on during the week-ends. I loved the Luminato Festival exhibit of the dolls featuring Victor & Rolf costumes.
This is a must see if you are in the city. This is truly a world class museum and should be on a travel itinerary for Toronto.

Even if you don't step inside the ROM , it's worth checking out the bizarre, jagged glass exterior that tends to delight or offend. With more than 40 galleries of art, archaeology and natural science, the ROM offers up a world of interest and fun. The diverse ROM galleries feature one of the world's finest collections of artefacts from China,...
Architecture of the building and artefacts. Loved the old and new. Easy access and use your City pass to get in
Did two guided tours, Highlights of the Museum and Superpowers of the Ancient world which were both excellent. Would definitely come back

The displays contain wide variety of items from all over the world. Great section for Ancient Egyptians, China, Romans and Japan. It also has unique architectural features. The shop contains several nice items as souvenirs.

I loved the ROM. If you like Canadian history and culture, you've got it all here. There's an excellent First Nations exhibit as well as a natural history exhibit. I am not sure how long it is running but there was a fantastic photography exhibit by Sebastiao Salgado called Genesis. Google him! His photography is amazing.The only complaint I...
The overall museum is above average but not as good as I expected. The dinosaur exhibit was very good and the best part of the museum.
Love the ROM and always will, always fun and interesting. Got to see the crazy dolls on display right now. It's on the MUST list for Toronto!

The only disappointment I had was that I had only allowed an afternoon. Where you could spend a weekend getting lost in this amazing place. I am not a fan of museums but fell in love with this one. Was at Christmas so we saw the dinosaur exhibition which amazed not only a 6 year old but the grownups too....
Excellent place to be and spend time with your family. You all get to learn something of every culture
The ROM always has several interesting exhibits, I would recommend going for sure. They also started to offer events on friday evenings for youth/adults that are great.
I was so disappointed with the new Museum. It is hard to navigate and the exhibits are boring. My kids couldn't wait to get out of there.
The display of Terracotta Warriors and Dinosaurs was breath taking ! With so much to take in we would have liked to have visited another day but it was towards the end of our stay.
The Royal Ontario Museum is truly a wonderful place to visit. Has everything you'd expect to a first class museum. No parking facilities

Beautiful facility that balances old traditional building with a modern addition. Much larger than we expected with a lot of interesting artifacts and history of Canada. Easy to find from our hotel by subway. We were not expecting to see so many students on field trips from school but they were very polite, quiet, and very well behaved so it...

Great museum with fantastic exhibits from all over the world. Great egyptian relics and a fascinating collections of birds / animals and a bat cave which is great fun for kids.There is also a great dinosaur exhibit with impressive relics.Food at the cafe was also of good quality. A great place to go for a few hours.

It had been about 20 years since I'd been to the ROM and I'd forgotten what a great selection of exhibits they have (they've obviously made a lot of changes in 20 years). They have the traditional museum stuff like dinosaurs and Egyptian and European history. But they also have a great selection of natural science exhibits about animals, ecosystems,...

Like dinosaurs? Got it. Egyptian artifacts? Done. Precious minerals and gemstones? A truly unique collection. This had the most extensive First nations exhibit I've ever seen. I've been to the Smithsonian, The British Museum, NYC museums and the ROM is truly a world class museum. We were able to pick and choose what exhibits to go to and probably saw...
yes well worth the effort but give yourself some time to look around properly -as it is the big !!!! one of the largest museums in North America - well worth it

Overall it is a good place to visit for an adult who likes history about wars, equipment's, pottery etc etc... For children there are lot of new things. For people hate to read and look this is definitely a boring place. They could have made the place more interactive or making a theme according to the country or civilization.Must...
Great exhibits! Very close to hotel. Large museum with many exhibit halls. Staff very helpful with information.

True Royal experience!! Have visited museum in Oct 2012. There is direct subway which drops near Museum (station itself is called Museum.)ROM - It is one of the best I have ever visited. Awesome Dianosaur skeletons, fantastic to see actual Mummy. It takes long time to visit different cultural sections, so plan for a day visit, take a break...

I am a huge fan of dinosaurs, and this museum delivers. It's not too crowded and at 16 dollars per adult ticket is not bad value for money. The natural history section on dinosaurs and animals of various species is impressive. Not as good as Natural History Museum in London but not bad either. Lots of interactive sections and good...

Easily reached by public transport, the ROM is a gem in Canada's crown. We only had an afternoon, but one could easily spend days in this amazing place. We chose to visit the Indigenous peoples' section and then a large display on the evolution of style. The quality of the displays is top notch, and the depth in each collection...
What's not to say about this museum. The displays are varied, amazing and informative. The dinosaur section was exceptional as was the bat display.

This is a beautiful and educational place.From the Native Canadian display to the Roman, Egypt and Cypress displays, they take you back to experience those civilizations.The food selection in the cafe is not the best.You can tour in about 4 hours.
Love the permanent collection at the ROM. They also put on some great temporary collections that pass through.

I am not a great fan of art museums so I went in thinking this was going to be a quick trip.It was not.The ROM has quite a nice blend of just about everything someone would want to see in a museum.This place is much bigger than it looks on the outside and requires a lot of...
The rom is a great building, I was expecting more from it though. Some of the exhibits were not laid out as well as they should have been. Staff were helpful.
Nice exhibits. Our family really enjoyed it. Good blend of materials shown. The kids were engaged enough to spend the day there.
The only problem is there's not enough time in a day to see all the amazing exhibits! Fantastic exhibits, great explanations and nice cafe - can't wait to go back.
This is one of the best museums i have ever seen and they have awesome collection .If you a re amuseum type of person then this place is a must visit in toronto .

I remember visiting this museum many years ago, and thought it very impressive.I returned recently and was disappointed. Millions have been spent on a modern extension which, to put it mildly, will not be to everyone's taste. It is as if a jagged alien spaceship has crashed into a grand historic building.
