ROM is not my favorite. Although It is impossible not to appreciate what you can see there, the museum is not well organized and I think that the eccentric building do not help in that. I went there on Friday afternoon and the museum was not at its best. They were preparing for dancing at the museum at that night...
Interesting exhibits, fantastic features, a planetarium, dinosaurs, tombs, it's like being Indianan Jones for the day and exploring the whole world - without having to leave Toronto.

You can check culture from China, Japan, Grece, Egypt, Canada and from everywhere, but if you have already been at Metropolitan Museum In New York, I think that it won't be interesting because Metropolitam museum has the same things but is bigger and you can pay what you want and at Royal Ontario Museum you need to pay the full...

The building of the museum was a combination of a chrystal embedded in a wonderful historical building. I understand there are those who love and those who hate. I thought it was ver interesting. When you travel through the museum you go from the traditional building to the modern structure. The exhibit itself was great and eclectic. Give yourself enough...
We saw the dead sea scrolls. The displays were well thought out and set up to entice you to travel along the exhibits. The information was clearly laid out. Well worth the visit.
The ROM unfortunately is like every other museum if you've seen one you've seen them all. It is very pricy as well.

I recently visited here with my Nanny and we absolutely loved it.. although she did find it very easy to get lost but there are plenty of staff around to help you. There was so much in the museum and everything was very well laid out and informative. But allow all day to look around.. we spent 5 hours here...

was well worth the price learned alot of stuff on the 2nd floor which was the kids floor , the asian male volunteer was great and taught us alot of things we didnt know. coutos to him. i want to go again as i didnt get to see everything i wanted since i had my teenage son and he wanted...
Worth a visit and something for all ages. I like going during weekdays. The exhibitions are beautifully designed.

I started going weekly with a membership (worth it if you love history!) and its a fantastic place. A bit annoying during march break or summer when its packed with a ton of families, but worth it. Its really interactive and great for both kids and adults and its worth repeat visits to really see it all.
Huge. Fantastic...and worth every penny. Buy the City Pass and save some money. It's got art, dinosaurs, culture and more.

I liked this museum from the beginning - the architecture is great. The dinosaur exhibit is the highlight for me but the rest is still excellent as it gives you a taste of so many diverse cultures and styles. I agree with other reviews that there are too many "knick-knacks" in some areas but still a great way to spend...
Liked: Canadian history artifacts, Natural History galleries (i.e bats, dinosaur, birds bones & skeletons. East Asian arts and European History.Disliked: Snakes & spiders

Great things to see from the dazzling minerals to intriguing dinosaur bones to the amazing mausoleum of a Chinese general. A must see in Toronto. Leave a whole day for this attraction and if possible swing by next door to the Bata Shoe museum.
It felt like Amazing Race - ROM has so much too offer! Lots to see, the group Scavenger Hunt was a lot of fun.
The Mayan Exhibit was excellent. I was the companion to one person in a wheelchair, and I found that the staff there were very kind and helpful to both of us in the museum and its restaurant.

We didn't care for the artifacts. Looking at ancient pots and pans just isn't our thing. we spent over 5hrs there, visiting every gallery.Plusses: The collection is huge. The mineralogy gallery was interesting.

I'm grateful I had a good pair of walking sneaks on since it takes at least 3 hours to get through the museum and that was just skimming the surface of activities and exhibits. If you are taking a child, expect at least 2 more hours. There are many things to do with your child in several areas. There were...

If you're wanting to give this museum a good go, make sure you get there first thing in the morning when it opens as you'll probably stay there the whole day. Make sure you have a good sleep the night before otherwise you will get very tired. As with most museums there is a lot of standing and walking. We...

I can spend many more wonderful hours there. Interactive and engaging. I went along with my husband and ended up enjoying it almost more than him. We did a 45min introductory tour with a very spritely, enthusiastic older woman. Besides all the incredible knowledge she shared, she inspired every person in the group.After knowing the lay of the land...

while there are amazing things to see and do at the ROM, overall our family has been disappointed on our 2 different recent trips there. the inside space, though renovated, seems quite dark and lifeless from an design perspective, and there are surprisingly very few interactive or hands on exhibits for children (or adults). having been to dozens of museums...

Can get pricey - certain times the Museum is free - check their website (I think Friday Afternoons). Collection is ok, not as extensive as other major museums around the world but Probably one of the best Dinosaur collections in the world. The Crystal (like it/hate it) it is at least an attempt to spice up Toronto's architecture scene which...
Just as fascinating as when I was a child. :) Loved all the new exhibits but the dinosaurs and Egyptian exhibits are still my favourites!

Took the kids a few months ago to see the Dinosaur exhibit. A family of four cost us just shy of $100. It was not worth it. I way prefer to take the kids to the AGO. More for them to do and a much better price.

I like to check out the ROM if possible whenever I come to Toronto. There's a great variety of things to see; antiquities from the Classical world, as well as large Asian collections, natural history, Canadian and First Nations items, and European weaponry and artefacts. Twice I've been for the special exhibit, and have found them to be impressive, interactive,...
The perfect escape on a rainy day. A large and diverse museum, the ROM appeals to the whole family. Well worth the admission.

I loved visiting this museum. It can be good fun! I saw lots of families, and was happy to see some parents taking their time to teach History to their kids, by using actual findings from digs. The amusement starts outside, for the combination of architectural styles makes the façade of the building a granted good picture! Seriously, you can't...

This was my second visit to the ROM and again I throughly enjoyed it. The amazing dinosaur exhibit is well worth the entrance fee alone. I also loved the Greek, Roman and Byzantine exhibits. A great way to spend an unseasonably cold day in Toronto with a visitor!!

Liked the ground floor exhibits- enough to take in in one day. Disliked the school children wandering aimlessly in all directions (even with adults supposedly supervising) and flash photography- Have some respect!
A very good museum with a global collection, but as a visitor I wanted to know more about Canada. A great building which is interesting on its own.
Always a favourite spot to take guests when I'm in the area, love the geological exhibit area. Wish there were more hands-on experiences but still worthwhile.

Was a wonderful showing of art but they advertised in a brochure a HUGE ancient egyptian section. We went all the way through and it wasn't there. However, I will be visiting again because their art section was beautiful.

This is a good museum, with all of the typical pieces ... Roman artifacts, Egyptian artifacts, animals, etc. I have seen a lot of museums across the world, and I would rate this as average. I did like the gems and minerals area though, because that was something I had not seen at any other museum.

The exhibits are always interesting and the interior of the new wing is amazing BUT, from the outside, it looks awful and out of place on such a majestic building. Can't bear to look at it when I drive by!
It is a big museum that takes a while to get round. Some great extracts of dinosaurs, mummies etc. If you were to read everything, you could be there ages!

The ROM is no Louvre, but it still has its charm. The building itself is a marriage of the historic and the modern. When inside, look for the beautiful golden mosaic on the ceiling; it was completed during the Great Depression.The exhibits cover everything from dinosaurs to ancient civilizations to Art Deco furniture and more recently textiles. There's also...

This beautifuly designed old building, updated by the best architects, offers a wonderful trip through time. In the one building you have excellent displays of the history of man through the ages, prehistoric, native cultures, Egyptian, Greek, etc, in displays that seem so real. that the animals might jump out at you or the dinosaurs might stomp through the room....
as the name implies, Royal Ontario Museum is a must see, if you love history don't miss out on this one.

Outside of Ottawa, the nation's capital, museums in Canada are pale relatives to those you find in Europe. The Royal Ontario Museum, or ROM, is the exception. Large, imposing and well located, it is only a notch below the grand museums of the U.K. and France. And that's a compliment.
Very good and interesting museum. One of must see in Toronto. Interesting exhibits, really enjoyed spending time there.

The ROM is a lovely Museum to visit, there are several interactive displays which are great for children. My favourite displays are the Egyptian rooms and the Dinosaur Displays. I would thoroughly recommend this for both for Adults and Families. You would definitely need to spend the whole day there to be able to see everything.

Took our family of 6 to the ROM. Had a great time. March Break meant there were lots of extra hands-on experiences for the kids. I hadn't been there in over 10 years. It was very busy but they had extra guides to help you find where you wanted to go. Be warned this is downtown so parking is dicey....

If you in Toronto for couple days please include this museum to you MUST SEE. You can find a lot of interesting exhibitions, historical galleries.It will take couple hours, but it will be interesting and very knowledgeable time spendingMuseum is very modern in a way of presentationand very logical in a way fo this presentation.You will start...

The ROM is a massive museum filled with both modern and ancient artifacts. Every few months there is a special exhibit brought in. I've seen the King Tut and Mayan special exhibits. It's always interesting to wander through the museum.You need a full day to really see everything.
Just a wonderful experience for my family. The kids loved the dinosaur exhibit and we all learned quite a bit about the world we live in. Thanks ROM!
My child and I thoroughly enjoyed visiting the ROM, and would recommend it for children of all ages.
I was glad i went to Royal Ontario Museum. It was great place. Only thing i hate it about parking. Plus it was not cheap.
alway a place to loose yourself, collection dates back centuries and now has current displays of recent toronto events
Very interesting Museum, really well laid out , lots of levels, artefacts and quite space. You would need to allow half a day to see it properly.

Visited ROM specifically to view the impressive collection of Dinosaurs as the 5 year old is obsessed with them.Very, very impressive and would have loved to spend more time in the museum but ran out of time without seeing half of what was on offer.Amazng place

We went to the ROM for the Dinosaur exhibit and enjoyed the display and interactive activities available. We unfortunately did not get to see much more of the museum as my son got tired and hungry. We visited the cafe on the lower level, and had a nice lunch - but boy was it expensive! the entry fee was on...

We were disappointed in our first ever trip to the ROM on March 29th. Our family loves museums and we never miss an opportunity to explore new ones. Just last month we toured the Field Museum in Chicago for our second time. We got to the Field when it opened, stayed until it closed, and still did not get through...
There is an unbelievable amount to see and do here. The exhibits are thoughtfully well laid out for visiting with a family.
This is a very wonderful place to visit while in Toronto. My 5 kids enjoyed it a lot. We had our own tour guide that showed some important pieces in the museum. It was a great experience.

My family enjoyed the mummy exhibit, the dinosaurs, and all the biodiversity section. My kids are aged 11, 9, and 5. My 5 year old practically ran through the bat cave she was so scared so I did not get to look as much as I would have liked. The exhibits we did see were very well done. I didn't...

My family and I had several days to spend in Toronto and the concierge at our hotel suggested the museum. What a treat, previously unseen dinosaurs were on exhibit during our visit. This was a big hit with our family, the interactive aspects were so interesting to all ages as we saw young and mature people using the computer screens...

Over the March break, my husband and I took our kids to the ROM. We went on the Friday afternoon as it was the only time we had available. It turned out there was a discounted rate at that time too, from 4:30 - 8:30 when they closed. It's a huge place but we managed to see just about all...
Had a lot of great exhibits. Many things to see...worth every penny to get in and spending the day. Highly recommend.....

I'd been here numerous times as a child, and very little has changed or improved. The bat cave is unchanged from when I first saw it 20 years ago. Compared to museums in other cities, it is not all that much, especially considering the price. The ugly addition makes for a lot of wasted space, and awkward layout requiring a...
TheROM never disappoints and the restaurant there is exceptional. We enjoyed the food and the service (sorry can't remember the name but it was a more formal restaurant not just a snack-bar).

This museum was amazing. So many different areas to explore and all interestingly displayed. Particularly like the mammals skeleton collection. Spent ages in this area! Also really liked the bat cave. As a Londoner this felt like all our big museums rolled into one! I was visiting alone but could easily see how it could appeal to everyone in some...
This is a museum which you have to spend a bit of time in to do it justice but it is well worth the visit. Variety of exhibits to choose from so you can pick you own particular likes.

I visited the ROM on Monday, March 11 which happened to be the first day of Toronto's Spring Break. Oh my gosh, there were a lot of kids. And the line-up to get into the building was ridiculous; fortunately I have a WAG membership which allowed me to skip the queue and also gave me free admission to the ROM....

I went this museum on aug, 2012. At first the great building shocked me. We were on a museum tour day and the only bad thing i can say about here is it is a huge museum. My legs nearly falled and i couldnt finish touring, or admiring. Full of beautiful artifacts. I completely fall in love. Whatever you are...

My husband and I went here on a Friday evening just before March break (its cheaper after 4:30pm and fit perfectly with work hours). The main reason we went was to catch the temporary dinosaur exhibit and we thought it was great. We also checked out the regular dinosaur exhibit and that was also good but not as spectacular (although...

I love museums, especially science museums, so my boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip up to Toronto to go to the ROM. Wonderful idea! There were 5 floors, each with something different to offer. I loved that the museum had a wide range of exhibits: ancient civilizations, architecture, Canadian history, birds and reptiles of the different continents,...

The ROM never disappoints. The Dinosaur exhibit was fantastic. The kids loved the medieval show as well. Even during busy march break, there was enough space for everyone to disperse and see the exhibits.

The AGO is an excellent place to spend a few hours in Toronto. They have some very interesting permanent exhibits along with a temporary exhibit that changes every month. The dinosaur hall is always a big hit with kids!The gallery can get very busy around school holidays such as March Break and if he temporary exhibit is kid oriented....
I really enjoyed the museum. I would certainly recommend that everyone visits it at least once a year with the family.

I haven't been to the ROM in quite a well, so I was disappointed to see that the "old" main entrance to the museum had moved around the corner onto Bloor St.. I do understand fully, why the new entrance was needed, more space to accommodate larger crowds, a better coat check, and a new ROM Gift Shop (much larger)....
Superb collection. Impressive exhibits. A bit tough to navigate. This is a must-see in Toronto. Well worth the ticket price.

We had a marvellous time at the ROM. My kids, aged 12 and 14 thoroughly enjoyed their time.We viewed the Asian exhibits, including a Samurai sword demonstration, the Dinosaurs of Gondwana just to name a few. It is set up very well. If one is going on March break, buy tickets ahead of time to avoid long entrance line-ups....
Great exhibits! Just be careful of the double paned glass exhibits when trying to get a closer look (ouch!) it was a fun day!

Not being a huge museum buff, we were unsure if the trip to ROM was going to be worthwhile. So glad we came! The dinosaur exhibit was amazing, we spent most of our time here. Also enjoyed the gems, egypt, and tomb. The gift shop was a little lackluster. Combine this trip with Casa Loma, as they are quite near...
A must do if you are in Toronto . A world renowned museum . A fantastic combination of old and new architecture . Astounding .

A visit to the Royal Ontario Museum or ROM as the locals call it, is a must when visiting this fabulous city. We were very fortunate to walk into an extremely impressive, well organized and educational exhibit on dinosaurs, their first appearance on the planet, the various habitats and species, most of them unknown to us.It was an unforgettable...

My adult children and I spent more than 4 fun filled hours at the ROM on March 9th, the first weekend of March break in the Toronto and yes, there were crowds of people and children of all ages and it was busy and so on and so on, but so what? Generally speaking both adults and children were well...
The ROM is basically a Museum for all cultures. but it has a special part that interested me specifically, the History of Canada and how it was founded by the Indians.
It was a zoo! Too many people; you couldn't move! There was no were to eat in the cafe and the food was cold. Will NEVER take the kids there duing March Break again. Lesson learned.
The ROM has to be my favorite place to visit other than the Science Center. The exibits are wonderful and if you can go while they have the Dinosaurs it makes it sooo much better!!
Four floors of history, there is something for everyone here. Kids will enjoy the hands on exhibits and activities.

Great to see as a family - grandparents, parents, (grand)children. ROM well prepared for March break madness with lots of interactive activities. Ultimate dinosaur exhibit was worth the little extra. Family pizza meal was good and reasonably priced, was a nice break, opportunity to rest and start again. So much to see, read and learn, worth another trip.

We attended the ROM on Sunday March 9th. It was $15 pp for general admission. This was March break and the dinosaur exhibit was in town so very busy. The staff managed very well. There was plenty of seating through out the museum if you wanted to rest your legs for a bit, which you will. We were there for...

The ROM is a great collection of fine art and natural history in a wonderful collection of adjoined buildings. She whisked us and four other guests through the museum to highlight an artifact in each...

For kids, there are great exhibits such as the Ultimate Dinosaurs. Adults might like the Asian Hall. The cafeteria has a big variety of food. My grandson enjoyed the rocky road brownies. My other grandson had pizza. The building's design is modern and interesting to see. Be sure to look around at the architecture. A family pass might be a...
You definitely need more than a day to explore all the ROM has to offer. There's just WAY too much to take in all in one day.
If you can avoid the crowds and lines ROM is a great place to spend several hours lost in history. Too much take it all in in one visit. Requires regular re- visits - just like all good musuems

I am always astounded when I visit. I love to take time in between trips there...not being from T.O. I sometimes miss exhibits I would otherwise love to see...all in all, I was pleased - but I also love to meander around at my own pace...this supports that notion well.

What a spectacular museum! Its awesome, so complete, but my review wants to recommend you to take the guided tour at 1pm Sundays so bad I don’t recall the lady’s name. but she had awesome highlights of the museum! It was a great way to see all the museum with someone who knows almost everything on it and in such...

What an amazing place to go, take your family or visitors to our city! There is never enough time to see everything and no matter how many times I've been there....there is always new exhibits to see! Just wish we could get in to the behind the scene displays and see how they are prepared, stored....etc.! A little expensive to...
Interactive zones for the kids. They love dinosaurs and the bat cave. I like the stone and gem exhibit.

But it is a bit pricey--so here are some tips that I found out about after I had paid the full fee--If you are a CAA/AAA member, present your card for a discount. Even better, there are passes to the museum that can be obtained for free from the public libraries. They are first come, first served and not...

We spent about 4 hours here. There is a great variety of things to see. We were hesitant that our 8 year old would be bored, but he enjoyed it and loved taking picutres throughout the museum. Easily accessible from the subway station.
Stood in awe of the landscapes--ever more meaningful after travelling from West Coast by train in winter. If that doesn't set the mood these paintings nothing will.

Loved that there was 3 floors; killed a lot of time here. There is a lot to see here and i loved the level with all the animals. The other two levels are all based on history and statues. The price was very reasonable, and it wasn't when we went.

I love the ROM. There is always something interesting to do or to see here. The displays are refreshed often. Children and teenagers always feel welcome here. There is always a good buzz of energy at the ROM. It is an easy three to four hours out (or longer).

We found the show on recently discovered dinosaurs very well presented, with audio-visuals that went well beyond most museums, presenting a lot of recent learning in the area most enjoyably. The ROM has some very good areas of concentration, and does them very well (Chinese artifacts, for example). There is also a very nice restaurant on the 5th floor for...

We unfortunately could only find time to come to the ROM on Family Day. There was a HUGE line-up and the first floor was crowded with children and parents. First, let me say I would go back to the ROM again. It was just not what I had remembered it being. Also, the new Dinosaur Exhibit is lame and geared to children. The museum is great, there are lots of different cultures and time period to explore (first nations, China, Korea, etc). Worth taking the time to walk there, the neighborhood south of the museum is really nice.
Well organized and great place to take young ones one a cold or rainy day. Arrive early on the weekend as it can take ten minutes to buy your tickets at mid-day.

It was our first time visiting the ROM. My 9 year old son and myself particularly enjoyed the Ancient Civilizations galleries (Greece, Rome & Egypt) because these are a topic of study at school. We spent the weekend in Toronto, as a getaway mini vacation, this past Sunday we decided to check out the ROM as we had never been. They have a well diversified collection of exhibits. Making it easy to view quickly or linger at something that interests you more.

I really enjoy the ROM when I'm in Toronto, especially the Chinese and other Far Eastern exhibits, which are breathtaking. Me and my 6 yr old went to the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) in Toronto to see the Dinosaur exhibit. My son loves dinosaurs. Very interesting display, especially for non-Canadians, of early Canadian material. Also a terrific display of ancient Chinese statues and much else. And a good museum shop! We also liked having a large room where you could sit down with your own lunch. Other countries should copy!

Went during Christmas holidays and they still had lots of activities for kids and families on weekdays.Haven't been here for a few years and I enjoyed looking at the renovations.The food in the cafe is better than it used to be....at least you have some healthy options.

that was as real as i would care to be in.This is a fun museum with exceptional Asian artifacts, informative listening stations, furnished rooms,paintings,sculpture.Quite an array really. Our group split up to pursue personal interests and every one wished we had booked more time for this visit.

I guess it's no longer "new" since it's been there for a few years... but I really loved the previous building design. Took the family on an outing. Wonderful exhibit and the history of some is very interesting. The kids were very interested in the creative workshops/building activities. If you can look past the blinding eyesore that is often ranked in the "Top 10 Ugliest Buildings In The World" you'll find an ok collection.Like most general museums, it has something that will appeal to most people.
Another fantastic museum in Toronto. Need to go more often, love the special exhibits such as 'BIG', awesome exhibit of textiles and costumes!

I’ve been to this amazing place 5-6 times in 2012-2013 and I will definitely come again. The museum is fantastic educational and entertaining place for children and adults. Prepare to stay there the whole day since there are LOTS of staff to see and to do, especially when you are with kid(s). What I liked the most was the second...

Some exhibits are great for adults, while others are wonderful for children - hands on activities. During the holidays we also had a great time at the animal shows and appreciated the long opening hours.

i'm not a fan of museums but i was pleasantly surprised when i visited this place, the building alone looks amazing and the exhibitions were interesting, they even had a place where you could dress up in ancient clothing

Great place to visit and lots to see. The museum was very well organized and five floors of things to see made it a bit overwhelming!!! The entry to the Musuem was around $16-35 depending on the exhibits. I didnt like it at all. The exhibits didnt flow through the museum you travelled through them all smooshed together. The best one i believe was the dinosaur exhibit but there was so many kids/strollers it made it hard to move around. Id save your money if your...

This museum is a major player in Canada's cultural landscape and no matter what one may think about the recent architectural embelishments, the collection, one of Canada's largest, merits a visit. Especially if your children are into dinosaurs.

This place is HUGE! We didnt even know where to start and it seemed like even with the help of a map we were still going in circles. This is a great Natural History museum and you definitely have to fit it in when you have the time to spend a few hours there.

My husband and I visited this museum on our last trip to Toronto. All I can say is it is huge we were there easily for 5 hours, by the end we were both exhausted. The is alot of walking to do.The dinosaur exhibit is very popular, esp with the kids. When we went it was also freezing and...
Although I haven't visited it for a while, I always enjoy going there, especially when there are special exhibits. Visitors to the city should place it on their priority list.

If you have the chance, the Royal Ontario Museum is worth a visit. The exhibitions were well maintained and covered a wide variety of times, subjects and interests. I much preferred the museum before the renovations several years ago. My boyfriend took me to the ROM for a date. We enjoyed all of the exhibits. A lot to look at for one day. If I lived in Toronto I would have a pass for sure.

This museum is world class with an excellent dinosaur exhibit and a bat cave for the adventurous. The rotating featured displays are always interesting although there may be an additional fee. The Dinosaur Exhibit, it was awesome. At that time they also had a display of Carnival costumes from Trinidad & Tobago which was designed by Brian Macfarlane

This is a fine museum of Natural History with some excellent dinosaur specimens from a huge variety of species. When I went there was also a very interesting exhibition on Mayan history. If you're a science geek like I am you will be happy to get lost in here for a few hours.

Dinosaurs that is, as well as many other items of interest in a broad range of categories from Chinese society, Egyptian mummies, to birds and reptiles. Lots of local historical artifacts. Everything is well displayed and the atmosphere is an interesting eclectic of Gothic Victorian to cubist modern. Don't miss this totem poles that reach from the basement to the...

my husban and i were told to get some culture so we came here we had a look at the dinasoure exibit and thought that it was time to go but when we looked we would have missed some amazing exibits we spent nearly five and a half hours there and really enjoyed it would do it again and the...

I was surprised to see that the ROM was rated as the #6 attraction of things to see in Toronto. We found it difficult to navigate (not many signs) and there wasn't much to see. Seemed like a bunch of useless items stuffed into an odd shaped building. Not worth the trip. There are more impressive things to see in...

Great combination of cultural and natural history. I especially recommend their East Asian and dinosaur exhibits. The price isn't bad at 25.00 a ticket when we went (reduced to 22.5 with a student discount). The museum is also located near lots or green space, which is fun to walk around after the museum,

This museum is large and worth spending a half day. If you don't have so much time to spare for this museum, it is a good idea to see only must-see items shown in the map you receive at the entrance. If you bring your lunch, you can find a space where you can eat it in the basement.

Took my 2 teens to this and I have to say we were far from impressed. The overall impression is of an old collection in a refurbished architecture award seeking building. Lots of stuffed animals in glass cases and collections of chunky furniture . Don't recall very much hands on or IT. The Geology collection was easy on the eyes...

I was impressed being at the R.O.M. Never been there before. Thought it would be pretty boring - but pleasantly proved wrong. A tip - be methodical when you move from exhibit to exhibit - there are lots of floors and displays - and its easy to miss attractions.

Loved the Rom - huge museum, the featured dinosaur exhibit was nice but could have included more - seemed small for a featured exhibit, otherwise , there was so much to see, including an area that was geared to kids with games and interactive displays such as aquariums and a bat cave. Staff and volunteers are very friendly.
this museum is the best! so fun and entertaining. My favourite place to bring my teenage son...something for both of us to enjoy.

There is not much you can say about a museum as well-known as the ROM. It is a bit pricy, especially if you include any special exhibits. But you will run out of time before you run out of very well designed and interesting exhibits to view. Need a break? The coffee shop/restaurant in the basement offers something for everybody,...

I wasn't sure if our 2 1/2 and 1 yr old would enjoy the museum but it turrned out to be a hit. There was a ton of stuff for the older one to do and the younger one to look at. We were there for over 3 hrs and only left cause bedtime was coming up. Very highly recommended.

I have had a membership with the ROM for the last 3 years now. It is by far, one of the best things I keep in my wallet for those days where I'm not too sure what I want to do but know I just want to do something profound and reflective. It's even better that members can go whenever...

I love their restaurant, not too expensive at all and nice selection.Museum was average, dinosaurs part is way too expensive to see a bit and their suvenir store way over priced LOL, a lot of people but nobody buying anything there.Dinosaurs should be included in the ROM entry price otherwise it is not worth it!
I thoroughly enjoyed the ROM! Very educational and very fun to experience. I recommend this museum for people of all ages!

Great atmosphere, fun for kids, interesting exhibits. Try and take subway if you can, parking is a challenge in this area of the city. Cumberland parking garage, just north is in walking distance and easy to leave southbound to Gardiner.
Good exhibits on history of Canada and the indigenous peoples. Plenty of exhibits from other regions of the world also, but for me, the Canadian parts were the ones of interest.

I used to love the Royal Ontario Museum, known as the ROM by locals. The dinosaur exhibit was excellent, and when they added a children's area it was the best place to spend an afternoon with my kids. Ever since I was a little kid, I loved going to the ROM. In a recent trip to Toronto, my husband and I took our grand-daughter to see the dinosaur display which was absolutely outstanding. The exhibits were amazing! The building and rooms were gorgeous and BIG!! The food in the cafeteria was good but the cloth benches in the cafeteria were really a terrible, stained and ugly mess! I had to lay down a bunch of napkins before I could sit on the benches! Fabric seat coverings were not such a good choice with...
We occupied our time with dinosaurs and wish we had more time to visit the standing exhibits. Well worth the trip.

If you come from a town with no significant museums and are fascinated by relics from the past, this is a pretty big place with some very interesting, but typical museum, displays. New controversial architecture has recently changed the from face of the old building, mixing modern design with the traditional. To many it's a strange mix.

Amongst the best exhibits I have seen. Well curated with excellent appeal to young and old paleantogists alike. Allow 2 hours to view, hopefully younger group members can hang in that long.$25 an adult ticket is steep however.

Royal Ontario Museum, otherwise known as ROM is always an amazing place to visit when you are in Toronto. It is definitely a lovely place to take your young children too. They have special place for kids to play in, amazing offers all year round and most recently they have added a spectacular and I mean a spectacular gift shop...

Even though I am not a kid any more, I still enjoy the ROM. We go there whenever we have visitors from out-of-town. The dinosaur exhibit is great, as well as the bat cave. Great for indoor days!

Next time I'll plan for more time.The ROM has a solid variety of world class exhibits - there's something for everyone, and lots for kids. Dinosaurs and Egyptian mummies have always been a hit, but there's plenty more.If you live in Toronto, it's a no-brainer to become a member.

It is an extremely large museum located conveniently in the downtown core. There was a lot to see and do and it will keep kids and adults alike occupied for at least a couple of hours. The special exhibitions are a hit and I would recommend seeing them first. The admission price is pretty steep though, at more than $20...
The museum had a variety of exhibits,suitable for people of all ages. A must see place for anyone visiting Toronto.
The first nations exhibit is quite good as is the minerals. Don't miss the cafeteria for a light lunch. Plan to visit with one of the many special exhibits such as the Dead Sea Scrolls or King Tut.

This destination is a must-see, particularly for any budding paleontologists. The displays are abundant and interesting. The mineral section is stunning.use much of the day and enjoy a leisurely visit. Food selections are pretty good with many healthy offerings instead of the standard chicken fingers, pizza and fries.

we went with the family to the Royal Ontario Museum. The kids loved it. My boys love the dinosaur exhibits. It’s a great place to bond as a family. We spent the whole day at the ROM (Royal Ontario Museum). We would love to go back in our next visit to Toronto.
Went with my child on school trip. Veryy good place for children to see. Alot of interesting stuff. Their favorite was the mummy and the dinosaurs.
Good museum space. Many many exhibits, you could easily spend 4-5 hours here. The basement cafe is quite nice for lunch or a snack. Make sure to ask for a guide as there are many different areas.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a collage itself. The three readily discernible building styles merge into a space that expresses the mission of the museum in enabling the patron to view exhibits in dramatic, functional spaces. The musical composition played in the Liebskind addition foyer in the late afternoon was a highlight.

What an extensive array of exhibits, from dinosaurs to minerals, from fabrics and costumes to historical artifacts this museum offers. We stayed for 4 hours and only saw a fraction of what it has to offer. Even if you stayed all day you couldn't see everything. At $15 it was a good deal. The special dinosaur exhibit cost an extra...
Special shows are great. Watch for them and subscribe to the ROM's newsletters to get alerts. Price is reasonable to all events at ROM and access is easy by subway.
Well worth seeing, dinosaurs section is good and exhibits are well displayed. Its a nice building to walk around as well.

Love the exhibits. Not too much and not too little. Animal rangers is great, very educational but still appropriate for kids. Love the dino area, the minerals collection, the hallway of the second floor with animal exhibits and interactive screens. Great fashion display.Very informative exhibition on minerals and rocks. The displays were fabulous. I really enjoyed the Weston exhibition of antique furniture and paintings.
We saw both a wonderful exhibit and a concert. It is always wonderful to visit the ROM as there is always something new to see or fun to revisit favourite galleries.

Being quite tired from exploring the city, I sat on a bench contemplating whether I should pay the admission fee to enter the museum. the Royal Ontario Museum is one of the best museums in all of canada and is located in the best place and could be the number one place to go see while visiting toronto besides the cntower and wonderland

Free after 5pm on Fridays, close to Yorkville and shopping on Bloor. Great for culture and the kids to explore.

Well for starters I was ticked off that i wasnt allowed to use my back carrier for my child. They told me it was metal and it would bang into things and that i needed to rent a stroller. The Museum looks amazing. We enjoyed several hours here. Loads of different exhibitions to look at and was set out well. Recommend the Asian exhibits. To top it off a fantastic gift shop!

the ROM was one of the great comprehensive museums.... like the Field in Chicago. It had some great collections, and a lovely 100-year old building. I got the seasons pass for this place; it is great for the whole family. I recommend the seasons pass as you will not be able to get all of it in with kids in tow. Parking is everywhere, but u of t is close and you can get in two adventures in one day....if you are daring.Great place,...

My son is a frequent visitor to the museum (4 - 6 times per year). He loves the dinosaur exhibits, and the biodiversity area. It really is a very kid-friendly museum (4 - 12 year olds). I have been going to the museum since I was a kid and I think it is one of the best I've visited.You...

I am not a huge fan of museums but I really liked this place . I loved the dinosaurs, the mineral section and I have also visited some of the different country sections they have there. I want to go back to see the rest ( we spent 2 hours there and it was not enough ) .

We visited the museum during the big dinosaur exhibition and loved every inch. I found the breadth of the museums collections to be very good and the curation quite excellent.While the dinosaur exhibit was interesting enough, I thought the First Peoples exhibit to be the best..

Myself and my 6 yr old went to the ROM today, specifically to see some dinosaurs!! The special dinosaur exhibit was awesome!! Totally hands on and my child loved it, there was lots to see and do. You will need a lot of time to go through the ROM. Lots to see, so many floors and exhibits. The displays are absolutely stunning.Very educational as well. (although do not forget the science centre either)Children will no doubt enjoy the dinosaur exhibit, but the ancient world is wonderful for adults to browse (or other areas depending upon...
For a first time trip to the ROM I wasn't sure what to expect but it was awesome. Fun hands on exhibits and a full day adventure. Was geared more towards kids but fun for everyone forsure.

We have been to the ROM multiple times and there is so much to see. The dinosaur exhibit is very well done for both adults and kids. The gemstone and minerals display is stunning. The medieval and ancient history displays have been updated and have some interesting artifacts. A very educational way to spend your time.
The collection of displays is absolutely amazing.Too large to finish in one day.However,the kids enjoyed the Dino show.Fortunately for us it was a weekday and hence not much rush in the museum.
Revolving exhibits and always something new to see. Historic building with modern additions... you'll have to decide about that yourself

The ROM has pretty diverse installations, and many are large-scale and hands-on or interactive. It isn't an old-style museum where everything is behind glass boxes and includes a small-print description. It is engaging and makes learning really fun. Perfect for families and single adults alike.
I've been to the ROM maybe 20 times and counting. It's very easy to spend a full day looking at all the exhibits and soaking in all the information.
this was my first time to a museum and i thought i was going to be bored to death but i really enjoyed myself. very fasenating exhibits and a eye opener. definately recommend this to everyone.
Great exhibits of animals -- birds, mammals, dinosaurs.Some rooms were cool, so if you checked your coat you were out of luck

I find it a toss-up as to whether to send people here or to the Art Gallery of Ontario, but I lean towards this one because it appeals to a wider audience. Check to see if the ROM stills offers free admission after 4 on Fridays. You can get a few hours in before they close.

This museum has a little bit for everyone. One floor is dedicated to natural history with an impressive collection of dinosaurs, but also other animals and a very well organized area for kids activities (the volunteers that run this section were awesome!). Another floor is dedicated to arts with impressive presentation of greek, roman and other artifacts (some genuine, some...

In addition to the special exhibits, what a wonderful selection and collection of art to view. Take a breath away from the noisy outside traffic and enjoy the wonderful Canadian and international art pieces the ROM has to offer. They also have a respectable option for young children who are either budding artists or interested in the arts.

I could get lost in here for days. There is never a dull moment and the museum is so huge you could go every day for a year and never come out learning something new. Definately a place to visit when in Toronto with kids!
A must see exhibit for textile and history of fashion lovers. Stunning Dior gown must be seen, including the detailed video of techniques used by Dior craftsmen to make it.
Really enjoyed this museum. The dinosaur exhibit was great. Lots to see, of course. Too much for just a morning. Highly recommended.

when you go to the ROM expect it to take the entire day to review all of the displays. The display of the minerals was out on loan when we attended (to another museum) but there was a lot of other things to look at.I wouldn't recommend it for small children as there is a lot of walking.

The ROM is certainly worth a significant visit when you come to Toronto. Admission is very reasonable for a family and the exhibits are very accessible. The cafe looked fine, although I didn't go in.Great gift shop. The dinosaur exhibit was fabulous!

Amazing experience! I can't wait to go back!!!Give yourself at least 3 hours to do this however if you can you will get more out of spending some serious time. Even if you spent an entire day you will want to come back to visot things you didn't get the chance to get to.
Dinosaur exhibit - Special displayBoth were amazing. I have thoroughly enjoyed every visit that I have made to the museum no matter what special display was on.

Both children and adults will enjoy it. It has a wonderful, well-serviced cafeteria in the basement with an eclectic menu that is still kid-friendly. Make sure you see the ancient Chinese, and jewelry exhibits, as well as the 20th century furniture - amazing.
Actually it was boring now that I think back on it. Kinda disappointed but I have been here many, many times over the years and have always enjoyed the learning experiences

Unlike other museums the ROM isn't a very formal place, and is constantly changing with new attractions. It is a fun recreational museum with interactive displays in both the kids and adult zones. The museum gets a bit boring after visiting several times however that is made up for by the fact that there is at least one new attraction...
I loved the fact that the exhibits are engaging for all ages and that there are separate dedicated places for children to learn about the larger world and to safely interact with other children.

On our travels we always stop at one or two museums. Sometimes they're disappointing. This one wasn't in the least and exceeded our expectations. Loved everything about the First People's Exhibit (a thrill to see Sitting Bull's headdress) and the gallery with beautiful antique furniture and decorative arts was very worthwhile. I'm not a dinosaur person but found the displays...

It seems that this is really a school attraction for children. Was not pleased with there summer camps there for the children. One would expect that the programs are based around the museum and they are not. Just a great babysitting program and not very professional.
In total I have been to the ROM 2 times. the last time I went was on a very cute date. The ROM closes at 430 so if you want to see all the exhibits make sure you go early.
I went here without knowing exactly what would be there and i was amazed about the museum. really nice place to go

although the special dinosaur exhibit was included in our $25/person admission ticket, we found the ancient greece and egypt exhibits more riveting. i agree with another reviewer mentioning the pangaea video loop in the dinosaur area--i could watch that forever. it does seem like a great museum for kids, but for those people visiting without children, it was almost impossible...

I love the ROM. As an Ontario student, I get free admission to the regular things every tuesday and my fiancé and I like to turn Tuesday's into "ROM dates". We just walk around, look at things, etc... It is amazing. I go there with everyone that comes visit me in Toronto, I must have gone about 20 times by...

Returning to it after a decade was eye opening and a lot of fun. We picked our floors to visit, I was using a wheelchair for my wonky knee that day and had no trouble getting around. Amazing exhibits, modern and exciting to see/ Liked the cafeteria too, great selection of food. Next time we'll see more floors of it....

I am very impressed with the Quality of exhibits at the ROM. In particular their new Dinosaur exhibition is outstanding. Their augmented reality apps bring the exhibits to life and are highly engaging. The exhibit is perfect for kids 3 and up, and include an explorer guide to help them learn, picture spots, passport etchings... And the ROM features their...

It had been decades since my last visit to the ROM but the new exhibit on dinosaur discoveries is well worth exploring. The video loop showing the breakup of Pangaea is fascinating all on its own. The exhibit shows the variety of dinosaur finds, the evidence of biodiversity, and how it all fits with the theories of plate tectonics. There...

We had a great time meandering through the ROM! There was a dinosaur exhibit that was simply amazing! The gems were spectacular and the entire museum was so full of history and so informative. We learned a lot and had fun too!
I have been visiting this place for decades and every time I go I see something new. This is an excellent outing for the whole family providing the kids are not too young.
I love this museum. It has so very much in it. Whatever your passion you will find hours and hours worth to enjoy. I love it
Great family retreat. Lots of hands on stuff. If you are more than 4 people, consider a membership. Easy parking across the street.

We didn't go to the pay extra dinosaur exhibit, but everything else was very good, well laid out, informative, attractive and a very eclectic collection of objects and natural history. Easily accessible from the Museum subway station, and with a great restaurant on the top floor, which even sells local craft beers in bottles. A really good place to spend...

Went with a friend and her kids. When you have a year pass, the ROM is always a great place for the kids to play for a couple hours. They love the dinasour bones, bat cave and the kid area. We don't really get beyond those areas unfortunately, but when you've got a 3 yrs old and an 11 month...
This is a great plaec to explore, no matter how many times we go during the dark nights of winter the ROM never lets us down. We learn, play and have fun. We love the ROM!

The response some long-time residents of Toronto have to the ROM is "I went there in grade school".These are the folks missing out on The NEW ROM - if you have not been to the ROM in the last 5 years, you have never been to the ROM.New, exciting, interactive exhibitions enhance the permanent collections. I hear there...
The special exhibition was excellent but we also enjoyed the history of the first Canadian peoples and the section on Paul Kaye of whom we had never heard

Embarassing in comparison to other museums around the world. But hey, if you haven't travelled it might be enough. One wonders if the folks operating this museum have travelled to other museums themselves.

The crystal wing is a stunning entrance to the museum.This is a museum where you can keep kids entertained for hours.The dinosaur display is well done and worth the entrance fee alone. Particular interest is the Chinese gallery with the Ming tomb, Bat Cave, totem poles and mummies from Egypt. There are also excellent cafes for lunch or...

It's been a while since my last visit, but it was wet in Toronto today and we wanted to see the new dinosaur exhibit. Fantastic job, guys. Learned something, and thoroughly impressed with the displays.

I have been there twice and still find it interesting to walk through the exhibitions. As a biologist, I was excited by the biodiversity and dinosaurs halls. The animals collection is not too large, but it has a little of everything and important massages to little ones like bats are not bad animals and most of them eat insects etc....

Since we live in the area we buy a pass every year: if you go twice to the ROM in a 12 month period it pays for itself. After renovations, I am still blown away by different exhibits even if I have seen them before. The ROM never disappoints (except in price)- weekends and during school break times are busy...
I went to the new exhibit "Ultimate Dinosaur" It is great to see new exhibits at the ROM.It is expensive for a family to attend.
What better way to spend a chilly October than wondering around the art gallery. Some great and interesting art both old and new!

This was a fun way to spend a day in Toronto. For one, the price is right - a lot cheaper than a lot of other attractions in the GTA! There's lots to see and do too, so be sure to give yourself plenty of time. We easily walked around for about five hours. The new dinosaur exhibit is pretty...

I like it very much! Very unique and it's a WOW EXPERIENCE! I never thought I would love it that much, since it's just 15 minutes away from my house. 1 day isn't enough, 2 days would be perfect. Their staffs are also friendly/

C5 was excellent. We have issues with allergies and they were well attended to. the value was good and the location and setting excellent. A good place on its own or in conjunction with a visit to the ROM which is a fabulous museum with something for everyone.
I love the historic artifacts and insights into the basis of civilization. I would have liked to have more time as we had to miss sections , will be back.
This museum was amazing--far more than we could see in a few hours. We paid a little extra to see the temporary dinosaur exhibit--definitely worth it!

Stunning collection of gems and minerals, including a huge sheet of naturally forming copper. Friday nights the museum is open until midnight. The dinosaurs are pretty great too. Lots of families with little kids checking out the Dinosaurs and the dioramas of animals, like a polar bear and a moose, in their habitat.

I loved the ROM. There is SO much to see. We went when the Mayan exhibit was on, which was fascinating and beautifully presented. Everyone can find something to interest them, from dinosaurs to suits of armour to ancient coins to statues of Gods and Goddesses.I would return again and again.

An excellent museum with a great collection of treasures, superbly displayed with ample explanation in English and French for each exhibited item. With a subway station in front, the museum is easily reached, and when rain spoils outdoor sightseeing, head for the museum and you will come away impressed with the unexpected treasure trove you found. A restaurant on-site offers...
Dinosaurs a total hit- architecture brilliant- worth hours on very floor.As usual TA wants a longer review but isn't 100% enough?

We regret we didn't have more time to spend in the Royal Ontario Museum, especially given the $15 entry fee per adult. The exhibits were wonderful, with lots of interaction for younger visitors. The gift shop is fantastic, so if you don't have time to devote to the museum, this is worth the stop.
A must see. very big museum, got a bit of everything there. I actually got lost in there. lol!!! Also a place to visit on your city pass. great for the kids and everyone
The Crystal addition is intriguing from the exterior ~ even more so from the interior. Lighting levels are dramatically impressive.

A really well laid out museum with excellent sections on Native Art,Egyptian Artefacts and much more. The Restaurant serves good food with a terrific view over rooftops and there is a good Mueum Shop.
Familiarity of the permanent exhibits and the excitement of the special exhibits always leave me exhilarated and impressed. Its always a treat and so incredible.

The ROM is great. There is a sabertooth tiger in full attack pose and a t-rex with some real bones in it. Most museums you goto have plastic assemblys which make you wonder why you left the house at all but this museum is well stocked. The basement floor has a great native exhibit as well. Good restaurant sin the...

The Royal Ontario Museum is a world class museum. I only had 2 hours to tour the museum unfortunately. The collections are diverse. With a limited amount of time I chose to take the free tour which lasted 45 minutes and features the museum highlights. It also afforded me to learn the layout of the exhibits quickly. There is a...
Think this collection is better than the Asian art museum in San Francisco. The older parts of the building are lovelyWorth a visit.

Went up for the Dinosaurs of Gondwana exhibit and LOVED IT. I always have a great time there and there seems to be a little bit of everything for everyone.I will say that Mammals part had a really rank odour this time. Not sure what was up, but I don't remember that from previous visits.
Wonderful historic collections of various periods. A lot to see - you eventually have to go twice. Visit: August 2010.

We only had about 1 hour to tour the museum. The China collection is wonderful. There is quite a variety to see. Seeing the dinosaurs and the other animals was interesting. There are a couple cool totem poles. Quite child friendly.

I love the ROM for the variety of the exhibitions, I also love the cube addition that was put onto the ROM. I like the contrast of the old and the new buildings, it is interesting.The exhibitions range from dinosaurs, to egyptian mummies, to living creatures, to fashions through the ages.It is a great museum that has alot...

We visited the ROM on the last day of our Canadian holiday so time was a bit tight. We travelled on the excellent Toronto underground system to the appropriately named Museum station a few minutes walk away. The museum is on a street full of very up-market shops and consists of two parts: the traditional, possibly Victorian, building and a...

This museum really has an interesting program. They always try to bring art in the mix to make us look at their collections in a new light. I saw here David Hockney's digital paintings and El Anatsui's tapestry and sculpture. These are signs of a very progressive curatorial trend here. You can also see nice displays of the regular generalist...
Liked all of it, although sometimes relating the exhibit number to the description was challenging. While we were there they had the dinosaur exhibition and that was excellent.

This is a great place to take science and nature lovers of any age. The dinosaurs are awesome. The period costumes/household items and furnished rooms are cool. the bird and insect and continental region exhibits are beautiful!! The restaurant is top shelf and the exhibits and layout will keep you coming back.Especially love the gift shop!
We were looking for something to do on a Saturday afternoon and couldn't have picked anything better. Our 4 1/2 old son loved it! We got some great pictures, and will probably return some day.
Staff are amazing and helpful, place is clean, intertesting...a great day with great themes and exhibits

This is a great museum. The Asian galleries were especially beautiful. The collection is extensive and displayed wonderfully. We burned out before we could see the natural history floors. The museum requires repeated visits,
I went specifically for a particular exhibit but stayed to see the rest. This is a lovely museum in a good part of town with some very interesting exhibits.

Checked out the South American dinosaur exhibit, and many others , Good variety of exhibits to see, lots of information on the current research, group tours every day. Fabulous place to see as a tourist or native Torontonian.
Can recommend the current exhibiitions (summer 2012). The whole museum is well laid out and easy to navigate
My husband and i like to wander around the ROM. we went when there was no school groups and it wasn't very busy so we could take our time.

This place is huge, I'm going to have to return a few times just to get through the whole thing. When I went, they were having a Mayan exhibit that was quite interesting, and I also got through the dinosaur and bat sections. All in all it was a good way to spend an afternoon.

Perhaps oddly, though the whole museum was great, we found ourselves totally absorbed in the rock (mineral/gem?) gallery for the longest! An interesting mix of art, culture, and natural history, it's got a bit of everything. There were great galleries of native/First People art, culture, and history, which is something you can't get just anywhere. Many other sections will be...

This must be about our 4th or 5th visit. Although some of the exhibitions are the same every time there are new ones to see everytime you go. It is some size of a museum and well worth the money. I think you would need to stay in it for a few days if you wanted to read everything.Will...

First off the dinosaur exhibit is on right now. Even if you don't have kids I highly recommend paying the extra 10. The exhibit on China had to be my favorite. The statues were breathtaking, the bird exhibit fascinating and the attention to detail simply spectacular. I planned to stay an hour or two and ended up staying for four...
Wonderful collections. Need to go again to see everything. Easty to get to by subway.There's a lovely path adjacent to the museum.

The new upgrades to the Museum are fantastic. It's a great place to bring the kids, or even for older folks who appreciate Museums.Try to avoid Thursday and Fridays during the day - often busy with school groups!

This is a great museum. We particularly enjoyed the dinosaur presentation in the basement at the moment, but as well as that we also had a chance to look around a lot of the other national themed exhibits, including Canada of course, but also seeing comprehensive exhibits showing Greek, Roman and other European civilisations, as well as Egyptian and others....

We visited the ROM during the dinosaur exhibit which was fantastic. There is so much to see. I wish we had more than one day to explore. The exhibits are amazing and there's lots to see for young and old. The food there is a little expensive and we ran into a situation where a lady took two buns and...
Nice cultural center with good shows and very good selection. Good facilities, comfortable seats and good sound.
Great displays, excellent layout. It the upmarket shopping area with lots of boutiques and restaurant close by. Fabulous museum store.
Quite Big..lots of collection. It a whole day tour....amazed with the collections. Real informative.Loved it.

We spent a rainy day wandering the halls of this great museum. We had to pay extra to see the special dinosaur exhibit. Although very interesting, it's the kind of thing you only need see once. There were lots of kids and families there but there were many places you could take your time and just wander through and enjoy...

My daughter loved the ROM. The temporary "Ultimate Dinosaurs" exhibition was amazing. You could download an App for your smart phone that showed a 3D image of a "living" dinosaur when you pointed it at the fossils! Don't worry if you don't have the App, there are viewers on site. If it is still there when you go, pay the...

This is a wonderful museum. I was a bit surprised by the $25 per person admission rate, but it was worth the money. The new addition is architecturally controversial, but has really improved the ability of this museum to display its collection. My favorite exhibits were those on the dinosaurs -- just fabulous. There are some parts of the museum...

The architecture is interesting. there are too many children's programs going on at the same time, and it is very noisy and unpleasant for someone who wants to enjoy art and culture. Too maky kids running around.
One of the best museums I have been in. Go. I spent hours viewing the exhibits. Well worth your time.
Enjoyed the vast number of exhibits. There were so many topics of learning. This is a great place to take children and adults for an education experience. The exhibits were very well done.

I went on a three day visit to Toronto with my two sons, ages 15 and 10. The ROM was on day one and didn't disappoint. We paid the extra fee for the dinosaurs and it was totally worth it. There were so many interactive displays. I did download the ROM app which was pretty cool.The cafeteria had good...
I've worked at this place before too it was pretty chill and actually i think it was here actually here i worked when it was finished i think its the one with all the animal statues
great exhibits, lots of choices, lots of space, you can spend time alone reading and learning, great for children who want to learn,

We went to the Dinosaur exhibition which was out of this world - I just loved it and felt I'd rediscovered my childhood enchantment with such creatures. The Collectors' exhibition was also excellent as was the food in the cafeteria. Friendly staff too.

The museum covered a lot of different topics/countries.The artefacts were really something covering Indian tribal to dinosaurs, very diverse exhibits.A very unique building within a building. Would be a good place to take your kids as a lot of interactive areasThe staff were ok, would take all afternoon to visit all areas.

neat exterior crystal, great gift shop, nice exhibits - overrun with school kids the day i went, but that's what you get for showing up at 10 am on a weekday! some really beautiful large pieces, big dinosaurs in the front foyer and totem poles are spectacular. probably can zip through it in under 1.5 hours if you are NOT...

Well organized and regularly changing - you will enjoy the visit - check to see what is the newest feature that is being exhibited and check to see if you can get a better rate by going a little later in the day - entry isn't cheap!

Definitely worth a visit on any trip to toronto. Reduced rates on Friday afternoons and Wednesday evenings (though I don't believe the latter still occurs) mean there is no excuse not to spend an hour here on a cold afternoon. Brilliant natural history exhibition as well as interesting anthropological studies on first nations people.
The very first and probably the last time I went to the ROM was with my cousins' kids we simply went to explore & trying to find answers to the things we were told to find on a piece of paper.

Poor ROM, what did they do to you??? What is that angular monstrosity that is so inappropriately attached to your fine old building? What an insult to your original architecture and dignity! Please, somebody tell me that this is just a temporary facade, one that will be moved when the real construction is done??? Please??????

My husband and I recently took our grandchildren (7 & 6 yrs) to the ROM and although the price was a little high we thoroughly enjoyed our day. We didn't do the Dinosaur attraction as it was more costly and our grandchildren were too young. We went to the 2nd floor where there are many interactive and hands on attractions....

The dinosaur exhibit is great, and lots to do for children and adults. Location is a little tricky for cheap parking. (I park over at U of T). Great area for wandering afterwards, across from Yorkville, and beside the Philosopher's path.

Great museum! I have been to many museums around Europe and North America and I would say that it is one of the best museums I have visited. I really liked the natural history section, worth a visit especially for children. Periodically there are very interesting exhibits from different parts of the world (usually they cost extra).

Staff was very helpful. Guide books were okay but a bit more discription would have been nice.Good access to the exhibits both by stairs and elevator. Great for those who are unable to do stairs or have issues with numerous flights of stairsThe Dinasaur Exhibt was great, worth the extra money.I like the interactive video screens that...

The R.O.M. has a number of fascinating exhibits. It always is a thrill to go there. The new addition is quite nice on the inside. I am still getting used to the crystal's appearance from the outside. I was saddened to see the planetarium go however.
the girls and i went to c the dinosaurs and we had an amazing time with all the interactive games that were offered

we can just spend a half and hour there this time. next time, I must spend a half and even a whoe day there.It's a big museum, with different selection, fossil, mammals, ocean, animal, history of culture, tools, cloth, decorative items.
A wonderful way to spend 1/2 a day. The ROM has a fascinating collection of medieval armor and several great dinosaur exhibits. Close to Yorkville for lunch or dinner afterwards.
This museum is one of the best I've visited. The exhibits are well displayed and the use of the floor space is excellent. We spent 4 hours there and still didn't see all it had to offer.

There's so much to say about the ROM that is good - but suffice it to say that this is a treasured, beloved place for our whole family. When friends come to stay it's never a chore to get our teens to come along and show the ROM to friends - they jump at the chance. The gems and rocks...

Travelling museum enthusiasts today have seen similar historical artifacts hundreds of times. What keeps exhibits interesting is the story they tell. This is exactly what was lacking at the ROM: there was no narrative, only a large collection of stuff with appropriate labels.Basically this is a message to the curator: Please inspire us, wow us, tell us a story...

Awesome dinosaur exhibit. Very clean and well organized museam. Great for adults and kids. My kids are 4 and 2 years old and they couldn't get enough of the dinosaurs. The second floor was also a hit (animals, and play area). We spent about 4-5 hours there, and it was well worth it!

This was our first visit to the ROM. DD and I were excited because we both are Museum buffs! We were NOT disappointed.On one of the hottest days in Toronto, we escaped into the impressive displays and collections this museum houses. The Mineral and Gem room was probably my favorite ...the beauty of these natural stones was breathtaking.I was...

My daughters were so excited for this trip. Loved how the dinosaurs were displayed, amazing! We had difficulty seeing the Egypt exhibit, they were taking pictures of the area for their web site and closed the area off.We were also really interested in the textiles area, with dresses from the past, but the whole area was almost empty...but still...

We went to the Mayan Exhibit. Fabulous, but whatever you go to see, its really cool to see it up close and personal. What a contrast in Styles. Hot! The inside is a journey. Then make sure you visit an exhibit that you want to really see. Otherwise, its a short trip.
Wether you have children or not, this is a great place to visit and spend as much time as you can! There is always something different to see!

While visiting my parents we took our son to the Dinosaur exhibit that will only be there for six months. It was amazing....great for kids. But to be honest I expected that.Since we had already paid we decided to do the rest of the museum. We were so impressed! Our 7 year old loved the entire museum and I...

Having shopped around different museums in N America, Euope and Japan, my standards for a museum has become more stringent and in Toronto, there are not a lot of really good museums worth the buck. ROM is an exception though. It is a treasure house of the world's treasures packed in one museum. The architecture is a little bit off...
Honestly, it is over sold as a WOW attraction. It’s a museum with a room for Dinos. Big Deal. If you like history museums (or is 6 years old and a Dino fanatic), you will like the place

Being a new resident in Toronto, i went into a quest to visit the city.We went to the ROM for the Maya exhibition.It was great with enough space to really enjoy everything.We spent some time in other areas but we will need to come back.Great place to go in winter.
The ROM is a huge museum. We only gave ourselves 3 hours to tour the museum. You need at least a day to see all of the exibits.
Like a cross between the London Natural History and British museums but slightly smaller! Great layout, interesting information and wide ranging but compact exhibitions.

Very large, needs at least a good 4 hours to fully explore. The Asian exhibits were impressive, if a little dull for the kids. Plenty of exhibits including First Nations, dinosaurs, ecology, though most of them are not particularly kid-friendly. Layout is a bit confusing as certain elevators are required to access certain exhibits on higher floors. There is a...

My favorite section was the minerals, which show gold, diamond, and tons of other minerals in all different forms. They were colorful and beautiful. I also like how they included some modern art work in the sections about different cultures. Cons: the furniture was worn, the museum could use some paint, it was very busy with summer camps and tons...

Highly recommend taking a tour to orientate yourself. The layout, stairs, elevators can be daunting to figure out if time is limited. The multi level museum is a piece of art within itself and the exhibits are so varied and wonderful. If you don't have time to wander through the entire museum, choose a few areas that peak your interest,...

Lots of exhibits to look through, and very informational. I feel like the natural section (with the animals / dinosaurs) to the minerals section is worth checking out for sure. Also, Tuesdays are free for students!

the variety of items to see and experience was just too overwhelming for our visit of only two hours! Next time, we would spend 2 hours in the morning, go for lunch across the street and then return to the ROM to see more
Wide range of exhibits, but the most popular, especially with the kids are the dinosaurs, gems & minerals, and the bat cave. Plenty of hands-on interactive displays for kids.

What a beautiful building designed by Daniel Liebeskind. We went in the lobby and the gift shop, which had quite a few reasonable things. We did not go into the museum....the cost of entry was quite high

The ROM's collections are fine, but it's too bad they spent so much money on the starchitect's hideous addition and then had to jack up the admission price to help pay for it. Check out Denver's art gallery if you want to see what Liebskind's crystal should look like. Too bad Toronto got scammed into buying an imitation, thanks to...

The artifacts were numerous, and well-presented. The new addition has a poor traffic pattern, though, and is acoustically terrible. The mounted dinosaur skeletons were great. Four hours and we hardly got to see half of it all.

Practically an entire floor dedicated to children activities, plus the amazing general collection, not to mention their visiting collections which are also thoughtfully curated and suitable for family visits. I live in Toronto and get an unlimited yearly pass for my family (kids 4 and 2), its a no-brainer for a half-day/day of fun when you need/want to be indoors....

If you are a collector of starchitecture, you may appreciate Liebskind's crystals bursting out of the original neo-romanesque building. I am not a fan of this intervention. But more important than the discordant juxtaposition of styles, I do not feel the new space works well to display the museum's contents. The ROM has important and interesting collections (in particular dinosaurs,...

Took my grandson to see the dinosaur exhibit. Went into the room where you can dig up bones in the sand and dress up in suits of armour. The staff in the area were great with the kids and explained all about the bones they found. The bat cave was a hit - had do go in 5 times. I...

I spent half a day at the ROM on a recent trip to Toronto, and all in all it was a very pleasant visit.It is quite conveniently located right next to a subway station, and the Queen's Park neighbourhood around it was quite lovely.For $25, I had access to the regular collections and to special exhibition of dinosaur...
This museum was great, very busy but had so many different exhibits to check out from cultural to scientific.

I love natural history museums, but this one was lacking in it's ability to teach or tell in-depth stories around its exhibits. The exhibits was very nicely setup, but there was little, if any, interactive displays to engage young visitors. Not enough seating areas for those physically challenged and needing a sit down break from all the walking. This museum...

Went here with our two kids (age 4 and 9) to see the Dinosaur exhibit and they really enjoyed the whole museum. Everything there was great and there are tons of things to see. The cafeteria at the museum has got to be the biggest and best of any museum I've been too. Not that I went for the cafeteria...
I was in a hurry so only spent with my kids like 4 hours only, actually we need to go again the dinosaurs skeletons are amazing
Wonderful collection of Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Greek, Roman, etc. artifacts. Special dinosaur exhibit for thoseinterested in dinosaurs.

We took our 8, 6 and 5 year old to the ROM Dino exhibit - well worth the price of admission (reduced rate when you show your Delta room key). There was a great balance of things to see and things to do and touch. Even the lunch was a hit.
I really enjoyed this museum. There are many intersting displays that makes it worthwhile for adults or families to spend a few hours here.

Located right by the subway station it gives it's name to, the ROM is a great place to visit, especially when they are having a special exhibition (for instance, when we went the Mayan exhibition was featured). They gather artifacts from around the world and present knowledgeable guides for those who are interested (for a nominal fee) and all in...
This fabulous museum is sure to exceed your expectations. Do not miss the extensive "Group of Seven" collection to see the post-WW I Canadian art movement. It is truly inspirational.

This is one of those great museums that is fun for kids and adults. There is cool things to see from all over the world. I found that I liked the set up. I was there for 4 hours and I am not sure I saw everything. The building alone is great to see. The food in the Caf isn't...
This is a very nice museum. A lot of very interesting and educational exhibits. Took us about 4 1/2 hours to go through the museum so well worth the money.

Liked range of exhibits - often take kids here to see dinosaurs, ancient civilizations, period pieces and special exhibits (e.g. Mayan civilization). Avoid line-ups by purchaing tickets in advance - also did not enjoy the crowds at recent special exhibit - will try to go on a weeknight for the special timed viewings next time.
