Lots to see at the Royal Ontario Museum. The Dinosaur exhibit was really interesting. Lots of floors, lots of variety. We took some friends who were visiting from Italy and they were impressed

Great museum, loads to see. Took most of the day wandering around all the different exhibits. Well worth the 15dollars! Food in downstairs restaurant left a lot to be desired and was overpriced for what it was. Would recommend the museum!
Love the exhibits and the building itself. The giftshop is great for gifts and the staff are helpful and enthusiastic.
The Extreme Dinosaur exhibit was fabulous; the museum itself can be a bit tricky to navigate though....map is confusing.

I visited with my kids after seeing the ads for the dinosaur exhibit. What a scam. There is no need to spend the extra bucks on the "special" dinosaur exhibit as the original one included in the price of entry is just as good and in terms of real exhibits is not really missing much. So save you money and...
We have the annual membership and the kids never seem to get tired of the ROM. Very convenient to reach by TTC.
ROM is a large museum. Need a fair bit of time to do it justice. We selected certain areas to visit to maximize our time and then skimmed some other areas.

When first we arrived at the rom the price seem fai as they recently lowered the price from $25 to $15 but it seems as if they have compensated by charging an additional $10 each to see the better dinosaur exhibit. Seems like a scam and we figured not worth it as the would be a large exhibit still for...

This museum is a must to see. It has such a wonderful collection from all over the world. I especially liked the Canadian section that shows the development of the nation and its tradition. The Egyptian section is also a must to see. They do also have many activities for kids above 3 years.
Something for everyone here- science, art, history, and so much to see that you are able to avoid feeling crowded or rushed. The newer building is also interestingto see, construction-wise.

We spent a long afternoon at hemuseum and found it well rounded and informative. With the city pass it was well worth the cost. Also easy to get to/from the Pellate "castle" from here to spend the rest of a day.

We enjoyed the museum during our trip to Toronto; the contrast of the traditional and modern look on the outside was very unique. They had a large selection of art and interactive activities for the younger kids which they enjoyed. I would highly recommend it as a place to visit.
We were in the museum from 11 a.m .to 5 p.m. This year they have a special Dinosaures exposition and we visited most of the other floors.Very interesting.Our grand children love going to museums

This is a museum that feels like a random collection of mostly cool stuff. I struggled to find any real order. It is mostly based upon geographical organization and the random collection of artifacts are grouped with stuff from nearby (ie. Chinese materials from centuries apart displayed next to each other).No real harm in this, but it does reflect...
Good museum, Dinosaur exhibition was the best and i enjoyed the Egyptian part. Coming form Europe i found the European part a bit... scattered.

Nice museum but ihad some complaints. You are given a floor plan with numbered exhibits but the numbers aren't shown near the exhibits so it wasn't much help. We paid for a group tour for the dinosaur display which was well done. I also liked the bat cave. But many of the other exhibits were a bit dull in my...

We went on one of the rainy days on our Toronto vacation. We spent 4 1/2 hours visiting and did not see anywhere near all of it. It is really incredible. All the displays are really well done. It was a bit pricey to get in and parking was $12.00 but I thought it was worth it. We had lunch...
I really loved the stones part, where you could see all types of stones (like diamonds and other precious ones). It's a nice place to go on a rainy day, there's a lot to see! Really worth it :)

The new dinosaur exhibit will appeal to the kid in you if you are eight or eighty. This is a classic Ontario destination not to be missed. There's nothing like walking amongst history and the ROM is the perfect place to do it.

Royal Ontario Museum is very centrally located in the Toronto Down town. Must visit along with Casa Loma. Exhibits are well placed and detailed. The Dinosaur section has got huge collection and very well displayed. Exhibitions are from all continents.

We tried to do it in one day. That was a mistake. This is the best museum I've ever seen. It is better than any Smithsonian. I really enjoyed the exhibits on Canadian history and First Nation history, these were so well done.

Very nice building, its blend of classic and post-modern arquitectural style, make it a must at least to pass by and take a couple of pictures of it. However, if you are used to the BIG museums of the world (NY, London, or my hometown Mexico City) you will find the content of this museum rather unimpressive. What saved the...
There are many people ate the main entrance since the openning hours. It's better to be there early. One day may be less then the necessary to see everything properly.

beautifully exposes arts of all sorts. its fun for everyone, of all ages, school kids to university students, to the elder and in between. There seems to never be enough time to appreciate everyyyy single exhibit and art piece in one day. But you do end up enjoying it while walking around from room to room. Art of all types,...

We took our 5 year old grandson to see the dinosaur exhibit and he loved it. Very good set up and info about dinosaurs. My wife and myself had a great time watching our grandson enjoying every second while he was there. We arrived in the afternoon and could not see the entire museum exhibits but we will definetly be...
My kids always visit the ROM and always enjoy it. With their cool and different exhibits and fun with toys and games it keeps my kids coming back and me to, to learn new things.
Make sure you see the jewelry and granite collections. The outside crystal design that shapes the interior is something you have to experience.

My two sons (13 and 9) and I went to the museum on our last day and we were all so sorry we didn't have more time. They had lots of great exhibits with dinosaurs, Chinese and Japanese artifacts (lots of swords) which my sons loved. They also had a nice interactive area for kids, a scavenger hunt my 9...

while most of the renovations to this old building are welcome changes we have to say we're disappointed with the new modern area. not sure if it's a sense of disconnection or someting else but the space does have a very different, even 'cold' feeling to it. from the street, finding the new entrance was confusing. we had passes so...

If you’re looking for something to do on a hot day, I really recommend that you go and visit the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM). The air-conditioned museum has 3 floors, which array many things such as ancient civilizations, animals, crystals and so on… When you enter the building, don’t be surprised if there is a big line; luckily it moves...

Went twice. This year with friends and last year with family. I got discount prices for the ROM tickets this year which included the Dinosaur exhibition. I was kinda disappointed with the special Dinosaur exhibition in the basement because I expected a show or a tour or something other than looking at dinosaurs and reading up on info about the...

I'm a History lover, so I couldn't miss a visit to the ROM during my stay in Toronto and I haven't been disappointed. The museum is huge and exhibits are various and really interesting : Chinese art, Ancient civilizations, Canada's first nations, Dinosaurs, Animals and so much more.I stayed an afternoon and this was not enough to enjoy the...
A nice, comprehensive museum that covered some natural, cultural, and geological history from around the world, but I was hoping for more exhibits specific to Ontario or Canada.

Looking for something to do on a hot humid Friday night in Toronto? Why not go to the Royal Ontario Museum aka the ROM. Reduced rates are in effect from 4:30-8:30 pm Fridays and the air-conditioned environment is a nice reprieve from the near tropical climate outside.I thought I would be one of a few museum enthusiasts to take...

Very eclectic collections in a great venue. The museum building itself is an attraction, mixing old and new architecture in a distinctive blend that is visually striking. The "First Peoples" collection provides a wonderful overview of the cultures and customs of the Native American tribes that settled Canada and North America. The minerals and gems collection is extensive and first-rate!...

We took our 5 year old on a weekend stay in Toronto, to the ROM to see te dinosaur exhibit. It was fantastic!! So much to see and so much for the kids to do! A great indoor activity on a hot, humid day. It took us about 3.5 hours to do the whole thing, but you could easily spend...

Even with only adults in our group we got tired before we could see it all. This museum has so many interesting galleries. Certainly worth the price of admission. The gift shops were also nice places to pick up souvenirs, so many funky items.

I was positively surprised by the ROM!It is a wonderful museum with tons of different things to discover,from dinosaurs to Ancient Greek art and modern Design - in this museum no one will be bored!Except the relatively long qeue at the entrace (..well it was a saturday...),I have nothing bad to say about this place!It is surely...

The museum has a number of interesting exhibits. The current special exhibit deals with Dinosaurs and was interactive and great for kids. If compared to museums in other large cities such as London, the collections is not as extensive. But overall, the experience was very good.

This place is big and you can't possibly see it all. Instead of trying to see everything, we focused on the parts that are unique to this place.The mineral collection with specimens from all over Canada is amazing and not something you can find elsewhere.We also went to the exhibits on the First Nations. Once again, they were...
Your kids will love the bat cave! Give yourself extra time - there is so much to see! The restaurant offers great choices at a reasonable price.

I took my 6 and 9 year old grandsons to see the dinosaurs at the ROM. I had taken my 9 year old grandson when he was 6 and he was eager to return. Right now the Ultimate Dinosaur exhibit is on and it features videos and interactive activities as well as great dinosaur skeletons. The dinosaur exhibit that is...
excellent place to visit, I liked the sculptures, paintings. My family enjoy every place in this museum.

We try to visit the ROM at least once a year. The new, expanded Dinosaur exhibit was fabulous. My daughter always enjoys the large chunks of semi precious and precious stones. It is a wonderful way to spend the day in Toronto.

This museum has everything. Dinosaurs, minerals, greeks, egyptian, native americans.. too bad that none of the exhibitions are very informative. Even the dinosaur exhibits, with all of the additional multi-media material, do not actually have a lot of useful information. On the plus side, it is not too expensive.

The ROM building is very nice with a mixture of old and new designs. We spent most of our time in the dinosaur exhibit (esp. with the kids). There were some interactive exhibits. I would recommend the ROM put more interactive screens and media to engage visitors.

Took my kids here to see the dinosaurs. Admission price was kind of pricey. But they do have great dinosaurs display. The kids especially enjoyed collecting all the carbon rubbing stamps.I recommend this place for family with young children.

We went there on Sunday 27th May when there was an Iranian Heritage Day and they had a lot of different kinda performances there. Music, dance and so on. And lot of paintings too. Unfortunately we were in a bit hurry and couldn’t stay and watch those more closely. I think the first level itself was my favourite. A lot...
Kids loved this place...very interesting artifacts as well as interactive games. Kids of all ages will enjoy this place.
Special exhibits here are worth a visit. You could spend days here looking at the different exhibits. I love the new addition.

i went to rom in early 2010 and the dainosours exhibition was happening at the time, i'm not into dainosours much but i was very impressed with the size of the huge things and the bone structure.i would like to visit it again. i really like the chinese and rock collection at the museum.

We visited some local attractions this week for an in town vacation. We had let our ROM membership lapse but reinstated it recently due to the excellent Mayan exhibit. The current dinosaur exhibit is equally well done and worth a visit. The jury's still out on the new crystal addition but we found the ROM to be bright and open...

I loved the dinosaur exhibit. It was great having a volunteer give us a free tour as the ROM is quite large and you would miss a lot on your own. It is always nice to take family and friends for a visit.
We spent a family day at ROM. Fantastic building and well thought out displays. We liked the way the museum was divided up and allowed manageable chunks of info to be taken in.
Went to see the Emperors exhibit - what a rip off! Total waste of time and money. The ROM is an expensive day out. Other museums are better set out and priced.
Beautiful building that mixes old with new in a very artistically pleasing way! Great day out! So many exhibitions we didn't get to see them all...

We as a family were amazed by the displays at the museum, our children are still sharing their amazement with friends/family. The dinosaurs and mummies were extraordinary exhibits! Allow a full day because there is soooo much to experience at this wonderful museum. Well worth every penny and an even better deal if ticket purchased through the City Pass

We loved the egypt area and the information provided by volunteers in many areas. We were not impressed by the dino exhibit. The dinosaurs were presented in a way that does not spark imagination, it is colourless and very dull. The area was very clinical and did not excite my child who is a huge dino lover.

Wow. What a great assembly of natural science and historical artifacts. It was amazing to see the biodiversity exhibits and to see the fossils that help you envision how it all started and evolved. The cultural exhibits help you walk forward in time. The family really got a lot out of our all day visit to the ROM.

The Royal Ontario Museum or the ROM as we locals know it. Took our guests for a day outing here. The building is an amalgamation of the old structure with a modern one attached to each other. People still debate whether they like the old part or the new part.Set you back about $25 but the displays are very...
You can get discounted tickets through several different places. The summer tours are great, because they change up the displays. My daughter went two times because she loved it so much.
This museum has potential, however disappoints us every time we go. It is very 'old fashioned' in the lack of hands-on interactive exhibits. Nice dinosaur exhibit, still pretty 'flat' though.

ROM has recently lowered their admission fees and the general admission is worth it. We did not purchase or visit any of the additional exhibitions.My 13 year old and I enjoy museums and history so we found it enjoyable. The museum is very spacious and even when filled with people, it does not get overwhelming with crowds.Take advantage...

'Well laid out, courteous staff and lots to interest young and old. it is located in the heart of uptown Toronto and is surrounded by many bistros, restaurants, art galleries, fine boutiques, theatres, several fine hotels and is adjacant to the lovely grounds of the University of Toronto.

If you have an hour or a month, there is something for everyone to see at the ROM. My 6-year old was there just for the dinosaurs, but mo other kids (14, 12, 11, 8) all found things to pique their interest. If you take the time to give the exhibits the attention they deserve, it's well worth it.
Went here on a lazy Saturday which turned into a great experience. Barbara Reid was there doing a reading of her book and workshops - LOTS O FUN!
there are many interesting exhibits. You must see the ancient Asia one and the dinosaur exhibit..

Until last weekend I hadn't been to the ROM since I was a kid. This summer we're going out West to the badlands and I wanted to expose my 4 yr old son and 2 yr old daughter to life size dinosaur skeletons. I know that the ROM has a special dinosaur gallery display on until Spring 2013 but we...

Loved the exhibits! However, lunch was a bit disappointing. It was March break, so there were families everywhere. But it felt like the Museum had not planned accordingly and the eating areas were not cleaned regularly. I would still return as the exhibits are amazing
Loved the museum just ensure you are not rushed. So much to see!
The kids will love the dinosaur sections. Lots to see for kids and adults!
many exhibitions. presently exhibition of dinasours4 floors of many things to see.you need 2 to 3 hours

Was at the ROM in 1998 and really liked it. This time I felt that it was somewhat disjointed and I was left feeling very dissapointed. I have seen this type of effect eswhere when an established museum had had a ,new bit bolted on'. (Just like the National Museum of Scotland) The new bit was also somewhat grubby.

My husband and I took our 4 year old to the ROM for the first time in ages. I grew up in Toronto so I have been here many times since I was young. Wow, how impressed I was with all the changes they have made in the past few years! The line-up was long but moved quickly (and we...

And here I thought Toronto is getting boring as I visit this city at least once every two years.Found this amazing museum filled with different and interesting artifacts. I love the dinosaur exhibit and the underwater exhibit. It's really interesting.Children will definitely enjoy this place as much as I, an adult, did.

There is so much to see here that it can become overwhelming. Pick one half to see in the morning, go out for a nice lunch and rest, then come back. The collections are fantasic, but after a few hours we found ourselves going through too quickly because there was just so much stuff. Skip the $10 additional Dinosaur exhibit...

"Walking tall" refers to the dinosaurs of course!Did you know that there were different types of dinosaurs? For example, Giganotosaurus, Dolichorhynchops? I did not know either.If you want to learn more and would like to see these ginormous creatures standing with their mouths open above your heads take a walk on the small side. It is a good...

What an amazing building, and the exhibits inside lived up to the reviews. The native exhibit, gemstones, textiles, early Canada were very detailed and a great experience. Make sure you allow 2-3 hours to get around them all.

Depending on what exhibits they have on display we always try to go atleast once a year! You get to be a kid again with some displays and you get to see once in a lifetime artifacts you will probably never get a chance to see again. I'm a little dissapointed with their bat cave renovation (probably just for the...
Your average museum, which from time-to-time, gets great exhibitions.
Awesome, just awesome. Too much to see in one day. This was our second trip and still haven't seen everything.

The museum contained a lot of artifacts you can't see anywhere else, like genuine mummies, a surefire crowd pleaser. The bat cave is great for the kids too, and the dinosaur and prehistoric sections are breathtaking and HUGE. Definitely worth the visit.
Small, but interesting. Seems to be the biggest Canadian museum.I would recommend especially for families with kids.
What is not to like about the ROM? New pricing should help some people.

I have been there twice already and everytime I went there are different attractions aside from the standard museum exhibit which will make you not bored. The first theme during my visits are Egytian culture and the second was about Dinosaurs which still differ from the dinosaur display they have.
If you like museums this is one you will like. The original building is very old with the new structure built only a few years ago.

There is so much to see here, you can spend hours or even all day! Lots of variety, so there's something to interest everyone - adults and children. We were only able to spend 3 hours there, and we weren't able to get around everything, so be prepared to spend a lot of time there if you want to see...
There is lots to see in this museum, you may decide you want to visit on different days to take it all in.

The Royal Ontario Museum is stuffed with articles. I don't know how anyone could really do it in a day (or maybe even two).I lived in DC and this museum is like two Smithsonians packed into the space of one.

My wife and I have been members of the ROM for eight or nine years now. We visit a half dozen or more times a year, checking out each special exhibition as it comes around.It's hard to know the best time to visit. School days often see ten or more yellow school buses lined outside, their eager young charges...

This was a nice place, but there was very little that interested my children. we left without seeing everything, and took the kids for a walk to the cn tower. the exhibits that my kids would have been interested in were only available for the members. if it was just me and my husband, I could have spent all day...

I was disappointed but compared to the wonderful, free museums in my home town of Washington, DC, I probably have been spoiled. Torontonians enjoy this museum, but I found it less than professional and "old school." The layout and displays were a bit confusing and the descriptions lacking or even nonexistent. I'm glad I went, but I doubt I'll return.
This is a wonderful experience for leanring about Canada, its, history, and its people.
The "crystal" addition is okay, not what I'd hoped for, but the extra space is a good thing. What really worked is the way it showcases the dinasours.

If you let your kids wander and investigate there are lots of interesting items here. There is no big "wow" factor after the amazing architecture, but worth investing an hour or two viewing. Once we caught a great Earth Rangers show with live birds and they loved that.

The collections are very well-displayed, and there is a wealth of artifacts here. Special exhibits are always available, and have never failed to impress (past visits have included the Terracotta Warriors, a very interesting exhibit on Water, Body Worlds, and one on the theory of birds being descendants of dinosaurs). There are also frequent talks, presentations and shows that are...

Two days ago,I appreciated this special museum's extensive collection of Chinese Art and artifacts from the Neolithic Period to the Qing Dynasty.Its collection of devotional Chinese Buddhist works was superb(images of Buddha,boddisatvas,luohans).I also was enriched by their fine collection of Pakistani(Gandhara)amd Indian(Chola Period)artifacts,primarily of a Hindu devotional nature.I liked their collection of Roman artifacts,especially their Roman mosaics.At the Canada section,there...

This is an extremely interesting museum packed full of exhibits. You need more than a few hours to explore it thoroughly. We especially liked level 2 which was ideal for our 4 year old grandchild. The discovery centre, the bat cave, the wildlife and nature in peril exhibits were all fascinating and very well done. The dinosaur experience was a...

My husband and I are members at the ROM and I could practically live there. I love dropping in for their regular collections as well as when they have special exhibits. There is always something to see.

There were a lot of nice collections here. Good for those who don't mind seeing the small things. There was a lot of pottery, coins, suits of armor, furniture from turn of last century, and dinosaur bones. I've been to a lot of museums like this and this one wasn't highly impressive.
Always a great day, so much to see, lots for kids and adults alike.
Something for everyone. Lots to see. Kids love the dinosaurs and the bat cave. Plan on spending the day. Cafeteria is a little pricey, but that's to be expected.
Whole family enjoyed this incredible museum that had everything from dinosaurs to fine art

The natural history and civilization exhibits are very good. The museum is broken down be geographic region allowing for easy transitions or quick access to only the areas you have interest in. The exhibit on endangered species is quite good, and all the kids really were engaged by it.

Various exhibitions make this place a venue that you can go back to several times. It's easy to get to, close to public transit, and always has new exhibits. They have a great website to browse and you can buy a yearly membership if you go frequently.

The building itself and the exhibits. More on the historic side, than the artsy. Loved the cafeterias downstairs too! Oy need a good couple of hours at least for it to be worth it. The gift store is lovely too.

My visit to the ROM on Saturday, July 7 was a disappointment for me. I had fond memories of visiting the ROM twenty or so years ago with my sister, who still lives in Toronto.As a visitor from the States (Vermont), I regarded the ROM as akin to the Museum of Natural History in NYC; its layout made good...

The collections were truly amazing with everything from ancient Greece and Rome to modern art and furniture and everything in between.The Canada exhibit gave us a very clear overview of the origin of the people, lifestyles and the government! Loved this section the best.

We were looking for something to do besides shopping on a rainy Sunday. The ROM was just the thing. We had a wonderful time exploring the spacious variety of collections housed there. A few hours was enough time for us to leisurely browse everything but we could certainly have come back for a second time to finish off the tour...

I went the other day for the first time. It was amazing! The dinosaur exhibit that's on now is fantastic. As is the rest of the museum. I'm going to have to go back since I didn't see it all in one go. Food is really nice too. Also, if you drive, make sure to park at 9 Bedford Rd....

I've been to museums in Ottawa/ Chicago/ PA and NYC - and the ROM stands up for sure- I've been there a couple times and can't wait to see what else they showcase next.Even the architecture of the building (inside/out) is something to see....bring the family/ go yourself or date - it's got something for everybody.

I'm a fan of museums in general when I travel, but I wasn't prepared for how BLOWN AWAY I was by the ROM. I went on a very rainy Sunday. I spent most of my time in the Asian and South-Asian galleries. The way the space is set up is so wonderful because you don't feel rushed to go from...
The permanent and special collections are worth a regular visit. The collections are so vast, I well understand memberships. The dinosaur room alone is amazing.

Visited the ROM's new exhibit "Ultimate Dinosaurs" this morning. We were 3 adults with 2 boys ages 7 and 10. It was the only exhibit we did - I have learned that my kids can only handle 2 hours maximum in a museum or art gallery. The show is very well put together with just the right amount of educational...

This was our first visit to ROM and we enjoyed it. Took a docent-led "highlights" tour and it was a great way to see the vastness of the space, get a sample of the collection and appreciate the new spaces that resulted from the renovations. It's a wonderful place. BTW, check your local museum memberships; ours gained us access on...

The museum was easy to get to using the subway (Museum stop), though pricey you need a lot of time to get through it. It is very large, there is a lot to see, you may want to pick and choose OR walk through the entire thing without spending too much time reading...

We went here and saw the dinosaur exhibition which was amazing. Very enjoyable. The rest of the ROM has a marvellous selection of artifacts spanning a wide range of interests.One let down was there was no souvenir thimble in the gift shop lol

This is a great visit for anyone coming to TO. Lots to see and decent admission prices (students get in free on Tuesdays with Id) They usually always have an exhibit to see (which you pay more for) but some are very rare and worth it.
so much to enjoy and learn I often have to plan just one floor one visit.
Beautiful expansive and roomy displays. Easy to circumnavigate. Particularly liked the Eskimo section showing sectional and partially built kayaks, canoes etc. Also very descriptive display notes
I have been to so many museums, that I would like to think that I have seen it all. Not so- what a great place, especially the Paleontology exhibit. This museum is great for the young and the old!
Great for all ages, so much to see and for the young, to do. You could easy spend a whole day here. On the main tube line for easy access.
It's a great museum. Love visiting it. I love taking my friends who are out of town over there. Everyone always enjoys it.
Too much to see too little time! More bathrooms and drinking fountains please.

I have been there numerous times. I'm a big geeky scientist. I love science. So why did I hate this museum? It was filled with scientific rumours noy science. Also, the food sucked, the dinosaur exhibit was freezing, and my daughter and I got sick from all the hands on stuff. Sorry people who work there!!!

The museum is very large and eclectic. Lots of great things. I particularly liked the Egyptian exhibits. Only disappoint was areas closed for renovation and a wedding reception. Definitely worth a trip. Reasonably priced. Like everywhere else I visited in Toronto parking was expensive. We used the Toronto City Pass which was a great choice if you want to visit...

If you like museums, then you'll like the ROM, apart from the new modern monstrosity tacked onto the front of the lovely old building,.think Federation Square stuck on top the Louvre. And the good news is that the ROM has been reducing prices. Best exhibits? Dinosaurs and crystals. Allow a full day if you want to see everything.

My family and I visited this museum recently and really enjoyed it. The museum is a beautiful mix of old and new architecture and the exhibits were pretty amazing. Our kids loved the dinosaurs but were really involved with the other exhibits as well. Once inside the museum, it was not clear where to go to start the visit but...

Loved the exhibits and the layout of the building itself. So much to explore. My friend was almost completely absorbed in the dinosaurs' section. I enjoyed Chinese art and the main hall with the the large Buddha statue.

If you are in the Yorkville neighbourhood the ROM's restaurant, c5, is a good choice. Service was slow but not bad. I warned them about my food allergies; however, something made me a little ill. It could have been worse. The space is stunning and, generally, the food was pretty good.
I've been coming here since I was a teenager and it's even more brilliant now. I went recently with one daughter and two out-of-town nephews and we loved the dinosaurs all over again.

Great visitor attraction not to be missed. All exhibits were meticulously displayed with good descriptions alongside. Directional signage was good. Exhibition not cramped, well separated and in defined rooms. Congratulations to the curator and his/her complement of staff, job well done!

I've never seen so many gems in my life! There were quartz, topaz, gold ores, cobalt, platinum, rubies... over 200 different types of minerals and STONES THAT I'VE NEVER SEEN IN MY ENTIRE LIFE... There was a dinosaur section as well, which was very impressive. The art galleries were nice, but what I really enjoyed were all the memorabilia of...

The Royal Ontario Museum has an amazing collection of a wide variety of exhibits, including Asian works, Egyptian mummies, totem poles, fabrics and clothes, mounted birds and mammals and fish, minerals, dinosaurs, photos from Afghanistan, and a wonderful exhibit on biodiversity and endangered species. There are lots of hands-on activities for children, like touching all sorts of skull mounts with...

This was a nice museum especially if your into archeology and history. We walked here from downtown and it only took about 20 minutes. Plan to get there early if you want to take the time to read about the items on display as they do have a ton of displays.For a family I would recommend the Science Museum...
The ROM is huge! It has something for everyone. The dinosaurs went down well as did the Orient and the 1st nations exhibits. Money well spent, great day out.
I though museums were boring until i got there ! Amazing and edgy exhibitions!

An egocentric addition caused this museum to have many awkward spaces and unusable areas. The collection is extensive, but a lot of it is ageing, too. New galleries are nicely-done, but this is certainly not one of the world's great museums.

Visiting the ROM is a must if you visit Toronto, because there are many great exhibits. If you are visiting with kids, make sure to stop by the Animal Section where there are interactive activities (such as the Bat Cave). If you are visiting with teens or adults, there are many exhibits such as Canadian history, Chinese art or others...
Kids end of year school trip, they all loved it and wished they had had more time to explore ALL the exhibits. Would certainly go back.
Lots of great exhibits.Special discount rate on friday afternoon.Special exhibits few times a year (that keep on changing)

I kept debating whether we should go to this attraction, I was concerned that my kids (11 and 9) would be bored. Thankfully (for the most part) this was not the case. The 2nd floor is the big draw for kids and I have to say it was my favorite floor as well. I read in another review that the...
Fabulous 4 course meal to celebrate the at the opening of the new Dinosaurs of Gondwana exhibit at the ROM
Good place to spend a morning with lots of different exhibits. The Maya Exhibit was good but unfortunately we visited during half term so there were a lot of children!
Lot's to see and do here. Great for the family. Good place to go on summer holidays

I had never been to the ROM before and it was really interesting seeing all the different collections. ( not too crazy about all the kids, but that is expected at a place like this) Would definately recommend if you are in the city.

An amazing range of things to see on our visit there - from Chinese history to dinosaurs. The staff is amazing. The museum is not too big and not too small. Its one of the features on the CityPass that you don't want to pass up.

I was coming to the end of my trip which took me to London , Quebec City , Montreal , Ottawa and Toronto by which time I had already visited National Maritme Museum in Greenwich, Canadian Museum of Civilization ( my favourite) and Canadian War Museum in Ottawa, Biodome in Montreal and decided to have a last visit at ROM....

We spent hours in the museum and only saw the third floor. We knew that would be the case going in so it wasn't overwhelming. The exhibits were really well done and so many artifacts! The Egypt par was my favourite. Definitely have to go again!
Was a little disappointed that most of the dinosaurs were fake. Didn't like the stuffed animals either. The collection of art and furniture is very good however. Something for everyone.
This is an excellent Museum! I loved it because it has everything. Paintings, Sculpture, Natural History. Plus, the building is beautiful.
Worth visiting the special exhibits and checking out the dinosaur fossils is always fun. I also always loved the bat cave when I was a kid.
I visit the ROM as often as possible - the kids love the history and it gives us an opportunity to learn together.

Growing up in Toronto the ROM was a big thing - we would go a couple of times a year - having travelled throughout Europe and some of the Mid-East made me realize how tired the ROM is though - they definitely need to start bringing in more interesting exhibits - Funding is a huge problem too - They don't...
Lots of great exhibits and they have a children's area and also special events for kids.

Navigating through the Royal Ontario Museum is not a feat that I found to be easy. There aren't many maps on the walls and most floors had just arrows pointing to where the exhibits were near the stairwells. If the exhibit you were looking for was in the corner of another, bigger exhibit, it's quite easy to miss. We almost...
I'd particularly recommend the Chinese gallery, super frescos and an informative volunteer guide. Good Roman - mainly Syria 4th century a- and Egyptian collections

For decades the ROM has been a must-do when visiting Toronto. Still is. Not so excited about the new architecture, but the exhibits remain top-notch and are updated thoughtfully. Located in a great area to walk and shop and eat. A bit hard to park.
Great for a bad weather day but check out the new dinosaur program it is incredible.
Spent about 2 hours on the 2nd floor with the kids. We weren't expecting much we didn't leave a ton of time for the visit. Would highly recommend.
You might not get through it in one day. Look for a deal online for ticket coupons as it is getting to be quite pricey.
We always go to the ROM. Its fun, convenient, and one of Torontos best attractions!

A great venue with regularly changing travelling exhibits. Don't skip out on the restaurant while you are there. Since I live downtown I have met people at the restaurant even when we do not go into the museum! It has good food, a nice contemporary design, and is quiet enough to hold conversations - without being too quiet.As for...
I didn't go inside of the museum, but outside it's really great. Behind the museum, there's a great park to take a walk.
We didn't check the opening time and had to wait for 30 minutes, but the visit was worth the wait. So many awesome things to see. A must-see attraction if you like museums.
Friday night at the museum with music, drinks and food. Great idea.

A grand and airy space with very nice exhibits. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable.Pity they stuck that awful contemporary addition on the front of the fine old original building. I'm sure the needed the space but it's an eyesore from the street.

I went to the museum this past Friday evening, which apparently is an event night at the museum. It's discounted admission ($9 for Adults) at that time and they were having an event that included food tasting and drinks (for a fee, of course) as well as guest musicians. There was also something called Rave Yoga going on in one...

The museum is fairly large and has plenty of items to see. The minerals exhibit and the dinosaur exhibit are particularly good. Each section is not outstanding on its own, but there are so many different exhibits (spanning Greece to China to Africa to dinosaurs...) that you can easily spend all day here.There is a restaurant on the top...

We had planned to spend a few hours here and then move on. We ended up spending the entire day at the museum, just taking time out for lunch.There is an amazing amount of items in each exhibit and probably less than 10% of their inventory is on display at any given time.There are touch screens all over...

There are as many viewpoints about the architecture of this facility as there are panes of glass. Get past that, just see it as a giant billboard screaming "look at me!" The collection of artefacts is amazing, if you have kinds, expose them to the dinosaurs, the bats and the spiders you will have done your parental duties. The restaurant...

You could spend hours at this place. We went at about 1pm on a Wednesday and it was not to busy. We went because its included in the Citypass. Decent amount of school field trips. Seems like a great place for kids.

The ROM is such a treat ...I used to go as a teen and right into my early adult hood ...its a fun place for a first date . You can just walk and talk and stroll the hours away .ROM is packed with incredible exhibits , informative tours and fantastic displays and artifacts . You really do need...
my parents have went there and me and my sister would like to go and see all the bones and all kinds of other stuff.

I spent 2 hours in the textile room alone. The rest of the museum was filled with school kids, but the textile room was quiet and amazing. The only negative was the guard who spent the whole time sitting in front of the video screen dozing.

Always worth visiting for the treasures there as well as the spectacular architecture. You don't have to be a history nut to love the ROM. There is a gem exhibit for jewel lovers, mummies for the mommies, dino bones and much more. The cafe is a great place to stop for a break. Leave time to visit the gift shop....

The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM to the locals) is a venerable institution, situated close to the University of Toronto and the Ontario legislature. Most of the museum is fairly traditional, Gothic-style exhibition halls, but that is now combined with a futuristic and very controversial "crystal" addition. The crystal brought with it sloping floors and sloping walls,and the result can be...

The museum covers everything from Natural History (great dinosaur and early mammal exhibit) to current biodiversity and geology on one hand and galleries on First Nations and Canadian art also. There were other sections dealing with Egypt, Greece, Rome etc, but the highlights for us were the First Nation, African, and South American sections. The Museum is very well laid...
The dinosaurs are super cool and the chinese art was outstanding.

We had a great time at the Royal Ontario Museum. The variety of collections & caliber of information/design reminded me of the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History in DC. I've seen some complaints on here concerning the layout/architecture but I really enjoyed the interesting perspectives from balconies and bridges between exhibits. Since it is less of a linear layout, it...
Very educational place..lots of facts and history. There are over-priced gift shops (which is usually expected at these kinds of places) but a great way to spend the day with or without children.
This was an experience I will not forget soon. Staff was friendly, value was well worth it and I had a great afternoon.

Toronto has many wonderful museums and galleries and the R.O.M. is one of them. Great permanent exhibits as well as ever changing temporary exhibits. Lots to see and do for the entire family. The architecture alone is exciting and innovative.
If you like dinosaurs, this is not to be missed. It is very confusing museum to navigate. Great for kids.

My family and i went to the museum to see the Terra Cotta Warriors exhibit and it was amazing. The museum was a nice diversion on a week long trip to Niagra Falls and the Toronto area. Depending upon what is there the next time we are in Toronto, we will return to the museum.

On a recent trip with friends to Toronto, we made sure to stop at the ROM, since none of us had been in years. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the admission price has been greatly reduced, making it far more affordable to the average person. We were really pleased to find that we could check our larger bags...
Very pleasant time. New addition to building is interesting but it does make it a bit confusing to navigate inside. Mostly this type museum is not my style. I like an art museum better like the AGO.
Natural history, plain old history and a whole lot more. Wish we'd had more time here.
The exhibits on display are very well made and displayed.The only thing I would have wished for is slightly more explanations to keep my 7 yo entertained all along.
This may be the biggest embarrassment in Canadian Architecture, which may be a good reason to stand outside and judge for yourself. (It's free.)Two buildings that had a crash at an intersection.

I live in the middle of Canada and only get back to Toronto, Ontario about twice a year.EVERY time I go I visit the ROM. It's one of my favorite places on earth. I am never disappointed with the displays or the atmosphere. I always learn something new, and if they'd let me I'd take up residence! I started...
I spent the day with some young people and it was nice to see how interested they where in learning

The crystal at the ROM has stirred up a lot of fuss with both those who love and hate its aesthetics.The shows have been rather over hyped eg. Dead Sea Scrolls and for adults not enough other stuff to make the visit worthwhile.
Enjoyed the diverse collections....North American Native collections were very good. Good to see school groups making use of the facilities. I like the new addition.
So very much to see and wonderfully presented! My husband had such a good time trying to take it all in. He enjoyed is much more than he ever thought he would.

This is definitely worth seeing if you are in Toronto. The Chinese and Japanese sections, and the natural history section are all excellent. In the Chinese section, there is wonderful classic art and calligraphy. In the Japanese section, there are fine swords and Samurai armor. In the mineral section, there are the finest matched colored sapphire bracelet, finest morganite, and...
Excellent exhibit. Interesting museum, well laid out.
well sinence is sinence and i had learnd alote of good excpireance well that is all i can say bye

The Museum is an enchanting place with well designed and well placed objects. Although we spent a whole day, I feel it is not just enough to truly cherish the relics. I was there for a wonderful business function. It is an excellent venue for business events or to show out of town family or friends.

Dropping the entrance fees to $15 for adults from over 20 bucks has not at all affected the ROM's quality and quantity of exhibits.Friends from China, the Middle East, and other parts of the world on our field trip today gave acclaim to the collection at Canada's premier museum. cause there just isnt anything else in toronto to visit. The crystal should have been real crystal instead of steel and aluminum, but what the heck...

Kids love the dinosaurs, but there are lots of other treasures. My 10 year old daughter's favourite display is the gems and minerals section. I like the birds and bat cave. A very revealing area is the south east asian part - Chinese tombs, statuary, etc. And boys are drawn to the medieval armour. A wonderful way to spend part...
interesting way to fill an afternoon with our family.

If you're looking for a fun, entertaining, and all-round educational experience for your kids (and grown ups too!) then look no futher, the ROM is the place to be. It's not only an architectural marvel but a real treat for the entire family. Restaurants onsite or you can brown bag it and eat in the cafeteria downstairs. Definitely worth a...

always something new, it seems. the dinosaurs are always popular, as are the mummies. nice cafe; and wonderful gift shop. on subway route and bus route, too; don't know where you would park, if you drive there...

This museum is absolutely beautiful! From the architecture of the new Michael Lee Chin Crystal outside to the old museum walls inside, this museum is stunning. The permanent exhibits are awesome, especially the Egyptian exhibit with the mummy - the kids were fascinated with this! This museum also has world-class special exhibits that change on a regular basis. The special...
very interesting and educational All ages benefit at the Royal Museum

I must say, I'm not a big science geek, but this museum is very fun. I love the dinosaur exhibits, and the architecture outside the museum is breath taking. I recommend taking a day out here, if you have time to kill.

Creative spaces, engaging exhibits, kids love it. Membership is worth every penny. Restaurants in basement have declined some from when they opened a few years ago, but overall still a good destination for lunch.

I went to the Royal Ontario Museum (also know as The R.O.M). Anyway if you are planning to go the admission is: Adult $15 (Previously $24)Senior (65+ years) $13.50 (Previously $21)Student (15 - 25 years, with student ID) $13.50 (Previously $21)Child (4 to 14 years) $12 (Previously $16)Infant (3 years & under) FreeMembers Free.So...

What a wonderful place to spend quality time. You're never too old to learn and what a place to do that :)The displays and exhibits are so well done and such care is taken to show everything at its best. Hope to return soon!
I want to go there again anytime soon. Had a great time with my family and friends. Exhausting but memorable outing.
Brilliant! What did you like about it? It was very nice experience for my son he love to go to the museum to learn about everything

Lots of Artifacts. With lots of Multimedia. Touch screens helps you learn more about the artifacts. Lots of activities for kids on weekends. Restaurants on the basement level, food studio, has less choices and bit expensive. If you effort it you can try the fine dinning restaurant on the 5th floor.
There is a lot to see so be sure to pick carefully what you want so see first.

The ROM offers a full day for the whole family. Visit during special events or holidays, especially if going with the kids, so they will be busy with the activities offered by the Museum. At Halloween, the kids got to make crafts, touch real bats and learn about them, and listen to story-books. When we are in Toronto for longer...
Always fantastic! Whether you're checking out the permanent collection or the latest exhibit, you can't go wrong. Mornings are less busy.

My friend and I took refuge in the ROM during a rainy afternoon in late April, and it was fairly perfect. Although not quite to the calibre of my favourite museums in London (but what CAN compare with the British Museum or the V&A, really?), it definitely was much better than anything found in Calgary.I really regret not having...
Georgeous art and artifacts. International reputation - great.Fabulous restaurant, top floor, great view, super exotic food.The place to visit, be seen and soak up some culture.Enjoy!!!!
They had me at dinosaurs. Seriously how cool is it to see these gigantic monsters that used to live here?!
The ROM will never disappoint. If you only do one thing during your trip to Toronto, make it the ROM.

The Front of this place leaves something to be desired because i think they totally ruined the historical front of it, but the contents is amazing, the new dinosaur exhibit is very tastefully done compared to what it was, and it is definently worth your time to explore!
Something for everyone! We bring the kids at least once/month.

Being an international student in Toronto, I decided that it is really important for me to visit this museum. It was even free for me (student discount). However, I did not like it. Fun for the kids and greta for the parents. Lots to do and so much to see...you need more than one day
Do not miss this! It is one of the best museums I have been to. They have outstanding programs for kids - spend an hour or a day and you will still want more!
The kids will like the bat caves (felt real) and animals etc. The rocks and gems were great, as were the Asian collections, English collections, etc. It's huge, so give yourself some time.
Lots of stuff to see and full of information for the whole family
I love visiting here. There are many intersting exhibits and I especially like when they bring in special exhibits like the chinese clay army!

I loved coming here on school fieldtrips when I was a kid and looking at the dinosaur displays but having visited recently with my own children this place could use some renovation as it’s a real bore in comparison with museums in other major cities.

Having been to some very famous museums in the past, I was a little skeptical about the Royal Ontario Museum. Lots to see and do for all ages. Enjoyed many of the exhibits.
An encyclopedic collection, with usually a blockbuster exhibition of one kind or another. Well worth a whole day's visit.

The ROM is a great place for history buffs of all stripes, and it's located right on a subway stop. Very convenient. It's surrounded by great shopping and other sites like Ontario's Parliament buildings and the University of Toronto's most historic (and attractive) grounds.It was quite pricey when we went, but the ROM has made a big deal of...

Well, it is more entertainment than informative- I personally do not like the changes into the exhibits that do not seem to promote literacy.many movie set exhibits.Good Asian art, but be prepared for so much walking,take your favorite slippers that resemble shoes- This is a good museam,worth the effort to visit.

My daughter (13) and I focused on the gems aisle. It was very amazing to discover all that diversity of forms and stones. Best of all, this museum points out their rare attractions. They put screens and you can listen the story of a persian wall, young Cleopatra, the unique biggest (896 carats) gem, etc. Fantastic!!!
It is still one of the most beautiful buildings in Toronto and the displays are always well done.

I went through this museum (leaving out the Mayan Exhibit) in just a couple of hours. Saw all of it from the top down in this time. It is worth a visit and the price of admission but it is a smattering of many things rather than a focused exploration of any topic. There is a 'hands on' area for...
The exhibits here are top notch my boys really enjoyed the museum at 9 and at age 10 and so did we as Parents.
The diversity of different species, dinosaur remains, extinct fish. What more could your child ask for than they could find here. Absolutely Amazing!!!

We went when the Mayan exhibition was on which we had to pay extra for, which was totally awesome! There is also a replica of a bat cave, which for little ones is very educational. The only thing that I would recommend is eating before you go in, as the cafe is sooo expensive!

Attended the Maya exhibit at the ROM. Far too many people were admitted at one time, making it difficult to progress through the exhibit. While it was certainly a comprehensive exhibit, it seemed that the curators had to work within an extremely limited budget - it seemed almost cheap - surprising since the entrance fees to the ROM for adults...

This is the best museum in Toronto, but it does not say much. Museums in comparably-sized US cities (Boston, Chicago, Washington) are considerably better. ROM does not warrant a trip to Toronto by itself, but can compliment a typical visitor schedule built around Niagara Falls, CN Tower and restaurant hopping.

While the ROM is not the Louvre, it holds its own.... The Mayan exhibit was great and we truly enjoyed the dinos. Unfortunately, I find the prices steep especially for families. If I think that the Louvre charges 9 Euros and the ROM $ 25, I find that steep for what you get considering that Toronto is not cheap in...
too many people,wonderful exhibits, amazing staff and lunch was pretty good also.
Very good collection, well displayed, professional , well lit, good story line.

If you're visiting Toronto, the Royal Ontario Museum is a must-see! The highlight for me was the dinosaur display, with complete skeletons of a T-rex, Barosaurus and others. One day wasn't enough time for us to see and appreciate everything. If you're travelling with children, they have special activities every Saturday (from April to June), and many collections have children's...
Great location right of subway, lots to see. Admission price reasonable.

I went to the museum on a trip in December, and it was a fantastic experience. They have so many exhibits it's hard to believe. I especially enjoyed the Asian art and Natural History sections. There is so much to see that you'll need several hours, and if you have kids, you'll probably have to make multiple visits. My girlfriend...

The ROM is a great place to take the family. I recommend buying a family membership as it is a great value. The exhibits change frequently and members receive invitations to special events. There is lots to see and do at the ROM.
Got a little overwhelmed with all of the exhibits, but it has something for everyone inside. Could spend more than an afternoon browsing the museum.

Coatroom to check your coat or backpack. The gemology room is beautiful. The dinosaurs are wonderfully displayed. Lots to keep you going. I love the gift shop! Check out their website to confirm admission prices & hours. Free Wednesdays from 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm. Half price on Friday nights. Special exhibits not included in general admission.

I really like the ROM not totally loving the crystal, looks great from the outside, not so great when inside. But the shows are done well, thoughtful, beautiful new spaces, loved that reduced the admission price! Always great to get back and see the new rotating shows, love the themes they're working on also "water" the Maya.... definitely worth a...
Perfect for a rainy day, mid week is always better, less crowds!
It was an amazing experience.. too good ...take a full day if you wanna see all the artifacts and exhibits...Dinosaurs are 'must watch'.

The ROM just completed renovations and they make it very open and spacious. The museum is easy to get around. Many of the exhibits are supported with interactive computers that enhance the experience. The Mineral and Gem rooms are great. the Rom is awesome, then we went to a great little place on Clinton Street # 53, Fuel House great people wicked backyard and good burgers!

lot's of room to do many things. every time I go I feel it is under-utilized. this said, while their major exhibitions are not very big and somewhat of a let down, the regular parts of the museum offer plenty of entertainment for all. there seems to be plenty of activities for all and it is great to go once...
We had a great time here. So much to see, this place is huge.
if your children are going with school, go and chaperone, quite the learning experience.great souvenir shop.

After several years of boycotting the ROM due to the extremely high prices, we decided to have another look today, as they've finally dropped their prices. This place is amazing, everything is very interesting, the animaks, the antiques and thre huge totems are WONDERFUL...!!!Wednesday is free..!!!

Being Canadian, the ROM is one of my proudest Canadian attractions! Whenever I go, it's always something different and you always discover something new. You can spend hours and hours just trying to see the whole place. There's a cafeteria on the lower floor, just the usual stuff, but helpful so you don't have to leave for lunch.Always a...
ROM is great just don't try to do it all in one day

Despite the entry charges, this is a good museum that is well presented. It has some unique items relating to early Canadian peoples but sadly fast-fowards from the stone age to the 19th century.An exceptionally good dinosaur exhibition clearly presented. Other highlights are the museum's gems and minerals collection and a themed collection of room layouts from the middle...
I love museums and learning about old and new things.
Always a great spot, something new to see every time. You cannot see everything at one visit. As an out of town member you get a great deal and you can bypass the lines.
wear good shoes, lots of walking, great lunch at restaurant C5

Talk to the staff, they're very knowledgeable and can recommend things from your interests. Being from the UK, we were told about the First people's room, and I was in there for hours on end, very good!

After reading all the guide books we were very excited about visiting this museum. We love visiting museums especially family friendly ones as we have a 5 year old. We loved the dinosaur section( go there first) esp the dino eggs was amazing but everywhere else was ok. Our son was bored after the dino section. Not much interactive things...
We greatly enjoyed the Mayan exhibition here - thanks! Wow, what a civilization and makes a trip to the Mayan Riviera that much more interesting to learn the history of it's people.

ROM exposes an impresive collection related to culture and natural history in a particular atmosphere that adds interest to all type of visitor. The incredible edifice is an additional nice and interesting positive point. Are particularly and excellently exposed the dinosaurs and birds in the second level and the objects of the ancient Egypt and Rome.
Family from England were enthused with the volume of displays being exibited
Nothing out of the ordinary. I went because it was part of the CITY PASS but i was not surprised
A good museum to spend your weekend... allow more time.
Loved revisiting the museum. The entry price is crazy expensive though! Way beyond the price of most families.
Lots to see and after there are several places where you can go out for a meal
The ROM has so many exhibits that are interesting that we stayed there for hours.

The Mexican Maya's made the experience funtastic, the Asian items of statues and swores and cloths was eye opening in to history and the culture. The art work andthe chore singing, wow.....I look forward to going back again soon.
Well laid out, great exhibits of interest to all ages.
With my finance, had a blast... in average museums are just as fun as you make them... park on side streets! They offer free parking after 4
Adults and kids will enjoy this place. It's amazing!

We saw an amazing temporary exhibit. In addition to their temporary exhibits the ROM has wonderful permanent exhibits including a wonderful dinosaur exhibit. Restaurant in lower level is convenient, but slightly over priced. Museum is well worth time and entry fee.
Last saw the Chineses Warriors at the ROM. I must get in to see the Mayan exhibit before it leaves town.

We saw the Maya exhibit; which was crowded & ending soon. THen we looked at the dinosaurs. They are in the newer, more light-filled part of the museum. I miss the old foliage, but liked the light. Nice feathered dinosaur fossil tucked away at the back.
What can you say? The ROM is a world class museum. A must see!

We saw the Mayan exhibit which was very informative. Not as dramatic as I expected, given the history of the people, but many replications of the cities and culture.The dinosaur exhibit is great. The ROM is a wonderful museum and I haven't been there since the renovations. There is alot to see and depending on what your tastes are, there is something for everyone. A super exhibit showcasing dinosaurs...very well done. The building (exterior) is a bit weird, but don't let that fool you!

I make it a point to visit ROM at least once a year - and I always emjoy the visit.

The ROM is a great bad weather/rainy day adventure - everything you can imagine can be seen here.Caution: this is not a one visit destination - it takes many just to get an overview & may become habit forming!

ROM is a treasure trove, especially for anyone who is a history buff of any kind. My 9 year old nephew considered it the best part of our 6 day trip to Toronto and Niagara Falls. If you're in Toronto, make sure to dedicate a few hours of your time to visit this museum. The building itself is beautiful. Easy to find parking.
Its a must do in Toronto ! Great exibits, friendly staff, good size, not as big as New York but decent

I'm a lifelong fan and member of the ROM. The building itself is gorgeous and peaceful-- really great blend of new architecture and old. Viewed this exhibition with my husband and sister-in-law and really enjoyed it. Allow 2 hours to view. The history of the Mayan civilization and culture is fascinating. Well worth a visit and the museum in general is a world class attraction. The exhibition is time-ticketed so need to book online.

Excellent entertainment for the whole family! The ROM kept my 7 year old fascinated for hours. His favourite areas were the Dinoaur exhibit, the animals and the Egyptian area. As a resident of Toronto I am guilty of not visiting this attraction in years. The Royal Ontario Museum is a great place to see things that are brought in from around the world and put on display. It's cheaper than flying around the world to see these displays!

We were more than pleasantly surprised when walking into the doors of the ROM. Definitely one of Toronto's greatest attractions. The building is a gem in itself.Photographers... take your camera's! What an amazing opportunity to test your skills with lighting and angles.Tips for the day...1. Be prepared to check your backpacks. You're allowed only very small bags...
Nice visit - lots to see and get through. Give youself a full day to spend time in each area. Cool building and easy to get to location on the subway.

Really interesting to see the objects and to read the information provided. Even if you know some history, and have been to Mexico, visit the pyramids, there is always something new to be learned. I really enjoyed their organized exhibits on ancient Egyptian and Greek history. The dinosaurs were fantastic! My only complaint is that the bat cave was. . . a complete letdown. Don't waste your precious time visiting the bat cave. But definitely go to the museum and see the dinosaurs!
a wonderful place to explore canadian and world history, fascinating and so many interesting exhibits.
Five floors of some very interesting artifacts, great for the whole family. Do not forget your camera. Inexpensive.
excellent place to visit from 9 to 90. Wonderful exhibits, beautifully done. and at a great locatino for dining before or after.

Went to see the Mayan exhibit, our tour guide was a mine of information, well worth the extra charge to a guided tour. Only negative was that being a Saturday the exhibit was very crowded and we didn't get to see all the artifacts.
Enjoyed all of it.....and was pleased to learn that the world is not going to end on Dec. 21 or 23, 2012!

I was down in the city with my Fiance for a doctor's appointment. It doesn't matter what interests you, you'll find it here. Just bring comfortable shoes and be prepared to walk around a lot. Fortunately there are frequent places to sit.One of the great museums of the world.

wonderful permanent collections-great special attractions-films shown and theatre as well form time to time-one night a week admission is free-phone for details
Love it or hate it, the new building is worth seeing. A great kids area provides interactive fun foe little ones.
I feel that the new arrangement has taken it away from the scientific spirit in which this museum was offered to the city.

The servers in C5 are knowledgeable & enthusiastic about the menu and the sites of Toronto. The menu is creative, the service is efficient yet leisurely if one so chooses, and the view offers a special appeal.
Took the family on a rainy day and had a great time. Dinosaurs were a big hit.

I am really not into museum but I have been twice to this one... a lot of interesting exhibitions, my favs were the Asians one and the CanadianIt's free on wed afternoon after 3pm or 5pm
new addition is fantastic. Love the way the art displayed in it

LOADS of stuff to learn about at the ROM. Going there always brings back childhood memories of school trips and each time i'm still in utter amazement when stepping into the Dinosaur exhibit. You could easily spend the entire day at this place and not see everything. It has many levels and tons to see. This photo looks like a bombed out shelter. I can barely recognize the majestic building. What a nice museum. Relaxing, informational, clean, beautiful, with lots of interesting places to roam about. This museum features many different attractions. Overall you can spend a whole day here and enjoy every minute of it. There is also a really restaurant there.

The museum is beautiful and very professionally laid out. Unfortunately, I was there with my kids who had little patience to read any of the information that would make the experience interesting. Unless you have a very cerebral child, I would recommend visiting the museum by yourself or with an adult.

Long line to get in, but well worth it. Bought our tickets online while waiting, then went to the service ctr, and they printed them for us, which ended up knocking about 10 minutes off the wait.Very family friendly, and the staff were helpful. Had lots of fun, just wish we had more time!
Despite many many visits to the ROM, I still enjoy my visits.

This is a world-class museum. There is something here for everyone. There are special exhibits. There is a superlative Chinese exhibit, and excellent Egyptian and Greek exhibits. The museums ain't free in Canada but this History Museum is as good as any. Go to the A.G.O. if you want "fine art." If you like museums, expect to spend a full day at the R.O.M. Lots of dinos and cultures: ancient Egypt and Greece/Rome and China/Japan(/Korea) and post-Feudal stuff.
so much to see very nicely exhibited Very childfriendly. programs (enquire) Franks restaurant on site is great
Full of interesting objects including a great Dinosaur display!.

Before coming to the ROM, I had very high expectations of the most hyped attraction of the Toronto CityPass. EVERYONE we ran into told us how wonderful this place is. Great place to re-visit and re-acquaint with exhibits. Really enjoyed the medieval activities that were showcased in the fall
I cant get enough of this place. I really love the special exhibits. The bat cave, and animal exhibits, Ancient Egypt. Looking forward to visit the Mayan exhibit soon.
The ROM is never a disappointment. Tons of fun always a new exhibit
Amazing and restored just great. I have visted the Great Museum in Paris and frankly like ROM better.

The building is really interesting (albeit a bit controversial) and I would say far more attractive inside than outside. This is a great place to take kids and yet also appeals to adults. Educational and always great shows like the Dead Sea Scrolls

Fascinating architecture and interesting displays .
Pretty average as far as museums go. Some interesting art but you have to look at everything .
My kids love the ROM so much, they have asked that we buy an annual pass! There is nothing stuffy about this museum!
Lots of interesting displays, in a wonderful environment. It brings the past to life and is an inclusive, active museum.
I get place to learn and have fun and not just for the kids!
They have a great collection of miniature boats. The museum is awesome but the boats are the best.
There is really alot to do here. Go if you have a lot of time, i usually go when there is a special exibit- those are ALWAYS well done and fascinating.
So many different things to see! Leave lots of time to go if you really want to get to most things. Only drawback - parking is tricky.
Amazing exhibit. Artifacts and mini-films transport you to the time of the ancient Maya. Excellent! My 13 year-old daughter loved it too!

This world class museum has extensive collections of Ancient Egyptian, Greek, Etruscan, Roman artifacts, and Chinese and Indian art and artifacts. The trading of ideas has been going back and forth along the Silk Road since time immemorial.
Exhibitions are always entertaining and very detailed. The place is so big you can't see it all in one day. Since it's downtown Toronto you can find a place to eat before or after you see the museum

New galleries are still opening after the major reno by Libeskind, but old favouritesstill there - the dinosaurs, the bat cave, etc. Just visited the expanded Schad Gallery of Biodiversity. Great collection of art and artifacts from all around the world. I was exhausted from spending half a day there, and was disappointed I didn't have the energy to soak up more!

I have been to the ROM so many times, and each time I go I see so many different places and exhibitd then I did the last. Honestly the dinosaur and egyptian exhibts are absoltuley phenomenal. It's a great museum for their dinosaur exhibit.  Located in a nice part of Toronto.  I take my kids every few years as an educational experience.  If you are looking for something fun and educational the Toronto Zoo and Science Centre are a better choice.

Great museum for kids and adults alike. The kids will love the dinosaurs, the shrunken head, all of the animals. Don't miss the staircase of wonder - why don't they do this in all buildings? We are members at the ROM and go at least once a week. We have two small children who never tire of another visit to the museum. Good variety of many cultures represented. Good children's aread.

Loved the dinosaur bones of course. Grandma & Grandpa took the grandkids (ages 3 & 41/2) to the Museum for the first time. I don't know who had a better time - kids or grandparents. A visit to the ROM was never expected to be so good. The Mayan exhibits were superb. It is a place worth visiting with family and friends over and over again.
Explore the World at Home. A true Treasure in Toronto and worth the effort. Get there early to avoid crowds.
so much for every age group. The kids floor is so interactive and fun for infants to teens! Each floor has such great exhibits. I have never been disappointed.
not too big, not too small. lots of interesting exhibits. well organized.

Visited the ROM in December - had not been for a while - thoroughly enjoyed it - took my aunt who was visiting. Greatway to spend the day with your family.

We went to the ROM for Family Day and had a wonderful time. We haven't been there in a long time (definitely way before the the renovations) and it was our first visit with our 4 yr old. First, I'm a member, so I don't stand on lines. My granddaughter and i go often., especially when there's an interesting show. Right now the Maya Exhibit is n, and it's fascinating. a must-see. Check out he dinosaurs and the knights-in-armour, especially. Lots more stuff.

I did not like how crowed the the musiume was and how mean the security was it mad me uncomfortable

long line ups in the summer. do get there early if you want to see the whole museum.

the expositions are great so far the diamond exposition the best.  also the sacred scrolls were cool. the terracotta soldiers was great and now the mayan which is different that i tought. all the museum is very impressive i been a member for three years and never been bored. new expositions make the difference.

I was surprised by this museum. It isn't huge like the Smithsonian or the Nat. Hist. Museum in NY, but it has a lot of exhibits. The ROM is a really cool place! I loved the mix of the history/art and the mix of all the skeletons of the animals. A must-see for tourists, great place to go for a date. The whole area is fun and full of life (right beside the University of Toronto St. George campus), but the museum is especially great for those who are young or young at heart. Great architecture - can't miss the dinosaurs!
Great exhibits, love the interactive areas for young kids and the hosts there to discuss things. Parking is a pain.

It has moderate colletion of historical things. Toronto is not itself historical city, it does not have charactors. You can see little bit of every continetal historical things. You might be disappionted if you have big expectation of museum.
Lots to see, the older part is a beautiful building.
We went for The Mayan exhibition and loved it. Everything was set up great. The customer service was good and we will definitely go back.

This place is always changing and the new addition, while it looks weird and does not fit the place, does add the space it needed. Excellent variety and good for yourself or with the kids. Something for everyone.
A great place in a unique architecture. Kids love it and always come away with something new.
This is a great place to see because it is alway changing and they are alway having new things on display... for all ages

for such a major city I am always dissapointed with the limited time exhibits. It draws us in, and then there is so little to see. The ROM could learn a lot from the fabulous museums of London, England, check it out, and best of all they are all free!

As a child all the way to an adult I have been attending the ROM. You learn something new about history everytime you go there.

As a teacher, I have seen a major improvement in what is available and how it is presented to children. It is a more hands-on and creative place to visit. The 20, eight year old, students that visited a few weeks ago, gave it a "10 finger" salute.

If you are coming to Toronto, my hometown, you must go to the museum. The collections are outstanding and the exhibits are always top notch. I always go to the Egyptian section when I go. Great museum!!! Take advantage of times/dates when the museum is free or discounted.

I love this museum. The dinosaur/pre-historic exhibit is amazing. This place is quite big and every inch of it is interesting. This is what makes Toronto such a great place to go to. If we did not have this peice of education the city would literally be a garbage heap. Lol.
The kids loved it! Lots of different things to see! Wonderful history

ROM is a great place to spend a day, lots to see and experience, and they usually have a theme that they are featuring, which makes it even more special. Totally worth it if you like museums. Lots of things to see such as dinasours and animals from stone age, huge and full of wonders

A wonderful experience. Very easy to walk through and find what you are looking for.

The Royal Ontario Museum is an amazing place. Big and beautiful, with what amounts to be too much to see if there are little people in toe. My son absolutely loves the ROM as much as my husband and I do. There is so much to see and to do. Kids play and learn at the same time, camps are one of the best in the city. Dinosaur exhibit is quite amazing :)

The ROM is great for the occasional visit. This place is huge and can take all day to visit the entire place. The only disappointment was the Mayan exhibit. Great special displays. Free nights and good rates for students.

OK - I love history, especially the cool stuff (dinosaurs!), and eating amongst them is appealing. The food was good - no complaints, but I think that my expectations are higher because of the location and price.
The museum has its exhibits in well laid out halls. It also has unique displays of the Bat Cave and Dinosaur exhibit. The museum will regularly get special exhibits that are worth viewing.
My sons specially liked the DInosaur exhibit at the Museum. It was also nice when we got free tickets to enter the Museum.
There is always something different happening at the R.O.M. A great place for tourists to visit.

I don't know, is it just me or do Toronto cultural institutions just not stand up to international comparison? It is a great place to see a littlebit of everything!

A visit to the ROM is a good way to pass a few hours in Toronto. There is something here for everyone. However, it's a real shame about the strange layout and design of the front part of the museum.
