The science,history,geography.....things we had never thought about simply outstanding ! Friendly people and a few crazy ones too to make it more exciting ! We thought we'd spend the morning there but we spent the whole day and still only saw less than half the place! Great museum.

This amazing place houses so many incredible collections and things of interest, it is overwhelming at times. You need more than one day to see it all. Wear comfy shoes and enjoy all the walking and discovery! The Museum shops are truly impressive.
The museum is great, very large and with different galleries. Take at least 3 hours for a full visit.
You can't visit without seeing the mummies & the dinosaurs, The totems are amazing.Special exibits are always worth the visit.
Very interesting & moved along .Tons of information. Very interested since we have seen the Coba Ruins in Mexico.
Wonderful exhibits; you'll need more than a couple of hours for this one. There is a nice cafeteria in the basement when you need a break.

Interesting exhibits. Architect dream and nightmare. The City of Toronto increased their property taxes for the bits that "hang out"
It's beautiful, educational enough, and the choice in the cafeteria is amazing

I have not been to the ROM since I was a kid, but we went as a family in the fall and it was incredible...there was so much to see and do...My son was in awe of the displays and interactive areas....well worth the money to go!!
signage terrible, difficult for handicapped even the staff commented on the poor signage, gift shop has few local Canadian products

Should have known better than to go on a Saturday in winter. A LOT of kids running loose. We did manage to find a couple of quite places to browse through, though. Really something to see but I would recommend a day through the week when little ones are in school.

My daughter and I arrived at the museum by taxi on a Sunday afternoon. visited the ROM during Christmas vacations. Nice place but too crowded. Could see exhibit at a good pace.
The ROM is in need of a content upgrade after its architectural upgrade. I was a part of the Young Patrons Circle and it got tiring after a couple months.

One of my favourite places to spend a rainy day is wandering the hallways of the Royal Ontario Museum. With one of the best collections in North America, the ROM never ceases to delight people of all ages, no matter what your interest!

Good museum as museums go, lots of beautiful artifacts. I rated it as average due to the the new wing. Growing up, my FAVORITE part of the museums was the dinosaurs. The crystal is something different almost unreal - always have interesting exhibit.

We love museums. This is an unusually shaped museum, but that doesn't add to the experience. The displays are sort of haphazard, mixing ice age mammals with dinosaurs - why do museums do that?! The ROM just recently reduced their entrance prices from 25 to $15 for regular admission, and on Fridays after 4:30 p.m. it's $9. Currently there is a Maya Civilization exhibition.
One of the best museums in Canada. Lots to see and well-presented. Great for kids.

Was here last Sunday for several hours with a friend from Elkridge, Maryland. Went to exhibits and displays of interesat to me. Have been coming to the ROM off and on for years and this place never disappoints me at all. Have toured several others world capital cities musems and the ROM is comparable to them. I can spend the whole day here..have not been since my kids were small but I am looking forward to taking my grandchildren ..a whole lot to see and learn!

The architecture is wonderful and truly worth seeing, and as far as a Canadian museum goes it is worth a trip and itnteresting, by international standards the collection at the museum is flat and a little dissapointing.

We love the ROM! It may not be as big as The Louvre or British Museum, but it never disappoints and always holds new delights. We especially love the crystal architecture with all its nooks & crannies. We also love how parts of the old building are incorporated into the crystal design (be watchful for this as it may not...
easily walkable and the exhibits were well-labeled.

Have lately enjoyed the special exhibits and the recent new architectual addition of "The Crystal". Since the R.O.M. is so huge, it's impossible to see it all the treasures in one day, so it's always an adventure to continue where I left off! The Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) was a really cool experience. Many different historical time periods and cultures were depicted, and the place is huge inside. Both young and old can enjoy this museum. There are also areas specifically for kids. Set aside plenty of time so that you can see everything!

I felt that I learned what I wanted to know about the Mayan civilization by visiting the ROM. I appreciated the layout, and the various ways the information was presented. I appreciate special exhibits such as this in addition to the regular collections. A wonderful place for learning.
All kidding aside - definately worth a day trip. I spend a lot of time travelling across the US and Canada - both of Toronto's museums are a great way to spend the day!

i came for the water exhibit and spent, almost 4 hours going through the whole museum... i heard they had reconfigured the lay out, it was difficult to navigate, still got to see every thing... architecture was very old, it very cool to see...fav part were the totem poles!

In spite of the awful modern architectural addition by Daniel Lebiskind most of the classic features of this building are still there to be enjoyed. The permanent exhibits are impressive and they always attract lots of families since its so kid friendly.
I really enjoyed it - but I haven't been in several years.

Go early; buy your tickets in advance online. Plan on spending the whole day--until you cannot take another step--and still come away feeling like you haven't scratched the surface! So much to see and do! Price is reasonable. Easy to put in several hours looking at all the displays. Great gift shop too!

This is a must if you are in Toronto. The Dinosaurs are spectacular to see. Sunday afternoons have great family events.

We were very fortunate to enter the museum as a docent-led tour was forming. Our guide was excellent and gave a tour of the highlights of the museum which has a very eclectic collection. The museum is a "must see" on any visit to Toronto.
The ROM is well appointed with a selection of artifacts that tell the story of Canadian history.
Brilliant and captivating exhibit - historically accurate and the quality of the descriptions and the collection were all worthy of reading each caption.

The new renovation adds to the street appeal of the museum, and inside it's still a great natural history/anthropological museum. I was surprised to find the David Hockney exhibition hosted here, but it's a must see if you're in Toronto.
Very interesting and the kids loved it. Would definately visit again

I love the special exhibits, the director is open to many concepts ideas and historical facts. The title tells all - tasteful, modern, good ambience
The content of the museum was good; just did not like the most recent addition from the exterior.

I accompanied my son's grade 6 class on a field trip to the ROM. It was fabulous and the students really enjoyed the exhibits. The boys particularly liked the dinosaur display. The ROM was educational and fun at the same time and kept the students' interest. We wish we could have more time to explore since it is huge and...
Liked the dinosaurs... very organized and good exhibitions. I will go in subway if I were you.

Just visited recently with my 4 year old son who wanted to see the "dinosaur bones!" He had a great time and enjoyed digging for bones in the interactive section. I thought he would like the "Water" exhibit but not so much, too advanced for him with the exception of a few interactive parts and animal exhibits he liked. Can't...
Kids loved the crafts and digging for dinosaur's in main room while adults enjoyed mariachi band. Kids got stuck on second floor so we didn't get to see all the exhibits but a worthy 4 hour visit.
I was particularly impressed by the collections about the local natural history, and also about native Americans. Besides, there's a nice workshop for kids, with a pedagogic hands-on approach.
Back some snacks and a nice way to entertain the kids.
Went there for their Diamonds exhibition, it's everything you gather a museum would be. Very cool and the redesign looks fabulous.
A lot of fun for kids and adults alike. We try to go twic a year.

The new addition is ugly and a waste of space, but the ROM is still a great museum for all ages. Everything from dinos to jewels to the expected art from all eras. The old building is beautiful in and of itself. Parking is horrible - we park in Yorkville, walk back afterwards for a nice lunch.
I've been to the ROM three times in 5 years and and it seems the only thing that ever changes is the special exhibit. Waiting for something new and different!

There is a lot to see at this museum. The first time we visited we spent about 3-4 hrs. Our last visit was about 2 hrs which was really to see the Mayan exhibit and then re-visit some of our favorites spots in the museum. The cost is rather substantial, but when we first visited for a non-resident membership it...
To much to take in... but great for a whole day trip, Went with a couple of teenages and they were bored easily.

We toured the Museum literally from the top floor down. Very educational and fun for us as well as for my 5 year old daughter who loved digging for bones. The videos throughout the museum were very informative. The one with the dinosaurs made the dinosaurs seem so real and life-like. Our daughter liked the mummies and all of the...
I have been to the Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) numerous times and each time find something new and interesting. It has great interactive exhibits that everyone can enjoy.
An excellent museum to spend time. You can move at your own pace (a little quickly if you have kids!), or take your time to really inspect. Good variety of old artifacts.
Go visit, one of the best museums in Canada that you can visit, lots of great exhibitions there,
My daughter and I spent hours here. We could have easily come back another day and spent even more time there. Exhibits were really interesting.

I visited the ROM's Maya exhibit a couple of weeks ago. The ROM is always a treat. Most recently we saw the Maya exhibit--on until early 2012--and were enthraled. It is a wonderful combination of pre-Columbian artifacts, hands-on replicas, video, and printed explanations that preclude the need for an audio tour. Allow at least 90 minutes--2 hours is better--for this exhibit.
It is one of the most beautiful muesem I have ever visited. Fun, Interesting,
Good for a couple of hours and with different themes and interest usually.

The ROM has a good selection of exhibits to spend the day and conveniently located downtown surrounded by shops and restaurants. Price is too high ($25/adult) for what it is, and only worth going if you get a better price.
It will take a whole day to truly see everything here. Well organized and I hope to visit again some day.
I've been to the ROM about 3 times. I love seeing all the animal exhibits. This is probably my favourite museum!

This museum is awesome. Everything you see and touch is a fantastic experience. The architecture is really something else. This is a must for anyone visiting Toronto, or for locals on a rainy Sunday..However: We ate lunch at the restaurant located on site. It was disgusting. I took my handicapped uncle for this visit and was not disappointed. the staff were great and the lunch was lovely. I will do it again.

Well its lots to see here... omg ive been to rom probably billions of times..and each time i go they have something interesting goin on..new exhibits are always spectacular..a must see museum for everyone in the city! they have days where admission is free or low..or u can get a pass from a public library and its free

I personally love going to the ROM. The original design was more acceptable for everyone but i like the new modern touch. Amazing exhibitions and changing displays. Good for a rainy or snowy day. Amazing architecture.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a real jewel of Toronto. A true central location to the Toronto core, you can't miss the Michael Lee-Chin Crystal addition to the building. Once inside, let your mind absorb the vast array of galleries and exhibits.I always have an amazing time at the ROM.
It is one of the best place to visit but I will not recommend with very yong childern.

I recently went to see the new Mayan exhibtion and was fairly impressed with the selection and the really good descriptions of the culture and the history. The cost of addmission is quite high which I feel is so unfair because there is so much to learn in the magnificant building . Most just can't afford to go and visit so I suppose it is just for a selective amount. For those who can visit do so as it is a place of wonderment to young and...

Mayan special exhibit is pretty good. Much larger then we expected. It is quite well laid out and steps you through many, many aspects of their history and culture. Definitely worth going. However, I still don't like the new cube addition to the museum. It looks ugly and makes the layout inside extremely confusing for the balance of the museum.

If you're visiting Toronto, or live there and it's been a few years, then the ROM is a must-do. This museum has been incredibly well thought out, the dinosaur exhibitions are exciting with lots of interactive screen and interesting stories.The children's room was great fun, from designing your own Islamic mosaic to identfying different spices through smell, parents and children all enjoyed it thoroughly.The advisors in the children's area were warm, friendly and full of interesting ideas....

I have been coming to see this place since my early teens and every couple of years love to go back and see what new exhibits are on and revisit some of my old favorites.It is located in a beautiful old building and please excuse the glass monstrosity coming out the one side, not everyone is happy with that...

interesting, much bigger than what I'd expected, very educational for people of all ages. I loved the mineralogy and precious stones sector. It takes quite a while to visit it all, I'd recommend...
I am local and go with my kids almost every month!!!!Amazing activities for kids and good exhibits!!!

If you are museum person, you cannot miss this. The permanent collections are vast and impressive. A first class museum with fascinating exhibits, though admission was surprisingly high.

The exhibits are well thought out and there is lots of room so even if there is a crowd there is still space to breathe. The metro stops directly in front of the ROM so its great for tourists. Some of the displays are interactive and there is something for every age to enjoy.
I'd visited the ROM many years ago, before the stunning crystal addition, and my recent visit was a revelation of how great a really great museum can be.

Wonderful fossils! The First Nation exhibitions are splendid and offered much insight into the past and present. The cafe needs to offer a wider range of refreshments for leg weary travellers. On the whole a great afternoon.We left only when the doors closed!

interesting for the kids, less for art and history lovers, collection muddled and rather poor.

The ROM is a combination museum featuring world cultural history and natural history. There is truly something for everybody here, from ancient Chinese wall art, to marble busts of Roman emperors, to ancient coins and weapons, to dinosaur skeletons, meteorites, and dozens of "stuffed" animals of every species, including extinct ones such as the dodo bird. After spending half a day at the ROM I left with some sort of frustration; I was expecting to see more, but there wasn't anything else to be seen.If you haven't been to the Louvre or the Met, I would recommend you to go, otherwise you might as well skip it.

While visiting Toronto we were fortunate to visit the ROM, and at the time the Dinosaurs were visiting :)! Fabulous display and totally went beyond our expectations! Would recommend the ROM to any visitors to Toronto!
it was so huge, so many things to see and read and experience. they had the maya exhibit and that was cool to. easily a day spent there.

The Royal Ontario Museum is a fascinating attraction located in the downtown Toronto. I enjoyed all the Royal Ontario Museum including its exhibitions

I love museums & the ROM is no exception! The ROM has lots of different types of displays, so if you're with a partner or group that has varied interests, it's easy to please all. I had not visited since the Libeskind facelift (2007) and it seems like a new museum. The displays are more people-friendly and less stuffy. Haven't been to the ROM in 16 years so was happy to see many changes and great new exhibits. The only downside is the lack of clearly definitive paths. You end up backtracking quite often to get to other exhibits.

I highly enjoyed my visit to the Royal Ontario Museum. There are a wide range of exhibits, it's well worth a visit.I recommend the CityPass as you can save a lot of money. Do make sure you have a car rental though as travelling is required to visit some of the attractions.
Amazing! Absolutely breathtaking.My favorite is the animal/marine floor!A great place for family, date and learning experience.
If you're in Toronto and you don't visit this museum you've done yourself a disservice. There wasn't time enough in the dy to see all the exhibits. Will be coming back.

What is not to like about the ROM? It is just special. Easy to navigate, great permanent exhibits and touring exhibits. This museum is a working museum, not just for exhibits. Lots of common museum items. Didn't see too many things I didn't see at other museums.It was way too hot in there.
I have visited the museum since I was a kid and I still love it!You can not see the whole thing in a day so pick an area you want to see and enjoy it!

Interesting but will take a full day to go through the museum. .

If you are a museum person, you need to visit the ROM. The Dinosauer exhibit alone is one reson to spend the day here. Easy to get to, kid friendly, and one of my favouirte places in Toronot.

coming from someone who stays in New York and had interned at 2 modern art NYC museums, i have to say this is a terrific place for non contemporary and modern art.of course, you cannot compare this to the met, but ROM does have an impressive chinese art collection.
There was a little show for children knowing animals and conserving the environnment. It was brilliant.

We were in Buffalo New York and went to Ontario Canada for the day to visit the ROM. The Museum is Amazing! I LOVE the ROM! I visit this place frequently and there is always something to see that I didn;t get to before, or a new exhibit. The restaurants are fabulous and clean, food is delicious, the entire ROM experience is incomparable - go!!!!

Expensive. $45 for two. Maybe I'm spoiled having seen quite a few museums around the world. A few hours over 5 levels were enough.

We were well educated in the debate that argued " Power leads to abuse in the position of Prime Minister" . Only saw the entrance to the ROM but certainly rekindled interest in checking it out another time. Beautiful new design!

Always a joy! Special exhibits and I love the Chinese collections.

Don't miss the fossils, the gems, and also any special exhibits on native peoples art and culture. This museum is outstanding!

Really good museum in a lovely building. It's very diverse with a LOT of different areas of interest. We did an overview free tour first and then went round the bits that we were most interested in. Definitely worth doing.
Great place to learn new things. Not only a place for children, but for adults as well.

There is definitely something for everyone here. Easy to navigate. You could spend a whole day here! The European section was standout, as was the dinosaur area.

They always have special exhibition. Ready to spend a few hours.
Beautiful museum, both outside and inside. But the restaurant on the 5th floor has to be avoided. Pricy mediocre food and bad service.
A lot of history to be seen here, very easy to get overwhelmed though. Personally, I liked the very large totem poles the best. Is one of the best attractions in Toronto.

This is a gigantic museum that is done really well. Even if you don't enter you ought to see the relatively new glass facade. We visited the Royal Ontario Museum after arriving on the subway. I loved the MOMA exhibition, the rest of the museum was very goodI spent half the day enjoying the fabulous art and the architecture of the museum.

The Royal Ontario Museum is the best world museum I've ever visited. We were staying on Bloor Street and decided to go to the museum. We paid extra for the "Water" Exhibit/Attraction. We had a long layover in Toronto, so we went downtown to explore the ROM. The new building addition is amazing! The dinosaur exhibit alone is worthy of a visit.

Although interesting the water exhibit was nothing special. It should be part of the price. It was educational and should be available as a free educational exhibit to encourage water conservation.

I visited the ROM while visiting Toronto in November 2011. I wish I had more time to visit because you definitely can spend a long time there simply just looking at everything in the museum. It's included with the CityPass for Toronto and is a definite must see and have a day dedicated to it.

Lots if fabulous exhibits the the day was spoilt by hundreds of kids running around un supervised by summer camp leaders. We left early as it was do hard to view the exhibits and being constantly knocked into by all these out of control kids. Staff working at the location need to be more proactive.
There was so much to see and learn. We sure got a lot of value for our admission.

The ROM ended up being a great place to visit with our four and seven year old girls. There are quite a few different exhibits - Canadian history, dinosaurs, animals, Asian history, minerals, and some more. The exhibits are interesting, informative, and laid out nicely. It may be that I'm use to mostly free museums in the UK, but did find the around $40 for two people quite expensive. This museum has something for everybody, from dinosaur skeletons to artwork and lots inbetween. I especially enjoyed the gems and minerals area, and the special collection of European armor. What an awesome museum! I don't think a full day is enough to take everything in here. The fossils and dinosaur bones were incredible.
